review_body: The rooms aren’t as big as they seemed in the pictures but there was enough space for two people. A few cobwebs in the highs and lows of the room, so in terms of cleanliness it wasn’t 4*. When showering the water went all over the floor, in puddles just outside the bathtub, I’m sure there was leak in the tub and the shower head was coming out the wall. The pressure of the shower was really good though.Breakfast was standard, but the staff were extremely helpful and pleasant.The location was good as we walked everywhere. It’s about 15/20 minutes from Trevi fountain and the Spanish steps, about 40 minutes to the Colosseum and about an hour from Vatican City. Advice is to pre-book all of these before reaching there.  Overall standard room, wouldn’t have paid as much as I had for the standard of it but we did go peak season.

review_body: My second stay and definitely not my last at this beautiful romanic styled hotel and art pieces which transport you into classic era. The super friendly staff, especially concierge add to its charm. Grazie for the birthday surprise.

review_body: My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our recent stay at Hotel Romanico Palace. Rooms were charming, clean, well kept, and comfortable, as was the entire property. The staff was courteous, helpful, and eager to please guests. The location near beautiful Borghese Park is perfect with easy access to many of Rome's attractions. Nearby restaurants offered everything from sandwiches to elegant dinners with impeccable service and acceptable prices. I would be delighted to stay here again.

review_body: Staff friendly, greeting warm on arrival.Didn't get my complimentary prossecco,lolRoom on level 5 and the smell in hallway was dreadful.Room had no shower, bath only! No view even though it was a deluxe room.Had the Do Not Distrub sign on my door, they still entered my room.

review_body: Excellent location near Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, some okay shopping and great restaurants, rooms big enough for 4, bar good but breakfast really not so great. On the other hand, there is a fine cafe next door

review_body: This was a very well located hotel, it was a 10 minute bus ride or 25 minute walk into the center. The staff were very helpful and whenever we needed anything, like towels, they would bring it up straight away. Our room was very spacious and the decor was wonderful. However the breakfast was basic and it was a shame that the roof terrace closed so early in the evening.

review_body: Had a week at the Romanico palace . The staff were fantastic . Nothing was too much trouble . Had a real cheery feel to it . Room was lovely with beautiful high ceilings and the breakfast room .. wow!

review_body: Once entering the room it was lovely to see the effort. Rose petals were sprinkled on the bed. One thing which I found funny was the window that allowed everyone to see inside the bathroom. The decorations on the walls and ceiling also added to the italian experience. The hotel is in a really good position to bars and restaurants and also walking distance to some major tourist attractions. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Romanico Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here prior to start of our tour. The breakfast was good and service there was good. Our room smelled of a strong, horrible odor. It smelled as if it were mold or mildew, but it was so strong it was a health concern. I shared my concern with the hotel, but there was no response. I realize the hotel is old, but this was unacceptable and needs to be attended to.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Romanico Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel for our stay in Rome. We had a large group staying here and each room was unique with its own style. The front desk and concierge were great to accommodate us and give recommendations and directions. It was very clean and the breakfast overlooked the city. I had read different opinions about the breakfast, but we all thought it was great. There is a small bar and sitting area you can sit if waiting to join a group of just to sit and visit. Good location if you don't mind a short walk to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain area, or even the Termini train station.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Romanico Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 Queen beds, spacious room, lovely decor and large claw tub bath with shower. Ask for room 311!Our A/C kept us cool--a welcome relief after touring the Vatican and Roman Ruins all day!. Although we were not within walking distance of our tours, (a 55-min walk to the Vatican), we were able to get a cab in 5 minutes. We booked a private taxi to the airport in advance which was well worth it. Only a few dollars more compared to sharing a taxi. Disappointed that the hotel did not serve dinner, but we found a great authentic place a few blocks up the street that fit the bill. Reserve in advance! Breakfast on the 7th floor was included and well worth it! Delicious and the view with light jazz music helped set the tone for the day! We had to contend with a loud party going on across the street and could hear their music which didn't help us get to bed early as planned. It was on a week night, and it stopped at midnight so we got some sleep before departing the next morning. Overall, compared to other hotels, we enjoyed this stay!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Romanico Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very Nice Hotel, accommodations were great, staff was very accommodating and perfect location to restaurants and shopping. This was our 3rd and final Europe stop on a 10 day vacation to celebrate my 50th birthday and I was looking forward to a massage before flying back home. The shower was amazing and perfect after a long day of walking! However, I was a little dissappointed they did not have a spa as I thought they did. Also, I was happy they offered breakfast, but, selections were more on the continental side, would loved to have had an omelette option:-) All in alI, I would stay here again!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Romanico Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Romanico Palace was booked for Rome on advice of my travel agent. Amount paid in advance. When we reached in our hotel and asked to check in. Staff at reception told me that we have some problem of no availability of room today so we arranged your room in other hotel and taxi will be arranged to that small hotel. I paid for 4 star hotel Romanico Palace and they don't care about reservations and sent us to other hotel with our all luggage. Because our booking was for 3 Nights so they said we will come tomorrow back and hotel will pay taxi rent also. Next morning we came back with our luggage in a taxi. Manager asked me about taxi receipt for promised rent while I have not taken so rent was not paid. Then he said room is not ready yet so deposite your luggage and go around Rome and will be back Afternoon. Bad experience of a 4 star hotel. Hotel rooms are excellently decorated and really nice. Hotel has no restaurant inside for lunch or dinner. No food serving in room. Only breakfast facility available with small range and bad service. Supply of food is slow. No fresh juices or coffee machine. Staff promised me to compensate of bothering with airport transportation but after check out said sorry no car is available so arranged for taxi and paid my rent myself. I travelled throughout Europe and stayed in eight hotels in different countries and cities in 18 days but this was only bitter experienced hotel during our tour. Rooms with no water, tea or coffee was available. Nice building hotel with beautiful capacious rooms and no ethics.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Romanico Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very, very good. What makes it excellent is the staff. They were so helpful, professional and friendly. The staff provided recommendations for dining and local travel that proved invaluable. I highly recommend the Hotel Romanico Palace.

review_body: Room and service was great. The breakfast setup was poorly designed and many times had to wait for items to be refilled.The location of the hotel can not be beat. Walking distance to many attractions and restaurants.

review_body: Everything was great with this hotel. The breakfast was good, hotel staff was very accommodating. The location was pretty central for the activities we were doing but not too close to noisy sections of town.

review_body: Excellent location , very clean room,thematic and comfortable. Very beautiful from ground floor of lobby to the top level. Very nice breakfast and view from the roof garden restaurant. All staff extremely polite and helpful!Very good choice.

review_body: Ruben works the night shift and made us coffee in the middle of the night, brought us forks and plates. Really did everything he could to make our stay as comfortable as possible. He was friendly and told us about everything we needed to Know about Rome. There is an awesome piano bar down the street, Frankie O. It’s like an American night club after 11.

review_body: Not bad hotel. Small rooms (the one we had), Basic furnishing in a traditional style. Breakfast etc fine. Noise at night due to chairs scraping on tiled floors. ntain etc. Location was good (walking distance to most sites)

review_body: Hotel is in a good location for the above. Management is responsive to needs. Rooms are adequate and clean. Good breakfast served on rooftop, small bar in lobby but no dinner service. Nothing special but for the price it was fine.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Romanico Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Hotel romanico palace for 8 nights at the beginning of May for a birthday/ anniversary trip.Hotel romanico palace is that calm sanctuary that keeps you refreshed and ready to face your day with energy and excitement. All this with true welcome for their city of Rome. This trip was a year in the making, and I had decided on hotel romanico palace early on. About a week before our arrival, I began to get nervous and thought my expectations were too high for this Hotel . I worried for nothing! They delivered an amazing holiday experience. Hotel romanico palace goes above and beyond in the service experience. It is as if they wish to provide you with lifetime memories. For example, one night while chatting with Vincenzo (name hopefully spelled correctly) we mentioned our potential plans for the next day and he gave us some great suggestions. Later that evening he thought he may have given us misinformation, so research was done and we were updated in the morning! This is just one example of the genuine level of care and concern shown at hotel romanico palace. The location of Hotel cannot be beat - steps from via veneto and the decor and comfort of the rooms fit right in with the overall goal of an elegant sanctuary. I cannot wait until the next time!
hotelName:

review_body: I liked it here, the room was big. There's a bit of queue for breakfast but it was worth the wait. We were here for 2 nights to watch Wales play Italy in the 6 nations, alot of Welsh had booked this Hotel from the UK.The only downside is that it can take a while for the night porter to serve you at the bar later in the night.

review_body: Great Hotel, and Location. The Roof Top Breakfast was a Favorite of Mine. The Rooms had an Antique flare with Modern Amenities. The staff was very professional and Courteous. I would recommend this place to anyone, and would definitely stay again!

review_body: Great place, the staff was super helpful. Our room was nice and spacious. Daily breakfast had a good selection and a great view from the rooftop. We were able to walk everywhere but the hotel was a little outside of the really touristy neighborhoods, which in a way was a nice thing.

review_body: Very friendly Staff, decent size rooms and good location, but too many other averages to recommend it to others. Decor & fittings suit style of hotel, if a little worn in places, but generally OK. Although having no restaurant facility in the hotel is not a real problem, (as there are many good places to eat nearby), it does mean the breakfast buffet quality is poor for the supposed level of residence. High level of usage by tour operators means the foyer and other front areas become very busy on changeover days and queues for the 2 lifts, but also the tour operator guiders take over all the lounge/bar area for their talks etc.

review_body: This hotel was part of the package for the start of our 2-week Italian Escapade holiday.These are my comments from our 3-night stay.Poor Status comments - opportunities for significant improvement.Very slow single passenger lift plus 1 for luggageOur Bar fridge did not get cold even after my two requests for a replacement. We needed it for medication.Lots of road noise our 2nd floor rooms, so be cautions for any facing west & SouthVery stiff bed mattressNo real table type space & power outlet to do any holiday Computer work or emails from family & friends. Plus no power point for the Pokie little excuse for a table.No in room Tea & Coffee facilitiesThey must have won an award for the smallest size guest hand soapManagement send 3 emails per day to most clients “as a reminder of Breakfast times” and how do you rate their serviceIt’s called a “Palace” but I would not rate its accommodation status any where that high & certainly “not a Palace”Good Very very slow single passenger lift plus 1 for luggageBar fridge did not get coldLots of road noise our 2nd floor rooms facing west & SouthVery stiff bed mattressNo real table type space & power outlet to do any Computer workNo in room Tea & Coffee facilitiesManagement send 3 emails per day to most clients reminder of Breakfast “how do you rate their serviceIt’s called a “Palace” but I would not rate its accommodation that high..The breamBreakfast as fair choiceGood city “roof tops” views from Breakfast ,locations

review_body: Room was dirty upon arrival. we stayed for 2 night and the room wasn't cleaned or the bed made after the first night's stay (no the do not disturb sign wasn't put out), The staff, however, were friendly and the rest of the premises was clean.

review_body: After months of research my wife chose this location as our Roman home away from home. Checked in on Apr 27 and checked out on May 2.Our room had a sitting area, bathroom and bed area. We found the room very comfortable.Two minor issues with the room. The street noise and the shower/bathtub. The shower enclosure only covers half the tub. So the water spray can cause wet floors.Breakfast is served on the 7th floor. Each morning they served scrambled eggs and ham, along with yogurt, cheeses and lunch meat. Juices, coffee and tea. Milk, cereal, oatmeal. Finally they had a table with many pastries to choose from. A couple of mornings they ran out of scrambled eggs and it took them a while to replenish.One of our mornings we took a taxi to the Colosseum (12 euro). The other days we walked everywhere. Most of the big tourist stops were 15-20 minutes. We even walked to the Vatican for the papal audience (40 minutes).If we return to Rome we would stay at this hotel again.

review_body: Staff lovely but afraid rooms are very very old...needs gutting & refurbishing ..our bathroom not only had mouldy old curtains at window but mould also extended into corners around spa which wasn’t working...(stand in tub for shower) when showering w after went everywhere hence the mould .....not a comfortable experience.

review_body: This hotel is old & not well maintained. Our room was so small that the door almost hit the bed when we opened it. The bed was hard and so low it was hard to get in and out. We also didn’t have a window-there was a mirror behind the drapes instead. We had breakfast each day as part of our package. The food was not very good, the selection small, and they kept running out.

review_body: Hotel Romanico Palace was very well located. It was easy walking distance to the US Embassy, the American (English speaking) Catholic Church and several restaurants and shops. On our first day, we walked to the Spanish Steps in about ten minutes. On our last day, we walked from the Trevi Fountain with no problem. Felt safe the entire time. The hotel itself was great! Staff was always willing to help and the breakfast on the 7th floor had a great view of the city. The rooms were spacious, had the great "old world" feel, and always clean. Would recommend it to all of my friends.

review_body: Hotel conveniently located near main station and a short walk to the Spanish steps. Good value for money .Room was good apart from the fact that it only had a poor view onto a small dark courtyard. However did not detract from our stay as we did not spend much time in the room.

review_body: This hotel is so beautiful. The detail and design inside is amazing and feels very Italian and classic. All staff were extremely friendly and helpful if you needed any help with anything! My one negative would be that the breakfast isn't that good. The fruit being tinned fruit in juices rather than fresh the view from breakfast was beautiful though (photo added) but other than that it was a perfect stay and i would 100% stay again.

The hotel staff were friendly and accommodating however the points mentioned spoiled our stay.

review_body: Lovely hotel with lots of old world character. Staff were friendly, efficient and very helpful. Deluxe room was very comfortable with a great bed. Great location with only 10 to 15 mins walk to most attractions or 10 to 15 mins to catch train to other attractions. Really nice restaurants within 5 mins walk of hotel.

review_body: I booked directly through the hotel's website. My flight was coming in very late, and the hotel were fine with me checking in after midnight when I let them know. The room was weird, it looked alright, but the floors were cold, and it was strangely humid, and it smelled.... it smelled so bad! We'd arrived so late I decided not to say anything, or ask to be changed rooms. But the smell was insane. I think it was coming from the drains in the bathroom, so we'd try and keep the bathroom door shut. It smelled like a man with glandular issues, wearing shoes with no socks that had several strains of bacteria living in there. It was insane how smelly it was. Breakfast was good, it got a little same-y after three days, but it worked. The location was okish. It was a little bit away from everything, but it wasn't too bad.

review_body: With only one or two exceptions, this room was perfect. Needed instructions on how to get the TV in another language (English), and coffee and tea in room would be nice! I would recommend them highly, service and food was first rate.

review_body: Friendly staff, good value comfortable hotel. A short walk from The Spanish Steps. Lovely views of the city from the rooftop breakfast area. Piazza Barberini, 10 minutes walk away and is on the city bus tour route.

review_body: Great location,staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was clean and spacious and had everything we needed. Breakfast had plenty of choice and the view from the terrace was stunning. city tax is 6 euros a day. The hotel is on a nice road and has a kiosk opposite for drinks nibbles etc.The safe broke and was replaced the same day.We used the hotel limo service back to the airport,taxis are 48 euros and the limo was 55 so we went back in style.

review_body: A most enjoyable birthday treat for me!Room was excellent with a lovely view of the rooftops of Rome from the balcony.The spa spa bath was most welcome, with all the walking we did!Tea and coffee making facilities would be much appreciated in the room, but this omission seems to be the norm in Italy!A restaurant within the hotel would be useful, but Fellini’s just around the corner is wonderful!

review_body: Stayed at the romanico as a couple for the 6 nations rugby weekend, staff were friendly pleasant and welcoming, room was larger than expected with a renaissance decor which was a nice touch, great bathroom with shower, toilet and bidet. Not to close to the centre of room but within walking distance of tourists bus routes,good breakfast on the rooftop bar overlooking rome.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Romanico Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Romanico Palace for four nights whilst visiting Rome. Right from the moment of arrival we were happy with our choice. The front desk staff were so welcoming and warm. We were taken to our room and we were blown away. It was a suite with a lounge, bedroom and bathroom. There was a massive, super comfortable bed with spotlessly clean linen, a spacious bathroom that was also very clean and was equipped with toiletries and clean, soft towels. The decor is wonderful. The bar staff were so friendly and there was a wide range of drinks to choose from. Breakfast was abundant and with a great choice and served in the beautiful rooftop restaurant with amazing views to look any as you eat. It set us up for the day ahead. It is in a quiet area with no noise at night but was close enough to the attractions this fabulous city has to offer. There are a few negative comments on here about this hotel but I really can’t see where they are coming from. All I can think is some people will find fault wherever they go. Please don’t be put off by them. I will return to Rome and I will stay here again. Thank you for a wonderful visit.
hotelName:
0    Hotel Romanico Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon arrival we were greeted. The lobby was clean and quiet. We arrived about 9am and check in was at 2 pm so the front desk associate agreed to hold our luggage in a locked a secured area. I asked if they can do an early check in because we had a tour schedule at 2pm and he told me to check back a little later. My daughter and I were able to walk from the hotel to the Colosseum. After a short tour and lunch we walked back to the hotel around 1:30pm and I asked about the early check in and the front desk person said no. I ask if there were any restrooms we could use to change and he said no. He stated that we would have to find a restroom somewhere. I was a bit disappointed because this was my first time in Rome and I didn’t know anywhere to go. So around 1:50 I asked if our room was ready and it still was a no. So needless to say I lost my money on our tour to the Vatican which was about $200USD. I was a little upset about it because they waited until exactly 2pm to check me in. I have never had an issue like this before in all my traveling. Overall the room was clean and the night staff was very helpful and friendlier than the day staff. The breakfast was AMAZING and the rooftop view was classic. Will I return, yes. Will I recommend this hotel, yes!!
hotelName:
0    Hotel Romanico Palace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel experience. The location of the hotel was very convenient, not too busy but close enough to walk most places of interest. The building and décor are very "fitting" for a trip to Rome, kind of enhances the experience :). Staff was very helpful, patient, and friendly. Special kudos to Vincenzo. The breakfast dining room and menu are superb! The rooms had very comfortable beds, enough room, very clean. Bathroom was also very clean and with more amenities than I expected (I really appreciated the magnifying mirror :).

review_body: Very clean, friendly and convenient hotel. I had to book at the last minute when airbnb reservations fell through and they checked us right in and were able to quickly get my elderly parents who traveled all night into a room. The location near the American Embassy is convenient to cab to the sights and Villa Borghese, the large park, is right down the street to walk around.

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Romanico Palace. The staff was very helpful. The rooms were a good size and the beds were comfortable. We enjoyed the rainheads in the shower (even if the shower was a bit tiny). It was nice to have a Hotel bar to unwind in during the evening.

Hotel breakfast beautifull lovley rooftop view ! Staff friendly and happy to help ! The spa was also great ! Highly recommended ! Hotel in walking distance ! review_body: Everything was good we liked the room we just wish our friends did not have to be moved to another hotel. The bath was large and room was very large. Breakfast was good with a large variety. The location was great near the US embassy.

review_body: A nice hotel near all the tourist attractions with excellent service. The staff was very accommodating and professional. Beautiful views of the city from the roof’s terrace. I spent my birthday week end here and enjoyed my visit!

review_body: From the moment we checked in and were given vouchers to visit the rooftop bar we absolutely loved this hotel! The staff is exceptional. They are friendly informative and genuinely happy to help. We booked a special romantic package so we had spa treatments while staying at the hotel. It was a truly special experience. We had dinner in their fabulous restaurant where everything was delicious. The breakfast is wonderful. Everything is fresh and abundant. They even have many different types of freshly squeezed juice. The mini bar is restocked every night and it is complimentary. We loved that!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So, to start - this hotel is absolutely gorgeous and has incredible vibes! The location itself is about 10 minutes from the train terminal by car, 20 minutes via taxi to the Vatican, and about a 15 minute walk to the Spanish Stairs. If you’re planning to arrive early, let the concierge know and they accommodate as best as they can. First stop, the rooftop bar for a complimentary glass of the bubbly (or coffee). However, I HIGHLY recommend Maurizio’s handcrafted Apple Fruit Martini . It’s seriously heavenly, plus he’s quite the gentleman so that’s a fun plus. The entire staff is extremely friendly, speak fluent English and welcome you with plenty of advice for local spots. And one thing - eat as much pasta and gelato as you can! Last but not least, stop by their spa...gorgeous. #enjoy
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I take this hotel because it accessible with with wheelchair.The Hotel:The hotel is beautiful, clean there's a good smell all the time.Each hotel has access with a wheelchair.The hotel location is close to everything, 10 min for the Termini, 20 min form the Colosseo.The Staff:The whole hotel staff was very pleasant and helped with everything I needed, from the door men, reception, and breakfast stuff. They all take care for you any time of the day.The Room: (Access wheelchair room)The room was very clear and look like new.The wheelchair access room was perfect with enough space also the bathroom. (I recommended to the hotel to add wheelchair shower to make it more easy).The room have 2 bathrooms, one for the wheelchair and one regular with bath and it was so nice.In the room the minibar is free and was filled up every day and it was so nice and perfect.The king size bad was big and very comfortable.Breakfast:The breakfast was just prefect, fresh and delicious food with diverse of food and amazing desserts and kind of fruits.We make checkout very early from the breakfast, so they make us a bug take away with breakfast, it was so considerate.I am absolutely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our third stay at Hotel Artemide and it did not disappoint. We asked to stay in the same room as before, not remembering the room number ourselves, but sure enough the hotel came up trumps. The first time we stayed was 10 years ago, and then again 5 years ago. It says a lot when you recognise some of the staff from before. The hotel has been updated in that time and is very pleasant and relaxing. The location is very central and we walk to all the main tourist attractions from there.Upon arrival this time, we were greeted with a very warm welcome. Everyone speaks English. We were given a voucher to have a welcome drink on the roof top terrace. Always an enjoyable experience. We asked for a table to be booked for that evening and later in the week (for our anniversary). All sorted out for us as it was fully booked.When we were shown to our room, a bottle of red and some snacks were waiting for us along with a personalised Congratulations card. Breakfast is a buffet and is very comprehensive. Continental meats, cheese, sausages, eggs, bacon, fresh fruit etc. All the breads and pastries are from their own kitchen and every morning you are offered the “cake” of the day by the waiting staff, as well as bruschetta and cheese. Staff are very friendly and always eager to please.Rome is a fascinating city with lots of things to see and do and staying at Artemide is the icing on the cake. We wouldn’t hesitate to stay for a fourth time.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for a couple nights this past week and I was absolutely amazed by the entire experience. Rome was the last stop on my European vacation and this hotel really made for the perfect conclusion to the trip.  The hotel is extremely clean and nice. The staff is top notch. The breakfast was the best I've ever had at a hotel. The rooftop restaurant is incredible. The spa is amazing. The AC in the room works fantastic (which is a plus for the hot summers in Rome).Look no further when searching for a hotel in Rome. Hotel Artemide creates an experience that lasts a lifetime. I would definitely stay here again the next time I visit Rome. I had fairly high hopes for this hotel given the prior high reviews, but somehow this hotel actually exceeded those expectations.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything you need - great rooms, comfy, clean, free mini bar, wonderful staff - so friendly and helpful, and the best breakfast you could ask for. Not only are you spoilt for choice in the buffet, but the waitresses bring around fresh bread and freshly baked bruschetta, figs and marmalade to try. The location is perfect, easy walking distance to main sites. Oh yes - we also used the spa which was excellent, and a meal we had in the roof top restaurant was one of the nicest in Rome.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I feel awful that I haven’t written this review sooner. Me and my partner stayed at this hotel last June for my 60th birthday. Initially there was some confusion over the booking through a third party and I do not believe this was the fault of Artemide. The staff at the hotel were absolutely fantastic at helping me to celebrate my birthday in style. They really couldn’t have been more helpful. I loved Rome and I loved this hotel. We will definitely return and we will definitely stay here. Hotel situation is good, staff are helpful and friendly. The restaurant is fabulous and Rome is beyond amazing! What more could you want? Loved it!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed at Hotel Artemide during our vacation in Rome and it was AMAZING. The staff was so friendly and helpful. They could not have been more pleasant and went out of their way to make our holiday wonderful. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again when we return.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is so warm, inviting, accommodating, helpful, I can go on an on. Never had any problems. The restaurant has the best food I ever had. You really never have to leave to get anything because this hotel has it all. Will definitely be using them again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked the spa for my partners birthday where we had use of the facilities and had hot stone massages in the same room. It was amazing the place is beautiful and the staff can’t do enough for you. Would come back again in a minute and even stay in the lovely hotel. If your headed to Rome defiantly book In on you last day after days of sight seeing it was just what we needed.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't recommend this hotel enough. This was our first trip away together without the kids and the hotel staff made the whole experience so relaxing.When we arrived the staff were so welcoming and gave us details of points of interest around Rome. We were abit early so we made our way to rooftop bar and had a couple of drinks.Then we were shown our room which was immaculate, so clean.Later in the day my partner was given a bottle of complimentary champagne as it was his birthday.In the second day we had breakfast and considering its 7am the staff are friendly, attentive and warm. Housekeeping were brilliant and when we came back to our room later that day it was amazing, just like arriving on our first day. Everything clean and in its place.We needed help booking our driver back to the airport and reception were more than happy to do this on our behalf.The stay at this hotel truly made our trip to Rome so much more enjoyable and I'm sure we will be back again! Thank you x
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabulous location, walk to almost everything. Cute, redone city hotel. Nice touches, an executive type lounge/meeting place with coffee but for all guests on ground floor, and free in room mini bar w soft drinks and light snacks. Very nice breakfast. Wait staff a little “befuddled” in morning but nice as can be, and try’s hard to get coffees right. Friendliest front desk staff as any I’ve encountered. Definitely recommend and would come back again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent/helpful staff. Nice/comfortable rooms. Great central location. Great for business travel. Good restaurant recommendations. Very accommodating. Nice gym for small space. Highly recommended. 5 out of 5.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel and roof top bar. Amazing staff and friendly atmosphere. Perfectly artistic made drinks. Highly recommend. Please visit. Clean, tasty pasta, wide variety. Bellissima!! Close to shopping.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel!! Excellent location! Rooms are a bit small but service is good. It was nice to get the free water and Juice mini bar..,smart move management!!! Breakfast was quite comprehensive. A big shout to Sabina serving breakfast. She was very caring and attentive to our needs!!! Overall a great stay in Rome!!!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We began our Italian trip right when we checked into the Hotel Artemide. Coming off nearly 24 hours of traveling, the wonderful Ivan helped us with our room and an orientation to the area. This centrally located hotel is close to many of the most famous sites in Rome, including the Colosseum and Trevia Fountain, and there are numerous great restaurants within walking distance. The room was nice and immaculate, and the service during our 5-night stay was excellent. Two of the highlights were Ambrosia (the rooftop bar and restaurant) and the most spectacular continental breakfast I’ve ever had at hotel – overseen by the super-helpful and always cheerful Salvatore. We loved this hotel and would definitely return.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of four (2 teen boys, ages 13 & 15) came to Rome for the first time having stayed here. It was glorious from the beginning to end for several reasons: 1) Great location - Central to everything, including walking distance to Trevi. 2) Unbelievable Staff - These people greeted us with smiles right when we checked in. As we were checking out, another staff asked if we needed our luggage held. He took the initiative. At breakfast, all staff asked if we wanted freshly made dessert or anything else. This brings me to the next topic...breakfast.3) Amazing breakfast buffet - Despite its 4-star classification (how could this not be a 5-star?), it’s breakfast was amazing. They had eggs, sausage, beans, smoked salmon...you name it. I looked forward to breakfast every morning. Even was willing to skip dinner for this breakfast. 4) Super fast and helpful concierge - Need I say more? Needed to change our train reservations. My husband went downstairs and Jess than 10 minutes later he was back up. Initially I thought that the concierge wasn’t there or able to help given how quickly he came back up. But it turns out that he was able to get it all resolved and taken care of that quickly. 5) Clean, clean, clean - this place was spotless. We stayed in Paris and experienced completely the opposite. The Paris hotel was an absolute dump despite its price and classification. This hotel was in stark contrast to what we had experienced there. America and the hotel industry internationally can learn a thing or two from the Italians. 6) Beds - The beds were absolutely heavenly. I did not realize how much I appreciate a firm bed until I stayed here. It was almost like a memory foam firm bed. I loved it and got the best night’s sleep. 7) Stocked bar - many of the hotels will charge you for taking one little creamer or a piece of candy from the hotel room. But not this one. Whatever was in the refrigerator was ours to keep for free. What hotel does that?Only issue that we had is that the shower door was too short. Whenever we took showers, because there wasn’t a sliding door, rather a short piece of glass that didn’t move, there was a ton of water that spilled out and sprayed out of it. Therefore leaving a huge mess. Would come back here in a heartbeat!! The BEST! And we’ve stayed at 5-star hotels before.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a group of 8 and stayed at this hotel which exceeded our expectations. From the front desk to the wait staff in the restaurant and roof top bar, we couldn’t be happier. The rooms were a bit small but clean and comfortable. We would definitely come back when we visit Rome again. Rose A.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel couldn't be more welcoming and responsive. Great outdoor dining and bar on rooftop. Booked the honeymoon suite with rooftop terrace and rooftop jacuzzi- it was outstanding! I emailed the staff ahead of time with a couple special requests and they responded within the hour - it was a sign of the great service to come!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Talk about being welcomed! We were shocked and amazed at how warm, friendly, helpful and the efficiency of the front desk staff as the service was outstanding no matter the time of day or evening!We couldn't have asked for a better location as it was easy to move around and find great restaurants. You might want to try Il nido del Pettirosso that is a short walk from the hotel as the food and service was excellent so make a reservation. Don't miss the Ambrosia Rooftop Restaurant in the hotel as it is excellent too. Reservations a must.The room was comfortable, clean and the rain shower divine!Hotel Artemide is our number one choice for our next stay in Rome.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was our first time to Rome; our accommodations, service and location of the Hotel Artemide were outstanding. The staff was truly awesome... the most helpful, knowledgeable, and friendliest staffs I have ever encountered. The rooms were clean and comfortable! The breakfast bar was wonderful and complimentary mini-bar; stocked daily. Yes, I repeat... complimentary mini-bar. I would highly recommend this Hotel to anyone staying in Rome. They made you feel like family.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We're stayed in many hotels around the world; the best ones have been in Asia. Indeed this hotel ranks in our top 10 for a number of reasons. The location is perfect. A short walk from the main Termini transportation station, we also walked to the Colosseum, and to the shopping on Via del Corso. Staff was really helpful on check-in and all really great the entire three days. Our basic double room (319) was small but efficient. Comfortable bed and sheets, very nice bathroom, really well lit, and the air conditioning worked great. Room includes mini fridge with two beers, sparkling and still water, juices, and a few snacks ... all complimentary and replaced daily. Good t.v. with the usual limited English channels... mostly news (CNN, CNBC, etc.). Room has a hot pot to make tea and instant coffee. Cleaning staff was excellent. Our room overlooked the interior so no street noise. There is a rooftop bar + restaurant where you can enjoy your complimentary glass of Italian prosecco and get buckets of ice for your room. There is a spa one floor below (-1 with 0 being street level). Robes and slippers are provided in the room. As in many places in Europe, there are no wash clothes so throw some in when you pack. Two close by restaurant we tried were Berzitello and La Cucina Nazionale for good (not gourmet) food at reasonable prices. For our June 2019 3-night stay we did the nonrefundable option and with city taxes the rate was $245 per night.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you happen to be lucky enough to visit Rome you must stay at Hotel Artemide! From the moment we arrived til checkout the service was amazing! Pasquale D’Auria and Sebastian made us feel like family in the restaurant and even sent us off to Sorrento with a delicious care package including homemade bread and limoncello! The rooms were clean and comfortable! My straightener wouldn’t work and they left one in my room for me! The rooftop bar and restaurant with Maurice were so pleasant and his drinks beautiful! They even accommodated my Italian family at off hours for drinks! I give this hotel 5 stars and would stay here again in a minute.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We couldn’t have asked for a better hotel to stay in while on a trip to Rome for 4 night. Exceptional customer service was a particular highlight but the delicious food, rooftop restaurant and bar, beautiful decor and comfortable rooms were also well worth the money. Hope it’s not my last visit. Only tip for others is to book the restaurant in advance...it is very popular so difficult to get a “last minute” dinner reservation. (But there are lots of other places very nearby which are also delicious!)
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so glad we booked this hotel for our stay in Rome. The hotel is beautiful, the staff extremely gracious and attentive. Location was great for us; we wanted something close to the train and walking distance to sites. The hotel is about a ten minute walk from Termini (with bags), and we easily explored the entire city on foot. As convenient as the hotel is, we were pleasantly surprised at how quiet it was at night. We seriously did not hear a peep. The breakfast buffet had great variety and the food was delicious. Don’t pass up cocktails or a meal on the rooftop; delightful! I will definitely stay here again on my next visit to Rome.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow, the reviews did not let me down. The friendliest and most accommodating staff I've ever had in a hotel. Byron the bellhop was so friendly and helpful. And the young mane who checked us out helped me buy my train tickets from my cell phone - saved me money and I wouldn't have made my connection otherwise. He even looked for train tickets on his computer to try and save me money.AMAZING breakfast buffet - the wait staff would come around bringing us fresh burschetta, homemade banana cake, etc. And they upgraded our room upon arrival. Was worth at least double of what I paid.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff and accomodations could not have been better. A premium room was spacious and comfortable. We were able to walk everywhere. The breakfast included was beyond our expectations. We can't wait to return!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Two years ago, my 2 adult sons and I visited Rome and stayed at the Hotel Artemide. We loved every aspect of our stay and I wrote an extensive review listing room information, amenities, location, ambience, and the beautiful Ambrosia rooftop bar and restaurant. I would encourage you to read that review for travel specifics about the Hotel Artemide. Everything is just as wonderful, if not better!For this review, I would like to focus on the extraordinary staff. I have vacationed at many wonderful resorts and I have received outstanding service at some of them, but in my opinion, no other place comes close to the level of service, professionalism, helpfulness, and cheerful attitude as exemplified by the very special staff of the Hotel Artemide! From check in to check out, everything is seamless. The front desk and foyer staff are exemplary, always attending to our needs almost before we can voice them. Whether it is making reservations or recommendations, calling for transportation, or helping with luggage and packages, they can be counted on 100%This same desire to please customers extends to the dining staff, both at the breakfast cafe and at the Ambrosia rooftop bar and restaurant. Staff members are quick to remember particular preferences and do everything possible to fulfill them. So wonderful to return late in the day and head to the rooftop for a relaxing cocktail and be greeted by Maurizio, Sami, or Lacra as if we were treasured friends.But what we loved most of all, was the playfulness and genuine friendliness that was extended that made it so much fun to interact with the various staff members. We have been thoroughly spoiled by the delightful Artemide staff, and can't wait to see them again on our next trip. Be sure to reserve early because, sadly for us guests, the word is out that this is the place to stay.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this hotel was wonderful; very centrally located for everything that we wanted to see. We had 2 rooms for 4 adults. The rooms definitely had enough space and were very clean. Everyone was extremely helpful and friendly. Federica, at the front desk, answered all of our questions. She, always, had a smile on her face. Maurizio, the rooftop bartender, performed magic with his drinks. Not only were they delicious but they looked beautiful. Salvatore, in the breakfast room, greeted us pleasantly every morning. He remembered what we liked to drink with our breakfast - either Americano coffee or cappuccino. Salvatore even helped my son with a cleaner when he spilled something on his white shirt. The porters were very helpful with our luggage. Would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First off this was our first time in Italy. Traveling from New York. We had a room on the 6th floor and could still hear outside street noise, not a deal breaker but noticeable. Hotel location was appealing to me, close enough to walk to main Rome attractions but far enough to be off the main hustle and bustle Rome streets. Staff was very nice. Doormen and luggage porters to the staff in the breakfast room. Breakfast was included in our stay and we loved it! The staff was great and offered a large number of options for food, all top quality. The rooftop restaurant was also great! Nice staff, food was delicious and very reasonably priced. Room service ordered through this restaurant as well one night was just as good. The room itself was very small, large bed took up 95% of the room. TV and cable options were more then sufficient. Bathroom was great very large and clean. Amazing mini bar stocked daily free of charge was a nice bonus. Highly recommend as a home base when exploring Rome!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would just like to say a big thanks to all the staff at the Artemide hotel, they really made our 4 night stay very special. It was my wife's 50th Birthday and they could not do enough to please us with any request. The rooftop restaurant was amazing with great views of Rome in the sunset, beautiful cocktails and drink menu. I will 100% stay at this hotel the next time I visit Rome, just would like to thanks all the staff at the hotel......hope to see you soon!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed here last week for 5 days and we had a great experience. The hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful, especially Ivan. He really went above and beyond to help us on several occasions. The hotel is beautiful and the rooms are spacious. The location is perfect - walking distance to most of the main sights. The breakfast buffet was delicious, though I wish they would have opened up a bit earlier than 7:00am. This is a smaller hotel, but does not lack in anything. I would highly recommend!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in Rome and what an amazing find the Artemide was. From the moment we arrived the service was amazing. We stayed for three nights, front desk staff were more than helpful, our room was immaculately clean, the room provided all toiletries, towels, robes and slippers were excellent quality, in room snacks/drinks are complimentary. There were facilities provided to make hot drinks in the room and there was also a room off the lobby providing 24 hour hot drinks.Breakfast was truly a delight, wonderfully presented, immaculately clean, the staff cooking and presenting the breakfast are very passionate and it shows. It was my wife’s birthday and on the morning she was presented with a wonderful fruit flan creation complete with a candle, which was a stunning surprise as we had not mentioned that it was her special day to anyone. Salvatore made each morning very special for us with his excellent customer service and his attention to detail. The breakfast restaurant was smoothly run and nothing was too much trouble, the staff were amazing. We also had a meal at the roof top restaurant, Ambrosia , which was a wonderful, beautifully presented three course evening meal. We received the same great customer service here to.The hotel is in a great location for getting to the main sights easily, also lots of shops and restaurants around the vicinity.We would definitely recommend this hotel and can’t wait to return. Thank you to all the staff for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Hotel Artemide May 19-22 and enjoyed every moment. Upon arriving at the hotel from the airport we were greeted warmly by the front desk with a lovely upgrade to our room from a triple deluxe to a junior suite. Loved this welcome! They proceeded to top this wonderful service when they found out we had an early start time the next morning for a tour of the Vatican by providing us with breakfast goody bags so we wouldn’t go hungry. First impressions are important and they exceeded expectations. The porter assisted us with our luggage and showed us the amenities to our room. Since we received an upgraded room, he realized my daughter’s sofa bed was not ready and took it upon himself to notify housekeeping. Housekeeping arrived a few minutes later with bedding, towels and extra robe and slippers. Kudos to their staff for being so observant and friendly! The room was fabulous, we had 2 doors leading out to a balcony with a great view of Via Nazionale. Our daughter had her own tv, closet and charging area while we had a huge bed with our own charging areas and a tv. Pocket doors separated the two areas. The bathroom was a dream with beautiful lighting and marble. The shower stall and rain head was big and so soothing. The room was a lovely refuge after tours and shopping. Our daughter loved it so much she didn’t want to leave for the tours. We loved eating at Ambrosia restaurant, so much that we booked another visit on our last night in Rome. The food was a visual feast for the eyes and stomach. We would have licked the plates clean if we could!Location wise, the hotel was close to all the attractions save the Vatican where we chose to use a cab. The Colosseum was at the most a 15-20 minute walk and less for the Pantheon, Trevi fountain and Piazza Navona.Concierge services had great recommendations for dinner and we had a delicious time at Cotto. They also assisted us with booking a cab to the airport when it was time to go home. All questions and requests were always met with a smile and warmth that clearly showed the staff wanted to assist. We had a great time staying at Hotel Artemide. There is a reason clients voted them # 1. We will definitely come back to stay here again. Thank you!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rome was our last stop on our Europe tour in feb. This hotel was so central to every tourist site which made it so easy to see everything. the hotel breakfast was incredible, with a wide variety and on some morning a special treat. the hotel staff was friendly and assisted us to arrange tours and dinners. the hotel was extremely spacious and clean and had everything you will need when travelling. the extra bit was the bar fridge and tea table in the room which was complimentary and replaced everyday of our stay. i highly recommend this hotel for an amazing stay in Rome.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel. The spa is to die for . Roof top bar is amazing. Close to shops. In the heart of Rome. Rooms are excellent, including FREE minibar. Staff is very polite and accommodating. One of the best hotel experiences around
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a return visit to Hotel Artemide, Rome, my wife and I were pleasantly surprised to find this already lovely hotel completely re-furbished. A combination of elegance and tasteful Italian décor set the mood for a wonderful end to our month long journey of Sicily and the Amalfi Coast.From the moment you arrive at this hotel you are greeted with excellent service, commencing with Sebastian and staff at reception, through to porters, cleaners, chefs, bar and restaurant personnel. In particular, the manager of the rooftop restaurant and trainee, Micaela, made our evenings most enjoyable. The chefs ensured our return each evening by producing delicious meals and by surprising us with extra touches, such as canapes, appetizers and desserts that seemed forever appearing. My wife’s birthday was made very special with a thoughtful bottle of bubbles and birthday cake.In our opinion, Hotel Artemide is equal to the best worldwide!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 5 Star Service. I can’t say enough great things about our experience at this hotel. From the cleanliness of the room, the great breakfast or the exceptional friendly service...everything about our stay was exceptional. Highly recommend this hotel. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the Hotel at the last minute for a really great price. We were not expecting much but it was amazing! It is about a 15 min walk from Roma Termini and about 30 to the Colosseum. From the moment we walked in we felt special. The concierge Francesco was extremely welcoming. Our room was fantastic! The pillows and bed were so comfortable I wanted to take them home with me. The breakfast buffet was outstanding with so many choices and the service was excellent.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was great. The Hotel itself is very nice and the room was quite comfortable. . Service was excellent att the way around. And the location was well suited for shopping, sightseeing and dining. Walking distance to so many things. Will definitely return if I am able.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely hotel, but what separates it is the staff and the service. Every single member of staff is warm, open, friendly and knowledgeable. We had lovely drinks in the rooftop bar and a great dinner (pre-booking is essential) but were also recommended other great options. The hotel is in a great location and we walked pretty much everywhere, most main attractions are within 10-15 mins walk. However, when a taxi was required, they arrived in less than 5 minutes each time. We also used the hotel recommended airport service which was very high quality. We had an amazing time in Rome and the hotel was a huge part of that – thank you!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service and atmosphere. Nice breakfast and staff. Rooms are very nice and clean. Had a very nice stay. Not a drop of negativity from the stay just not a 5 star hotel which would fetch much more money. Would stay again. Great location and amazing gelato across the street :)
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location and a fabulous hotel. Very comfortable beds. The staff was very friendly. Did not get a chance to use the spa or eat the breakfast but I'm sure it would have been great. Loved that it had a free mini bar. Not many hotels do that.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel walking distance from all the sights. The hotel is modern and spotlessly clean and the staff are very welcoming. The food in the rooftop restaurant is incredible and breakfast is good quality and very comprehensive.The spa is very relaxing after a long day walking around Rome. We stayed for four nights and couldn't find anything we didn't love. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the minute you step foot into this hotel, till when you check-out, your experience staying here will be amazing. Everyone at the front desk is eager to help, the hotel is spacious, and clean, and the exquisite restaurant on the rooftop will take your breath away. It's walking distance to major sites, shops and if you need a taxi-- the front desk will immediately call you one. When I asked the front desk for a shower mat, and two small towels they were waiting for us in our room. The complimentary breakfast is one of the best I've ever had. They even had vegan croissants! Honestly, if you're torn between booking this hotel or another, I implore you to book this one. You won't regret it! Thank you to all the staff at Hotel Artemide for making my first stay in Rome memorable!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We lucked out when our hotel search led us to Hotel Artemide. We stayed for 5 nights and loved everything about the place...from the terrific buffet breakfast, their highly rated rooftop restaurant Ambrosia (make a reservation before you come...we ate there twice and it was full both times), the nice sized rooms with the VERY comfortable bed and replenished room fridge, the “eat off the floor” cleanliness, to their amazing staff with their constant, sincere smiles. They truly can’t do enough for you. We’ll see you again!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I visited Rome for the first time and somehow we lucked out by finding this amazing hotel. They gave us a free upgrade, free drink vouchers, and their customer service was amazing from the very start to the very end. They always had smiles on their faces and always willing to help out in any way. Their amenities are great. Best shower in a hotel we’ve had in a while. Their rooftop restaurant and bar was a gem. Their location is perfect as it is in the middle of all the main attractions... about 15ish minutes walk to the Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and Spanish steps and about 20 minute walk to the Colosseum.Bottom line is that if we ever come back to Rome, we will definitely be staying here again hands down! Thanks to the awesome staff who helped give us this amazing experience!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What makes this hotel a 5-star is the staff. We stayed here in 2017 for 5 nights and now once again for 5 nights. We were reacquainted with much of the same lovely individuals at the front desk, which in itself speaks volumes. They cannot do enough to help out in every way. Room was small but with ample space to unpack. The bed was wonderful and the bathroom was modern and spacious for spreading out toiletries. I was pleased to see all their shampoos etc were cruelty-Free. The rooftop bar and restaurant are first class. We went there on our final night and were treated to gourmet dining. Breakfast was also delicious with a huge array of choices and fresh homemade specialty dishes offered up to your table as well by a wandering waitress with a tray of goodies. If you need personal transport be sure to ask at the front desk for Aldo. He was a marvelous driver on both our visits. If we return to Rome we will surely stay at the Artemide again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went here with my girlfriend in Feb 2018 over Valentines day. It is hands down our favorite trip ever. The hotel is fabulous with an excellent location and friendly and helpful staff. The hotel room was spacious and finished beautifully. It came with a FREE minibar stocked each day which was great for refreshments after a long day of walking around the city's amazing sights. Hotel is last word and a real experience. Also 5 mins from a metro so travel is a breeze
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Four nights stay in May - Hotel service excellent - very good breakfast - Excellent dinner in the Artimede rooftop Ambrosia restaurant - great hotel and rooms - finished off with a delicious Maurizo Chocolate Martini
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i went with my husbend for 4 days, we enjoyed our stay, we had a quiet room, so we sleept better than home, we had a nice breakfast, the stuff was okay. clean rooms, and perfect location we recomend for sure.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is absolutely wonderful. The situation, within walking distance of both the station and the main attractions in the city, is perfect. Transfer direct from the hotel to the airport was quick by taxi and at a fixed price. Loved the food both for breakfast and in the restaurant for dinner. The roof top terrace is great for drinks in the herb garden. Above all, the staff are so friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No need to look any place else, this is the one. Great property, great location, great breakfast and great staff. This is our second time using Hotel Artemide and it only gets better each time. Go to the roof top restaurant and enjoy a nice lunch with great surroundings.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location. Short walk from Rome Termini Station, 15 min walk to Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, and the Spanish Steps. Unfortunately it is not in the best area for restaurants and we found ourselves walking 20+ minutes to get to most of the highly reviewed restaurants. It is possible to walk to/from the Vatican as well, but that is 45 mins to an hour. If you aren’t concerned about access to trains, you might want to consider something a bit closer to the river. The hotel itself is quite nice. We have stayed in some bummer 4 star hotels in Europe and we were nicely surprised by Artemide. The rooms are nicely appointed and well maintained. Ours was a bit small but it was comfortable. Yes. The reviews are true. The mini bar is free and restocked daily. This is an incredible plus and saved us a substantial amount of pocket cash each day on water, sodas and light snacks. We had no view to speak of and missed being able to peer out our window at one of the city’s many sights. Breakfast is well done and I highly recommend a room rate that includes breakfast. There are plenty of options, both hot and cold, to choose from, and plenty of things to grab and stuff in you bag to snack on during the day. Staff were nice but really the hotel isn’t full-service with a dedicated concierge. They will try to help you book tours and can assist with major arrangements, but they lacked detailed local expertise on dining, drinking and entertainment. The spa is nice and has good facilities - sauna, steam room/Turkish bath, plunge pools, etc. I got a massage for a decent fee, and it was good, not great. However the massage fee did not include access to the spa and it was 30 euro to use the facilities on top of the 75 for the massage. Fortunately the front desk was honest about our booking which apparently included 1 free spa access per occupant, so the fee was waived on check out. The fitness center is tiny but has good modern equipment. No excuse for not working out here. Overall I would recommend this hotel. It is a solid 4 star performance for a solid 4 star property. A little extra attention here and there from the staff and a few more included extras and I might consider rating it a 4.5-5. The one thing going against it is value. The price we paid was high for what we got, both in terms of accommodations and service. We stayed in an exceptional 5 star property in Milano just prior to coming here, and by comparison Artemide was not a great value.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Artemide
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely Hotel in a fantastic position (walking distance to almost all attractions). Staff were very polite & helpful- particularly the lovely woman in the breakfast room, who was always polite, smiling & willing to help.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, but it is very very loud at night. You will be woken up throughout the night with glass breaking outside and people moving out of their hotels. The rooms were big and spacious. Would return.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Be aware of additional charges! Location is convenient. It is walking distance to Spanish steps and metro station “ Spagna” on A line. It would have been a 5 stars experience for a mom and two little kids except UNEXPECTED CHARGES applied when we are rushing to airport at 8 AM. First, during check in, the staff stated the breakfast were included(direct quote) in hotel stay. It was untrue that we are charged. The breakfast in this hotel is not worthy it)Second, city commission tax also charged even we pay in full prior arrival. We understand business needs profit but slapping multiple fees in opportunity is indeed questionable. We were planning on returning to Rome but sadly we just rather deal with honest hotel which is upfront. FYI. We pay Us $721.19 for three nights and $68 Euro were charged additionally.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Condotti is really as central as you can get in the centro storico, a stone's throw from the Piazza di Spagna. The room that I stayed in was small, but very clean and with all the necessary amenities. The staff is very friendly and extremely helpful and accomodating. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed staying here on a short trip to Rome. Location was excellent, transport links are good (although the nearest metro station was closed during our visit). The room itself was clean and well furnished. No shampoo in the bathroom, but there is a small 24 hr supermarket nearby, so it was easy to get some. The room also had tea and coffee making facilities, which was brilliant!
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Condotti Hotel is just a few minutes away from Spanish Steps. It is very rare to find a real comfortable hotel in Rome at a good price. The condotti hotel was perfect with its rooms, reception staff and cleanlinesss..I do not think to stay somewhereelse then Condotti Hotel in Rome. Thank you very much for everything.You can easily reach from airport to hotel with metroline.The restaurant next to hotel Restaurant 34 was very good I recommend it also
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Been to this little hotel for an overnight stay in between hotel stays in Rome. Must say we were very pleased with the overall product. No luxury and nothing Wow but the location is perfect, the staff very polite and accommodating and the breakfast is very decent and extremely well priced. Prices for the accommodation vary from very reasonable (130 or 140 to 500 and more per night). We paid 160 excl city tax for a room in main building which we found very reasonable. One word of advice, if you like a quite room fo not take a room at the front as it can get noisy with the street performer till late. We weren't bothered in fact we liked it! . Thanks staff for printing our boarding passes and providing kettle with teabags in our room for free. Water and small pastries available in the lobby all day long. Recommended. We will be back
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We didn't stay in the main hotel, we stayed at the sister hotel which was on "Via Del Corso" around the corner which is one of the main streets that runs through the centre of Rome with lots of high end shops and many side streets full of bars and restaurants. A few minutes walk from the Spanish Steps this hotel was located fantastically in one of the most breath taking cities i've ever visited. The hotel itself was not only well located, but it was spacious, comfortable and modern. An espresso machine along with snacks was included daily and a fridge was also included. Staff super friendly and it was one of the highlights of our tripsHighly recommended
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even though our room was in a separate building a few blocks away, the check in process was quick and easy. Someone did help with our bags and escort us to our room. It was small but clean and comfy. Good location to Spanish steps, shopping and restaurants.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As my wife and I see things, this hotel can be rated no higher than fair (btw I took the trouble of taking photos on my phone if any of these details are disputed). I should state that staff were incredibly polite and were as helpful as possible in the circumstances. The hotel is also in a great location. Anyway, We booked a ‘superior’ room and the room that we were offered for our stay was room 101 on the first floor (although we’d requested a high floor at the time of booking). According to the booking.com portal ‘superior’ rooms were supposed to have a balcony but room 101 didn’t have one (we didn’t realise until arrival but only the higher floors actually have balconies!) - we were informed that this error was the fault of booking.com. We had to accept room 101 as there were no rooms available on higher floors until the next day (we were only staying for 3 nights). We entered room 101, there was an awful musty smell and the window was open. I complained about the smell and mentioned the suspicious open window - I was informed that apart from having the room re-cleaned nothing could be done and it was hotel policy to leave room windows open prior to occupancy. We accepted our lot as we were tired from travelling. We then discovered that although very warm outside the air conditioning didn’t work - we were informed that the air conditioning throughout the hotel hadn’t been ‘switched on’ as it was too early in the year and all rooms were the same. The bathroom in room 101 had a bath with integral shower arrangement - my wife tried tried to run a bath but only the shower worked. We complained - a maintenance man arrived and informed us that the bath tap was broken and he could leave us with either the bath or shower working (not both). We chose the bath. Again, my wife tried to run a bath and the dirtiest brown liquid spurted out (and with ‘bits’ in it). I left this coloured water in the bath and went to reception. The reception manager came to take a look and was also taken aback by the colour of the water. He went away to speak to the hotel manager and offered us a 50% discount for our first night’s stay. Being on the first floor and with the window open due to no air conditioning, it was a very noisy first night and difficult to sleep (it was a Saturday). One other thing (and just an aside really) - some time the next morning, looking up at the ceiling, I noticed that the smoke alarm had been covered by a plastic bag. The next day we were moved to a newly refurbished room (414) - it had its own terrace and this room was absolutely delightful (the type of room we thought that we’d booked initially). Upon entering, we found the windows closed and that the air conditioning worked. If you are thinking of booking this hotel I would advise asking for a confirmed room number and at the very least whether or not the room is refurbished - if the hotel cannot confirm these details then stay elsewhere. A discount of 50% for one night may sound reasonable until you factor in that one third of our stay was made unpleasant by this hotel’s performance and the cost of one third of our trip was considerably more than the discount we enjoyed.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Condotti Hotel is just a few minutes away from Spanish Steps. It is very rare to find a real comfortable hotel in Rome at a good price. The Condotti Hotel was perfect with its rooms, reception staff and cleanlinesss. I do not think to stay somewhere else then Condotti Hotel in Rome. Thank you very much for everythingAlso the 34 restaurant next to Hotel was very good I also recommend it
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just disgusting. So old and run down. Location is just about the only thing it has going for it. Do your research and stay some place nicer and enjoy Rome.The customer service was horrible. As we were checking out at 4am, we thought we'd settle the city tax bill the night before. They wanted the city tax paid in cash and had no change! The young guy behind the desk was so rude about it...quote "what do you want me to do about it" We had to go to nearby restaurants and beg them to break a note for us so we could pay the guy at reception the city tax in the exact amount.We were checked into a room that had a broken window, the window wouldn't actually close. And then were moved to a new room where the mattress felt like it was pulled from a dumpster, the springs were poking our backs. Don't stay here...you'll only be disappointed
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good loation very close to spagna station. I booked adjustment sweet with officiating web site. official site offer cheapest price when I check several sites. room was separate building from the building have reception. but it was ok since I used reception wad when I check in and out. I didn add breakfas service so that didn't need any serive at reception.Room was good considered their price. it has kettle and free coffee, tea bag and some biscuit.二人で3泊しました。泊まったとは公式ページでadjustment buildingのjunior suiteと記載のある部屋です。公式ホームページの値段が一番安かったのでここに泊まると決めた人は公式サイトからの予約をおすすめします。予約する際はadjustment buildingの意味が何を指しているのかよくわかりませんでしてが、別の建物を意味していました。部屋がある建物はフロントがあった建物をでて角を一曲がりするとある建物です。フロントとは別の建物ですが、朝食もつけておらずフロントにはチェックアウト以外で行かないため支障はありませんでした。朝食をつけた人はフロントがある建物に止まったほうが便利だと思います。朝食はつけていませんでしたが、部屋には無料のビスケット、ジャム、紅茶、コーヒー、ポットがあるので簡単に済ませたい人はそれで充分かもしれません。スーパーも近くにあり便利でした。スペイン広場、spagna駅からも近いので便利でした。spagna駅からバチカン市国まで乗り換えなしで行けます。
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: if you have a few days in Rome this is absolutely the best possible spot yo ant think of. you can literally visit all there is to see for a short visit on foot. the staff is really helpful especially Daniela.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the annex building in Via del Corso. Positive: Great location, a bit noisy during the day and early evening though due to numerous shoppers. At night it was perfectly quiet. Room looked relatively new and comfy. Cleaning was good. We had electric kettle, little fridge and complimentary snacks + tea/coffee, whick was really nice. They also had extra brankets.Negative: The room was cold. We were freezing at night. Air conditioner was pre-programmed on a certain regimen and the sign said not to change it. Conditioner display was malfunctioning and not always allowed us to adjust the temperature (sometimes we managed to increase it, sometimes didn't). As a result we caught a cold..On the day of check-out our cards just got blocked and we could not get inside our room where all our luggage was. Since this building has not staff on duty - it is really not very customer oriented. Besides I wish they told us about possible blocking in advance..Finally, at the check-out although staff was nice, they pushed us really hard to leave excellent review (like, "when you get the questionnaire, put only 5 stars on every question"). That was weird. I mean, if you want excellent reviews - make your customers' stay excellent. Also you can just ask your customers in person what they liked and what they didn't ))
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Daniela, Fabio, Alex & all the staff were so professional. From checking in earlier than scheduled was handled very kindly .Chapeau as well to the honesty of their cleaning lady who found my ring .The rooms we had were so clean, toilettes are disinfected everyday. 3 stars hotel which provide slippers & bathrobes The location is perfect
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: distance to most all the historic sites.Had a lovely pre - cruise stay at theHotel Condotti.
