We stayed in the Annex which is justa short walk from the main location.We actually had 2 rooms.One would have been perfect for a childor would have worked for three friendsstaying together.In the annex you have everything suppliedfor a quick continental breakfast.We enjoyed having our morning tea whilegetting ready to get started sightseeing.Sitting down for a normal American stylebreakfast is very time consuming.All the hotel staff are very helpful andwelcoming.We especially enjoyed chatting with Fabio & Vladimir in the main lobby desk.I have never had more helpful and informative personal anywhere we havestayed.We would definitively stay there againfor the location, the cleanliness andcharm.Also, good value for your money as youcan walk just about anywhere.Cabs are expensive and don't expect toget one if it is raining.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were delighted with the extra steps the front desk staff; I think the woman who was the most helpful's name is Danielle; she was always pleasant and went above and beyond to make sure we knew where we were going, scheduled our taxis when needed, etc. Our room was spacious and comfortable; the location perfect. I highly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a week here and would definitely return. Stayed in a room in the annex building which was modern and large by European standards. Had 1 1/2 baths and a small balcony (without much of a view). Great service at the front desk and upon checkout. Also recommend using the car service. It simplifies getting to the hotel after your flight. Great location one block from the Spanish Steps and a metro station. Lots of good places to eat nearby and walking distance to many of the sights in Eastern Rome.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Easy to book online at the last minute and the recommended way of doing it. Once booked, staff is friendly and helpful. Trying to book in person at the front desk or extending a stay are losing propositions in terms of cost. The secondary buildings are not staffed, but rooms are clean and modern, and the nightly rate is lower than at the main building. The locations of both the main hotel and the secondary buildings are very good and walking distance from Piazza Spagna, a metro station and a tourist attraction.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, very nice and helpfull stuff, the rooms are small, though very nice and clean and overall great value for  money we enjoyed our staying very much indeed. Nice restaurant next to the hotel called Dilla
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My positive experience with the hotel began as soon as my reservation was made. I had a few changes prior to arrival and they were responsive by email and very accommodating. We also asked at the last minute for our two rooms to be next door and were lucky they were able to accommodate. The attitude was friendly, lighthearted, and helpful. The location was ideal for us. Central, busy street, walkable to most of our preferred sites. It was a two minute walk to the Spanish Steps. The room met our necessities and was comfortable. Air condition and water pressure were strong. Rooms were clean, and included a safe, slippers, extra pillow and blanket, soap, shower cap, cups, coffee machines, biscuits. We were in the other building (not the main building where you check in) and being unfamiliar with the area I was worried what that meant. I worried for nothing. It was around the corner on a Main Street, and felt like we had an apartment in Rome as opposed to a hotel room because there is no hotel lobby. But if you need anyone, the main lobby was a 30 second walk around the corner. The breakfast was good; if you stay in the annex building its additional and if you are in main building it's included. It was good, no complaints. If you don't eat much for breakfast, I'd just buy coffee and a pastry at a nearby cafe for less and get moving. We fell in love with Rome on this trip and plan to come back someday. We would 100% stay at Hotel Condotti again and will recommend to friends. Thank you so much for a wonderful stay!
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located literally 100 meters from the Spanish square and Spanish Steps and within a short reach of the main attractions of Rome. The service was good and we got directions to all what we needed.Rooms are comfy and actually more spacious than expected
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are small, but quaint and lovely. The receptionist made reservations at a really great restaurant one block down the street. There is a bit of stairs and walking involved, so if you need are unable to navigate such things find a bigger hotel. All in all, we loved this place and would stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As much as I would love to give this historical hotel 5 Stars, I did have issues with the size of the room and their breakfast. Room Size -1 Star– Very cramped. Ignore the pictures on this website.The Spanish Step are NOT down the street from the hotel. They're close, but more like 2-3 blocks away. I rented the ‘double standard’ room, er, closet.. There was about a 2 foot space around the perimeter of the bed, hardly any space to open a suitcase. The bath was small, but large enough for 2 people. Water pressure (shower) was adequate. Bed was a bit firm.My issue was that I specifically requested a room in their annex (I never did find out where the annex was). According to their website, the rooms in the annex are suppose to be slightly larger, but when I questioned the hotel about the different size rooms, they insisted all rooms, whether in main hotel or annex, were the same size.Then why does the web site specify the annex was larger?My second issue was their breakfast. They quoted me 14 Euros for the breakfast, and believe me, it wasn’t worth it. Nothing hot, mostly cheese, some meat and rolls. Major ripoff, so go to a nearby pastry shop instead.For each of my issues, I deducted one star on the rating. I will give a 5 Star rating to Angelo at the front desk. Speaks great English and knows the best restaurants in the neighborhood. Super nice and professional..
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked at Condotti for 2 nights (1 night on our arrival to Rome and the second one after 1 week). When we arrived at Condotti hotel, the receptionist said that there was a problem with our room because of the rain and that he will take us to a better hotel (a four star hotel)... without saying sorry, without asking us if we were ok with that, without even asking us if we prefer a refund... they didn’t even sent us a mail to inform us about the situation. They waited until we arrived at the hotel at night (at 11:00 pm) and they informed us about the problem. The guy accompanied us to the other hotel, it was a terrible hotel (Hotel El Corso) very old and dirty. It was not a four stars hotel as he said, it was a 3 stars hotel but for me this hotel doesn’t deserve a single star. It was a very bad experience for us. Don’t book at Condotti hotel because they are liars. You book online at Condotti then when you arrive to the hotel, they take you to an annex bldg or to another hotel and tell you that they have a problem with your room. They did it to us twice this month. When we arrived for our second night at Condotti hotel, the receptionist said that the hotel was full and that we will take us to annex bldg that is part of the hotel also. In fact our room was not in annex bldg as he said, it was about 8 min walking from Condotti hotel, and it was in another hotel (Style inn hotel) in Via del Corso. When I said to the receptionist that I didn’t want to go to another hotel, he said that our room was not refundable.Don’t book at this hotel because they will not give you a room in the hotel, they will take you to another hotel. They are liars!!! And they are thieves!!!!They did it to me twice this month.This is the worst hotel in Rome!!!We were really disappointed about this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was lodged at an annex building on Via Corso. It was very clean and quiet. The view was not great but I only stayed there one night. The big plus is the central location in Rome, next to the P. Spagna metro and the Spanish steps. The staff is corteous, won’t go out of their way, but are reasonably friendly.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we walked in and got a big discount . the access to everything was given and I love the trattoria opposite it was a short stay in Rome but we can make the most sightseeing places in 2 nights stay. the rooms in the upper level are ok and not noisy at all. ya the hotel need a renovation little smelly in the shower but ok for the price.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We selected this hotel for our brief stay in Rome due to its location and it certainly did not disappoint.The location is so good, walking distance to great shopping and many good cafes.Rooms are just OK and customer service decent.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in a top position so close to Piazza Di Spagna and all the staff were excellent The negative the room for 4 of us was a bit small and a very disappointing buffet for breakfast with very little fruit.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and comfortable if a bit dark and dated but we didn’t mind very much since we only slept there. We were four people and stayed in the annex. A great thing about the room was that it had 1 and a half bathrooms which was great since there were so many of us. The hotel is extremely well located in the center of Rome and close to the metro station. The only issue we had was that when we were paying they didn’t have change for the city tax that had to be payed in cash so they ended up keeping 2€. Not much but I feel not very professional. We would definitely stay there again though.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very well located in the center of the city. I cannot comment on the rooms as, although I had a reservation for the main building, I was sent to another location that the hotel uses, 300 m. away. There seems to have been an issue with the travel agency that processed the booking, rather than the hotel as such, bearing the blame for it. What I did not appreciate though was the utter lack of interest on the part of the staff, their attitude in (not) dealing with the issue, and their lack of professionalism and courtesy thereof.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I have just come to the end of our stay here and I have to say it lived up to all expectations.The location is fantastic. Within walking distances of the main attractions such as the Colosseum and Vatican City, you will not be disappointed.The rooms are clean and quaint. The shower was fantastic. We had a small issue with our air conditioning which was rectified quickly. The rooms are cleaned and fresh bed sheets put on daily. The breakfast has everything you need to start your day with. The staff are beyond helpful. They will go out of their way to help with all requests, including making reservations and advising on local attractions/clothing attire. It was my partners birthday to which they figured out without being told...we came back from our day out to find an ice bucket in the room with a bottle of champagne inside! It's the little things isn't it that really make you feel welcomed.If you're flying into Ciampino airport you can get a bus ticket for €6 that'll take you straight to the Termini train station(about an hour). It's the only stop so no need to worry about where to get off. From there you can either walk(roughly 40minutes), taxi(around €15), take another bus or get the metro. On a personal note I would just like to thank all the staff at the Condotti Inn that really made our stay in Rome feel most welcome. I would have no hesitation in recommending this place to anyone. Ryan Drew
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelling with my teenage daughter on our first visit to Rome and I am so pleased we chose this hotel! The location is marvellous - a short taxi ride from Roma Termini station (it should cost you around 12 Euro if the meter is on, don't let the cab drivers quote you a higher amount!), and you are placed right in the middle of everything - the glorious shops, beautiful cafes and bars, Piazza's and Spanish steps with Trevi Fountain around the corner. We were fortunate to be offered an upgrade on the room we booked (under advice from other reviewers we booked in the main building), which placed us on the top floor with a balcony, the views from which were exceptional. The room itself was tasteful and beautiful, with typically opulent fabrics and rich, layered design. The bathrooms are large, clean and very well appointed. Breakfast in the downstairs dining room is simple and healthy, typical of what is to be found in Europe. We were able to walk everywhere and enjoyed the lovely surroundings. I am certain we will visit Rome again and this would be my first choice of where to stay. Our thanks to the management and staff for making us feel so welcome, we really loved it.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a great location: very close to a metro station, shops, restaurants, bars and some major attractions. The hotel is old and the rooms are small, but if you are not going to spend all your day in the hotel, it is perfect,. The service is great, everybody is ssuper nice and helpful, especially at the front desk.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Through Expedia, I booked my flight and my stay in Rome for two and half days before our cruise on the NCL Epic! So wanting to be thrifty but maximize our time in Rome, I searched out Hotel near some highlights that I wanted to cover. This hotel did not disappoint! A few blocks from the Spanish Steps, within walking distance of the Trevi and with eateries and shops everywhere, we didn't go wrong. Although we stayed in the annex and the rooms were small, - who cares? LOL/ it's about Location, location!! Annex is close to where you check in - rooms are small, but as long as you have your basics, - you're not in the room much!! Very helpful concierge!!
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel located in prime location, in the heart of all the attractions. 1 minuet from the Spanish Steps, Via Condotti and Via del corso, and walking distance from all the interesting places . A lot of restaurants and bars all over the hotel, great place to stay. The room is clean and comfortable, and has all the facilities you need. Very recommend.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you have allergies don't stay here - carpets, drapes, bedcover very old and needs replacing. Room so small that two people can not move around at same time. No view. Very expensive for what you get. Would never stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I spent 4 nights here within the last fortnight, before and after our cruise. What a lovely stay!! Prior to arriving the hotel inquired if we needed a car service from the airport. We booked this service to and from the airport as well as the ship terminal in Civitavecchio. I thought the prices were comparable to those here. The drivers were prompt and professional. The hotel has a few buildings, we stayed in the main building. Our room was small but clean and comfortable. There is a lift to all floors. Breakfast is continental in the lower level. It is just what one needs. They do have the ultimate coffee machine that does espresso and cappuccino, hot chocolate and tea. The staff are very helpful. The location is great, about two blocks from the Spanish Steps. There is a Metro station nearby about 3-4 blocks away. It is also near the bus stop for several Hop/on Hop/off buses. Trevi Fountain is also nearby as is Piazza Venezia. There are so many restaurants nearby and also shops. There are also 2 McDonald's for those so inclined. There are horse buggy rides by the steps too.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had not realised that my room was in a separate building - on the Via del Corso five minutes away from the beautiful looking main hotel. This was disappointing and the breakfast replacement offered in that building was coffee and dull plastic wrapped cake. Not the best start to the day! The air conditioning was impossible to alter - a note saying it was set to match the season: a huge assumption that everybody likes their room at the Same temperature! I don’t. The water in the shower was not always piping hot and other guests in the block could be heard showering and this also sometimes caused gurgling in the basin. The room was beautifully clean and the reception staff at the main hotel were delightful and helpful BUT make sure you are in that section of the hotel! That would have been great!
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel Condotti is in one of the best locations in Rome....in few minutes there is the wonderful piazza di spanga,pantheon,piazza navona and Fontana di trevi.We stayed in another building in via del corso.Clean room with modern design and nice view We suggest to everyone this hotel,really a wonderful choice
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a four night trip to Rome. We had a very warm greeting at the reception from an English receptionist (Dan I think!) after our early flight it was most welcome! We had the superior double room on the top floor of the main hotel. It was a beautiful room with an interesting bathroom like we hadn’t seen before. It was a real feature of the room with glass windows but cleverly designed. We loved the massive bath and great shower. The room was very clean and cleaned daily with new towels etc which was lovely. As we were checking out, Vlad at reception offered us a complimentary breakfast which was wonderful as breakfast was not included in our package. This was a lovely touch as we were leaving very early (7.30am) for a coliseum tour. All staff were extremely helpful and friendly during our stay. Would not hesitate recommending this hotel and would return. Central location and quiet little street Trastevere area is much cheaper to eat in that those places around the hotel. It’s a bit of a walk but has a nice local feel and plenty of choice for food and drink! Check out bar san calisto for an authentic and very affordable night out Also enjoyed le piccolo wine bar if you’re looking for an authentic feel.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hi, we are staying at this hotel near the Spanish steps. Its a very good location. Breakfast is typical and nice with both continental and hot and cold items. The main hotel is a bit old style and our room needs updating. The video playing in the bf room depicts room furnishing that are selected with elegance (I think is the wording). its also marketing. The linens need to be updated, as well as hard pillows and carpeting. Room 103 has a fairly updated bathroom. The problem is that the room needs to be aired out. The air cond does not work at this time of year (perhaps never). Opening the window was horrible as the building behind is about 12 feet and the stench of garbage or urine is horrible. Do not stay in this room. Do not accept room 103. We are here only 2 nights and frankly, its a pain to move rooms when we have had so little time to sightsee while here so we have not complained. Note to hotel, provide air freshner and portable fan in this room or don't rent out. Staff is helpful and recommended Doris Restaurant around corner. Had dinner next store the evening before and significantly better than Doris.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was a very very last minute booking (due to being let down by the MF Hotel- check out my review there).& loved the room! The location is incredibly good. Clean, tidy, comfortable.Made our trip to Rome even better. Would highly recommend!
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the annexe of Hotel Condotti for 4 nights in February. It may have been an oversight of ours but we had not realised that the annexe was a number of streets away from the main Hotel Condotti. The annexe itself has no Condotti branding, rather is the ‘Stay Inn’. You must, however, check in and out at the main Condotti reception. Vincenzo who took us to our room was very pleasant and said he was available should we need anything though our our stay however we didn’t see him again for the duration of our visit. Only by seeing the signs when walking down the hotel stairs did we learn that reception was on floor 2. The room was fine and clean, our only issue was that the temperature was automatically set due to the time of year and was very warm Indeed. Location is fantastic and we were not disturbed by much noise (only when others were returning late, doors etc). Spagna metro stop only a few minutes walk which is very convenient to get to the Roma termini train station, as is the Spanish steps. Walk to the colosseum and roman forum took 25 minutes or so and there are plenty of shops and restaurants all around. We were initially a little disappointed but I would book again now I know what the arrangement is and how good the location is too.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is a standard 3 star hotel with walking distance to every attraction point of Rome. It is situated near Spanish steps and Trevi fountain, Phanteon, Vatican, Colleseum etc are in 1 - 3 km circle. On top of that Pompi, best tiramisu, and Pastifficio, best pasta are in the same Street. For those who will come for shopping, it is the best location without hesitation. Every brand including the most luxurious to bargains has a store nearby. Rooms are small but who cares ? Go to Cantina Basseria and forget the room :)
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After staying briefly in January 2011 I was pleased to be able to return to Rome and the Condotti with my wife. We both found the staff and the service at the hotel to be excellent and ver thoughtful. We had a week of day trips to all the great sights of Rime - and all within easy walking distance of the hotel. The Condotti remains an inexpensive home away from home for adventures in Rome where you’ll feel at ease.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice hotel in a great location. We stayed in the annex building in a room overlooking the street. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The hotel is close to an abundance of restaurants and we didn’t need public transport for the entire trip. There is some noise from the street below if the windows are open, but it isn’t offensive loud music or the sound of partying, but just the hum of people going about their business. It was quite pleasant. I would stay here again and would recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. Minutes walk to Spanish steps. Convenient. Rooms could be more updated. Other then that no complaints. Front desk staff is friendly and helpful. Will stay here again for the price and convenience.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited this hotel last week with my husband. I had read in many other previous reviews of how people are sent to another room and given a room so small and all those things and to avoid this we wrote a mail well in advance that we will be coming for honeymoon so please do not provide us a room so small or a room without a view ! but as my fear took shape, it happened to us as well, went to another building, and the room was so small that we didn't even have space to open luggage without keeping it on bed. So when we called main hotel reception (remember we are in other building), we are told that the hotel is fully occupied and that they will try their best to upgrade us to a better room next day. Next day we had an early morning tour and my husband was very comfortable to not change rooms again since he said it would only be night when we would crash in. So we unfolded our bags, took out our stuff that we would be needing for next four days since we did not want to open our bags again and again in the tiny room. Next day, we left for our tour and when we came back, voila ! our key wasn't working. we couldn't enter the premises of the rooms and there was no one to help immediately ! so we called up the main Hotel and a person arrives in 15 mins while I am fuming on the top of it. he opens the gate with the master key and asks for our room numbers. when we tell him the room no, he says, the room is given to someone else. Four five mins we have this debate on whose room it is, each of us looking at each other like a cheat ! So now, this person calls up the main Hotel and it turns out that the hotel changed our rooms ! in our absence ! with everything (including very personal items!) in the new room kept in places it was in old room. I don't know if this is a good practice to touch someone's stuff in their absence but I definitely don't like my stuff being touched but the hotel gave an explanation that they assumed we will be okay to be shifted to a new room like that ! Plus side: we got better and bigger room facing the street side ! Also, this was the only hotel in Italy (we stayed in one in Florence and one in Venice), that provided a kettle, some snacks to eat and coffee and tea sachets to be used ! Everywhere else, it was a paid minibar without even a complimentary water bottle. Not so plus side: I still don't like anyone touching my things.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights on our first visit to Rome. The service was excellent and staff were extremely helpful and friendly with any requests that we had. The hotel is perfectly located with restaurants, shops close by and only an 8 minute walk to the Spanish Steps. The Trevi fountain is about a 12 minute walk through lovely cobblestone streets with the hop on hop off bus stop close by.Our room in the main hotel was large by European standards with a large balcony to sit on and look down the street. The bed was very comfortable and good sized bathroom with a strong shower. We even had coffee/tea making facilities in our room which is very unusual in Europe. Our room was serviced everyday with clean fresh towels. Lift was good. We did notice some street noise but nothing extreme and it is a big city after all. The breakfast buffet (which was included in our reasonable room rate) was very good with plenty to choose from. Maybe not as large a choice as we have had but certainly more than enough to have a good breakfast. Coffee was good too.We found the foyer quite large enough with couches to sit on to wait for taxis or just rest. We would certainly stay here again.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is located in one of most visited places in Rome. Very good location. Polite stuff and helpful. Clean place. Very big bathroom. Recommend it. It was near metro station but We did not use it very much because we could walk around and we enjoyed that or many places we wanted to go, like piazza navona, Fontana di Trevi, pantheon, piazza Venezia, palace Vitorio Emanuelle.. shops and many other was not so far..
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service, excellent staff. This the property we will definitely recommend to all of our friends. It's close to almoust all of the city main attractions an for shopping lovers you just need to turn the corner and enter Via Condotti. The rooms are nice, clean and cozy.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were booked in the Main hotel but found it looking tired. I have been led to believe that it is now under renovation in December 2017. We were moved to the other section a few metres away and it was modern, clean, pleasant and friendly section. It was very good stay and its again all about LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!!!!!!!!This was the last part of our 3 week European adventure and the hotel allowed us to settle done and relax before coming back home. Well done Hotel Condotti.
hotelName:
2    Condotti Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally located. 10 minutes walk from Roma termini, 15 minutes walk to the spanish steps. Our room was spacious enough to accommodate our family of 4 persons. It had 2 single beds and one double bed. And the best part, everything was super clean. The check in was easy and the staff were friendly. Recommend: yesRepeat: yes
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were booked to stay at Hotel Raffaello on June 17, 2019. When we arrived we received a free upgrade and the room was beautiful. Everything was perfect. Later that evening the air conditioning was not working and they didn't have anything else available so we had to change hotels. Barbara the manager refunded our money and extended her apologies for our trouble. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Rome, wonderful area!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: THe room was great - very comfortable and clean, the bathroom was spacious and modern, and the location was perfect! We could walk to and from the train station easily; it was convenient to the metro, and it was within walking distance of many of the sights we wanted to see. The decor was lovely, and the breakfast option, which we tried one morning, was great.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely loved this hotel. Excellent service all around. We reached at 10am, they checked us in though the rooms were not available. They kept the bags as well. There was a small lounge where you can grab a complementary tea or coffee and pastries and use the rest rooms. The rooms were nice and cold when we got in. Toilets were clean and spacious. The location of the hotel is excellent, very close to Roma Termini
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel in a great location. Nice quiet area in walking distance from Termini train station and easy to walk to all the top visitor sites. Breakfast buffet was greatLovely roomHelpful friendly staffThe only small negative was the most bizarre layout in the bathroom which meant you couldn’t actually sit properly on the toilet (about 15cm between the pan and the shower cubicle!) Not sure how a man would manage to stand either. As mentioned by others the shower space was extremely restricted too due to the unnecessary corner unit (See photo) Would have given 4.5 if I could have, as for one night this didn’t matter too much
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this hotel because we wanted to be close to the Roma Termini without being immersed in the crowds. The location was perfect - a quick walk from the Termini but a world away from the crowds. The rooms were clean and modern, the breakfast was really good with a lot of choices, and the staff was friendly and cooperative. We couldn't ask for more in this price range for a very good hotel in Rome in this location.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Raffaello was a wonderful place to stay in Rome. There were many many things in walking distance and the staff was very helpful. The rooms were unique and the bed was comfortable. Would stay again.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a pleasant part of Rome, and within walking distance of the main train station. The hotel is small, and the elevators are tiny. Our room was very small too, and although my wife and I are of normal stature and height, we frequently had to get out of each others' way to move around. It's a bit of a minus that there are no tea/coffee making facilities in the room too. Breakfast was okay, but I wouldn't rave about it as others have done. The hotel is very quiet at night, and the staff and friendly and helpful. The hotel is also very clean.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Of all the hotels we stayed at in Italy, this was my favorite. The gentlemen at the front desk were gracious and helpful in their advice. The bedroom was huge. The breakfast was delicious. And the location allowed us to walk to virtually everything (other than the Vatican). We walked to the main train station, Colosseum, Trevi fountain, Forum, Pantheon, Jewish Quarter, etc. etc. I heartily recommend this hotel!!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very enjoyable stay - staff were really friendly and helpful, room really clean and spacious, quality of breakfast food high, great location near lots of good restaurants and independent shops. A few minor things - bring your own hair dryer (fixes ones to wall are never great), breakfast quite crowded at busy times, scrambled eggs and croissants run out quick, didn’t see the balcony I saw in pictures guess it must be in one of the rooms. No bar area (but plenty nearby).But overall a great stay would definitely stay again and recommend.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a lovely place felt like romantic clean nice food pizza pasta room was good air con and all the mod cons.great wines and a trip to see it made too. Will be only too pleaded to go back great work guys
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a very wonderful experience at Raffaello. It is located in the heart of Rome.Before everything!You can save money easily through: travelscut.tkThere is a supermarket next to the hotel. Restaurants and cafes are directly on the door sill. Room is small but practical and very comfortable.The staff was really helpful!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Rome for a 50th birthday celebrations, the hotel was well situated close to all the main sites, and bars & restaurants too were all walking distance.The hotel itself was well equipped, clean, tidy, and comfortable. Bathroom was modern clean, bed was comfortable and we slept well on our 3 night stay. The decor was a little dated and the furniture a little tired, however this did not impact on our stay and enjoyment.The staff learnt of our birthday celebrations and gave us some complementary wine to celebrate, which was a nice touch. The team at the hotel were helpful and curtious, and we would very likely return.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great little hotel only about six blocks from Roman forum and four blocks from subways and trains. I enjoyed a three day stay here before a trip to the south of italy and a one day just before returning to the US. ATM available about 3 blocks away, and some really good restaurants, artsy shops. Staff is very helpful and talkative. Continental breakfast in the morning included. Desk will arrange transfer to the airport, it costs 50 Euro. Hotel lobby and waiting areas are decorated well with pictures and artwork.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I saw that headline from another review and I think it sums it up perfectly! For what we paid, I think we should have gotten better. The room needs updating and is tiny - with 2 people in the room, it was almost impossible to move around. We had to move furniture around to make room for our bags and to make sure we didn't bump into anything. It was also very stuffy, the AC was practically useless (we were there in spring). And the shower....OMG it was the smallest shower I have ever been in (and I have travelled plenty in Paris which supposedly has the smallest bathrooms in the world). We were on the first floor, and the lift takes you to the first floor, but you still had to carry your own bags one more flight of stairs up (or down) - no concierge to help. The area itself was ok, central enough to walk around to all the sights or take the train. I'd say this hotel is ok, but I'm sure you can find something better at the same price. If you can't then you'll do just fine here but not very comparable to the other hotels we've stayed around Italy.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good low cost accommodation near basilica Santa Maria and hop on hop off bus sightseeing pickup point. Many restaurants nearby. Rooms are clean but extremely small. Desk staff can be a bit curt. Included breakfast is adequate. Hilly area to walk around in.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful staff; lovely hotel comfortable clean bedrooms; central location, just five minutes from Termini station.Staff offered help with directions, organized taxi , suggested restaurants, let us leave bags until our evening departurestaff excused our poor Italian and spoke impeccable English. The breakfast gave a great choice, was lovely.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable room for two people, and very friendly and helpful staff. The complimentary breakfast is the best I have had at any hotel, ever, anywhere. Well located in easy walking to all the major sites, If I am ever in Florence again, this is where I will stay.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel, located on a little one-way street, is just outstanding. The staff is the best-kept secret of all - wonderful, friendly, and helpful. This hotel is small and cozy, yet manages to provide guests a wonderful experience in Rome. Plus, it's only 5-minutes to the Hop-on, Hop-off bus! Restaurants and shops are located on the same street, and a small market is right next door, with wine and beer. Breakfast was an absolute delight, and it was not the same each day! I cannot say enough about this great little hotel. We'll be back! The only quirk is that elevators stop between floors, so have to carry luggage either up or down a level! Hey, it's Europe!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just spent one night in this lovely little place. We used their driver to pick us up from the airport. Perfect. The staff were friendly and very helpful. Perfect. Breakfast had plenty of variety and we enjoyed everything. Perfect. Room was comfortable with all you could want. We thoroughly enjoyed our short stay and would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great hotel right in the middle of everything we spent several evenings in the bar. Angelo the bartender was fantastic gave us great advice and great service all the way through and all the staff supported us and you were first class the breakfast was great what else can I say just a five-star experience all the way through and by the way thank you again Angelo!!!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Hotel. It was my 3rd visit to the Italian capital and my first stay with Raffaello. It is a mid sized hotel located on a quiet part of the bustling Via Urbana. Rooms were very clean and decorated in a traditional style (comfortable beds, good WiFi, quiet & peacful surroundings). Excellent breakfast buffet with very friendly staff and perfect cappuccino's made on request. (There is also a free coffee/tea making facility on a lower level of the Reception area). Check-in & Check-Out were quick and hassle free and all the staff were friendly and greeted us warmly throughout.The location of the hotel is very good. Termini Station is a 5 min walk up hill. The Colleseum is a 10 min walk in the opposite direction either on Via Urbana or the the adjacent Via Cavour. [I'd favour the Via Urbana route as it is more traditional and filled with arty shops and many bars & restaurants]. The Spanish Steps are 20 mins on foot by heading in a *westerly direction*. There is also a nice supermarket next door to the hotel for any essentials or treats.In short I would highly recommend the Hotel Raffaello if travelling to Roma if you are looking for a decently priced mid-range hotel. You are in Rome to explore the City and with this hotel's location everything is accessible. **Ciao Bella Raffaello Roma**
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfast is wonderfully rich, everyday almost the same but the choices are unlimited, fruits, pastry, boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, ham, salami, cheese, jogurt, etc-etc-etc. Staff is amazingly friendly and helpful! Bar in lobby - great cocktails! Tram 14 is in front of hotel. Room was clean (except under bed) - bed comfortable. It was not cheap but would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, close to everything, very good breakfast, the reception is very helpful and friendly, gives good recommendations for places to eat. Rooms are clean bathroom was just gigantic for 1 person
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very spacious room! Best of our stays in 3 weeks of travel. Staff were courteous. Parking is excellent. Breakfast was outstanding. Very clean and comfortable. A tram stops in front of the hotel and goes to all the best of Milan. We would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a short walk from the central train station and metro lines, and we walked to all the main city sites. It is off a main road so is a little quieter, but easy to find. There was a nice breakfast selection, mostly continental with a few hot options, with some nice pastries. There is a good pizza restaurant just around the corner for dinner.The staff were all very friendly and helpful. They stored our luggage when we checked out as our train was not until mid afternoon.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3 night stay to celebrate my birthday. Staff on reception friends, even lent me a selfie stick! didn't have breakfast so cant comment on that.Short 8-10 minute walk from Termini, 10 minute walk from Coliseum, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain.Room was small however cleanBit disappointed that I had emailed ahead to advise it was my birthday and this was not acknowledged like most other hotels would have done.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay. All rooms in Italy seem small. We thought it was a nice place. Fun surprise..we had a small, yet nice size balcony off our room. We were able to walk from the train station, rolling our bags. I think the maps say it was 8 blocks. We had to walk through one of the frequent weekend street protests, but it is not far. Some cobblestone streets, but all in all, very doable. Safe location!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is perfect! Great neighborhood, near Termini Station, restaurants and shops everywhere! The room was just right, the gentlemen that worked the front desk was fabulous , made so many helpful suggestions. Pointed us to the great Restaurants,gave us tips how to get around, what to do and not. Will go there again and again!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel recently, even before we arrived the hotel were wonderful, we contacted them on their email and they booked a taxi for us from the airport. The staff were very welcoming when we arrived. Our room was very elegant, the hotel is an old hotel which is well maintained and the decor is inkerping with its age, which we loved. The breakfast in the morning was very enjoyable, plenty to eat, and beautiful scrambled eggs to accompany the continental selection.The hotel is very central for all the attractions, and very close to the train station. There are also plenty of restaurants close by.The only reason I haven’t given it 5 stars is because the mattress cover on the bed has a plastic backing underneath which made me sweat, I totally understand why they have these to protect the mattress, but i have stayed in many hotels that have mattress protectors that are not plastic backed. Apart from that I would recommend this hotel for anybody wanting a city break, that wants an older hotel with good service and within a 30 minute walk to all the attractions.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Hotel Raffaelo for one week in late November. We got a good price and in addition used the Rick Steve’s discount. The location is excellent: 5 minute walk to Termini, 2 minutes to Santa Maria Maggiore, 10-12 minute walk to the Colosseum. We walk everywhere in Rome but had two early trains for days out so being so close to the station removed any stress. We also had two early morning timed entries at the Vatican and although we could have walked, it is much better to take the Metro from Termini if you have to get there quickly. Upon arrival into Termini, which is always disorienting the first time, walk straight to the farthest exit from the trains. You will be on a large transportation plaza with cabs, buses, etc. Look left and to the first corner past the station for a green Pharmacia sign. Walk downhill on that street for about 5 blocks, perpendicular to the transportation area. Look for Santa Maria Maggiore on the left. You will be at the back of it but it is massive so you can’t miss it. Look for a hotel on the right with Bethlehem in the name and turn right down the alley. You will see the hotel sign right at the end. The hotel is nicely decorated, and extremely clean. The housekeeping staff cleaned thoroughly and restocked toiletries daily. Towels are rather skimpy by American hotel standard. As one reviewer pointed out, there are no washcloths but I bought really cheap ones at home and threw them out each day. Bring your own tissues too. Breakfast was ample and varied. You can eat healthy with fruit, muesli and hard boiled eggs or not with assorted meats and pastries. The breakfast staff is friendly and attentive. The Cappuccino was delicious. Breakfast was always prepared exactly on time and we were provided with breakfast to go on our early mornings out. The front desk staff was competent. One woman was particularly helpful and went above and beyond to try to get us into a site with limited access. There are free maps at the desk, which are better than the Roma Pass maps and even those given out at Marriott. Now for some areas for improvement. The mattresses are just awful. Everyone points that out. Overlays must be requested when you book. They do offer pillow selections an I was happy with my choice of down. The bathroom is tiny and poorly lit. It is nearly impossible to get to the toilet because the bidet faces it about 8 inches away. My tall husband really had trouble. The room was way too hot and despite knobs on the radiators nothing changed. The interior of the hotel was very quiet but our room faced the alley which was noisy with late night arguments and revelers, animals, and early morning garbage and other trucks. Lighting overall was poor, but the armoire was adequate and we had enough room and seating. We tend not to spend much time in a hotel room. The hotel could make some relatively easy improvements with better lighting and mattresses, more shelves in the bathroom and removing the bidet. There are some restaurants in the area, but not as many as I hoped. There is a good grocery store two doors to the left of the hotel. Cheap water, decent wine selection, produce and food for train journeys and picnics. So, if those inconveniences do not bother you, this is an excellent choice. I think the positive aspects outweigh the negative and I would return. My husband might not.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a cozy single room which wasn't too big but had a quite large and comfy bed. Although the room wasn't very large - as is common in old town hotels - there was enough space for everything, even a big closet. The bathroom was nice and modern. Drinks at the mini bar were free. The TV in the room was, however, very small and didn't work properly. The room itself was a bit dark, but that wasn't a big problem.The hotel is located in a quiet zone, there was no noise coming from outside. The breakfast was excellent, as was the very friendly staff. The whole house was very clean and friendly. Would recommend the hotel for a city trip, as it is located near Termini station and only some 15 minutes by foot from the city centre. Very good value for money.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a very nice experience staying at Raffaello. It is situated in the heart of Rome.Before everything!You can easily save money with: travelscut.tkThere is a supermarket next to the hotel . restaurants and coffee shops right on doorstep. Room small but very functional and comfortable.The staff was really helpful!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect hotel, great price in a great area! We had a nice room, spacious for Rome. As others had reported the shower was a bit snug, but not a problem really. Monti is a great neighborhood and you can basically walk everywhere from the hotel. Nice restaurants on Via Urbana, so we didn't have to go far for a great meal. We had a nice terrace, which we used at night. Would absolutely stay here again.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a classic Rome feel, oldish and quite nicely maintained. The old fashion elevator is very small though, fitting in only 3 persons at most each time.The room is clean and basic without an electric water kettle or coffee and tea bags. The location is convenient though with plenty of good restaurants nearby and a small supermarket just next to it. It is also quite close by to station and tourist spots.The hotel staff are friendly and provided good service. We appreciated that they kept our luggage for a couple of days when we took a short trip to the south.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is only 10 mins walk to the Colosseum and convenient to go anywhere. Rooms are clean. We really enjoyed our stay there and will definitely come back to stay next time we go to Rome. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely friendly hotel quite close to Termini station. It was recommended to us and I would be happy to recommend too. Great staff, nice breakfast, lovely room. Getting about is easy and staff are very helpful. I'll be back.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel with great staff. Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast. Our twin room had plenty of room. Enjoyed the pillow menu. Ask for a mattress topper, that was a nice touch. There was always staff at the front desk to call a taxi or answer any questions.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel decor is styled in a classical way but the rooms were very spacious and very comfortable. The reception concierge was helpful and knowledgeable. It is the first time I have ever seen a pillow menu and the location is great. Walking distance to train station and a supermarket that’s open til late two doors down. The only drawbacks I could mention are no kettle in the room. Not a massive thing it we had a baby and needed to heat up some water which meant I needed to come to the breakfast area. The other is the lift, it stops between floors and I guess there is not much you can do about that but if you are less abled it may be a problem, Check with the hotel first to make sure they can help you to and from your room with your luggage.These things didn’t bother me that much though and when I go back to Rome, I will probably stay here.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have been using this hotel for more than ten years, mostly for business but also, occasionally, for tourism. The location is very convenient. Close enough to Termini railway station to walk to (10 minutes), far enough from it to be in a nice and quiet environment.The cleanliness and comfort of the rooms are impeccable, the service efficient and effective. And friendly. The one and only remark: single bedrooms may be really tiny. I advise single travellers to use double bedrooms instead.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel, in a very convenient location, a 10-minute away from Stazione Termini, is clean and comfortable. Service is impeccable and warm. Breakfast is tasty, healthy and rich. Single bedrooms, though comfortable, and clean, may be very small. Double bedrooms are perfect, instead.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel to be in a Great Location. We could walk to a lot of the main attractions - Coliseum, Circus Maximus and others.It was what we envisioned a room should be in the old city - we absolutely loved it. We even had an amazing bathroom which we were surprised to get. However, another family member was in a different room and their bathroom was quite small but they still loved it.They also served a great breakfast for $8 E /person which we really enjoyed.Would definitely recommend this as a great place to stay
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well, we thought this hotel for our 4 night city break was excellent! Small and charming hotel, with homely feel. We had a double room ( not economy double) Bed was large, clean and comfy, was even a pillow menu.Little fridge (mini bar), TV (but didn’t use) Free wi-fi. No tea/coffee making facilities in room but you can get free coffee/ tea and little ice buckets of ice ( a lovely touch!) for drinks in your room from the lounge area. Decent supermarket just 2 doors down. Bathroom quite large and clean with shower over bath.Hairdryer provided.Breakfast was lovely, large selection of items..scrambled/hard boiled eggs, toast, bread rolls, hams, cheeses, assorted pastries/doughnuts/cakes, fresh whole fruit, tinned fruit, yoghurts, 4 sorts of cereal, fruit juices, salad. Plentiful tea/coffee. Waiting staff lovely. Location very good, 5-10 walk from Termini station ( get Leonardo Express train from Fiumicino Airport to Termini, every 15 mins, takes half hour €14 each. Take station exit on LEFT leaving Termini station for hotel!) Metro also v easy to use. Just ask for Metro ticket in any tobacconist. Only €1.50 each. Once activated at station you can travel for up to 100 minutes. Great value! Beautiful Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore only about 200 metres away ( go around back for entrance, free to just go inside, or buy ticket for museum/exhibition stuff)  Colosseum only about 10-15 mins walk.All staff we encountered were lovely, friendly and helpful.Would definitely recommend. Thank you for a lovely stay!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has a fantastic location near Termini station and the service is excellent. Rooms are small but nice. The hotel is small and has its charm. We had a good stay and the location is good for visiting the city.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited this hotel, chosen on recommendation by relatives, and was adequate for our purpose, ie short break. A friendly welcome, a lift to the fifth floor in a tiny lift, as the grandparents we received the smallest of the four rooms. It was comfortable enough, with hot water, tv, but somewhat cramped for our taste. Tea and coffee in room would have been nice.An excellent buffet breakfast, and during the day, tea and coffee with pastries were provided free in reception.Generally adequate for our purposes, but situated in an uninspiring side street away from our preferred area of Rome, which required more walking than us oldies would have liked to reach "where it's at".Nevertheless if you are fit and like the bohemian atmosphere then this would do you for a day or two.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was clean with nice amenities. Its location is walking distance to train station, about a 15 minute walk. It had a typlical Italian breakfast every morning. I did not like the fact that you had to leave your room key at the front desk when you left for the day.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel due to its proximity to the main Termini train station that links direct to the airport (it's about a 5-10 minute walk) and its recommendations from people who are gluten free.The various staff that we encountered during our 5 nights were all universally friendly and helpful. We said that we were gluten free on the first morning and after that, all the staff brought out a plate of gluten free goods and toast each morning. They really looked after us well from that perspective. The breakfast selection on the buffet was a good size and had various options.They also have a coffee machine and kettle with a selection of teabags in the lobby, which is a nice touch. Our room was compact but fine. My only negative would be that the shower cubicle was tiny. I'm not small but not huge either but I struggled to manoeuvre myself in it.Overall, a nice hotel, just off a main shopping street with lovely staff who look after you. I'd recommend it.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hands down, our favorite hotel out of the three we visited during our Italy trip.Personnel were the friendliest we encountered during our trip. A shout out to Daniel (day) and Francesca (night) working the front desk. Daniel handled all our inquiries with suggestions/directions and helped with booking the Vatican. He went so far as to help with the coffee maker (which by he way, is available 24 hrs with occasional bakery). Francesca was great offering suggestions for dinner along with great conversation/advise in general. The location is perfect, within walking distance from the train station. However, use google maps as the hotel site directions were a bit confusing. The hop on/hop off bus pick up was 2-3 blocks away. If you enjoy walking, most sites (except Vatican) can be reached on foot. The hotel itself is located near grocery stores, pharmacies and more restaurant choices than you can ever visit. All reasonably priced and good. We walked from the train station, but took a hotel recommended taxi on our return to the airport (50 euros flat fee), which was a good decision with an early international flight out.The room was a good size. We had a walk out balcony (Urbana side) which was totally unexpected. Rooms were large, clean and comfortable. Bathroom was large, but the shower small. The bed was very comfortable (request pillow choice online) and we never heard street noise from the busy street below. Most importantly in Italy, available room safe (request safe key at check-in) and both air conditioning and water pressure were great!Breakfast was ideal (meats, cheeses, pastries, fruit and eggs). Plenty of seating was always available, but were down by 8 am every morning. Loved this hotel and highly recommend !!
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: WE had an amazing time at this hotel...the room size, bathroom and terasse were PERFECT! The breakfast includes anything you can imagine and the staff is so nice and helpful with anything you need. I will book this hotel again when I return in ROME:)
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a small Italian hotel within walking distance of the Colosseum, then this could be the hotel for you. We stayed three nights and wished we could have stayed longer. We had a double room with ensuite bathroom. Well decorated and very clean. The air conditioning worked well and although breakfast was a basic buffet, we found everything we needed, served in the small dining area. There is a small lift, but even using the lift, there are stairs to climb, so just something to keep in mind. One of the great benefits is the neighborhood which has a wide range of restaurants and bars. Perfect for walking to dinner and having a drink at the end of the day. No need to use a taxi. I would have no hesitation staying there again.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is charming and located close to the train station, Santa Maria Maggiore bacilica, and Coliseum. It is nicely appointed,the room was good sized, and the bed was comfortable (firm.) There are good restaurants near by. The staff was nice, professional, and helpful.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location on a quiet street. Friendly staff, they were very helpful and lovely breakfast. excellent value for money. Our room had as little terrace which was great to sit on of an evening. would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed one night recently and found the hotel to be very basic:the most important issue was the bed was the hardest and most uncomfortable that I have slept in. I couldn't sleep much and had a bad back for a couple of days later. The reception staff never enquired whether I enjoyed my stay, the only comment at check out was to enquire whether I had used the drinks fridge. Would not recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We, sadly, only spent one night here but it was our favorite hotel of two weeks in Italy. Why? Beautiful ornate lobby with complimentary coffee all day and night long. Fantastic spread for breakfast and if you depart before the breakfast room opens, you will be given a "goody bag" with water, juice, rolls and sweets. Our room was large, especially for European standards, with a roomy bathroom that enabled me to put out all my toiletries. Shower was a bit tight but plenty of hot water and a small window for ventilation. Its location in the Monti neighborhood, yet an easy walk from Termini Station, made this stay absolutely perfect.
hotelName:
3    Hotel Raffaello
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stefano, our host, was very helpful and kind. We booked transportation to and from the airport through Stefano and the service was excellent. Our room was comfortable and clean with great wifi connection. We were well rested during our stay with Stefano thanked to his air conditioner was working superbly in keeping our room cool - we were not so well rested in Venice since our B & B there did not have good air conditioning.My Guest Roma is only a short walking distance from bus and metro stations. ATM and a coffee shop are just few steps away. There are several good restaurants and a couple of supermarkets nearby as well.Our experience at My Guest Roma was very positive. We highly recommend you to stay at this B & B as Stefano will take very good care of you.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I wanted a kosher bed and breakfast while visiting Rome. We were recommended to this place by two friends. It was just what we wanted!!Stefano, the host, was helpful and personally involved in making sure our trip would be meaningful, comfortable, and tailored to our interests. The breakfast included freshly made coffee or cappuccino, fresh fruit, vegetables and pastries served by very caring people. The bedroom was clean and well lit as was the bathroom. We appreciated the fact that the bedroom window could be opened to let in the crisp air. The apartment is about a 10 minute walk from the Piazza Bologna Metro Station. From there it was 10 minutes to downtown Rome. We could also take an express stop bus a few minutes from the apartment. Kosher restaurants were within walking distance as were synagogues. And there was a supermarket a few minutes away. There were also many other restaurants and gelato shops very close to the apartment. Stefano knows his city and made sure we knew how to get to where we wanted to go as well as being very helpful in suggesting places to visit.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for four nights at My Guest Roma. We found the room very clean and very comfortable. The kosher breakfasts that Stefano provided were amazing with a lovely variety, Stefano made cappuccinos, there were fancy pastries, cereal, fruit, bread, lovely cheeses and yogurt, and set a lovely table that felt very homey. Stefano took the time and effort to plot out how we spent our time so that we could make the most of our trip as we were there only a short time, and really helped put things in perspective from a local point of view - taking into account the various transportation options which made life so much easier.For Shabbat, Stefano arranged Shabbat candles, a hot water kettle (urn) and provided us with a Shabbos belt. There was the option of a hot plate to heat up the food which we didn't require as we went to Chabad for meals which was a 5 minute walk. He advised us about friendly Batei Knesset that were nearby, which were themselves an incredible experience. Stefano even arranged transportation from and to the airport which was a pleasure. Stefano is a wonderful host and we highly recommend My Guest Roma in general to everyone, and in particular to any Shomer Shabbat guest to Rome.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect-sized room configuration for a family of six looking to stay in affordable accommodations. Location was convenient to both the metro and the bus. Breakfast was generous, varied, and delicious. Most importantly, our host, Stefano, took the time and effort to plot out how we spent our time so that we could make the most of our trip and ensure that it was enjoyable for everyone in the family. It was the sort of above and beyond service that we would not have received from the concierge had we stayed at a five star hotel. And beyond the recommendations, he even arranged our airport transfers and our tour guides so that all we had to do was relax and enjoy our vacation.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great experience in Rome thanks to Stefano and the staff at My Guest Roma. First Stefano greeted personally and sat down with us to go over the city, bus routs and any other needs we had. Even providing early breakfast every time we had an early start for the day.The room was great every thing clean and in the right place, the location of the hotel is perfect for transportation in and out of the city.The breakfast had all the options possible, fresh, warm and amazing.Will recommend to any one looking for a cozy place to stay and enjoy Rome. Make sure to sit down with Stefano and have a great conversation.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Guest Roma offers clean and comfortable rooms, a great kosher breakfast, and easy access to bus and Metro to all the sites in Rome. But the true jewel in this crown is owner / manager, Stefano himself! Stefano comes personally every morning to help you plan your day, down to the finest details. Stefano truly cares about each and every guest. He even made sure we had a "breakfast-to-go tray" on the morning of our early flight. Never seen anything like it. Thanks to Stefano, we made the most of our few days in Rome and happily recommend My Guest Roma for your next holiday in Rome!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just had a fantastic 5 days in Rome. Had a wonderful stay at My Guest Roma. As I am coeliac, it was great to have breakfast and to be given details of lots of places in Rome where I could eat. Stefano was a great host and gave us lots of suggestions of what to visit and we found his instructions very easy to follow. Our room was nice and having a fridge and a safe in the room were very useful. Would definitely recommend My Guest Roma for your stay in Rome.Sandra and Jon
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fabulous time at My Guest Roma. Stefano was a brilliant host- he recommended how to make the most of our few days in Rome and his attention to detail was perfect. It was great to have my Coeliac taken seriously and we had no problems at all. I would highly recommend whether you have any food intolerances or not.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second time staying with Stefano. We love the family feel of My Guest Roma. Stefano has so many ideas of what to do and things to see, our second time he made sure we were able to see new things. The rooms are quaint and freshly decorated. Very clean and very hospitable! Would suggest My Guest Roma to anyone!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: B&B manager/owner Stefano Milano goes the extra mile to serve each guest's needs. Had a lovely quiet room. Plentiful breakfast provided each morning. Advice on points of interest in the immediate area and beyond. 24/7 full grocery store across the street. Nearby transit (bus and Metro) to downtown Rome and train station. Extraordinary hospitality.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The host, Stefano, took care of every detail to.make our trip just so much better. He even prepared an awesome breakfast sent to the apartment in advance of an early departure including snacks to take on our trip. This is as good as it gets. We are grateful!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would like to thank to the owner, Stefano and the staff for the great exprience that we had in My guest Rome. Me and my family enjoyed from every minute thanks to the help and the good service that we got from them. The breakfast was good, and  tasty. thank you very much Stefano
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family of 4 spent 3 nights at My Guest Roma. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. My boys, 8 and 10, loved the bunk bed. Our room was large, very clean and very comfortable. The breakfast every morning was great and kept us going well past lunch time. Cereal, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, pastries, toast and jam, juices, hot chocolate for the kids and excellent coffee for us. Couldn't have really asked for much more. The location is great, a short bus or metro ride to all of the big sights, a super market 1 block away and plenty of convenience stores, cafes and restaurants a short walk from the property. The biggest selling point, however, is Stefano. He provides personalized service from the minute your reservation is confirmed. He gave us advice on sites to see, the best times to go, which tickets to buy before arriving in Rome and which to buy on site. He arranged for a car to pick us up at the airport and bring us to the property. Once there, he gave us maps and sat down to explain how to get where we wanted to go with the bus and/or metro. He even helped us find the best train prices from Rome to Naples! There is also laundry service, which we used and greatly appreciated. I have never been so well taken care of! Thank you Stefano for a wonderful stay in Rome!!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely Bed and Breakfast with one of the nicest hosts we ever had. Great hospitality, lovely and very comfortable rooms, perfect Service. An ideal Location and stay, with kosher facilities. Highly reommendable.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there through a reference. Had wonderful time! Right from the moment I stepped in, felt almost at home.Yeah the room I chose, was possibly the smallest, but then it was my choice, and it was just about fine for a solo traveller. Stefano is a rockstar. We almost spent an hour on the first day pondering over the map he provided me. And I followed the exact path he had suggested. Next day, repeat ! Another round of discussions and another day to explore. He was extremely helpful when I called him many times over the day. Breakfast is good. Decent spread. Not to forget his support staff. The lady who originally hails from Sri Lanka, and manages Breakfast and house keeping made sure I had a wonderful stay there! Kudos to them. Rooms are just fine, if you are not looking for luxury, this is just perfect. Location, slightly away from the city buzz, but a quick bus hop will take you directly to the main tourist spots. Supermarket bang across the road. Do buy groceries and wine from there. M definitely staying there again, when I go back. And, I would definitely recommend this to my family and friends. Cheers !
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was so neat and clean, and Stefano took such good care of us! From showing us the best places to visit in Rome, to providing breakfast, to staying up late to make sure we arrived safely. He’s the best!!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stefano is a most wonderful host. Very very helpful and keen to be of service. We enjoyed a delicious breakfast every morning where he was happy to accomodate any request, and came back in the evenings to our comfortable accommodation which was easily accessible to and from town. Great service made it very good value for money and it was a lovely place to return to in the evenings after a long day of touring.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came to Rome for few days inc. Shabbat , Stefano helped a lot before the trip with answers to all our questions. When we arrived he set everything nice and neat (we had the big apt. with 2 rooms)Very nice KOSHER breakfast and many advices to tours in Rome In one word - EXCELENT
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The vibe is amazing: staying at Stefano's B&B in the heart of Rome really gives you the feeling of being in a home away from home. The owner took great care of us - he was polite, considerate, incredibly helpful and knowledgible about the city. Fantastic experience.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the cleanest and nicest B&B that we stayed at during our recent Italian trip. The host, Stefano, is incredibly helpful and is treating his guests as his family. The place is very well connected to the city's main attraction and is great value for money. Way to go!!!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so happy with our choice to stay at My guest Roma. The owner was so helpful, he sat down with us for a full hour helping me and my friends plan our itinerary. Additionally the room was clean and spacious and the service was amazing. I highly recommend this place!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stefano was a very friendly host, always willing to help us with tips regarding gluten-free meals around the city, main tourist atractions, and other ways of enjoying Rome. We were very well acommodated and enjoyed a nice gluten-free breakfast every morning. We moved easily to and from the city center using metro.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even before we arrived, our conscientious host arranged our transportation. Upon arrival, Stefano escorted us to our meticulously clean suite. He sat in "our kitchen" and explained all our touring options. He took as much time we needed to understand directions. The following morning Jenny prepared a delicious cappuccino and a nourishing breakfast .During our 5- 5-day stay, the staff kept our rooms and bathroom scrupulously clean.The hotel is in a central location to bus and train.We had fun traveling each day with the natives. In the evening, we ate delicious food at near-by eateries. We will certainly stay again on our next visit to Rome!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time we have stayed at My Guest Roma & I would never think of staying any where else while visiting Rome. We stayed for 4 nights in Oct 2017. It is conveniently located just 4 bus stops from Termini Station. You are close enough to the center of Rome but not in the middle of the touristy area. The area has many reasonably priced restaurants & a supermarket is located across the street. The rooms are immaculately clean & very modern. The full international buffet breakfast, if you choose this option, is a wonderful assortment of pastries, cheeses, fruit, eggs, yogurt, beverages etc. The owner, Stefano is very accommodating & friendly. He goes out of his way to insure that your stay in Rome is very memorable. He is a world of advice on places to tour & exactly how to get there. He is a true gem. You would never be disappointed staying here.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spotless, ideally located for bus, metro, supermarket, cafés and getting to know a 'real' area of Rome whilst no distance from the tourist attractions.Stefano is a star!......extremely helpful and informative......his advice was invaluable and meant that we didn't waste any time or opprtunities.Breakfast for my husband who is ceoliac was absolutely gluten free.....and the list of restaurants that Stefano recommened was really helpful. Unlmited tea and coffee was much appreciated, as was the use of the dning room for DIY suppers!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
