review_body: This was my second stay at my guest Roma. Stefano is a gracious host, so kind and friendly. Readily gives advice about the city and how to get around, and where to. The double room was clean, spacious (on the bottom floor there was not much natural light but there are enough artificial lights). Breakfast is simple and tasty, a good start for the day. It's not in the center, but just a short bus/metro ride away. It's in a quiet and pleasant neighborhood with good shopping. I highly recommend a stay.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had only two days to explore Rome and we could not have picked a better place to stay than My Guest Roma (we found it on Google). The owner, Stefano, took great care to help us plan the perfect itinerary for our short trip. He is so kind and knowledgeable about Rome - it's really 5-star service you're getting here. I am a clean freak (I get sketched out staying in hotels and inns that don't seem sanitary) and this is the cleanest most well-taken care of place I've EVER stayed. The bed was comfortable and the shower was really nice too. The breakfast was very good each day and filled us up. If you want a snack or to buy other things there is a SUPER convenient, upscale market across the street that is open 24-7! You can't ask for more convenience than that. There are great restaurants and gelato shops within a few minutes walk from the inn, which was also wonderful. I see a couple reviews that rated this place less than 5 stars based solely on the fact that it's not right downtown next to the monuments. Let me give travelers some advice. You do NOT want to stay downtown near the monuments. It's more expensive, not as clean, crowded, and tourist-y, and honestly, after exploring the sites for a few hours I was always relieved to be leaving downtown and going back to the clean, safe, quiet, and charming neighborhood where My Guest Roma is. And it's only a few short minutes ride on public transport (only 1.5 euro!) to get downtown from the inn.As for getting downtown, it's easy to use public transport. We walked half a block to the bus stop and took the bus to the sites. It was easy and cheap. We took the metro another day and it's about a 5 block, lovely walk and also easy and cheap. I think this is probably the best deal you can imagine finding in Rome! We are from the US, but if my husband and I return we will certainly stay here again! Thank you Stefano for being so wonderful, you really work hard and genuinely care about the people who stay with you!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our week long stay at My Guest Roma featured comfortable accommodation, delicious breakfasts, but most of all great advice about where to go and what to see from our host, Stefano. He takes a personal interest in each of his guests and does his very best to ensure that we all have a wonderful time visiting his city - which we did!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stefano is the host with the most! He took care of everything! True hospitality in the traditional sense of great vacation experiences. He arranged everything for us from transportation from the airport to ordering special meals to providing us with every comfort. It was like staying with family or a good friend. He is very knowledgeable about Rome, its Jewish history and culture. Despite the heat in Rome,Stefano made our stay extremely comfortable.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found My Guest Roma by accident but we are SOOO HAPPY we did! It worked out perfectly for us and we could not have asked for more! We stayed at My Guest Roma for 5 nights in February and it was a pleasure. From the moment we booked the room, Stefano was eager and attentive to ensuring that all of our needs were met. By phone and email he arranged for a driver to pick us up from the airport (for a very reasonable price) and arranged for us to have Shabbat meals in the dining room. When we arrived, Stefano met us at the front door, carried our bags and settled us in. A few minutes later he called us and asked if we had some time to sit down with him. He sat with us for over 45 minutes going over our itinerary for the trip. He made invaluable suggestions for things to leave out and what not to miss. We discussed different modes of transportation and where we were better off walking. He was extremely informative but never pushy or overbearing. It felt like we had a guardian angel in a city where we knew no one. We ended up significantly changing our itinerary based on his suggestions and we are so happy that we did! Every day he brought us a beautiful breakfast and was more than happy to pack up the leftovers (of which there were many) as boxed lunches! He was always available to us and could not have been lovelier. The accommodations themselves were clean and comfortable. The location was great and everywhere we wanted to go was easily accessible. We will always associate our amazing trip to Rome with Stefano and My Guest Roma. We will certainly recommend them to all of our friends and family and hope one day to stay there again ourselves! Thanks Stefano!  B and T
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It very nice and wonderful place you will feel like at home.we gonna stay her for weeks wonderful room very clean and great breakfast to start your day.her we have bast time ever staying in Rome at my Guest Roma!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was great as a base for visiting Rome!! You can easily and cheaply get the metro in no time at all to the city centre. The room was very comfortable and large with a big en suite bathroom!! Stefano was a brilliant host who looks after you during your stay! He made sure we got to see all the sites in a stress free 3 days with his map of the town. When we arrived he let us settle in and then suggested ways of us seeing everything we wanted to see each day to make it as easy and relaxing as possible, Stefano also has an incredible guide of gluten free restaurants in and around Rome which we took advantage of!! The gluten free breakfast also made the start of every day very straight forward and hassle free.I cannot rate this B&B and especially Stefano highly enough and if we ever return to Rome this would be our first option!!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was wonderful place with feeling like at home. Stefano the owner of this place is a amazing guy that help us at any time and solve us problems and questions. He is very polite and good manners. The flat is located in very good area and give you to feel like at home. We recommend this place for every guest that want to visit at Rome. This is now our favorite place at Rome. Tova danon solomon
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a week at the beginning of our vacation. From start to end it was a wonderful experience.The accommodation was clean and bright with plenty of room, and a great breakfast to start every day. But best of all was Stefano the host and the special care and attention he gave to each of his guests every morning. He checked in with each of us on our plans for the day and helped us with our routes and always had many suggestions of other things we could do to add to our experiences. I believe he goes above and beyond. I have already recommended his establishment to other friends and if I were to go to Rome again would be sure to stay at My Guest Roma.Linda
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights at the end of May and it was superb. Stefano runs an immaculately clean B&B which is very modern , light and airy. The room was perfect, it had air con and electric shutters to black the room out which were great for our 18 month old daughter. We found My Guest Roma because it was recommended on a Coeliac website (our two daughters are Coeliac) and Stefano provided a good range of breakfast for them each morning. He also gave us a map showing nearby gluten free restaurants which was handy. Stefano was able to answer all our questions and gave us some options in where to go that was child friendly, Villa D'este was one example that we all enjoyed although the bus journey was pretty long. He was always at the end of the phone when needed using WhatsApp and couldn't have been more helpful. Would absolutely recommend staying here, it's not right in the centre but only a 10 min walk and then 5 stops on the metro to the Colosseum.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely a wonderful place to stay. MyGuestRoma became a total place of comfort after I suffered a bone fracture ending with a plaster cast on the leg. Every possible thing was done by Stefano to ensure all my needs were met as a result of having to suddenly use crutches. An example of his caring was that Stefano located museums which loaned wheelchairs to visitors so that I was able to enjoy myself in a safe environment. In every way he provided extraordinary service and his staff were so very good too, in catering to my new distressing situation. The bedroom and bathroom was most suitable and attractive. Breakfast was always something to look forward to as it was always so appetising. I was sad to leave as never before have I experienced the quality of survice provided by MyGuestRoma!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very comfortable, clean and modern guesthouse. Short walking distance to local train station, kosher shops and shuls. One bus to centre of Rome. Very helpful staff. You get an honest answer from a local as apposed to a tourist shop. Large varied chalav yisrael kosher breakfast and shabbos facilities. We would definitely recommend this place and look forward to going back.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were so pleasantly surprised with how amazing the stay at my guest Roma was! The rooms were spotlessly clean and the beds were comfy.But the best part was the owner, Stefano... He made it his goal to make sure we were happy, but not only with his accommodations, but with our trip as well. He sat with us and helped us plan our day trips... And had amazing suggestions!We felt so taken care of! It was amazing! He is seriously the nicest host! If we ever come back to Rome, we will definitely come back to my guest Roma!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 5 nights. Room was cozy, clean and fully equipped (Air conditioning, TV, mini-fridge, safe).Stefano, the owner, is an exceptionally caring person. Always willing to help, even with things not directly related to the guest house (Helped us getting tickets online for various attractions and also explained in length how and when it is preferable to get to them. Saved us loads of time!). Place is ideal for people who keep Shabbat and Kashrut (Down to the level of providing a solution for lack of Eruv on Shabbat!).Highly recommended!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent eight nights in “My Guest Roma” and we really enjoyed it! Stephano is an amazing person because he is such a wonderful host. Our trip would not have been so smooth and successful without his advice and help. Before my arrival, he helped me create a productive schedule for each of my days in Rome. Stephano is the primary reason for my trip to Rome being so relaxing and safe. The accommodations are located in a green and quiet neighborhood of Rome. The rooms are clean and private. The window can be kept open all night without any concerns about safety or noise. The city transportation is near and easy to reach. (Please note, I prefer the bus over the metro because the city can be seen when traveling.) As well, there are a variety of restaurants, and a super market, located in the vicinity of the residence. Stay at “My Guest Roma” and I guarantee that you will not be disappointed. Basically, Stephano provides a vacation within a vacation! I say, “Thank you Stephano and staff for making our stay in Rome so pleasant.”
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have nothing but goods things to say about our stay. Stefano (the owner) contacted me personally since I made the reservation and kept in touch all throughout our arrival, giving tips and suggesting ways to get there. Once at the hotel he made us feel right at home. He was at the doorstep to personally welcome us "home" and sat with us explaining the city and suggesting itineraries. The guest house delivers perfectly on what they offer. We were 4 in one large room, with single comfy beds. Bathroom was super clean and serviced daily. We overlooked a small interior courtyard. No noise at all from the street. Charming 1930s house, off the super touristy areas of the city but very well connected by two bus lines and a 10 minute walk to Bologna subway station. Hearty european style breakfast, with an assortment of pastries, rolls, jams, cheese, hard-boiled eggs, cherry tomatoes, yoghurt, fresh fruit, juice and of course, espresso! It might not sound like much, but it will get you going until lunch. The neighborhood is super nice and safe. There is a 24 hour supermarket just one block away as well as a nice restaurant/bar one block down and across. After a long day of walking it was a lively place to go have a drink and relax just steps from your room. On our last day one of us left very early in the morning and Stefano left a breakfast tray in our room the night before, with all we had liked having for breakfast. That is attention to detail! Stefano made us feel in our home away from home for a few days in Rome. Him and his staff deliver impecable and taylored service in a homey atmosphere. Thanks Stefano, we'll be back!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent five nights here as family on half-term break in February 2017. Great value for money, excellent accommodation, clean & quiet, very convenient for transport and walking distance to a fantastic park, restaurant & gelateria. Host Stefano goes out of his way to help you enjoy Rome, his tips for things to do with kids were all spot on.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, Stefano the host is great. He will go to any effort to make your visit pleasant.The rooms are nice and clean, the bathroom is welcoming, and the water is nice and hot.The breakfast is rich (the corasons are divine) and tasty.If you are staying for Shabat, and you care for Kashrut and Shmirat Shabat, Stefano provides all the solutions, from a hot platta to a key-belt.Touring Roma without experiencing Stefano's hospitality, is missing out on something. We had a great time, and we highly recommend "My Guest Roma". Enjoy!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three pleasant nights at My Guest Roma B&B. Our room was clean, spacious and comfortable with lots of storage and minimal street noise. The highlight of this location is the terrific hospitality provided by Stefano, who welcomed us with tea and crackers and provided us with detailed orientation to Rome highlights, public transportation and local neighborhood resources.The (kosher) breakfast is an excellent way to start the day with a variety of options including fresh fruit, bread, cheese, yoghurt, cereal and excellent coffee (as much as you need).
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being in Rome for the second time and OF COURSE stayed again at „MyGuestRoma“ – where else ?If you decide to enjoy your stay at “MyGuest Roma”, you will find yourself in a very nice area, quiet and not crowded by tourists but nevertheless equipped with nice restaurants, supermarkets and cafes as well as some shops. All you need for a comfortable stay is easy in reach. Getting there is uncomplicated with several bus lines (between 2 and 5 minutes walk) or with the subway (maybe around 7 minutes walk). If you arrive by plane my suggestion would be to ask Stefano to organize a pickup by taxi. Besides it’s the most convenient way, in my eyes it gives you a nice trip through the city as well.Again, we stayed in the comfortable 4-bed-room with an en-suite bathroom. The room is equipped with enough space to store your luggage, a TV and a fridge. And this is what I love about this place – all these nice little things that make your stay even better and that show that there is someone who obviously thinks a lot about the needs of his guests ! Enjoy the advantage of having breakfast in the small but cosy breakfast room. First, because this breakfast will be a perfect start into your day. Second – just use the chance of getting in touch very easy with other guests. Nothing as useful as other guests to share ideas and plans.Besides all other advantages of staying here – the best thing was, is and will most probably remain Stefano and his team. Stefano knows everything, has everything and does everything for his guests. And this of course without being obtrusive. He is just there when needed…..We always wonder how he has the right tips for each person – seems, as he feels which kind of interests you do have .If you are looking for a really great place to stay in Rome – you found it.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Anything I say will not do justice to our wonderful experience with Stefano and My Guest Roma. As amazing as our trip was, staying here and working with Stefano before and during our stay was the icing on the cake. Communication was quick and helpful (He and Ida had an enourmous amount of patience with all my questions), and as soon as we arrived, it was like coming home. Stefano helped us with our itinierary when we arrived, advising us on the best way to see Rome which was different - and a better use of our time - than we originally planned. We found ourselves saying multiple times, "Stefano was right!" The room itself was clean, comfortable, spacious and exactly as described. We had a quadruple room for three people and there was more than enough storage space. It was cleaned every day. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful, including lots of coffee. If we left earlier than it was served, Stefano made sure we had it in our room to go the night before. Centrally located, there are a bunch of bus lines a few minutes walk from the bed and breakfast and the metro is about a 10 minute walk. All busses and subway are a short trip to anywhere you want to go in the city including to Termini if you're leaving the city. Our stay included Saturday and as we are Sabbath observers, Stefano made sure that we had every accommodation. In addition to being professional and hard working, Stefano was also great to talk to, it very much added to our stay. It really was the best we could have hoped for and we can't wait to come back and stay. Thank you Stefano!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The breakfast was great, the room was fun and comfortable - and Stefano's daily morning briefings helped us make the most of our time in Rome. From great suggestions as to what see and in what order, and tips for minimizing wait times, Stefano doubled as a personal tour director. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I briefly stayed in this B&B four years ago; this September I returned for a two-week stay. I stayed in a single room, which is small but cheerfully decorated and well-organised so that the space does not feel cramped. There's a safe in the room for valuables, and a small fridge. The B&B is very good value.Stefano is extremely accommodating, happy to offer suggestions and advice for things to do in Rome even for those who have already been there many times and seen the main sights (I used to live there). He will do anything he can to make your stay more comfortable and enjoyable.The location, though not central, is convenient--well connected by bus and a short walk from a metro stop, making it easy to get to the city center. The neighborhood is residential with plenty of shops and restaurants within a reasonably short walk.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don't look any further, this is brilliant and its greatest asset is Stefano who will give fantastic advice on how to make the most of your visit to Rome. Don't be put off by the distance it's an easy frequent bus service to termini the train station and in to piazza Venezia from where you can get to most places. Very Clean, comfortable, good breakfast. Felt like we had a friend in Rome giving us the inside advice.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Back at home, after wonderful days spent in Rome celebrating 34 years of marriage.it couldn't be better than staying at Stefano's guesthouse. He took care personally till the smallest details since we arrived at Fiumicino arranging for us a cab from the airport to the hotel and looking after us everyday that we stayed in the hotel till the last minute.The rooms are clean and comfortable to stay and a very tasty kosher breakfast in the morning waiting for you. we warmly advice for this place and we already are planning our next stay beezrat HAshem there.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an exquisite time in myguest Roma. Stefano is a fantastic host. Always there when you need him. He sat with us and explained everything we needed and more. Comfortable room and beds. 10 out of 10
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very enjoyable and relaxing experience at My Guest Roma B & B. First, Stefano, the owner, greets each guest personally, gives important tourist advice and takes a personal interest in all his guests. We loved the building, high ceilings, our room was quiet, clean, and beds were very comfortable, good a/c, and a mini plasma, mini refrigerator, spacious bathrm. Location was outstanding for our needs, good public transportation, close to the synagogue and good shopping district in the neighborhood of Piazza Bologna. Amenities were great, a Shabbat hot plate, kosher food for breakfast, preparations for Shabbat Kiddush. Stefano caters his B & B, to all tourists, kosher or not. We met people from everywhere, although it is a small B & B, so you need to book in advance. It provides an intimate environment and Stefano is always there to make you feel at home away from home with his attentive staff. I highly recommend My Guest Roma.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very nice stay ( 3 nights ) at My Guest Roma, the huose is beautiful, in very good location, it was easy to reach the center with public transport. The room was spacious and contained everything what we needed. The breakfast buffet was rich, full of fresh goods of Italy, perfect. Stefano is the best host I ever meet, very nice and extremely helpful.
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed back in June '16 with my partner on our first trip to Rome. I was attracted to this B&B due to the high ratings and positive reviews on TripAdvisor, and I am glad to say that My Guest Roma did indeed live up to its perceived standards. In a nutshell, MGR is a clean and welcoming guesthouse which is managed by Stefano, a highly attentive and warm host. I do not exaggerate when I claim that he will go out of his way to assist you with every aspect of your stay. The B&B is situated in more of a local part of Rome, where tourists are more rare; this suited us in the way that was less hustle and bustle, and it provided insight into another version of the more commonly seen and advertised Rome. The nearest Metro station is a rough and straightforward 15 minute walk; the Metro is then only a 10 minute journey into the heart of the city. More conveniently, a large 24/7 supermarket is only a minute's walk away and you can find a surprisingly vast selection of foods here!Booking the room was simple and fast - the staff are always alert to messages and e-mails and they understand English well. I was pleased to discover that they offer the arrangement of a taxi to transport you between the airport and the B&B itself. This is pre-arranged before arrival and it is worth doing so, to ease any stresses of the journey. At Fiumicino airport, the taxi driver was fairly easy to spot amongst the many pick-up drivers, and the journey to MGR was relaxing. Upon arrival to MGR, Stefano was there to greet my partner and I; he made it clear that we had the chance to rest if required, before offering us a chance to discuss the plans of our trip. From this experience, it was evident that Stefano had extensive knowledge of all the go-to-areas in Rome - from where individual bus stops are located, to the best places to eat out and what times best to visit the Vatican City to avoid the worst of the queues. The advice offered and willingness to bond with his guests is certainly a quality of Stefano's which definitely distinguishes him from typical hosts.The room itself was clean, cool and welcoming. It was simplistic in the manner that there were only the bare necessities required for a temporary stay, e.g., small table and chairs to eat at, and a sufficient wardrobe. This was not a problem and added to the character of the room - the only improvement that I would suggest is an instalment of a full-length mirror, in addition to the lone (yet large) mirror in the bathroom. There is a safe which I trusted to put my valuables inside, and Stefano kindly instructed us on how to use it. Moreover, there is a TV that can be watched from the comfort of the bed. Our room was situated on the far end of the hall, and outside the window lay a small garden which was lovely. In the hall outside of the room, there is a kettle along with cups, and a selection of coffee and tea. Brochures and leaflets are available also, displaying information about possible tourist sites to visit.We opted to eat breakfast at MGR and had the chance to choose the time we would attend every morning. The selection of foods consisted of fresh croissants (a mix of chocolate and plain), fruits, breads, cereals and cheeses. Juice and hot drinks were available too. The breakfast sufficed for the typically long day ahead, but it was also an opportunity to chat to Stefano, discussing our plans for the day and the routes to the places we wished to visit.Overall, I would recommend staying at MGR for a pleasant stay with the warmest host. Thank you Stefano - you outshone our expectations and you are a most kind and generous gentleman. Amina and Richard x
hotelName:
4    My Guest Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just returned from a three night stay.Clean, comfortable rooms. Delicious breakfast buffet laid on each morning.Easy walking to the sites.Helpful, friendly host.10 mins to nearest Metro Station.We loved staying here!
hotelName:
5    FeelinRome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very small and located in a quiet area in Rome close to a metro station. The rooms are modern and clean. The breakfast is very good. We strongly recommend to stay here if you like to be in a quiet place which is more in an area where local people live. Also Giorgia, the host is a very nice and helpful person.
hotelName:
5    FeelinRome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed here with 2 friends. It was great. Georgia was really helpful when we arrived, she gave us lots of tips about Rome and good places to eat. Our room was a good size with a nice sized bathroom, both were kept clean throughout our stay. The breakfast was amazing, lots to choose from and excellent coffee!The location is a little out of the city, about a 20 minute walk to the Colosseum which we did most days. In the evenings we tended to catch a taxi back which didn't ever cost us more than 15euro. I would 100% recommend this B&B to friends and family. We loved our stay in Rome.
hotelName:
5    FeelinRome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Modern, clean and lovely Little BnB. Absolutely worth it. The breakfast was great and Giorgia had some really nice advises. The Metro Station to the Sightseeing Highlights was only a 5 min walk away. Great place for a trip to Rome!
hotelName:
5    FeelinRome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had fantastic 4 nights in FillinRome Bed and breakfast. The room was exceptionally clean and was cleaned every day during our stay. The bathroom was very clean too.The location was really convenient for the keen explorers on foot, as well as very closely located to the metro,train,tram and buses. The host was really kind and warmly welcomed us.I would recommend this place to all my friends and family as it is great value for money and offers very comfortable stay.
hotelName:
5    FeelinRome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful! Smaller than most Intercontiental hotels we have used in other cities, this lovely more boutique style hotel was perfect. Not on the main thoroughfare;Via Guilia has some lovely little shops and is convenient to everywhere with a short taxi ride. The stand out here is the staff. Orietta Raggazone and Roberto at the front desk were exceptional. The rooftop bar was the the perfect place to end the evening! Grazie tutti!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Adorable chic and comfortable in a great location. My adult son and I spent 5 nights here. It was a perfect choice. The staff were so friendly and so helpful. Walking to the market daily for breakfast was our favorite way to start our days.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cozy hotel in the hart of Rome, and few minutes walk from Vatican City. Nice facilities, profesional and warm service, wonderful city view from the restaurant on the roof garden. All in all the best acomodation in Rome. Many thanks to Alessandro Landini excellent hotel manager.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good quality hotel. As in most cities in Europe, the rooms are not huge but perfectly adequate. Location was very practical, breakfast very good and the bar at the top very romantic.Personnel at front desk were very helpful and friendly
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the location and the area.The hotel is in a quiet place, yet central.The rooms are not big, yet, very well arranged. Nothing is missing.Nice decor.The people are very nice and helpful.Breakfast is outstanding!We would definitely return.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Indigo – St. George is a newly renovated hotel located just east of the Tiber River in Rome. The location is above average as it is only 20 minutes walking or 5 minutes driving form the Vatican City. The hotel is set on a quiet side street that is just one block away from Via de Banchi Vecchi which is actually a nice strip of local restaurants and shops. Banchi Vecchi is unique because it seems to be a good mix of locals and tourists enjoying good food and drinks away from all the bustle of Roma city. We witnessed a vibrant happy hour in the early evening where people lined the streets and freely enjoyed wine.The main draw to Hotel Indigo is the updated lobby and the renovated rooms. The place overall looks great but there were quite a few downfalls during the stay, especially for a 5-star labelled hotel. The first major issue was the central air conditioning situation. Our room did not have proper working air and we notified the staff upon arrival. They attempted to fix the issue twice but were unsuccessful, which made showering and sleeping difficult. We also had an issue with the service to the room. We requested some silver ware to the room as we needed a few plates and forks. They couldn’t bring anything to the room because they said all staff were busy with a rooftop happy hour, causing us to go down to the restaurant and finding our own silver ware. We did not feel a priority during our stay there.Location (4/5)  +Great location on a quiet side street, very close to the Vatican but away from tourism+Vatican only 5 minutes away, other major attractions only such as Colosseo only 10 minutes away+Close to local restaurants, markets, sandwich shops, and gelato Room (2/5) +Clean and well decorated-Air conditioning was an issue for whole stay-Pretty small room and tight quarters Bathroom (2/5)+Clean-Small shower and very small vanity area with sink-Lighting was not great, difficult to get ready in Additional Space (2/5) +Good size closet and nice sitting area for coffee or dessert+One small sofa in the room-Not much else to the room, mainly a place to sleep  Comfort (1/5)  -Hard to judge a room that was consistently 75+ degrees Fahrenheit Service (2/5) +Concierge was very helpful and the lobby offered refined comfort-Service to the room was basically non-existent and made the stay rigid Breakfast (N/A)
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent hotel. The staff was very friendly and professional and the rooms were clean and quite comfortable. As an added bonus they always had a ginger, honey infused water that was really good and very refreshing. The location was great too. It is in a quiet part of the city but everything is walkable if you are in reasonable condition. It was a 15 minute walk to the Pantheon 10 minutes to Piazza Navona, and about a 20 minute walk to the Vatican. There were a ton of great places to eat heading towards any of those locations as well. The bus stops were all quite close as well when we needed to reach locations a bit farther out like St. Paul's or the Colosseum (though we did actually walk to the Colosseum once or twice as well). The rooftop bar is a great private retreat to hangout in the evening. They say when you toss a coin from your right hand over you're left shoulder into the Trevi Fountain you'll return to Rome some day. When I do, I'll definitely be staying here.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although it's in an older building, the Hotel Indigo was nicely updated. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The staff at the front desk are helpful and welcoming, and a bartender we had at the hotel bar showed us what we needed to know about Grappa! The property was on a quiet secluded street, but was within easy walking distance of many fine bistros and restaurants. They have a beautiful Vespa on display in the lobby, and our room had a large mural of a vintage Fiat on the wall, adding to the charm. I would highly recommend this hotel, and would certainly stay there again!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a Nice and well located hotel! The breakfast included is very good. I really enjoyed my daily dose of capuchino! Pastries were fantastic. I really liked the decoration. It made me feel like home.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love staying in St George creators and artist neighborhood and live Indigo in Rome. Balcony overlooking ancient terra cotta tiled old roofs and hearing church bells combined creates Rome in your room. The care of the tuck down w chocolates in evening and always keep the facility clean and pleasant is fabulous treatment. Staff was excellent in meeting every request with energy and smile. A great spot to stay when in Rome.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn’t spend 2 days better in Rome.Currently sleeping in room 408... and really impressed and satisfied.A warm welcome by Roberto from Front desk.... professional fast check in with a few good hints including benefits and places to visit.Then you go to the bar and the I sofa restaurant and guess what...... you meat a great team, including the kitchen brigade who prepares mouth watering dishes to compliment your nice stay in Rome.No Valerio and team no party :) a great host for I sofa restaurant that knows how to make your experience a memorable one... making you want to come over again.Rooms clean, good size and comfortable.A great hotel in the middle of Rome with all locations walking distance.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just finished a 4 night stay with our two teenagers. The hotel rated excellent for us in service, cleanliness, decor, and location. Its convenient location allowed us to walk to everywhere ( i.e., Vatican City, Musei Capitolini, shops, cafes, restaurants, churches...). We had two rooms, a suite with a sofa bed and a regular room. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but they were very clean and well maintained. (This is our pet peeve when we travel.) Lastly, the hotel staff is friendly, accommodating and very helpful. Every morning they cheerfully provided directions and information for our plans for the day. After our first night, our daughter lost her stuffed bunny when it got accidentally tossed into laundry with the bedsheets. They were able to call the laundry service and retrieve it. Thank you for the extra effort, it is very much appreciated. The stuffed bunny is very special to her and irreplaceable.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Indigo is the Hotel of Hotels. The Staff are second to NONE, The Property itself is immensely CLEAN, the service is exquisite, the rooms are stupendous and marvelous, the location is ideal and when you leave home for ITALY, PLEASE ensure that your local residence is as follows:Hotel Indigo Rome - St. GeorgeVia Giulia, 62, 00186 Roma RM, Italy.What a TREMENDOUS Experience. Thank you Hotel Indigo.Dr. Julius Theophilus.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Never been to Rome before. Could not have asked for better place to stay. Staff extremely professional and friendly and we were made to feel at home. Fabulous breakfast not often I get offered Prosecco for breakfast. Wonderful rooftop terrace with incredible views. Restaurant limited menu but as good service as you would get anywhere and food was very goodReception staff on arrival could not have been more friendly and professional A big thank you. We will be back.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Hotel Indigo made my daughter and her boyfriend feel truly special. Upon arrival they were upgraded to a balcony room. Tucked away on a quiet street it is walkable to all of Rome’s sights.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you’re going to stay in Rome and wants to stay in a nice hotel and location, this place is definitely worth it. We took the bus while in Rome and this hotel is centrally located to bus stops that’ll take you to tourist spots. This hotel also lend you a phone use for free that helped us and saved our data. Staff is friendly, especially bartender Ludivico (special mention) and a good breakfast spread. Spa, steam and sauna are great added feature especially after long walks in the city. I would stay here again!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best places I have stayed at as this was my 1st trip to Europe . The hotel is so great because it is within 15 mins to all the major attractions . Also the breakfast is one of the best buffets I have seen so much variety to choose from . Can’t thank the hotel enough .
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Incredibly charming and lovely hotel! Was only here for one night, but I cannot wait to come back to Rome- will definitely be booking here again. The front desk staff was so nice and accommodating. The room is chic, totally loved the decor! Perfect location too! Thank you for a wonderful start to our holiday!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are absolutely huge fans of Indigo and what their properties mean. Our first question for anywhere we go is - is there an Indigo there?Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George did not disappoint.Loved the ambiance, the staff, the location, the room, the continental breakfast, the Negronis in the bar at night. Everything.While we love to travel in the off season, it does occasionally mean that outdoor seating areas are closed. The rooftop terrace was only closed for food service. You could still go up and enjoy the view at night. We bought a bottle of wine at a local shop and had an amazing time looking at the city (and listening to unexplained fireworks. Forgot to ask the staff what they were for.)The shuttle service from the airport had zero issues finding the hotel. We asked the staff 3 of the mornings to have a taxi available at a certain time with a 100% success rate.Didn't eat lunch or dinner there. But happily started every day with breakfast and finished every night (save the one on the rooftop) in the bar.So, if you're to throw a coin in the Trevi Fountain to come back to Rome, what do you do to make sure you can stay at the St. George the next time?
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night during a trip through Europe. We had been wanting to visit Rome for years but also wanted to make sure we stayed in the heart of everything given the short timeframe. This hotel delivered on location and experience. It is in a very old building but has been updated - very cool and very clean.The front desk attendant, Orietta (sp), was excellent and very nice. We arrived earlier than check-in however was kind enough to help find us a room without waiting long. We were on our honeymoon and she went above and beyond providing us with a nice note and bottle of wine. Very nice touch!We thoroughly enjoyed our quick stay and are already talking about a return.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had selected Hotel Indigo Rome for its great central location to all the popular tourist attractions - only about 16 minutes walk to the Piazza Navona, and equally convenient walking distance to the Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, etc. Excellent location! The Hotel Indigo is located in a nice, quiet location with only a small narrow street front with hardly any traffic to speak of (see photos). This makes it very nice location for walking to the various attractions. All the buildings in this neighborhood looks like old architecture on the outside but well maintained physically - including the Hotel Indigo. I read that all buildings in the historic, central location of Rome must maintain their historic appearance on the outside. The Hotel Indigo outside architecture does indeed match the historic designs of the other buildings in the area. However, when we entered the Hotel Indigo, we were pleasantly surprised about the inside design of the hotel. The interior designs of the lobby, lounge, restaurant, bar and our room were all very comfortably modern. This feature may disappoint some people who were expecting the interior to be historically designed as the outside, but for us we prefer the more modern design. At least for us, we found the modern design more "like home" and very comfortable and inviting. Having stayed at other centrally located Rome hotels that were historically designed both inside and outside, we felt that the Hotel Indigo design suites us better. I have attached several photos of the Hotel that illustrates the nice design features of the hotelThe check-in process was quick and easy, and as a bonus for us being a Spire-Elite IHG club member, we were upgraded from the Standard Room to a Mini-Suite. We found the Mini-Suite to be very spacious and comfortable - large living and bedroom areas with separate TV's in both rooms, small walk-in closet with mini-bar that is complimentary for Mini-Suite guests and nice size bathroom. The rooms were very nicely appointed and there are murals on the walls of the bedroom and bathroom that is very "Romanesque" - a very nice touch.We ate at the Hotel restaurant for breakfast and dinner and found the service to be very good and the food quality to be good as well. The restaurant design is also quite modern and very comfortable which again is fine with us.For our next trip to Rome, I would definitely select the Hotel Indigo Rome because of the comfortable accommodations and great central location.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights, I was fortunate to get an upgraded room, the sleeping area was up several stairs from the bathroom. Nicely furnished with everything you could want. Staff are very friendly and attentive. Great location to walk to some of the main sights.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I havent been guest of the hotel. I used a groupon vowcher to treat my mum. In the coupon was included sauna, steem room, swimming pool with jacuzzi, half an hour massage for each of us and an aperitive in the garden.For what I paid the value of the deal was a bargain!It's a luxury hotel, everyone inside looks details oriented.Giorgia the girl that she does the treatments she is frendly but professional.The place is clean and spotless.Me and my mum we really enjoyed the time together. We have been very lucky coz we were alone in the spa even tho the hotel was full booked. You have at your disposal water, infuses and teas during all the time.Me and my mum we had such a great time, they treat us as if we were guests of the hotel paying full bill.We had a VIP day pampered from such a lovely experience.The location is fantastic, in the true heart of Rome, just along the river Tevere.My experience was more than positive.Giorgia
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had never stayed at Indigo hotels before but was tempted by an offer from the IHG Rewards Club. This beautiful hotel is tucked away in a quiet street and yet is within walking distance of all Rome's great attractions. There are many nearby cafes, bars and restaurants. Even a dry cleaner across the street! I was warmly welcomed and allocated a lovely junior suite overlooking the courtyard. The room was so nice I regret not staying longer! The room was beautiful appointed, extremely comfortable; and spotless. I slept soundly and enjoyed a nice breakfast in the hotel restaurant. Food selection was quite good, featuring Italian and British dishes. The espresso coffee was terrific. Cocktails at the hotel bar were awesome, accompanied by very generous snacks. Having stayed at many IHG properties around the world, I'm glad I tried out Indigo - this hotel is very elegant. A real class act complemented by attentive and friendly staff.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Indigo hotel for 6 nights on our first visit to Rome. We were a bit hesitant at first as we thought the hotel is situated in a remote area which was totally wrong.We arrived late (After 22:00) and were greeted by the lovely Orietta Ragazzoni who gave us all the details we needed with a smile and reassuranse which made us feel we are welcomed and all is going to be great.The room we got was large enough, super clean and modern with all amenities like AC, Bath robes, Slippers etc.Breakfast was great, fresh and delicious. The hotel is situated in a small road and close to all attractions within walking distance. there are great small restaurants and pubs in the streets next to the hotel and Trastevere district is 10 min walk if you want to spend an evening out.We will surely recommend the hotel to our friends and will love to come again.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel on the Via Giulia, booed it as part of a large group.Spa area was nice pool is a lovely temperature. Its a shame the lining of the pool looks so scruffy and one of the underwater lights are hanging off!Breakfast is fab - you must try the pancakes!!! YumWalking distance to all the major attractionsWe parked the hire car on the road outside - don't think we got any fines!! Would definitely recommend
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely hotel in a quiet, less touristy part of Rome but still very close to all the major sites. The room we had was an upgrade. It was spacious, clean, and loaded with perks and extras. The bed was quite nice and comfortable. The bathroom was spacious and very well equipped. A small but nice complimentary mini-bar was a nice plus as was the turn down service. The rooftop lounge was delightful for an evening drink. We did not use the hotel restaurant but it looked inviting and got very good reviews. This is not a large hotel but it have everything you would expect in any five star establishment.Would highly recommend it to all visiting Rome.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’d recommend this hotel. That staff are all very attentive. Good concierge. Fantastic location for all the sight seeing excursions. Stay here! Lovely roof top bar too. The gym is small and the indoor pool and Roman baths small as well but very clean. We went everyday to refresh after sight seeing
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at the Hotel Indigo Rome - St George. We had a fabulous time. Our room was large and well appointed. The bathroom was spacious with excellent products to use. Whilst at the hotel we had dinner in the Roof Terrace restaurant. The view from the terrace over the roof tops of Rome is spectacular. Our meal commenced with a basket of delicious warm bread rolls and bread sticks. We also had an appetiser which was a gift from the chef. I had steak which was cooked perfectly and my wife had pasta, tomato and lobster tail. She said it was just stunning. We enjoyed Prosecco with our meal. For dessert I had lemon with meringue and my wife had creme brûlée with exotic fruits.The service throughout the meal was impeccable and the live music added to the most romantic atmosphere.We also enjoyed drinks one night in a bar which is also located on the Roof Terrace and on another night we had drinks in the inner courtyard which is also just lovely. The greenery, reflection pool and music made the inner courtyard the most perfect way to relax after a busy day sight seeing.We loved the breakfasts in the hotel, the choice of food is just wonderful, the focaccia was my favourite.The hotel's location is very special, so close to the Vatican, Piazza Navona, Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. One early morning we walked to the Vatican to enjoy the beautiful sunrise before St Peter's Basilica got crowded.From the little touches of chocolates, lollies and water in the lobby to the highly skilled and knowledgable staff, the Hotel Indigo made our time in Rome so memorable. Thank you!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Rome Indigo St. George is an absolute joy to stay at. This is my second stay at the property. The public space is wonderful, the rooms are big and nicely appointed, and the roof bar and dining area is a wonderful retreat. The food and beverage is everything you would expect in a high quality Rome hotel. The location is perfect. Minutes away from almost every Rome must see historic place or object.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful Hotel, perfectly located. Close to the City center but also hidden in a romantic little alleyway. The roof top restaurant & bar offer great food with a wonderful view.But the most impressive is the staff. I rarely experienced such a friendly and caring team.Under these Orietta from the Concierge desk is even outstanding.Whenever I'm back to Rome the Indigo will alway be the place to stay.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Indigo - St. George is incredibly well located to several fun neighborhoods, major sites and the Vatican. The property is beautiful and we especially enjoyed having a drink at the rooftop restaurant while admiring the view of the city. We were pleased with the helpful service and effort to ensure we were comfortable, secured transportation easily and that our food and beverages were prepared to our liking. We did not have the opportunity to use the gym or spa given our brief stay, unfortunately. While this is a luxury property, the cost was high for the size of the rooms and for breakfast not to be included. Additionally, in a couple of instances, we had to track down our servers to order additional drinks, settle the bill and request the status of our food. This was not the case every time, but I mention it because we encountered this situation in three different instances. With that said, the issues were not enough to deter us from returning again.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 1week stay at the Hotel Indigo in Rome was wonderful. The staff, the breakfast buffet each morning, the rooftop bar/restaurant... everything simply awesome!! We would definitely stay there again, without a doubt!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On an anniversary trip to Rome to see the sights and enjoy a pilgrimage to the City. We booked on my IHG points for a long weekend and chose the Indigo carefully as we wanted something special.When we arrived, we were not disappointed. Our greeting from the front of house set the tone with Roberto & Orietta the warmest and most welcoming of hosts.The room they had prepared for us was spectacular, with a balcony and views across the rooftops of Rome.We with a personal note and gifts from the GM Alessandra, we were on our way to one of the most special city breaks ever, our reward for 30 years together.The hotel is on 5 floor with a roof top terrace on 6. The reception area and restaurant are very chic, and the staff are exceptional throughout- well done Alessandra.Hotel location is perfect location for Vatican City and many piazza’s and restaurants in the location. Don’t stay anywhere else... and as for Rome, well that is whole new adventure...
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recommended by friends and I can't thank them enough. Wonderful service, intimate setting. Great breakfast, comfortable beds, great sleeping conditions-- shutters keep outside light out, terrific pillows, plenty of outlets for CPAP users like us. Terrific location with many outstanding restaurants in walking distance. I just returned home and I am wishing I can return soon.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel located in a pretty quiet area of the city center, just a 10 to 15 minutes away from the Vatican City by foot. Walking distance to other attractions like Pantheon, Colosseum etc. The room is clean and pretty, and the toilet is excellent. Was initially uncertain about getting the hotel breakfast, but didn't regret my choice after the first morning. the breakfast spread is pretty good, quality and variety wise. Staff is friendly and helpful. Will definitely return to this hotel when I return to Rome the next time.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a weekend in Rome and had a fantastic time, this hotel is within easy access to all of the attractions if you don’t mind a walk taking in the sights on the way. The Vatican City and Trastevere are a short walk across the river, whilst others are further afield it is great to stumble across other little gems such as ruins, squares and even a daily market surrounded by bars and restaurants on the way. There are also bus stops a few mins away for those who don’t want to walk everywhere. The hotel is modern in decor and is truly lovely, we upgraded to a superior room and was not disappointed, even a Nespresso coffee machine for our daily coffee fix. There is a rooftop bar and restaurant with lovely views over the city, we popped in when we arrived and also one night for a nightcap, we found all the staff in the hotel friendly and helpful. There is a spa area in the hotel but we did not find time to use it, maybe next time Overall a lovely weekend
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 2nd visit to Hotel Indigo in Rome..and We would stay no place but while in Rome!Absolutely love this hotel..can’t wait to come back for a 3rd visit! This hotel is located on a beautiful neighborhood in Rome and within walking distance to other neighborhoods such as Campo de Fiori, Piazza Nouvano, Trastevere and so much more. The Vatican, as well as many other attractions are within walking distance also. The hotel itself is its own retreat..fantastic rooms and facilities including the wonderful rooftop deck while in season. The hotel staff is very helpful, friendly, and knowledgeable! The guest rooms are beautiful with modern baths, such comfortable beds and a delicious breakfast!The spa including a Roman Bath pool is a fantastic way to wind down after a busy day in Rome!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is nothing short of outstanding and the location couldn't be better. Via Giulia is in the heart of Rome and Hotel Indigo Rome - St George is at its epicenter. My colleague and I spent 2 weeks here for business and we can thoroughly recommend it. The staff are wonderful and the roof top restaurant is incredible but the amazing breakfast hosted by Elena Ventura and her team takes first prize. The breakfast menu has a fab range of hot and cold dishes for all dietary needs and by the time you finish, Elena and her team will leave you planning your next trip to Rome.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great hotel.within walking distance to Vatican, Trestevere and Piazza Navona. Very friendly service. Great amenities including a rooftop restobar, and cozy inner courtyard for breakfast. Clean and very confortable beds with nightly turndown service. Spa and Roman baths available great little perk. A complimentary android phone is given for uaage during your stay so navigating around town is so easy. Loved it!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Rome for a long weekend and stayed in Hotel Indigo - and what a surprise it was! Faultless staff service from beginning to end, perfectly located for walking to local sites, a beautiful rooftop bar and restaurant, a luxurious spa, and the room... wow! Spacious, comfortable, stylish - it was perfect in every possible way! When the staff realised it was my birthday they delivered a bottle of Prosecco and a tray of sweet treats and cakes to the room, and they provide a turn-down service of an evening which is a lovely touch and makes it feel all the more special. We are planning to return here for our 5th anniversary as we loved it so much!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having lived in Rome for 5 years many years ago and stayed in a few good hotels, this one gets 10/10! Lovely rooms and decor, steeped in history and on a lovely cobbled back street this small but modern hotel ticked all our boxes. Could not fault it in any way. Exceptionally clean, very good standards, great smelling toiletries ( not the dinky, stingy seed ones some 5 start hotels use that have no scent!) Staff all very friendly, polite. Roof top bar is too romantic and cosy with staff offering free fleece blankets to keep the chill off on a windy eve. On our last night we walked up the street and turned left to discover a fabulous (expensive) celebrity haunt called Pierluigi which was fine dining and you can rub shoulders with the stars here, supermodels and famous celebrities turning up constantly. What a find! We accidentally found it and waited for an hour in the lounge for a table as we told them we were guests at the Indigo and got a table, pricey but worth it just for the experience to see a famous face. One of Rome's little kept secrets... I would definitely reccommend Hotel Indigo if you are a couple and wanting a more intimate cosy stay away from the big 5 star type hotels. I would definitely return again as it was located in a perfect spot a few mins walk from Piazza Navona, Pantheon, Castle Sant Angelo and other historical attractions. I will give this hotel 10/10 as I could not fault int in any way. Thank you all the staff for making our stay very memorable and hope to return very soon. Perfect gem in the heart of Rome tucked away from the hustle and bustle and so quiet... Rory Donnelly & Maria Stockton, Manchester, UK
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just stayed at the Hotel Indigo Rome St George with my son. The hotel is beautifully decorated and the staff were all very friendly and helpful. Its well located for the the tourist spots but tucked down a quiet street. I didnt use all the facilities as there is so much to do and see in Rome but I would definitely recommend this hotel and hope to stay again very soon.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very chic, modern hotel within 1 hour's walk of all the sights. Set on a very quiet street, one block away from the Tiber, this unassuming gem is definitely a good bet for a stay in Rome. Friendly, helpful, and courteous staff, spacious, silent, and clean rooms, modern decor, and comfortable beds complete the deal. There's also a rooftop terrace, perfect for dining al fresco, with a view of the St. Peters dome, very popular with the locals. A varied, and delicious menu, and concise, but complete wine list. The rooftop lounge area is open to guests 24 hrs to have a quiet smoke. VERY appreciated. Highly recommended, and a credit to the IHG group.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 2 nights at this hotel, got upgraded when we checked in (always a plus). Great location, quiet are but near everything you want to see in Rome. Very well maintained hotel, welcoming staff. Had breakfast on the terrace, very good breakfast (diversity, taste, etc.). Lunch was also really really (lobster pasta). The room with the terrace equipped with a small table, two chairs and a long chair were nice. Tiny room though.The rooftop terrace is also a plus. Comfortable seatings, good service. We definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A fantastic hotel in a great position in Rome. Close to everything but situated on a quiet street near the river. The rooms are of a very high standard beautifully presented and the buffet breakfast was very nice. The roof top bar has a lovely view but unfortunately drinks are way overpriced.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My parents and I shared a suite here for a week while visiting Rome for the first time. The hotel was great and definitely helped us make our experience in the summer heat more enjoyable. The AC worked well in our room and throughout the hotel. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. The best part of the hotel was the fact that it is so centrally located to so many sites. We were able to walk everywhere. Despite the fact that it is so centrally located, it is on a very quiet street so we never had issues with street noise. I also got a facial and massage at the spa on my last day, and that was wonderful as well. Oh, I can't forget about the breakfast. Make sure you book with breakfast included. It was served in the back patio, which was lovely in the morning and the spread was great. The service was great as well, keeping us well supplied with coffee during breakfast. I highly recommend staying here next time you're in Rome!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is an IHG property and I'm in their top tier and it was just ok. It was centrally located for those who like to walk... 20 min to the Vatican and 30 to the colosseum. Didn't take the package with breakfast as it was available close by. The room was small even though I got upgraded. The one snag was the AC. Now Rome is hot during the summer and like a giant collective we were all one the one temperature setting - problem was it was hotter in my room than the corridor, that and infrequent room make ups resulted in an average rating, given the over €300/night price tag.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 nights and loved every moment. The location is perfect to walk to most of the sights of Rome. We stayed in the family suite which was decorated really nicely, was large and we had 2 bathrooms which was an extra bonus. The whole family enjoyed using the Turkish Baths at the end of a hot day walking around Rome.The breakfast selection included everything you could think of, and the setting in the court yard was a great way to start the day. It was also great to sit on the rooftop bar at night and enjoy a drink taking in all the sights. All the staff were extremely friendly and helpful meeting all our needs. We will definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is not cheap, but it is worth treating yourself. An easy walk from the Piazza Navona, St Peter's or the Castel Sant'Angelo, the location is amazing. Despite the central location the hotel is in a quiet back street so noise is not a problem at all. In fact, the highlight of the hotel is the amazing tranquility of its rooftop restaurant and bar. From here you can enjoy delicious meals or relax with a drink and watch the sun set across the rooftops of Rome. The service is stellar! I checked in before lunch and my room was not ready, but they asked me to take a seat, put the room cleaning on priority and called me over within less than 15 minutes to give me my key. The room itself was clean, stylish and comfortable. I would definitely return here next time I want to treat myself in Rome.
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really liked this hotel from the start, great rooms, super clean, amazing breakfast, romantic terraces, staff is very helpful and amicable. Also is walking distance from Vatican City and close to so many amazing little restaurants!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don’t often write reviews - good or bad, but this hotel deserves a GREAT review. The staff is amazing, professional and extreamly helpful, the rooms are great - good size, unique and tasteful decore, good size, nice bathrooms stocked with good products, beautiful rooftop bar and restaurant (amazing views), nice breakfast and breakfast setting. I would come back to this hotel any time. Location is also great!!!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best hotels I've ever been to. Fantastic location in the heart of Rome! The castle is about a 10-minute walk to the Vatican 15 minutes. Beautifully decorated rooms, very spacious and comfortable. Amazing place where you can have a nice time, restaurant and bar on the roof, spa, not to mention the garden where we ate breakfast every day. I recommend to everyone! Price is right for quality. Special thank you to the wonderful employees for creating a homely atmosphere!!! I will definitively come back!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Indigo Rome was wonderful! We were upgraded to a suite which we loved and very much appreciated. It was stylishly decorated and had a very comfortable bed, nice sitting room with sofa and desk and bathroom with separate sink and tub/toilet room. This is always convenient for two people to get ready in the mornings. Also, I loved the toiletries!The service was excellent; friendly and efficient. We loved the area the hotel in. It is on an old and quiet street, Giulia, but easy to walk to lots of sites, such as the Vatican and Piazza Navona. And, there are lots of great restaurants nearby.We highly recommend this hotel for the comfort and style of the hotel, location and best of all the service!
hotelName:
6    Hotel Indigo Rome - St. George
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed in this hotel for a week. We were given a room on the other building. The room was small but clean, quite basic. The breakfast selection was good. The location was great, because it is near major tourist attactions. The staff were very friendly. Definitely, we’ll recommend this to our friends.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel should have at least one more star! Location is excellent in a walking distance to all major tourist attractions.In the same street there's an Italian restaurant with great pasta's and pizza's. The stuff in this hotel are kind and helpful. Breakfast is very good.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location for this small local hotel is excellent. The service is also of high quality and the staff very helpful. WiFi is free and strong however breakfast is not free but helpful to have instead of searching all over the city. They will help with transportation as well. Rooms are small and are the bathrooms but that is normal. Pretty good spot to stay for a few nights.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are very helpful, the bed was very comfortable the room is small however perfectly adequate there was a good breakfast with good coffee. We walked to the Vatican, Colosseum Spanish Steps etc so the hotel is central.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Italia was a wonderful place to stay in Rome. There were many many things in walking distance and the staff was very helpful. The rooms were unique and the bed was comfortable. Would stay again.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here two nights and loved it. It was clean and comfortable. I got a single room, which was quite small, but it provided everything I needed. The breakfast was very good. The people at the front desk were friendly and helpful and spoke good English. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives: clean, safe, location to sitesI may be more particular than you but my issues are these; At arrival this was the first of 4 hotels with no staff to check us in, but rather an Italian man who spoke not a word of English who seemed uncomfortable being there alone watching us stand there not knowing what was going on. Had the check in desk had a small sign notifying guests that someone would be back in 10 or 15 min. we'd have felt better. This man only made us feel a bit uneasy as he kept speaking Italian to us. We assumed based on his appearance that he may have been a relative of the owner who was given a job as a kind gesture. What I really was not happy about was when the counter woman who showed up after 15 min. of us waiting gave our key to this 'porter' to show us to our room and take our bags. After shlepping our luggage from the train station by foot, did I really need a porter to 'wheel' our bags down the hall to our room? NO. She should have asked if we'd like him to accompany us to our room. I resented tipping him, which I felt obligated to do. They made this a compulsory service. Funny enough this was the only hotel with our room just down the hall from the service desk.  Walking into our room, I noticed the headboard was a fabric that obviously couldn't be washed, or disinfected with Lysol wipes etc. so I went down the hall, checking for an unlocked linen closet, which thankfully I found. Without the headboard barrier we created from a bed sheet, I'd have slept with my feet hanging off the end of the bed, to avoid contact. Happy with the wood floors.  Breakfast selection was 'okay', but the service at the breakfast was excellent. I was able to walk to this small kitchen and request a whole orange and tomato. I didn't like the way they were presented, so I was thrilled not to have been hassled about my requests.  There was construction one level below our building at 7:30 am but for early risers this wouldn't be a problem. At least they were repairing whatever they were fixing.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my husband stayed here for 3 nights in March. Room was located on the other side of the road and we were shown to room by hotel manager. Although small (you couldn’t swing a cat) it had everything required and we had a very comfortable stay, we didn’t experience any noise or disruptions.Location is brilliant, 5 minute walk to the main terminal for the Leonardo Express for direct train to the airport and within walking distance to all the main attractions or metro if going slightly further afield.Would return and recommend!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were very friendly and helpful during our stay. The breakfast was great in the mornings and they provided some gluten free cakes and biscuits for us. The coffee was really good too. We stayed in the building across the street, it was quiet and we felt safe. The room was very clean too. The hotel is a 15 minute walk to most tourist attractions in Rome. It's about a 50 min walk to the Vatican. We only used a taxi one night to get back to the hotel otherwise we walked everywhere.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to get some sleep; don't stay here. You can hear the conversations in the rooms next door; very loud outside with cars and people. Also, if you enjoy picking up local food and eating it in their lobby, you can't do it here! They asked us to eat outside (in March, which was cold) and no lights on the terrace. Also if you rent a parking spot..it is very tight.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Literally could not fault this hotel, perfect for what you need. Was dubious about booking as seemed so cheap but was pleasantly surprised!!! Such friendly staff i would definitely be recommending to friends and family
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderfully located close to Termini station and other landmarks. Combined with decent pricing and a good breakfast makes this hotel very appealing. The hotel is on the first floor of what seems to be an apartment building, with some rooms in a building across the street, and you have to be buzzed into the building. Our room in particular was across the street and we experienced some road noise at night and in the morning, though it was tolerable. The only thing that keeps me from giving the hotel full marks is that when we asked about the pricing of the laundry service we were told that it varied, that was it. Come to find out later after having our laundry done that they charge per article of clothing. If I had known that I would have saved my 30€ that it cost me for them to do it and take it to a laundromat myself.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff falsely accused and indicted me and my classmates of breaking a locker to a drawer in such a cynical manner that we didn’t even get a chance to explain or argue that didn’t do it. In fact there was no indication of a locker being there in the first place and the staff wouldn’t show any evidence of the issue. They demanded us to pay an absolutely ridiculous fee at a price point of 70 euros, which if you ask me is an absurd and unreasonable for a small locker that was none-existent. As mentioned earlier the staff treated the situation in a very disrespectful and frightening manner that possibly reflects through the rest of their service. In all reverence I can honestly say that I would hope to never experience being falsely accused like this again and hope they can handle likewise situations in a more delicate manner in the future.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel and we have never regretted!excellent location to visit everything in Rome.the breakfast was really good and fantastic!the best of all was that this hotel was really clean touching the perfection!well done!one small complain was the noise to the rooms and i would prefer bigger rooms also but the positives are more than the negatives so i would stay again there without thinking it!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having read the previous reviews I was really looking forward to staying here. Once we arrived just by see the facade of this place I knew it would be wonderful. You have to use the intercom buzzer to get access but all good for security. It has the sweetest old style lift which was a treat. Once we arrived on our floor it was spotlessly clean, very bright and the reception was extremely welcoming. Our room was a bit on the small size but was perfectly adequate for us. We didn't spend much time there anyway with so much to do in Rome. I can't find a fault at all, clean, modern yet traditional, friendly. The big thing here is location, it is extremely central and within walking distance of all the main attractions you would lije to see in Rome. The breakfast is typical European continental but again everything was delicious and plentiful, no sooner was it running low everything was freshly replenished.
