As I'm sure you can tell by now I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to this wonderful city, we booked the weekend for my 40th birthday and to have this place as a base made the whole weekend perfect. Thankyou so much for the memories.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Italia is in a great location, close to the train station and the Metro. We were able to walk to Trevi Fountain, Colosseum, Pantheon and other iconic sites. It sports the  most adorable elevator. Staff was friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideally placed for sightseeing in Rome. Room was clean & comfortable if a little sparse. Staff were all friendly & helpful. So many wonderful cafes serving fabulous pastries & coffee close by that I wouldn't bother with the breakfast at the hotel though.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this hotel in 2014, 2016 and just recently in October 2018. It is located not far from Termini which is key for us (as we travel via train to various destinations). The hotel is located on a quiet side street and there are two convenient places to eat across the street. The staff is the same staff which we have seen since 2014 which tells you something -- no turnover. They are always pleasant and helpful. The rooms are small, but this is an old hotel. The beds are comfortable and the shower is fine. The breakfast is quite nice -- a good selection and constantly replenished. Coffee is good too!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from our trip to Italy and stayed in Hotel Italia in Rome.Room - we were in the annex building directly across the road from the main building, did have a mini fridge which was good. A touch on the small side as had a put up bed in too but was clean and well maintained. Up a few flights of steps so not for everyone unless you have small coins for the lift.Breakfast - a good selection of continental breakfast served in the main hotel. Staff - all very friendly and helpful and could not fault them.Location - quite central for sightseeing but just out of the way of the tourist areas so plenty of traditional trattorias close by. Walkable from the Termini station, to the Colosseum, Trevi fountain etc and close to a few Metro stations.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first trip to Rome started very roughly with the hotel my travel agent booked turning out to be wholly unacceptable. I was able to go online and book a room at Hotel Italia starting the same day for three nights. We made our way over to the property, arriving exhausted and drained from our ordeal. ABDUL at the front desk was incredible. Through a computer glitch, it first appeared that he didn't have a room for us, even though I had just booked it and he showed our reservation. He kindly and graciously kept looking and trying to find us a room and eventually was able to accommodate us. We couldn't even believe it, all the effort he made on our behalf and his ultimate success. He MADE our trip. Beyond that, the location of the hotel is ideal. Not super touristy but right in the heart of everything. Easy walking to every historical site - about a half mile (30 min) walk from the Vatican and even less from the Forum and Colosseum. Truly perfect!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very well located off Via Nazionale and close to the Termini. Major attractions in Rome are within walking distance. We stayed on the other side of the street and found our room to be clean and comfortable during our 3 night stay. The staff was very accommodating and breakfast was good. The one issue we had was no hot water in the shower one morning - not a good way to start the day! Air conditioning was good. I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights here after our 24 day cruise ! We had never been to Rome before but Hotel Italia had everything we needed Abdul at front desk was a beautiful kind intelligent man who gave us many tips on tours etc throughout Rome The room we had was roomy and spotless and ensuite also We couldn’t have asked to be in a better location Cross over Nationalez st and we found a restaurant and bar we ate and drank in most days I would certainly recommend Hotel Italia family owned and friendly and would stay again on my next visit to Rome
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pretty good location, a few blocks away from Fontana do Trevi. Breakfast was ok. The hotel is really quiet and clean. Amazing quality-to-price ratio. Employees were really friendly!Loved the place. I'd definitely go back!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in hotel italia for 3 nights during my time in Rome. The hotel is in an excellent location - 15 minute walk from the Trevi Fountain, 10 minute walk from the coliseum and a 10 minute walk from the termini station. The rooms are fairly small, but has everything you need and very clean. We found it lovely considering we were out for most of the day. The staff are very helpful and the beds are the comfiest beds ever! The breakfast is nice - a choice of pastries and cereals. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a hotel to stay in Rome!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at the Hotel Italia. The staff is very friendly and go out of their way to help. The rooms are modern and comfortable and the morning breakfast service was excellent and a great way to start each day.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable beds! Quiet rooms! Walking distance to everything! Those were my biggest requests when we travel and this hotel met them. It is located in an apartment building on the entire 2nd floor, so you have to ring the buzzer to be let in. Never a problem, just need to know what you are looking for in your arrival. The owner of the restaurant across the street assisted us with no problems. 2 small restaurants right across the street that serves delicious food, so that was convenient. About 10 blocks from everything and we enjoyed the walks every day. It is just off a major street so catching a bus is easy, but it also offers more restaurant and gelato choices (Green Pistachio! Awesome gelato store!!!). Breakfast is pretty much the same thing every day, and it is good. The staff is kind and accommodating. The hallways are carpeted so that keeps the noise down too. For the price, this is a really good hotel. If you're looking for a Marriott or Hyatt - they will cost 3 times the amount so don't go in expecting it.The only downside - tiny showers but thats Europe. My boyfriend is a big guy and it was a bit tight, but it was not a deal breaker.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good location, you may walk to all historical attractions except Vatican. Near to Railway station if you plan to visit other cities. A five-minutes walk to sub-way in Republic square. There are lots of clothing shops in the street beside if you love to shop. And the breakfast was good. Reception kindly help you with your visit to the city.Clean and neat.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel’s staff, especially Eleanore was friendly and helpful while the hotel was centrally situated and delivered on all promises. The breakfast was also more satisfying than the usual continentals.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent our last night in Rome at Hotel Italia. Our room was in the building across the street. It was clean and comfortable (although very small). A bit noisy during the day and evening but calmed down at night. The location is good; walking distance to Termini train station and Cavour metro station, and in the Monti district with lots of restaurants close by. Due the size of the room, probably wouldn't work for an extended stay but perfect for a short stay on a budget.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are on a budget, this hotel is a good and clean choice for you and the staff are great. If you can or are willing to spend a bit more, that may not be a bad choice either. What I liked about this hotel was: - convenient enough location (just off a main street) with easy accessibility to bus transportation and even subway - breakfast was good enough continental breakfast (even though you may run out of seats if you don't go out early and the food keeps running out because its just a small counter), tasty coffee, tasty hot chocolate, friendly staff - very friendly staff at the counter - very clean - near enough supermarket less than 5 minutes away - good restaurants opposite the hotelWhat we didn't like about this hotel was: - very difficult to adjust the temperature in our room (during winter). when we get in after walking around the whole day the room would be toasty hot. the only way to cool it to an acceptable temperature would be to open the windows which would make the room quite noisy or subject to a breeze. it appears the heater also shuts off sometime in the middle of the night. if you prefer an even temperature throughout the room throughout your stay ... this is not the place - you can hear people walking outside and if you are staying near enough to the breakfast area you will hear people talking as well - the beds can be a bit too soft? our backs started to hurt. it could be a combination of the soft beds and uneven room temperature - they advertised free bottled water in our superior room but we never got any. - the queen bed (like in some other hotels) are actually two smaller beds put together - the shower is quite small and if you are not careful you can slip on the shower floor(basically I will barely fit if I sit on the shower floor) - you have to leave key at the counter when you leave - street outside the hotel a quite dirty ... you could literally step on someones poop - even newly renovated rooms of the hotel have "older" electrical plugs ... so it still feels a bit old
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed with Andrea and the staff at Hotel Italia three times. The first in 2008, 2015 and 2018. Our stay was fantastic and we were welcomed as old friends. Rooms every time were clean, the staff as helpful as family and the breakfast delightful. My friends and I would stay here any time we are in Rome. For those who want a small, quaint and very well located hotel this is perfect. I would give it a 5 of 5 stars! Mary
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had high expectations based on th reviews. However, those reviews do not prepare you for what you will encounter. I was not thrilled when I arrived. I was greeted by what seemed like an apartment building, equipped with a buzzer. No one outside to greet you or clear instructions on where to go. I had to even look for the buzzer.When I was buzzed in, I was greeted by stairs and what frighteningly looked like a makeshift elevator. But it wasn't there. When the elevator reached my floor, it was extremely small with 3 doors to open and close before moving. Again, no one to greet me.I reached the first desk and the lady there was refreshing nice, she explained where I was in Rome and handed me a map. She explained that Everytime I leave I have to return the key, and assigned me my room, right away. This was good because it was 9am and I was tired!Pros:Confortable and clean beds and room.Small TVFree breakfastExtra blankets and pillowIce machine in the hallIron on requestClose to everything (except the Vatican)Shopping at your fingertipsCons:Rude night person(an older man)Small roomExtra small bathroomNo washclothsVery little room toiletriesSewage smell in the hallway (awful)!Noisy people stomping over headDark roomIt was ok, but I think when I return, it won't be here. That sewage smell even though only the hall, was too much.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very basic , but clean and comfortable. The staff were always friendly and happy to hear how our day went. We had some good laughs with them. Breakfast was always good and a great way to start the day. The rooms could do with some colour but that would be my only criticism.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights with my husnad and 2 other friends . It was advertised as 2 star but had very good reviews . I was not dissapointed ,great location within walking distance of most sights . The room was small but everything we needed ,tea coffee ,hairdryer, fridge and iron if requested . Lovely hot water and clean white towels daily. The bed was larger than a double and very comfortable . The breakfast was very nice with a selection selection of cereal, pastries ,friuit, cheese ,eggs and meat , The staff were very friendly and there to offer advice 24 hours ,also free wifi
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are basic and have kind of a weird smell to them that we fixed with air freshener and opening the window. It’s a great location because all of the sightseeing spots are very close and there are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. All of the staff were very kind. I didn’t really like how we had to check in and out our room key at the desk when we left the hotel.... We got clean towels daily and the room, too, was cleaned daily. The breakfast offered is quite small and basic but it gets the job done. Their cappuccinos are SO GOOD. I had two every morning. Convenient place where you get what you pay for.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights. Hotel is housed in a historic building and its rooms are in two buildings across from each other. Make sure to ask for your room to be in the newer building; and remember to have coins available for the operation of the elevator in the newer building. Hotel is clean; but it needs a renovation.Hotel staff are very kind and friendly. The daily breakfast is good; but the space for serving breakfast is very limited; therefore make sure to get there before 9:00 am.Hotel is in walking distance to Piazza Repubblica, main train station (Termini) and Imperial Forum and Altare della Patria. You can get to any of these attractions anywhere from 10-30 minutes.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Happy with our stay here, the staff were friendly and our room was always clean. Breakfast was good and saved us a lot of hassle and money. We had the economy double room which was ok for us students on a budget but would recommend spending more if you can. The hotel is about 10 minutes walk from the main train station/bus station and about 15 minutes to all major landmarks. There are supermarkets and restaurants nearby. My only complaint is that the walls are very thin and we were woken a couple of nights, however reception staff were wonderful in helping resolve the issue
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was nice but I admit I don't get the "twin beds" in a room for a married couple. Abdul was very helpful in the reservation process and also in person. Only complaint is light just inside door did not work and it is in front of a mirror, so I used that to apply makeup while my husband was in the shower. I asked about it the first day and it was never fixed (or bulb changed). Otherwise our stay was fine. We walked to all major attractions including the Collosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, etc. Taxi driver from airport had no idea where it was and it took 3 times as long as it should have to get there, but otherwise no complaints.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Front desk is UP one floor making it just a tad hard to find. Great location if you are arriving by train from the airport. It is an easy walk from the Termini station - even with bags. Very nice and professional reception staff. We arrived prior to check in time and they graciously held our bags till the room was ready allowing us to so some sightseeing. Common areas were very clean. We were in the rooms across the street from the front desk area, there is a small lift/elevator that we used only when moving our bags. Our room was clean and had everything we needed. The bed was comfortable and larger than I anticipated. Street noise was minimal for a room in a large city. Breakfast was a nice selection of cereals, breads, pastries etc... in a nice well appointed dining room.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this room because a) it was cheap and b) it was in walking distance of everything we wanted to see in Rome. So it fulfilled our two main needs but I will say the photos are deceiving as the rooms are VERY tiny. We walked from the train station to this hotel and was easy to find. You have to be buzzed into the building to get to the hotel. There was one girl who manned the front desk most days and she was very friendly and pleasant. One day there was only a man at the front desk who we had a negative experience with - the phone in our room wasn't working and we were trying to book a restaurant as it was my birthday. My fiancé went to speak with him for help twice and the man basically shooed him away saying the phone in our room did work and we were wrong. Ok... we walked to the restaurant to reserve it since our phone didn't work and he didn't offer to call for us. The only other thing we didn't like is you have to leave your key at the front desk anytime you leave which is annoying if there's a line at the front desk when you come back and you just want to get into your room. It's a fine stay if you're not too picky and just want somewhere cheap in a good location in Rome.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Has everything you could want. 15-20 minute walk to the Colosseum. 10 minute walk to the subway and 1 block to the buses. Andreas at the desk was helpful showing us on the map places to go see, and eat. Staff is wonderful and breakfast always fresh and bountiful. Has been refurbished and is so clean you could eat off the floor. Great place to stay!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were all very helpful. The breakfast buffet was full of delicious and full of fresh items. Even though the room was small and the bathroom even smaller, it was clean and well maintained. I really liked the location because it was relatively close to the main train station and about 7 blocks from the subway. The restaurant across the street was reasonably priced and convenient.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nothing fancy about this place but they sure do try. Staff is friendly and knowledgeable . Bathrooms are not like what we're used to in the US (roomy) but very clean. Would stay here again if I'm Rome.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is located very centrally, within easy walking distance of many sights. However, the room was really minuscule, probably the second smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in, and that's saying a lot, as we visit Japan every year (famous for its tiny rooms). Not even enough space to open two luggages. The shower unit was so small, it was really elbow to elbow. If you're on the bigger side, the shower won't fit you. The saving grace was the staff, very friendly, very accommodating and nice. The breakfast was also decent, but the staff attitude was what made the stay bearable. I would say this place would be fine for a short stay (one night!). Any longer and you'll get cabin fever.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Hotel Italia very much. The location is great, it is within walking distance to all the main tourist attractions: the Coloseum, the Forum, Fontana di Trevi, Trajans forum, and many other ancient sites. There is excellent cuisine just outside the hotel. You have to go to Pepi Maurilio on Via del Viminale, just around the corner, with John. This is one of the best meals we had while in Italy. The hotel staff was very friendly and very accommodating. They have a great breakfast setup every morning, self serve style. Just one catch, they charge you for it at the time of check out. Also, no parking, unless you find a spot on the street. The room we stayed in was tiny, although cozy. It had AC and was cleaned daily. The bed was a queen size. And the biggest deal for us: we weren't told beforehand NOT to drive in between 6 am and 6 pm into the part of Rome that the hotel is in. It is in a controlled traffic zone (ZTC) and you get a 90€ fine for driving in during those hours. Some hotels will get you a permit or waive the fine, but not this one. In spite of these few setbacks, it was still a good stay.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed my staying. The hotel is located in the center of Rome, I walked to most of the ״must see" sites. Room was small but clean and comfortable. Basic breakfast. Staff are great, friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff here is very helpful/friendly especially Simone! We did struggle to find the hotel itself, there was no sign, just an address and a call button. Once checked in, we made it to our room, a little outdated but nothing to complain about. There was only 2 plugs in the room, and the shower was a little bit small. The breakfast spread is a good variety.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location of the hotel is very good, perfect base for a trip in Rome. Walking distance to Colosseum, Piazza Venizia, train station, bus stops. Room was spacious though shower room was a little congested. Breakfast served in the price was good enough. There are many restaurant options around. Will definitely recommend the one just opposite to the hotel. Hotel staff were very friendly and helped us with any queries and suggestions. We just found only one staff to be a little rude while we were checking out. Overall a very good stay and would recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just come back home from Italy and we had a lovely holiday at this hotel at very good price,efficient service, frendly italian staff,,everything was perfect Roma beautiful city, beautiful places to visit , can't wait to go back again
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful location, nice staff. We loved the breakfast in the morning, definitely the BEST we had in Italy. The rooms were spacious and very clean. We would have loved to have a fridge in our room but I guess you can request that if needed. Elevator makes it more accessible. Make sure to take Via Nazionale from the train station, do not follow google maps, it will just make it more confusing to get there! Definitely equal value for price, good budget-ish hotel in Rome. Note that the internet is not very good, often cut out so do not depend on it here to Skype home, it will not work.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location. We stayed in the Superior Double which was nice and spacious. It was very clean and the reception was very helpful. Breakfast was included which was nice. The only downside was you can hear everything in your room. But I would stay here again. It's a great place, perfect location. The bed was amazing, I wish I could have it
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic Location!! Nice Clean Rooms! Perfect for Rome Vacation. The bed was very comfortable. Huge bathroom with beautiful tiles. The shutters on the window give the room a uniquely roman feel. Overall Great Stay!!!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, cozy rooms, very small sometimes, nice breakfast although not quite varied. Helpful and very friendly staff. Good location, around 7 minutes walking from the Trevi Fountain. Well connected via metro (the Piazza della Reppublica metro station only few minutes away). High price usually but I was lucky booking when on 40% discount rate!
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I loved this place and it's location! The breakfast is also great and so cute! This was located centrally. We walked to pretty much everywhere in the city. Room was great with cleaning service done every day, which we loved. Room always was back to a brand new feel everyday. Great place to stay and excellent pricing.
hotelName:
7    Hotel Italia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one night at Inn Urbe Colosseo and were well-treated. The rooms are comfortable if a trifle austere, and the breakfast pastries were wonderful.The manager was most helpful with dinner reservations as well.One thing to keep in mind--while much of Rome is quite level, the area near Inn is on a hillside, and long flights of steps can be encountered without warning.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this Inn by reading reviews. It is a great place to stay while in Rome! Convenient location! Very accommodating! Helped set up a private tour of the Vatican which was awesome... Breakfast provided in the morning was an added bonus! Would stay again!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first trip to Rome, and we didn't realize until we got there how convenient this lovely little hotel would be! We chose it because of the good reviews, and were so happy to find out what a good choice it was. It was only about a 15 minute walk from the train station (and easy to find once we got a city map), only about half a block from a Metro station. It is a very old building (as is about every building in Rome) but was obviously renovated and modernized inside. I am not even sure how many rooms there were, but I think only about 4? Our room was great - good bed, computer, very nice shower and bathroom, extremely clean. One of the best things was the breakfast room, the cost of the breakfast buffet was included in the room charge, and it had all sorts of pastries, cereals, bread for toast, a Nespresso coffee machine, fruit, juice.....we loved it as most of the places we stayed in Italy did not offer a breakfast. The staff (we only saw two of them) were so nice and helpful, especially Barbara who was happy to help with anything (such as translating some postage forms that I could not understand!) The first night we were there was just took a walk (having no idea where we were going) down the street and after about 10 minutes the Colosseum loomed before us! The sun was setting and made the Colosseum almost glow. So just realizing how close we were to the Colosseum, the Forum, and the Palatine Hill made this hotel choice even better. There are tons of restaurants everywhere in Italy, but Barbara did give us a couple of suggestions which we did follow up on, and they were excellent. When we wanted to go somewhere further away in the city, the Metro was very convenient. I would highly recommend Inn Urbe Colosseo and would definitely go back there again if I am lucky enough to get back to Italy!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I was looking for a room for my wifes suprise 40th, I was after somewhere that was close to the city's attractions, and this place certainly ticked the boxes.Firstly, I wasnt after something that had all the bells and whistles on, literally just a base for somewhere to sleep and shower. So I was suprised to see some extra touches. The b&b kindly organised airport transfers for me. As it was my wifes birthday I thought why not, so that was handy, allthough I believe the shuttle to the town is just outside the airport for 8 odd euro.The room itself comes with a flat screen t.v (which we never turned on) and also a laptop, which is handy if you want to book a last minute excursion. There was a mini bar with soft drinks and beer, all be it small, it was only 1 euro per drink. Wi Fi in the hotel worked fine.Breakfast consisted of a small selection of pastries, breads, fruit, hot/cold drinks, yogurts and meat/cheese. Not a huge amount, but enough to get you started in the day.Room was cleaned daily, so no complaints there. Shower was good, towels were supplied. Responded swiftly to e-mails to arrange transport back to the airport. There is a metro station straight outside the hotel more or less, which is the best way to get about Rome. Also the Colosseum is only 5 mins down the road.All in all, I couldnt fault the room. One thing I would say, was that it could be a little tricky to find, as there isnt a sign as such on the outside, just a small buzzer on the door outside with the name on there. No major issue, but we did struggle the first night to find the b&b again.We will stay here again for our next visit to Rome for sure, good job guys :)
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sandra, greater us on arrival, gave us great local knowledge for eats and excursions. Made our holiday perfect. Great modern a/c room, yummy breakfasts all you need! Will definitely stay again next time in Rome. Thank you!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Customer satisfaction focus of the personnel and hotel itself exceeded my expectations. All specific information were provided in advance in our emails exchange, how to get to hotel from our city arrival spot, how to book/visit sights, etc. Example - when we realised that we need to leave hotel before working hours of reception desk (08.00-17.00), not yet payed for room, I contacted personnel and was asked to leave money in the room. Just like that! Correct and impressing customer focus (receipt rcvd later through e-mail)Location is excellent, 15 min walking from Colosseum, Forums, Piazza de VeneziaRooms are clean, big enough. Free wi-fi, safe and coffee availableBreakfast is quite goodExcellent impression and surely would advise to all who wants to visit Rome
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there for 4 nights and we were quite ok. Location is fantastic! We walk all the city, not necessary to pick the public transport, 5 minutes walking to the coliseo. The brekfast is ok, but i have missed some salt products as tomatoes, eggs, ham or chese.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our second visit to Rome and we returned to the Inn Urbe. The location is great, only a 5 minute walk to the Coluseum, 10 mins to Forum, across the street from the Metro and many restaurants minutes away. This B & B is very clean and very reasonably priced especially given the location. The breakfast includes coffee/cappuccino, cereal, toast, pastries, fruit, yogurt. Sandra the host is very welcoming and helpful. Would defiantly stay here again!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay with great service, breakfast was of good quality. Room was spacious and clean and had good facilities. Very close to major attractions and excellent commuting. Supermarkets close by to purchase food to store in the room fridge.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super location for a stay in Rome. PC, wifi and sky TV in room. Great breakfast. Our host Sandra was really helpful and very welcoming. Great Base for exploring Rome on foot or by metro. Will definately be back
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent B&b ! Superb location, a walking distance from Forum Romano. 100 m from Cavour metro station. Very confortable room and bathroom. Excellent breakfast! Many options for restaurants nearby. We thank our hosts Sandra and Barbara for the excellent time we had in Rome! Auguri!!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walking down from the Inn Urbe, just go around a couple of corners and you are standing at the Colosseum. The location of this place is wonderful. The price is very affordable for something in this locale. You are given a great map and list of restaurants nearby at reception. All of the amenities from a large shower to your own personal computer in your room were amazing. The cold breakfast included in the price was good to get us going, with fresh coffee, juices, fruit, and more. Very clean, neat, and such warm and hospitable people.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Could not have picked a better place to stay in Rome. If you're looking for a high end luxury hotel, then there are plenty, however if you're looking for a modern functional base that is clean, in a great location, offered to you with a smile and at a great value price then this is the place.Walk out the door and down the road 5 minutes and you're looking at the Colosseum. Close to the Cavour Underground station and easily walkable from the main train station.Breakfast is a cold buffet offering and perfect for everything you need to start the day. Despite staying in 4-star hotels during our time in Italy this place had the best coffee.Inn Urbe is located in a residential area and whilst not noisy, a room at the back of the property as we had is a better option.If we ever return to Rome this will be the first place we look to stay.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This bed and breakfast was incredible! It was our favorite of all the places we stayed during our two weeks in Italy! The owner was ver nice and helpful and the room was very comfortable. Also, the breakfast that was provided each morning was very good! I would definitely recommend this to anyone and would stay here again.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my daughter were staying for two nights and were very pleased to have booked this B&B. It is a 15 minutes walk from Termini station, 10 minutes from the Colosseum and even walking to other parts of the centre of Rome was easy. Also a lot of nice restaurants nearby (Monti). A clean room, good breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff. Both Barbara and Sandra helped us with bookings and tips to go to. I definitely would recommend this place to others!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my girlfriend have just returned home following a 5 night stay at the Inn Urbe. We really couldn't fault the hotel. The staff were very welcoming, the rooms were very comfortable and the breakfast and coffee were delicious. We highly recommend this place for anyone visiting Rome!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We couldn't be happier with the location which was 10 minutes walking from termini station and 5 minutes from the colosseum. The room was really nice and the bed was really comfortable. The staff was super friendly and told us everything we needed to know and gave us some great tips.The breakfast was alright although we had hoped from something more. If you're going to visit the city of Rome this is a really good place to stay!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here before a Norwegian cruise last month. I loved the location of this hotel. It is less than a 10 minute walk from the colosseum and less than 5 minutes from the metro. Know that if you have big bags there are a lot of steps up to the street level, from the metro, as well as up to your room. The inn is actually on the "second" floor. The room was clean and very quiet. I had no trouble navigating the area alone on foot, nor did I feel unsafe walking back at night. When I checked out the next day, they were very nice and let me stay in the breakfast area for over an hour while I waited for my transfer pick up. Would stay here again no doubt.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a great hotel! I would highly recommend to anyone looking for a place to stay in Rome.We walked with our luggage from Termini station which only took about 10-15 mins. The manager Massimo was super lovely and showed us all the good places to see and go, he also helped us take our bags up the single flight of stairs.Breakfast was included and had everything you would want. Coffee, tea and pastries are available all day. Rooms were a good size by Rome standard! Nice and modern inside. The use of a room laptop was very handy as was the keyless entry into the building and room, you don't have to bother taking a bulky key around with you.The Colosseum is only a 5-10 minute walk away. We walked to The Trevi fountain and Pantheon and it took about 20 mins.Lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. Wifi was awesome, super fast. I would definitely return to this hotel if I came back to Rome!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First, I would and will stay here again. We selected this B & B because it is located in the Rione Monti area that we know well and love (I have been to Italy 20+ and Rome 15+).. The B&B is a 3 minute walk from metro cavour and a 4 minute walk to about 25 restaurants. The train station is a 20 minute walk or 1 metro stop away as is the Coliseum. I especially like the area because there are easily 40 restaurants within a 15-20 minute radius and after being busy all day I like to be able to walk to and from dinner. Next, cleanliness. Super clean and I especially like that the duvet is in a cover that is washed between clients so one is not sitting on a bedspread that someone else has used. All units are non smoking. Floors are wood and they provide slippers for guests. Room size: The room is huge for Rome standards, and we found it to be a very comfortable size . We had a twin bedded room and each bed was larger than the usual; not quite a double but bigger than a U.S. twin. The shower in the bathroom was at least 4' in length.Convenience: KEYLESS entry to building, b&B and room. You use a pin code. Having stayed at other b&b's where I have had to carry heavy keys and jiggle the keys to open some doors, the keyless entry is a bonus. Very nice room darkening window drapes. There is free wifi and also a ipad in the room. Also, we found the mini bar in the room especially convenient because although there are charges for water or juice, they are very reasonable. Water was 50 cents; I think juice was 1 euro. I think this is a lovely courtesy that they offer their clients. Breakfast: Excellent quality and variety; yogurts, toast, cured meats, cheese, cereals, fresh fruit, pastries, jams, etc. Laura who was there during our stay is a delight. She is kind and sincerely helpful. She suggested we visit a nearby church that has a statue of Moses sculpted by Michaelangelo. I have no negatives; however point of information: there is no elevator so you do have to climb some steps but Laura helps with luggage, and I am 65 and had no problems with the steps.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel only has 4 rooms, with a small but adequate breakfast room. Continental breakfast was lovely with yummy pastries. Nespresso machine available for use 24/7. Room had it's own net book and sky TV. Room was overlooking main road so back rooms may be slightly quieter but excellent double glazed windows. Domenico was very helpful helping us with restaurant reservations. All staff very friendly and helpful-could use computer to print tickets FOC. Room was cleaned each day. Hotel is located on a single floor within a residential apartment but no other noise-very quiet. Close to Cavour metro stop. Downhill walk to colosseum.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and approachable, Domenico was a wonderful host. The B&B is very nicely decorated with modern furnishing and has a nice small shared dining area for breakfast. The room was well equipped and maintained with the basic necessities. There were even additional facilities such as sky TV, a laptop and a safe.The neighbourhood is also relatively safe with a police station in the vicinity. The main door and room doors were locked using electronic number locks so you don't have the fear of losing any keys for the room as well.As we rented the room near Rome Day (21 April), Domenico was also very kind and printed out the events that were happening during that period.Overall, the stay was pleasant and is definitely recommended for its simplicity, cleanliness, practicality and convenient location!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here at the beginning of March 2014. ROOM: anyone who knows Rome a bit knows that hotel rooms are notoriously small and expensive. Here we booked accommodation for three and got a relatively big room at a decent price. It does not come with extras like bathrobes and slippers, but it has a lovely modern design, the beds are good, the bathroom is nice and the place is well kept. CHILDREN: We traveled with a nine year-old. As third bed we got a roll-away bed that was placed at the foot of our king-sze bed. As far as we know, it was comfortable and there still was enough space in the room. BREAKFAST: simple continental breakfast with very tasty pastries. LOCATION: close to the Colosseum, but the street is on a hill, which is good to know if you plan to do everything on foot. The metro is near and there are busses in the area.RECOMENDED: absolutely. We enjoyed our stay.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this bed & breakfast here at tripadvisor and besides the great reviews, they were able to surprise us even more with their personal skills and customer service! We stayed for 5 nights and Sandra was on duty at our arrival to show us around the room, details for breakfast and tips around the city. I (Eliana) mentioned about the lemon trees around the city and how much we loved lemon... To my surprise, the next morning there was a lemon cake as one of the items for breakfast! We've stayed in many luxury hotels around the world and we know what means to go the extra mile specially that we always worked in hotels... and the little details this small, cute and modern hotel did during our stay surprisingly put them in the same level of service as many 5 stars we know. Massimo and Sandra were always trying to help and even asking if we needed anything extra at all. The hotel is modern, clean, the bed is great, breakfast is a plus and Sandra and Massimo were the key to make our stay perfect! GREAT location close to the metro and walking distance to attractions specially to the colosseum!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent a lot of time trying to find a place in Rome that is suitable for us and this B&B met all our expectations. It` s very close to the center, in walking distance to the Colosseum and the metro station is some steps away. The street itself even though is in the heart of the city is very quiet so you don` t have problem with seeping. There are only four rooms in the B&B so you feel kinda comfortable like at home, no way like in a busy big hotel. The breakfast was enough to start the day and the best thing was that you could make a tasty Nespresso also during the day when you came back from your wanderings to cool down. The room was tidy, the bed was comfy and the small laptop provided by the B&B was big plus. Recommendation for anyone who wants decent accommodation in the center without fuss.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My fiance and I stayed here in December 2013 for a few nights. A perfect location near the Colosseum and a metro station, this was an excellent base for our sightseeing. Massimo was an excellent host. Very helpful and friendly, he recommended an excellent restaurant nearby. A strong recommendation for anyone who wants to stay in a nice place in Rome!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We couldn't have been more happy with Inn Urbe Colosseo. Walking distance to main attractions. Modern, clean with a wonderful host Sandra who made us excellent cappoccinos! Would definitely stay there again!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: excellent location: close to the Colosseum, Roman Forum, 1/2 block to Metro; great room, very good breakfast; friendly, helpful staff (Massimo was great); fair price; very quiet, no complaintsKent M.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is a short walk from the metro station, making it very easy to get around Rome. Our room was very clean, and had a very comfortable queen bed. Wifi connection was strong the whole stay. The provided breakfast included tea and coffee, cereal, toasts and spreads. Each room in the apartment is individually lockable, and you hear very little of other occupants during your stay. It is situated on the first floor without a lift.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights here in late May 2014. It was a very nice room that looked and felt a bit upscale and very modern. The room was completely quiet and had great sleep.We were pleasantly surprised to learn the air conditioning was on. We had read and been told at other places that the government restricted use of AC before June 1. The location was very convenient to the Metro and walking distance (15 minutes or so) to the Colosseum and other sites. We didn't though have much luck finding decent places to eat nearby. Breakfast was great with a large assortment of pastries plus yogurt, cheese, bread and a fantastic coffee-making machine that made great cappuccinos. The staff was very friendly and helpful with making arrangements for ground transport to the airport.It had free wi-fi and provided an in-room laptop.Highly recommended!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean room, And a very personal touch. The breakfast was sumptuous and staff pretty helpful (considering the fact we were travelling with a very picky toddler). Massimo, our host, was full of tips and places to visit (for day and for night). The bathroom SAS very nice, esp the rain shower. And it is located very close to colosseo, and other attractions in city centre.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was excellent and most helpful...which is sometimes hard to find in Rome! Sandra helped me enjoy a 3rd anniversary by supplying a bottle a champagne and some very tasty treats for our stay...so awesome! She was also very accommodating and willing to help. The B&B is perfectly located within a 10 minute walk of the Collosuem...piazza Venezia...old Rome and other great spots, also right next to the metro. I will stay here every time in Roma. Grazie Mille Sandra!!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 4 nights. A modern room with adequate space (very good for Italy). Within a 5 to 10 minute walk from the Cavour Metro Station which made it easy on arrival and departure. Being that close to a Metro Station meant that most tourist attractions were easy to get to. The breakfast was excellent. The maps, directions, and (most importantly) the restaurant recommendations were very helpful.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Rome for two nights as part of our honeymoon in various parts of Italy, and we absolutely loved Inn Urbe. It's modern, clean and comfortable (winning the 'comfiest bed' award of the places we stayed), and just a few minutes walk away from some of the major tourist spots and some good restaurants. The staff are fantastic too, Massimo was a great host and was really helpful - nothing was too much trouble! If we were to come back to Rome we wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Inn Urbe for four nights in mid-May 2014 and were very pleased with the accommodations. The room and bathroom were spotless, towels were plentiful, shower was good. The inn has a lovely breakfast room, where a very nice breakfast (meat, cheese, bread, pastries, fruit) is set up each morning form 8 to 10 am. We loved the self-serve espresso machine (early rising guests are welcome to make a cup of espresso before the start of the official breakfast time).Perhaps most important, our room was very quiet! We slept soundly every night. Masimo and the other staff members are lovely and helpful. They always made sure we had what we needed at breakfast and were very helpful in directing us to a bus route that would take us to Campo di Fiori. The inn is within walking distance of the Colosseum, the Roman Forum, and a few notable churches (such as San Pietro in Vincoli). It is also within easy walking distance of the Cavour underground station. We had a great lunch at Cavour 313, which is also just a short walk from the inn. There is a grocery store nearby, too.We would definitely recommend this inn.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotels in Rome seem expensive Inn Urbe was certainly value for money. It has only 4 rooms and is in a great location, 10 minutes walk from the train station with bags or close to the metro. It is modern, clean, and very quiet. It is situated on the first floor but they kindly carried our bags up for us. The common area has hot water and tea and coffee available all day and the breakfast catered for all tastes. The Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Pantheon, Basilicas etc are all easy walking distance away. We were recommended a great restaurant for diner and on the day we left they kept our bags for us as our train was late afternoon. We were only sorry we couldn't have stayed longer.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I celebrated our 25th anniversary in Italy, and we were so thankful to have this be our first B&B to start our adventure. The folks were friendly, accommodating, and cordial. We loved the fact that after exploring the very visual and sound frenetic city, we returned to our quiet and somewhat stark-walled yet pretty contemporary room. The bed and bath were very comfortable. It was really a welcomed relief for our senses to be able to energize ourselves in this room for the next day's wanderings around the city. The B&B is well situated within walking distance of the ruins, train station, Colosseum, and numerous restaurants. We would love to return someday.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Discovering this über modern clean and friendly boutique hotel just steps from the Colosseo was the highlight of our time in Rome! Love the idea that technology has replaced room and hotel keys... And the breakfast and snacks in the common area are delicious ! Can wait to go back and try the other location near the Vatican!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed as a solo traveler for 4 nights at this apartment / b&b and was so pleasantly surprised by the interior of this place. Cleanliness and style were a 10! The decor was sleek and clean and the rooms were detail oriented with everything built for the comfort of the guest. The breakfast was a typical morning Italian spread. With espresso ( or cappuccino) fruit, cold cuts , cheeses, and delicious pastries. Just what you need to start you day off conquering Rome by foot! The location is so perfect that you can walk to all of the main sights within 10-15 minutes or less. The metro and Termini train station are both within walking distance.Lastly, I must comment that Massimo was wonderful! His eagerness to help with everything really made me feel well taken care of. Almost as if I had my own Italian friend living in the city that already knew the ropes .He printed off Tickets for me and gave great advice about shuttle buses to the airport and my train to Florence. Big help and thanks again Massimo.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ideal location. Modern, clean and spacious room. Wifi and laptop at free disposal for clients . Lovely breakfast with all you need to start the day. Coffee and fruit available all day - really appreciateCavour metro station is 2 mins walk and Colosseo + Roman Forum at 10 mins.This hotel made our stay in Rome just perfect.Thank you Domenico :)I hope we will be back soon!
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for a weekend in this brilliant b&b. I have nothing to complain about, everything was spot on. Nice clean rooms, quiet location, nice personnel, good breakfast, internet, english tv channels, etc. It might be wise to note the b&b phone number if you are arriving earlier than planned. Location is close to the metro station and walking distance to Colosseum and Forum Romano ... very convenient.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've been to Rome several times, and never before have we enjoyed such a nice big clean and quiet room for such a reasonable price. We had only one night in Rome and needed a place to stay that was pretty close to the train station and the sights. Inn Urbe was exactly the right place and for a good price too. For us it was an easy walk from the station, and convenient enough that we could make the most of one afternoon, evening and the following morning in Rome. We were able to leave our bags by the front desk while we did some sightseeing before catching a 2:30 train.We would definitely recommend Inn Urbe to other visitors to Rome.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights and couldn't find fault. Clean,quiet and easy access both to the main attractions by foot or by the metro across the street. Breakfast was excellent and all enquiries both beforehand by email and during our stay we're dealt with efficiently.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a weekend trip to Rome and we stayed here for three nights. Sandra very kindly stayed on till 9pm to greet us as we were delayed by 4 hours. Lovely clean and modern facilities. Fantastic breakfast and very 'posh' taxis provided for transfers both ways. Good location at the Colosseum end of Rome.Very quiet rear room. Electronic locks both on main entrance and your bedroom so no bother with keys. First time i've ever stayed in a B&B with it's own notebook pc for free use in your room!Mini fridge also in room and free tea & coffee in breakfast area if you needed it.Perfect place to stay.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and clean place, easy to find. We unexpectedly arrived early and left our luggage while the manager arranged to have our rooms quickly cleaned. We also were able to arrange to put a few things into the refrigerator for breakfast since we had a very early departure. Rooms are very spacious, contemporary, and have a mini frig and free internet access. Baths were very nice (with rain shower). Very clean.We stayed in the Inn nearer the Colosseum.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at the quaint, modern, and extremely clean Inn Urbe at the beginning of September. As a small B&B, the service was exceptional and there was a great attention to detail. From help with our luggage up the arduous staircase, to daily recommendations for restaurants and sites, as well as thoughtful amenities in our room (laptop, minibar, slippers), our needs were certainly met. We appreciated the fact that the hotel was on a safe, quiet street and that the AC in our room worked perfectly - especially when it was 35 degrees Celsius everyday. It was excellent value for an accommodation. Pros: - location that was safe and easy to find from the Metro station- clean and very modern, looked exactly as it does on the website- personable and friendly owners/staff that greeted us daily, made us coffee and provided helpful tips for sites (map) and yummy (non-touristy) restaurants- free wifi that generally worked okay- keyless entry into the building and individual rooms- delicious, plentiful breakfast (assorted pastries, meats, cheeses, fruit, cereals, juices, espresso maker) as well as coffee station available all day- well-stocked minibar - water was free- small B&B ( only 4 rooms ) that was very quiet- AC that worked great- very comfortable beds- held our bags for a few hours after checkoutCons: - patchy wifi service- the shower leaked all over the floor- breakfast was only served until 10am, would have been nice to have it extended an hour
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really, really enjoyed our stay at Inn Urbe. Inn Urbe amply met my main requirement of having updated, modern, comfortable décor - it was a place we wanted to come back to after a long day of sight seeing. The cozy room enabled us to wind down on the last night of our trip, spending a few comfortable hours lounging in the room watching Sky TV's English channels and surfing the (free) WiFi. Truly, this B&B's main focus is the comfort of guests: reasonable prices in the mini bar (i.e. water was 50 cents - they are not trying to gouge prices), tablet computer in every room, free pastries coffee/tea machine in the common area, the aforementioned English TV channels and free WiFi. The proprietresses were incredibly nice, leaving us a breakfast in the mini-bar fridge since we had to depart for our flight earlier than the front desk/breakfast opened.Something to be mindful of: this is not a traditional hotel, but a B&B-type place, a feature of which is that the front desk is manned only from 8-5. So if you are arriving or departing before or after these times you will have to make specific arrangements. Also, the inn is not staffed at night, so there can be no calls to the front desk at 1am for room service. Some people might miss 24 hour service; we didn't.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent B & B, close to underground station Cavour. If you enjoy walking though, Inn Urbe is about a 10-15 minute walk to the Colosseum and Roma Termini. Clean, comfortable, and spacious room. The pics posted by management and other travellers were accurate representations of the premises during our stay...yay! Breakfast was continental which included yogurt, fruit, cereal, pastries, and bread. Drinks included coffee and juice. Had access to espresso coffee machine all day.Our flight arrived in the morning, before check in time and we were able to stow our luggage at the premises until our room was ready.Massimo was very welcoming, helpful and friendly. We expected to haul our luggage up the flight of stairs but he helped us carry them up. The staff made our stay so much more enjoyable.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are very clean, spacious and comfortable with free wifi and a netbook that is on a long bench that you can comfortably sit at. The AC is good and the windows block out any street noise, if any. The breakfast room is well set up with coffee and pastry available anytime during the day at no cost. There is one flight of stairs and they will help you with your bags if you need. Marialucia who operates the B&B is extremely pleasant and helpful and goes out of her way to assist. We needed to call a doctor and she quickly found what options were available and within an hour the doctor arrived. The continental breakfast buffet is excellent. The location is one street back from the busy via cavour and is in a quiet nice area. It is close to the cavour metro station, 15 minutes walk to Termini station and 5 minutes walk to the Coleseum.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything from my stay here was great. The ladies from the front desk were very nice and helpful, they even offered to arrange my transport to the airport the next day. The place was clean and spacious. The common areas are nice and comfortable, with many facilities. The only down side to it is, that it has no elevator, but as it is situated on the first floor, it is not an issue, besides, they help you get your bags up.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came across this hotellast minute through tripadvisor reviews and probably the best place in our entire Europe Trip. Close to termini and colloseum. Being recently started, rooms are spacious and nothing less than 5 start hotels. Spotlessly clean and calm. Reception ppl were also very helpful. Great bfast. Though we stayed here only for a night, we would hav def loved to stay more. The only negative which i can think of the that even though its close to the Termini, the website needs to give more detailed direction. we took almost half n hr-40 mins on foot to find the place. However, all was made up for on reaching. Close to other attractions and worth spending evry penny
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at Inn Urbe on our first stop of our honeymoon European trip. The location of this B &B was perfectly located, just a 5 minute walk from the Colosseum. Marialucia was a wonderful host, making us feel right at home. She even went out her way to help us with tracking down our lost luggage from the airport and understanding train/metro schedules. The room was very clean, spacious, and updated. The breakfast selection was nice with a fresh selection of pastries, meats and cheeses, and cereals. There was even an espresso machine that we had access to all day. The accommodations were very good and we would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little hotel was the accommodation highlight of our trip to Italy. Beautiful room, chic, cool and immaculately clean. Great free breakfast and tea and coffee available throughout the day. The staff were truly lovely going out of their way to help us out and super friendly. Location is a little out of the craziness, which is nice but only a short walk to the Coliseum.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this place after reading the great reviews here and they were justified.The place is perfect in a fabulous location for walking to all the great places to visit in Roma.Massimo and his staff are great and very helpful.The email they sent us to book entry tickets for the Vatican and Colosseum saved us hours of queueing.Breakfast is simple and plentyful. With tea and coffee to hand all day and night.The place is clean , tidy and very comfortable.Lots of great little touches that make all the difference like a notebook and free wifi.
hotelName:
8    Inn Urbe Colosseo
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Villa Matissa was phenomenal. It had everything we needed, the location was fabulous. Close walking distance to sites and even closer to a lively neighborhood with amazing restaurants. Silvio was truly wonderful and obviously pours his heart into his property. I would stay again in a heartbeat. The weather was rainy so we didn’t spend too much time in the garden, but next time!
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am delighted to write this positive review. Villa Matissa was our first stop after long flights from New Zealand and we are so pleased we picked it. It’s a real family run oasis away from the mayhem of Centro but easy to walk there or catch the super convenient trams and buses.The Villa is spotlessly clean with immaculate gardens we loved spending down time in. The host Silvio and his wife are wonderfully attentive and extremely helpfulSo close to all Trastevere’s attractions. Here’s a little secret. Trattoria da Paolo next to St Francis of Assisi church, (with its beautiful Bernini). Try it ! Divine food, very cheap and. Highly entertaining.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is just wonderful. Sergio arranged car transportation from the airport making it so easy for us when we arrived, definitely worth the 50 Euros. He gives you a tour when you arrive and then shows you to your beautiful room with a great bathroom and plenty of space (and an extremely comfortable bed). We had breakfast of yogurt, pastry fresh from the bakery, cappuccino and hot tea. We sat and ate in the beautiful garden surrounding the property. I will definitely stay here again when I visit Rome.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has been one of the nicest places I’ve stayed in a long time! We stayed in one of the apartments, which was spacious, clean, had a terrific bathroom, comfortable bed and a nice little kitchen. Silvio was very responsive both before we arrived and while we were there, even meeting our taxi at the gate with an umbrella. I’m writing this review in his beautiful garden, which has to rival Eden! As others have said, it is a true oasis, close to the tram and busses for easy access to everything you would want, but far away enough from the craziness of central Rome.I’m sure there are many wonderful places to stay in Rome, but if I return, I would want to return to Villa Matissa!
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Villa Matissa is by far my favorite place to stay when in Rome. I travel throughout italy twice a year and each time I make sure that I end my journeys in Rome so that I can stay at the Villa Matissa. The rooms are clean, the staff is great and the setting is perfect. Villa Matissa is located in Trastevere a quaint quiet neighborhood in Rome. It is perfectly situated. Close to the main attractions by foot, tram or taxi. It is also located down the block from a great park where I spend my mornings and early evenings walking around with the locals. Silvio and Monica are great hosts and always available and willing to help out. I most definitely recommend Villa Matissa !
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay at Villa Matissa, this time on a solo business trip, following a stay with my wife last year on vacation. The location is appealing as it is walking distance from all that Trastevere has to offer but with none of the noise when you finally want to sleep. Beds are comfortable, bath amenities very good, breakfast garden lovely. Host SIlvio is a gem.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful guest house, spotlessly clean. Peaceful, tranquil retreat after exploring the sites of Rome. Host Silvio is very friendly and welcoming and very helpful and knowledgeable and helped us with recommendations for restaurants and travel etc. Excellent location, 20-25minutes walk to the centre of Rome. Close to trans, buses and Trastevere train station. The neighbourhood of Trastevere has some lovely restaurants with reasonable prices. Being out of the main touristy centre of Rome means you can enjoy a more authentic experience for dinner/evenings out. Beautiful, well-maintained garden which made a lovely setting for breakfast. Lovely breakfast - pastries, toast, fruit, yoghurt etc. Room spacious and clean. All staff very friendly. Communal fridge and small kitchenette area which is a nice touch. Would highly recommend staying here and would definitely return.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1st tip, avail yourself of the limo the hotel provides from the airport for €50, it saves you tons of hassle, last year it took me 6 hours to get from the airport to Trastavere, dragging my case. Arrive to be met by the owner waiting at the electronic security gates. 1st class welcome and complete briefing of area, attractions, taxi bookings and maps, including places to eat. Leave an hour min for breakfast, once you eat in the gardens you wont want to leave (if they haven't won prizes, Rome is unjust). Rooms large, clean and very nice. All amenities and staff spot on. I will be going back and I travel a lot, so not easily impressed. A little gem you wont regret.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROS: - The owners: attentive, accessible and helpful. Available immediately on Whatsapp to answer any questions. Waiting for us when we arrived. - Clean/immaculate - Beautiful garden, nice patio (so nice to have in Rome) - Large rooms with high ceilings and windows. The bed was great. Sometimes a challenge to find in Italy - Great wifi - Great A/C - Extra little amenities - shared little kitchenette to store food/snack - Lovely Italian character - Close enough to everything in Rome if you want to walk (~30min to Piazza Navona for a fit walker), or an easy bus/tram ride. Bus and tram are 2min from the villa - Far enough away to take a nice break from the chaos - Great restaurants nearby - Value: the price is great for what you get - Safe - Tasty little breakfast with toast/pastry/cereal/yogurt/fruit/cappuccino. Silvio accommodated for my partner who is celiac. Do not expect bacon and eggs.CONS: - We had to leave - I have run out of time to write more positive commentsWe stayed four nights at Villa Matissa. We felt like we were coming home at night. Quiet, beautiful and comfortable.I really enjoyed our experience, if that has not been made clear. Thank you Silvio and team. Hopefully we will see you again on our next trip to Rome.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with my two very boisterous 4 and 7 year old grandsons. The owners were very tolerant of them and helpful. The hotel is back from the road in a pleasant couryard, so fairly quiet. bedroom and bathroom very clean. What was especially important for me was you could make your own cup of tea in a little communal kitchen area. Wonderful if you wake up before others. So I highly recommend this place if visiting Rome..
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Villa Matissa, its beautiful Garden, Silvio and his team are unbelievable charming. We had a wonderful time and did not miss a thing. Villa Matissa is the perfect Location to explore rome, most of the sights are reachable by foot. We also really loved characterful Trastevere with its narrow cobbled streets and the great variety of restaurants. At Villa Matissa we truly enjoyed room, Garden and breakfast and would certainly stay again.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Villa Matissa is a truly charming place, in a calm location just 5 minute walk from the lively vibe of Trastevere. Our room was very spacious, clean and comfortable, with a view of the beautiful garden which belongs to the villa. There you can enjoy your breakfast surrounded by flowers and trees, a truly magic experience. Silvio and his wife are very friendly and helpful hosts. We can only recommend this place to anyone who wants to stay away from the crowds and have a more authentic experience of Rome.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second trip to Rome. We have picked Trastevere as it is an ideal place for the traveller to be. Here you can walk by old narrow streets and enjoy tasty local cuisine. Villa is located in a silent area and at the same time is few minutes away from restaurants. It's very cosy and has an amazing background garden. It is very clean and host Silvio is very helpful. And we miss Nerone, the best cat in Rome)
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, spacious and clean rooms, extremely friendly and helpful staff and beautiful garden with fountains and fish pond. We were in Rome on a short family holiday and we had a great stay at Villa Matissa.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Silvio is a wonderful host. British Airways was late and so we missed our connection from LHR to FCO, which caused a two hour delay for our (much later) arrival.Silvio was very responsive in re-arranging our pickup at the airport, and greeting us well past normal check-in.He took time to get us familiar with with the Villa, and with how to get around Rome. It was easy to see all the sites in Rome from the Villa. Having said that, we were very happy to explore Trastevere as well. We found ourselves very happy with the quaint shops, and streets packed with wonderful restaurant choices in Trastevere.We started each morning with a wonderful breakfast and coffee at the hotel, then full days of sightseeing (with taxi arrangements by Silvio - if needed- to ensure being able to meet our 8am Vatican tour), and then back to the comfort of Trastevere and Villa Matissa. If you are new to Rome, I highly recommend the Villa.Thanks Silvio for a wonderful time. [Should you want an E Ticket adventure, full of wonderful views and sites, buy a 1.50 euro ticket at the tobacco shop by the camera store, then get on the 115 bus. It will loop you back to the hotel. All I can say is .. jump on, quickly find a seat or something to hold onto firmly, and be ready for the ride of your life. Hair pin turns at 50 mph, and beautiful scenic stops (hop on hop off - without the hassle)]
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights at this fabulous villa. The experience from start to finish was excellent. The villa itself is very clean and freshly decorated, the rooms were spotless but retain their old world character. Security is good and the rooms were very quiet. The breakfast was very tasty and the dining room leads out to a lovely well maintained garden. The owner was very helpful and took the time to draw on a map the sites and the transport links to take us to them. He also had keys that we had left in our room couriered home to us. All in all highly recommended.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was our first time staying in a small guest house or B&B and we found owner Silvio very welcoming even when we had the misfortune to be delayed by by the storms raging throughout Italy and arrived hours late thus missing a full day at this lovely hotel.Our room was very large and airy, spotlessly clean and offered very comfortable amenities for our 2 nights here.Breakfast was lovely, good quality offerings and we had the pleasure to enjoy in the fabulous gardens which really are the feature if the Villa. The neighborhood of Trastevere offers a short walk to numerous choices for meals and shops and even a market or two. We were there Halloween night and felt perfectly comfortable strolling after dark along with the families out for trick or treat. There is a great vibe this area and the chance to spend nights at Villa Matissa was enjoyed.We will definitely return!
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small place away from the crowds but still in walking distance to a lot of restaurants and sights. Trastevere is a nice area. The owners and their staff are very friendly and I would love to stay there again. Rooms are perfect in size and facililties. I can really recommend this place for your stay in Rome.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved everything about it starting of course with our hosts Silvio and Monica. They could not have been more friendly and accommodating. Everything about the location is amazing. Great rooms, great location and that garden courtyard is a little slice of heaven! Thank you Silvio and Monica. We hope to see you again!
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I had a wonderful stay at Villa Matissa just this weekend. Breakfast in the beautiful garden was a great way to start busy days in Rome. The room was modern,spacious and clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly.I am going to recommend Villa Matissa for my friends and family if they are going to Rome in the future.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Place! I cannot say enough good things about this gem. The garden, the host, the room was first class. Unfortunately, we were only able to stay here for one night. I would love to return some day. This B&B had everything you could ask for when it comes to comfort and a great location.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly located, bed and breakfast are wonderfull. Rooms and bathroom are very clean and quiet, with possible climate air. Bus stop and tram are very close. Owners are very nice and helpfull. I will come back with great pleasure !
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Sitting in the enchanting garden. Enjoying caffè. Sleeping safe and sound. Big rooms. Sitting on the entrance steps looking at the beautiful surroundings. Walking in 5 minutes to Trastevere with all its restaurants and bars.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breakfasts were simply and delicious to kick the day off. Silvio was very cheerful and helpful with directions to the sites. Nothing was a problem.The room we had on the ground floor was traditional with a high ceilings and light and airy. We enjoyed the continental breakfast was outside in the beautiful back garden every morning before setting off for sightseeing and walking to the city. Being outside of the main city centre you felt part of the local community. There are also plenty of good restaurants to stop off on the way back from sightseeing. A thoroughly enjoyable stay and good location.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cannot recommend highly enough this charming guest house. Spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated with a fantastic garden in which to have a lovely calm breakfast before venturing out into the hustle and bustle of Rome.
