Great transport links into the centre and in easy strolling distance to the vibrant cafe/bar scene of Trastevere. Silvio and his team were the epitome of friendly, helpful professionalism. Had a wonderful stay and wouldn’t hesitate to recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely rooms very clean, comfortable and spacious, beautiful gardens to eat breakfast. We were made very welcome by all the staff and Silvo was very helpful the perfect host, gave us a map with several must see places highlighted to visit and always happy to help. Trastevere is the perfect area to stay a short walk to the centre of Rome, a perfect area with some lovely resturants and bars. Will be recommending Villa Matissa to our family and friends and hope to go back soon.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I absolutely love Villa Matissa - I return there every year when I am in Roma. Silvio and his wife are the nicest people. The B and B is always clean. The rooms are spacious by Italy standards. They are always very helpful and accommodating. I highly recommend Villa Matissa.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a beautiful guest house in Trastevere. Close to attractions yet not in the middle of it all. A short walk to the village gives you many restaurants and bars to choose from. Very friendly and helpful staff. Beautifully manicured gardens and clean, comfortable rooms. Excellent choice for a visit to Rome.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Villa Matissa met all my expectations.The guesthouse is secluded and amongst some of the most beautiful gardens I've seen. The host, Silvio, has seen to all comforts you can enjoy. He is friendly and very welcoming. He makes you feel at home.Katia sees to it that your room is clean and comfortable and has a wonderful way of making you feel welcome.The room was spacious and clean, with all the amenities of home. Windows open to a beautiful view of the courtyard.You eill love this place!
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing location, walking distance to the heart of Trastevere and the Tiber River, with great restaurants & shops nearby. Silvio is a very gracious host and he serves a perfect continental breakfast in the lovely garden. I enjoyed my stay immensely and hope to return soon!
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just a couple of minutes walk to restaurants and bars, the Villa is set back from the main street, where there's a bus stop (which we didn't use, as we walked everywhere). A lovely old house, beautifully renovated and a gorgeous garden. The rooms and bathrooms are large and very clean. We enjoyed the very good selection at breakfast and all in all had absolutely no complaints. Villa Matissa can certainly be recommended.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow! Just wow! Villa Matissa was definitely part of the magic we experienced in Rome. Located in a great area of the city near plazas, markets, and historical sites, this guesthouse is a family-friendly accommodation that features an amazing outdoor garden, common kitchen on each floor, self-serve fridge, and child-friendly amenities such as baby playpens and wheelchair elevator on main entrance. Sylvio and company are the loveliest, most charming hosts ever. We were treated like family, our 3 year old daughter even got a gift on Christmas morning! Rome is a beautiful city to visit, and Villa Matissa is a shining example of the warmth and hospitality of it's people. Definitely staying here again on a future visit to Rome!
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a wonderful trip to Italy. We stayed at Villa Matissa for 3 amazing nights. The hotel was impeccable. So clean and beautiful and our host Silvio was so very gracious. The Trastevere area was a fantastic choice with tons of restaurants, shops and things to do. The Villa was an east walk across the river to the many sights of Rome. We loved being so very close to everything yet being in our own little oasis. Such a wonderul hotel that I highly recommend to anyone visiting this special city. We enjoyed breakfast every morning in the lovely beautiful courtyard garden. Rooms were large and very nice bathroom....it felt more like a luxury hotel then a B & B. Such an enjoyable stay....Thank you Silvio!
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Villa Matissa is quiet, clean and beautiful. We were tossing up whether to stay in the centre of Rome or just out of the action and this Villa just out of the centre was totally the right choice. The city was easy to reach by tram, just a couple or three stops. There were great squares just within walking distance offering excellent bars and restaurants. The first day we walked along to the Vatican (less than 30 mins) along the river which is close to the accommodation. Our room was located on the ground floor, and two large windows looked onto the beautiful Villa gardens. There was absolutely no noise, the bed was comfortable, great bathroom and the room was really spacious, light and airy. Everything was scrupulously clean and the whole place smelled fresh. Our Host Silvio was relaxed and friendly and each morning he was in the Villa dining room offering us a perfectly adequate continental breakfast and coffee which we could have in the delightful garden in good weather. I've stayed in Rome previously and this time my trip was so much more enjoyable because of our wonderful accommodation, great host and excellent location. Thanks Silvio this was a real treat. Jane and Ralph, Australia.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have now stayed 4 times at Villa Matissa - on my own and with a small group of graduate students from the USA. Villa Matissa is simply gorgeous, clean, and spacious. It is also perfectly situated in Trastevere as a home base for anything you need to do in Rome. Silvio and his family are wonderful hosts and go out of their way to make our stay easy every time we stay here.From their villa, you can walk to all of the major sites or get on a tram or bus to go places directly. Or, you can stay at the villa to relax and regroup...their gardens are gorgeous and offer small tables and chairs to relax - you will literally feel like you are in your own private garden.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a great location in a quiet street. I love the serenity of the garden. Trastevere is an exciting area with fabulous restaurants and close to the river. Our room was spacious, the breakfast served in the garden and the linen and towels nice quality. We were very comfortable.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I found this guest house on the internet. We were charmed by the gardens in the pictures. It lived up to our expectations! It is an oasis of calm and beauty in the middle of a lively neighborhood in Rome. Our host was so helpful and our room was lovely. The breakfast was a great continental spread with the opportunity to eat in the garden. We are so happy we found Villa Matissa.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed here for 5 nights. The villa is immaculately presented, with modern, contemporary styling. The bedroom has a large bed, with memory foam mattress, and the large ensuite has an excellent shower. Sylvio, the owner, was always. helpful, and able to answer questions. There are bus stops outside the Villa. The Number 75 bus goes to/from the termini railway station, and takes about 20 minutes. We used the buses a couple of times. There are restaurants nearby within about 10 minutes walk,and we walked to the Vatican (40 minutes), and all of the main sights within about 30 minutes or so, so it is well located, but nicely out of the way. The Villa has lovely gardens at the back, and we ate breakfast outside each morning (in November!). the breakfast ius typically continental, ie good quality pastries, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, coffee and orange juice, and toast if you like.We really enjoyed our stay here, and cant recommend it highly enough.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms & Property:Each room has a theme of a place in Rome.Bathroom is very spacious.The gardens are very beautiful for a nice breakfast in the sun.Host:Silvio is a very good host. He lives on the property and is available at all times. He is also reachable via Whatsapp.He suggested us some really good Italian restaurants in Trastavere.He was there to receive us when we arrived and showed us the place.Silvio provided us with city maps & brochures. He also gave a brief guide on the city and its main attractions.Location:Bus stops just outside the villa gate.Since the location is just off the main road, it's not noisy & quiet peaceful.Trastevere is a really good place for authentic Italian experience, food and wine. It is walk-able & very pleasant in the evenings to enjoy a real Italian evening. Most of the attractions are just a bus ride away.Breakfast:Variety is sufficient enough. Cornflakes & milk, coffee/cappuccino, croissant/cake/bread, yogurt & fruit, bread/butter/jamOn the day we had to leave early, Silvio was very accommodating and provided us with breakfast at 7.30 amNormal breakfast timings are from 8 - 10 am.All in all, we really enjoyed our stay. It was like really living in a Villa. We would definitely go again.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly placed guest house close to transport links. We got the 75 bus from the Termini and it dropped us right outside. Silvano the owner was an excellent host. Communication before we got there and during was spot on. Lots of tips on eating, transport times etc. The room was large and comfortable. Beautiful garden where you can have your breakfast or take a bottle of wine. We will definitely return here if in Rome again. I can't recommend it enough. Thanks Silvano for making it so special.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Where to start on this great find ?!!Silvio & Monica are the perfect hosts - there to help when needed, and really good with taxis, transport & "how to get there on foot" instructions. Perfect.In a lovely setting, this small hotel feels like an oasis in the city. A very short walk from the street life in Trastevere, and only a few more minutes across the Tiber and into the old city itself.This is probably the cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in, but still with a relaxed feel to use the place inside and out as you wish. Lovely spacious rooms with plenty of storage and a really, really good shower room. Many regular changes of towels and bedding was a welcome touch.Breakfast was a limited selection of coffee, cereals, pastries & fruit juice made to order, with everything being extremely fresh.There is a small upper covered terrace for drinks & relaxing, plus plenty of space around the building and garden to sit outside and drink their pretty good house wine.Security is very good.
hotelName:
9    Villa Matissa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Amalfi hotel for 3 nights over the last week (end of June 2019), check in was straight forward, reception is manned 24/7 and the hosts were all lovely. The hotel is very traditional, really beautiful and was great to stay at. The rooms are air conditioned and clean, they are a little on the small side but this wasn’t an issue for us as we only used it for showering and sleeping. The hotel breakfast is basic but does the job before a big day out! Rooms were cleaned and towels changed daily. Reception also organised our transfer back to the airport which was great.The hotel is a short walk from the Colosseum, and around 20/25 minutes to walk to the Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. The hotel will call taxis for you and they arrive within minutes. We visited the colosseum through City Wonders which was £50 but well worth the money! Same tour company for the Vatican but for us it wasn’t as enjoyable as it was ridiculously busy during the tour which isn’t the company’s fault, it’s just one of those things. My main advice would be to definitely book with a tour company for the main sites, don’t go on the day and queue as the lines were crazy but due to pre-booking with a tour company we went straight into both venues without queuing which was great.The hotel was in a good location and near to lots of bars, restaurants, shops etc. The neighbourhood felt safe and was clean. Two good pubs nearby are Falls Road and Druids Den. The hotel is also just round the corner from Basillica Papale Di Santa Maria Maggiore which is free to enter and definitely worth a visit. Overall the hotel was perfect for a city break, would definitely stay again if I came to Rome.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little traditional hotel with very friendly staff. Breakfast was good and the rooms were clean and quiet. It was a good price considering how central the location was. Just a short walk from the Colesseum and the other main sights. We were worried about being so close to a church with the bells and other noises, but with the windows closed the glazing kept the place exceptionally quiet. We could even hardly hear the Rome Pride march going past directly beneath our window! Really handy for the train station - we took the bus to the hotel and then found it actually was quicker to walk there.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located near Termini train station(5 minute walk). City center and Colosseum are also in walking distance. There are few great restaurants and pubs around the hotel, and also a supermarket. Rooms are small and vintage looking. They could be a bit cleaner, and breakfast was OK but not up to Italian standard. Service was good, they were all nice and helpful.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 3 nights in March. I’d taken a trip to Rome for my 50th birthday and wanted a hotel near to the station as I’d never travel to Rome before and was travelling alone. It was no more than a 10 minute walk and found a door into an exquisitely decorated hotel. Painted with murals it was beautiful. Staff were so welcoming and showed me to a beautiful single room again with murals painted into the ceiling with a tiny court yard with table and chairs. Complimentary breakfast was included each morning with bread eggs and pastries. Hotel was in walking distance to Colosseum and forum. Close buy to good restaurants and bars. This hotel is a gem and if I return to Rome I’d stay here without hesitation
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cosy, small hotel with friendly & helpful staff. Many major sights within 15 mins walk: Capitol, forums, Colosseum, Domus Aurea, National Museum & many interesting churches including S Maria Maggiore & S John Lateran. Termini Station also only a few mins walk with Metro, bus & train links to other sights, airports & rest of Italy. No restaurant but good continental breakfast, and plenty of places to eat nearby with a broad range of cuisines and prices. Only drawback: noise of traffic to front of building and of aircon units to rear - but we were on the top floor close to latter.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a smallish but very friendly and efficiently run hotel. My solo room was a perfect size with a modern and well-equipped bathroom almost as big as the room itself..the single bed comfortable with a tv close by. A plug was close to the bed ( a pet peeve when across the room). Breakfast is from 7:30- 9:30 with pastries and cooked eggs, sausage and bacon. Front desk very efficient Ck in and out and totally helpful for local guide and information. There is also a small lift going to all floors. There is a close by bus stop and all the local busses leave from Termini. Good restaurants are adjacent and steps away.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Amalfi was the smallest of our three hotels stayed in, and I say that with a smile. Again a clean and well run hotel with good people. The area is also well stocked with cafes and diners.  We were able to walk from the train station, again with the aid of google maps. We also walked all over.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The overall hotel and our room were not up to my expectations based on previous reviews. The location is in fact quite good, close to the Termini rail station and a block from Santa Maria Maggiore. But there are lots of hotels in the area, and our experience was not up to the norm for a 3 star. There is no lobby to speak of, the room key was a charming old key, and the elevator barely fit two people, but these are not serious issues in my view. The room was quite small, and had the distinct taint of mould -- not enough to keep us from spending the one night we'd booked, but noticeable. The staff were pleasant, though did not have to do anything in particular. For the same price we could have had a room in a 4 star hotel a block away. Not my worst stay ever, but I would not return.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my fiancee for 3 nights at the start of our Italy holiday, booked through Citalia. Really good little hotel, it's 3 star but I wasn't planning on spending much time here so only needed a base for exploring. Very friendly staff, especially the non-English speaking waitress at breakfast who made a flower out of a napkin! Good location and within 15 mins walk from most attractions in Rome, plus Termini train station only 5-10 mins walk away. Rooms are a little small but have everything you need. Road outside quite busy so best to close window at night - air conditioning can only be used if really hot though (A Rome thing) so be aware that rooms can get hot at night. Great view of the Basilica from the window. Comfy bed and all kept very clean - really liked the fresco on the ceiling too which are different in every room. Would definitely stay again when coming back to Rome!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very close to the train station and tour buses while still being away from the craziness of that area. Close to the hip part of the Monti area with lots of restaurants and shops. Rooms are small but normal for Italy. The ceilings are decorated with frescos which makes it feel homely. Breakfast is nice and filling. Staff is supportive and there to help with whatever you need. It's about a 15 min walk to the coliseum and 20-25 to Trevi. But the station is so close that you can use that if your legs are tired. It's not quite city center but if you don't mind a little extra walking, it's great value!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights in the Economy Double Room. Room was small as expected but bathroom was decent sized. Room was clean and had a kettle with tea set. Hotel has a lift which was helpful because we had heavy luggage. Breakfast was great, had multiple types of breads, pastries, cereals, hot food (sausage, bacon, scrambled eggs) and coffee and juice. Staff were all super friendly and they kept our luggage on our last day until the evening. You get an amazing view of the Basilica di Santa Maria every time you leave/come back to the hotel. There is a kebab shop next door for late night munchies and a pharmacy down the road for any emergencies.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well-located to attractions and train station. It has a cosy ambiance in a big city. Good restaurant steps away. Clean. We had a street-facing room, and I don’t like noise but the windows work well to stop it and the traffic lets up considerably overnight. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The woman who looks after breakfast is really kind and attentive.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great little hotel in which to base yourself while in Rome. All the main tourist attractions are within easy walking distance. Trevi - 15 minutes. Colosseum - 20 minutes. Staff are really friendly and helpful. Some great and reasonable restaurants close by. Merulana is a busy street though so expect some traffic noise but remember you are staying in a busy city! You'll love the hotel and the city!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were thrilled when we arrived to discover our room was ready! After a long international flight, this was an unexpected plus!The staff here are very friendly and helpful. The rooms are small, but well appointed (hot pot, in room safe, etc). Very clean. The lovely woman who runs the breakfast was delightful. One caveat - when we were there, the a/c was not yet operational for the season. This was not a problem in general as we could open the window to let the cool air in. Unfortunately, our room faced the street side so we were not able to keep the windows open because of the noise. With windows closed, the room was quiet, but got a tad warm. We traveled with another couple who had a room not facing the street, so this was not an issue.Close to the Termini so easy to get around the city. Also within walking distance of the Colosseum.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Currently staying with Amalfi Hotel - perfect place for my husband son and I to put our feet up after a long days sight seeing.Really well situated just a 10 min walk from the Termini and another 10 min walk to the Colosseum.Our room is small but perfectly formed. Very clean and with everything you need to be comfortable.The breakfast is excellent and nothing seems to be too much trouble for the very friendly staff!Would def recommend this as a good place to lay your head whilst visiting this intriguing city!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Superb well appointed hotel with friendly helpful staffPerfect location in central Rome for sightseeing, within 5 minutes walk of termini station for access to all forms of transport, metro, train, bus & taxi.The hotel staff are friendly, helpful & professional.The hotel is vey well decorated, spotlessly clean and the continental breakfast sets you up for a days sightseeing.Without hesitation I would recommend the Amalfi hotel.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed several nights at the march and were absolutely satisfied. The staff was extremely friendly. The breakfast was surprisingly rich and tasty for 3 stars hotel. The women who served the kitchen was very pleasant and helpful. The room was exactly as described - nice and cozy. The bed in the room was actually a double bed and not 2 single beds attached together. There was a safe in the room ( 3 stars hotel !). The hotel has an elevator. We have reached all the Rome attractions except the Vatican by walk. The bottom line - highly recommended.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Have just returned from 3 nights at this hotel, location was great, no issues with facilities and the friendly staff really made this place. They were friendly, accomodating and went out of their way to make you feel welcome!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back from a very enjoyable stay in the Amalfi Hotel. We had a large group, but everyone was very happy with the excellent facilities and great staff.Great location. Well done to Francesco and all your staff.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I decided for Hotel Amalfi because of its central location and proximity to Termini Train Station. It is located just 10 minutes walk from the city main points of interest such as the Colosseum, the Roman Forum, the Palatine Hill and the Altar of the Fatherland. Clean room and public area. Very comfortable room and bed. Room big as much as one can need for a short trip. A lovely “fresco” decorates the ceiling of my room. Moquette on the floor.The staff was very helpful by answering to all my doubts and questions.I will come back for my next trip to Rome!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last summer me and my wife were in Rome. I knew Rome is charming old-fashioned city, therefore I sought hotel at the same style. In my opinion, Amalfi Hotel is perfect for ancient city. In addition to this hotel has Certificate of Excellence by “Tripadvisor”. In shortIt is a three-star hotel.It is located in the historic center of Rome, in few minutes walking from the Coliseum. We had a double room with view of the Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore.Friendly staff. One of female staff from Russia. Her name is Natasha. Good woman. She is always glad to help. Guestrooms are furnished with air conditioners, cold and hot shower, telephone, Wi-Fi, interactive TV and minibar. One disadvantage for me, there are small rooms in a hotel. However these rooms are always clean. If you are visiting Rome, I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my second stay at hotel Amalfi and this time with my niece. We were satisfied on our room and everything. The staff on the reception was very friendly and nice. The check in and chk out was fast. And What I like staying here is that it’s very close to everything A lot of restaurants and close to termini and my favorite the Santa Maria Maggiore basilica. Would definitely recommend this. And thank you Amalfi.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family enjoyed this charming hotel’s decor of artwork and painted ceilings, friendly staff, great neighborhood, terrific location, clean rooms, nice breakfast. Warm rooms and towels were appreciated in winter. Only toiletries provided were liquid soap in the bathroom,
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location to walk and take metro, and train. Owner and son manages so you get exceptional service. When you need something they try their best that moment.The rooms are small but it is ok if your goal is seeing as much as you can in Rome. So it was very good for us.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In order to save money for tours, my son and I took the bus from the airport to the Roma Termini railway station. This hotel is located about 5 blocks away about 1/2 block in front of St Mary Major. It's also convenient to 2 to 3 subway stops. This makes it easy to get around to many of the tourist sights in the city. I would recommend you buy a transportation pass at the Termini when you arrive for this allows you to travel both on buses and subways in a cost efficient and convenient manner. The hotel rooms are small , but efficient and well maintained. I did have a problem with the television reception which they offered to work on, however, since we weren't there to watch television I never insisted on a repair. I just watched for a while on the hotel lobby tv. The front desk is very helpful and are willing to work with you on any questions you might have. The breakfast was varied, good quality, and if it's part of your reservation (it isn't always) it's a good deal. We were there for 6 days and were very satisfied.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Another short break in the eternal city and once again found the Amalfi so convenient and pleasant. Rooms are always clean and fresh. and the breakfast lovely. The owners and staff are friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent three nights at the Amalfi and highly recommend it to travelers. The location is great. So close to Termini Station. The room was comfortable and clean. The breakfast was very good. The best part is the staff. The gentleman who works the night shift is a gold mine of knowledge about Rome. I enjoyed so much talking with him. I was there in November, when Romans think that 15 degrees Celsius (59 Fahrenheit) is very cold, so the heat was turned up too hot for my tastes. One of the friendly young front desk staff went out of his way to find a fan for me, so that I could keep the room at a temperature I like. I will stay there again in the future.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walkable, great location hotel at reasonable rates with a lovely view of the piazza of Santa Magiore. Charming decor so right for Rome, comfortable room. European breakfast was the best we'd had the whole 3 week trip we had in Italy AND Paris. Highly recommended. Great value! They also sent a van to pick us up at the airport (four in our party.) All around, great place!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: arrived early morning and they let us check in and get our day started. Had to do Rome in a day. The front desk attendant was above and beyond helpful. Very patient and kind. Told us how to get to all of our destinations with a map and instructions. Quaint little hotel that served our needs well. restaurants close by and within walking distance of all attractions except for Vatican. Just jumped on subway close by.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here during a 5-day trip to Rome. The hotel is clean and comfortable with friendly courteous staff. Well located and a couple of nice restaurants nearby. We would definitely recommend it and look forward to staying here again.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only had one day to enjoy Rome while waiting for our flight home from our cruise. The location was superb - we were able to walk to so many places and enjoy the splendor of Rome.The staff was really wonderful, they went out of their way to accommodate us (we had been caught in the rain and were drenched) with a place to dry off and some hot chocolate.We will certainly stay there again.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights and the hotel was just what we needed. Perfect location - short walk to Colosseum & Forum. Easy to get to from Termini- another short walk.Small little room but everything you need for a short trip away. Breakfast was fine and the staff were really helpful, organising a taxi when we needed it.The only reason I won’t give it 5 stars is because it’s not a 5 star hotel, but it did its job just fine! I would go again and recommend it as the place to stay for a Rome break away!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A well kept typical Rome hotel. The staff were very professional and all very friendly and helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. Our room and bathroom were spotlessly clean. Our room had a beautiful fresco painted on the ceiling! The breakfasts were delicious with a large variety of items to choose from, hot or cold. The hotel was perfectly situated, only a few minutes walk from the railway and metro station and within easy walking distance to the Colosseum, Forum and Trevi Fountain.First class service all round, my number one choice on my next visit! If you are visiting Rome, I would recommend this hotel without hesitation.Well done Amalfi Hotel and thank you for making our visit so special.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 4 nights in October 2018 with 2 family members in 2 rooms; a single and a double. I selected Amalfi Hotel based on price, location to train station (and Metro station) and ratings. Traditional European hotel with small (by USA stds) rooms, but the rooms were very clean and very functional. Beds are comfortable and air conditioning worked well (not all locations do). The hotel fronts a busy street, so best to have a back room. It has a small elevator, which is needed for 4th floor rooms (where I was). Staff was very friendly and accomodating. Another good feature is location next to stop for Hop on-off bus that we took to get around Rome to look at different sites.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned home from our first holiday abroad to celebrate our 30th Wedding Anniversary. The staff at Amalfi were welcoming and friendly and there are not enough thank yous for making our trip so special.On the day of our anniversary they presented us with a bottle of prosecco and a cream cake.Breakfast was delicious and the lady who cooked and made sure we had everything we needed was lovely.Thank you once again for a lovely trip and will definitely return
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I generally don't stay near train stations. Hotel Amalfi is less than a 10 minute walk from the main station, Termini. It is clean and comfortable. You can easily take the bus or subway, or walk to important sites and sights. I am a light sleeper, but the quality of the windows kept the room quiet. Breakfast was fine. One outstanding feature of this hotel is the staff. They are extremely nice and helpful. Francesco at the front desk gave us very good restaurant recommendations. The woman managing breakfast went to the bakery around the corner to buy a whole wheat croissant at my wife's request. How often does that happen? We paid about $200 for the room. It is a very good choice at this price point. From what i saw in my web search, to get a higher quality room in a better hotel would require spending $300.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amalfi is a nice little hotel located across from St. Maria Maggiore & in 15 min walk from the Colosseum & 10 min walk from Termini train station. The staff is very pleasant & helpful. We stayed there for two night before our cruise. While the room was small, it was cute & clean. We didn't have any issues with taking a shower as we had hot water (I saw many complains about hot water & AC in Rome's hotels) & AC was very good. We didn't buy breakfast at the hotel as there are plenty of restaurants around & we wanted to have breakfast at different places. The location is very convenient - we even walked to Vatican on Sunday to hear Pope;s Sunday prayer. We didn't use taxis but we used subway - buy subway tickets at tobacco stores not at subway stations. One ticket is 1.5 EUR and very often ticketing machines at subways don't have/give changes. We walked to Termini with our luggage as we took a train to Civitavecchia/port. It was 1+ hr ride for 5.10 EUR per person. We stored our luggage at the hotel on the departure day while we took a walk to Colosseum/St Maria Maggiore/etc.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great little hotel 15mins from the Colosseum and forum everything is really just a short walk from here. But the taxi rank is around the corner which makes it easy to travel. Hop off hop on bus passes hotel too. Very friendly staff speaking good english. Would definitely revisit.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel for 3 nights. From what I could gather this seems like a family owned property, reminded me a lot of a similar hotel we stayed in Paris years ago. It is very clean and nicely decorated in period style. The room was very small as I expected, but we made due. The bathroom was comfortable and had all amenities, soap and towels were provided and abundant. The room was very clean with AC and the window had the noise insulation window sash, so the street noise was not heard. Breakfast was plenty, it had all the basics and clean and set up very nicely. What made this hotel a pleasure was the staff. In all cases every person was so helpful and welcoming. The housekeeper was such a sweetheart, we felt like we were in someone's house! She wanted to make sure we had all we needed in the room as well at the breakfast. We had an early morning tour and they opened up for us so we could grab some food before running out the door. If any suggestion could be made is I would have the breakfast open earlier like at 7AM because there are so many tours in Rome that start at 7;30 and there is no way you can have some coffee and travel to the tour destination.The location is also good, close to Santa Maria Maggiore. It's not as convenient to the Vatican but very close to the Forum and the Colosseum. But in Rome you can't be close to everything and for our purposes on this trip, this property worked out very well. There are a lot of places to eat close by and the area is easy to walk to the the train station as well as Via Nazionale. This was not my first trip to Rome so I based my choice of hotel on what we were planning on doing.We were very pleased. Thank you for all your work on our behalf Hotel Amalfi!!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel nearby the train and al the touristic attractions. Next to the Church the Santa Maria Magiore. Nice and clean rooms, Good breakfadt and nice staf!We sertenly will come backMille grazie
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came for one night with our two young kids because of the excellent reviews, location and reasonable price. The room was perfect, really strong air conditioning. Staff was super friendly. We were only in Rome for one night and the location was perfect since it was near everything including great restaurants. We wee beer very happy with this hotel and would recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recommend Amalfi Hotel to anyone staying in Rome. The location was the best part, with so many interesting things within walking distance, and the train station nearby.The room was cozy, but I had enough room, and also had a small patio, which was nice. The room and patio didn't offer much of a view, but it didn't bother me, with downtown Rome right outside. The bed was comfortable, and they did accommodate my request for a softer bed, with some extra padding, which I was thankful for.Hotel staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. The breakfast room is on the smaller side, so it can get busy, but it helped force me to wake up earlier, since it wasn't so bad earlier in the morning.And the price was great!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Amalfi is a well-run small hotel! We stayed here for 4 nights and would highly recommend anyone when visiting Rome. The room itself was quite small, however, it was very clean and the service makes it a 5! The staff was very friendly, willing to answer questions and point out key places/tours worth visiting. The breakfast was basic with 2 different kinds of cereal, breads, and fruit, but it was lovely! The location is perfect - 3 minutes walk to the hop on hop off buses as well as a 15-minute walk to the Colosseum. A lovely hotel in a quiet location in Rome, well worth a stay!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quick and easy check in, Very central location, 5 min walk to the Termini Station and 15 mins to the Colosseum. Rooms were clean and very boutique. Air condition worked great, room cleaned everyday. Breakfast, brilliant. Scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage and all the pastries, yogurts and fruits every morning. Staff were polite and friendly. I did a solo trip and I felt very safe at this hotel and area.Would 100% recommend.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was amazing to stay in this hotel!!A specially Mega amazing the room with balcone !Clean - 10Location - 10 Security - 10Very profesional,friendly,helpfull stuff !!! 10+ . Will stay agane 100%Jenya
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely LOVED our stay at Hotel Amalfi! We stayed for three nights before going on a cruise and we cannot say enough wonderful things about this hotel and the exceptional staff. Everyone we met was super friendly and helpful. The breakfast was probably the best hotel breakfast we've had and we appreciated the free bottle of wine in our room. The room was spotlessly clean and quiet, and the bed was very comfortable. The location was also great, as it's close to many restaurants and a short walk from the Colosseum. (We also walked there from the Vatican fairly easily, but it was a bit of a walk). We are so thankful to everyone at Hotel Amalfi for making our first trip to Italy a great one!! Highly recommend staying here!
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had four nights here in a triple room. The third bed was in a small area between the main room and the bathroom. The room was clean although the carpet was worn in places. The bed was comfortable and we could see Santa Maria Maggiore from our window. Breakfasts were ok but everything was self service and on our first day they kept running out of crockery and cutlery. The hotel is less than ten minutes walk from Termini station and the Via Cavour metro stop, so it is easy to get around from there.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, I want to thank the Amalfi staff for their excellent hospitality and helpfulness. Very nice and patient people! Several advantages should be mentioned in regards to this hotel:1. Being in central Rome, it’s walking distance, or close Metro service, to several major sites (i.e., the Colosseum and Roman Forum in particular)2. It’s walking distance to Termini, the major train station in Rome. You can pretty much go anywhere from there (including Fiumicino Airport, FCO)3. The breakfast at the hotel is very good. Excellent cappuccinos! The seating, however, can be limited 4. The housekeeping staff did great work. Much appreciated…5. Visited Rome in July and it was pretty hot. The hotel’s AC seems to be ample6. On the negative side, you will need a special adaptor to charge your phone and camera. The front desk was kind enough to loan me one7. The rooms are nice (especially the bathrooms) but small and tight (probably all comparable hotels in the area would have the same problem). You should pack very lightly. In my room there was one cabinet for hanging clothes but not too much room for anything else. The desk and nightstands did not have drawers. No alarm clock or American style coffee maker. The bed was okay but a little on the firm side Overall a very pleasant experience; would highly recommend the Amalfi to a friend. I hope to stay there again in the future…V. Matkins
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice comfortable room with good air conditioning and decent breakfast. Friendly staff. Very close to Basilica santa maria maggiore aboutFifteen minute walk to Colosseum and Forum. Decent restaurants nearby, metro stop within a few minutes walk. Taxis easily available.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Rome for three nights and had a family room in this lovely hotel. Lovely warm welcome when we checked in and our room was perfectly sized for us with a teenage boy (they seem to take up a lot of room!)We arrived in the early afternoon and room was ready. We were also able to stay an hour longer for check out, which was so kind. Hotel is wonderfully located for exploring on foot or by metro. We walked a lot and saw the Trevi Fountain; Spanish Steps; Colosseum and lots of other places. Also plenty of restaurants around and the hotel are very happy to make recommendations. We tried one of them and it was indeed excellent. Breakfast was plentiful and was quite tasty. Filled us up the one day we had breakfast there.I’d absolutely recommend this hotel, it’s great value and wonderful service and best nights sleep I’ve had in a long while!Should I be lucky enough to come back to Rome, I would definitely look to stay here.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Amalfi Hotel for 4 night with a party of eight during May 24-May 28, prior to our cruise trip. The staff was very helpful by making airport pick-up arrangement and local restaurant reservation for us before our arrival. Additionally, they gave us all sorts of local advices at the best they could. The breakfast lady is funny and friendly. She did her job well by making sure everyone eats well and happy. The only issue we had with the property is that one of the room that we occupied had some strong odor. We made a complaint to the owner but there was nothing he could do due to the busy weekend. Odor issue was largely mitigated after the compliant and we left 2 days later. The hotel location is very convenient. The hotel is close to the train station by 5 mins walk, Hop-On and Off bus stop (Basilica of Santa Maria Maggiore), and local supermarket and drugstore. It takes about 30 minutes leisure walk to Spanish steps and about 20 minutes to Colosseum. It should be noted that nearby the hotel, it has pretty good local stores for shopping. Nothing extravagant but you can find some pretty good quality “Made In Italy” shoes, umbrebella and clothing. We love our stay at this hotel and we will definitely stay there if we visit Rome again.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is perfect and as pictured, with the cathedral just outside the hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a 3 bedroom room, and it was nice with sufficient space, though not overly spacious, but with a beautiful street view. I highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel staff was welcoming and friendly. They offered several suggestions to make my trip to Rome a wonderful experience. They seemed to genuinely care about their guests. The hotel was pretty and I loved my stay there.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really recommend this tiny hotel. We stayed 6 nights and our time there was amazing, especially for the great personal and also because is well located, the breakfast is good, the rooms are small but perfectly comfortable.
hotelName:
10    Amalfi Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated on the second floor of an apartment block (with lift), QT is a quiet hideaway from the craziness of the action below on the streets. There are 3 large rooms and all are very well equipped and comfortable. They are owned and managed by Diego with help from Federica. Breakfast is served on a tray to the room each morning and there are coffee machines in the rooms. The location is approx 100 meters from the Spanish Steps and most places are easily walked or accessed from the nearby Spanish Steps metro. This was our second visit to QT and it only seems to continue to get even better.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot recommend this apartment enough. Location is perfect. Right next to Spanish steps and a stones through away from Rome's many highlights. The room itself is very cosy. The Sky TV is excellent. Coffee is Lavazza and is amazing. Breakfast was superb. This was all the better due to our ever helpful host Diego. He was extremely polite and eager to help. We had to have an early breakfast and Diego accommodated us without hesitation. Would come back here tomorrow if I could!! Thanks Diego and Forza Roma!!!
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: "Wonderful" is the word which best describes the first port of call of our recent European trip at the QT Suites & Apartments! Our courtyard-facing room was quiet, spacious, super-comfortable, and beautifully designed. It was equipped with everything we needed after our long haul flight from Australia, including iron/ironing board for our crumpled clothing. Diego was a wonderful host, helping us feel totally at home and ensuring our every need was catered for. His breakfast trays were simply amazing - artistically arranged, full of fresh produce and local treats, and tailored beautifully to our vegetarian requirements. We never had to eat again until dinner time! Diego's restaurant recommendation upon our arrival lateish on a Sunday night proved to be the best meal we had in Rome.The QT's location was also wonderful..... A relatively quiet street which led directly (about one minute's walk) to the Spanish Steps. The Trevi Fountain was only about five minutes away by foot. A little further afield, but still well within walking distance, were the Galleria Borghese, Piazza del Popolo and other major tourist attractions of Rome. All in all, a wonderful base from which to explore a wonderful city.Thank you Diego for helping make our time in Rome truly memorable.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I came back to Rome for the third time and we have stayed in a couple of other places, some good and some not great. The moment we met Diego and stepped into the Apartment Suites, we knew we had a new favorite and did not want to stay anywhere else in our future Rome visits. We were greeted in a very welcoming and friendly manner and never felt anything but welcome and taken care of. It is also in a nice quiet street away from all the hustle and bustle, yet only 1 minute away from the Spanish steps and close to other attractions. The rooms are very spacious and have everything you need and you can't beat a personally delivered breakfast to your door! I am so happy we chose to stay here and cannot wait to return.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is a treasure in the city of Rome! I cannot recommend this place enough!We feel so lucky to have found Diego and his wonderful hotel during our travel to Rome. He was extremely communicative, helpful, caring, and attentive both before and during our stay. The location of this hotel is PERFECT - super close to all the sight seeing that Rome has to offer. We walked to everything from our hotel. There is also a subway station right next to the hotel in case we didn't want to walk. Our room was EXACTLY as described in the photos and narrative. In fact, I would have to say it was even BETTER! What made this place most special however was the personal touch. You can tell that Diego cares about his business and his customers. He put in extra effort to ensure that our stay was perfect. He even gave us his personal phone number and was available to us 24 hours a day.Breakfast in the morning was fantastic and customizable. The sheets and the towels were high quality. The windows did a very good job blocking the noise outside the apartment. The air conditioning was digital and worked well. All of the provided amenities were high quality and worked well. This place was just as nice as any 5-star hotel. The quality of stay was just as good, if not better due to his personal touch. We will definitely stay here again when visiting Rome.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at QT suites for a short break and found the accommodation to be absolutely faultless - the room we were given was large and airy and very well equipped. Clearly a lot of thought has gone into the design of the apartments with everything you could possibly need provided to ensure you have a comfortable stay. QT suites is located very close to the Spanish steps and Spagna Metro station so is an excellent base for exploring the central part of Rome. We were given the rear room (heyschia?) at QT which has a small balcony overlooking a courtyard and was a lovely peaceful retreat after a busy day in the city - listening to the birds it is hard to imagine you are only minutes away from the thousands of tourists and busy traffic.Diego is the perfect host and ensures you have everything you need to make your stay enjoyable. The generous breakfasts provided are a perfect start to a busy day exploring Rome and delivered direct to your door at a time of your choosing which is a nice touch. Whilst we were on holiday we celebrated our 20th wedding anniversary - we did not make any mention of this to Diego however our anniversary cards must have been noted since we returned to our room to find a heart shaped cake which had been baked by Diego's friend Francesca - a lovely gesture which we will long remember and which clearly shows Diego has genuine interest in making his guests feel special We had never stayed in an apartment before this trip but the QT suites is one the best accommodations we have ever stayed in - a real home from home!If you are reading this Diego many thanks again for making our stay in Rome so perfect!!!
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great place to stay, so convenient, right near the top of the Spanish Steps, with very comfortable designer accommodation. Diego, our host, obviously has a penchant for art and has set up these apartments with flair. Breakfast is included and is delicious, it is so good and nutritious you can tour the sights all day without lunch. We would definitely recommend this accommodation for couples.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for couples. Diego is a complete star. The rooms are beautiful, we had the one at the back with a small balcony which was perfect for us as it’s very quiet and peaceful. The service is amazing. The breakfast is lovely. There is a daily cleaning service with fresh towels. The mini bar is very reasonable and well stocked. Love it! ❤️
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Diego was there to welcome us to our apartment. He explained how everything worked. We loved how close we were to the Spanish Steps, shops and restaurants and could walk everywhere. We had a front apartment which faced the road, so we had a bit of traffic noise, but after long days of walking we managed to sleep. The apartments are huge and the breakfast's wonderful. Staying here made us feel like locals instead of staying in a hotel. We would recommend this apartment. Thank you.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: QT Suites is more of a luxury guest house than a hotel. Proprietor Diego is mentioned a lot in other reviews, and really does take a lot of personal care in looking after guests. However, whilst he was attentive, he was not obstrusive.The property is charming, located on the second floor of an apartment building. The interiors were smart and modern, and very comfortable. Our room was spacious and overlooked a very quiet internal courtyard, which was very good for sleep. Breakfast was delivered to the room every morning. Continental style, Diego made sure foods such as cold meats/cheeses and fruits were different each day. He also accommodated mornings when we had to head out earlier than the standard breakfast hours. There was a Lavazza coffee machine and kettle in the room.The location is excellent for sight seeing. Near the Spanish Steps and the Spagna Metro, it is not a long walk to other attractions such as the Trevi Fountain and nice shopping streets. We also found a few good restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here during our honeymoon. We were greeted with our room decorated which was a really nice touch. The room was modern and clean, the bed was so comfortable and the view was nice too! The location is brilliant, only a short walk from nearly all most popular tourist spots like Trevi Fountain. The breakfast is out of this world, delivered to you at a time of your choice. The owners are the nicest people you will meet and couldn't do enough to make sure our stay was perfect. Overall we would highly recommend to stay here if you are visiting Rome.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the QT Suites for 6 nights in May. I had read the reviews and booked accordingly but we were still pleasantly surprised by our beautiful suite! We were greeted by the charming Diego and introduced to all our ammenities personally, we had everything in our room we could possibly need and more! Our room was large, bed really comfy, large bathroom, coffee and tea making, tv with English speaking programs( we were in Heaven after a week in Paris without English news or anything to watch at the end of a long day out!) and the most amazing breakfasts served at whatever time we would like, from very early at 6.30am before we rushed out the door to mid morning brunch after a sleep in.Diego was fantastic to talk to and was brilliant at helping us with information about Rome, where to go and how to get there! He was so helpful whenever we needed, from his superb breakfasts, phone calls to tour groups, printing our emails and even buying rail tickets for us online, nothing was too much trouble! We can not thank him enough for making our stay in Rome so happy:) The apartments were in a great location so close to all the sights, the Spanish Steps 200 metres away and the Trevi really close too!I would highly recommend the QT Suites and Apartments and would happily stay there again:)
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: QT is an absolute gem. No detail has been overlooked to make your stay as comfortable and memorable as possible. The room is a perfect mix of comfort and cool, the wifi is fast, and the bathroom fabulous. There is a really good coffee machine and a kettle in the room as well as a great mini bar. The breakfast delivered to our room was incredible. And QT happens to be in the best location in Rome. I couldn't recommend it highly enough.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent one night in this lovely, clean and modern B&B. Diego was very friendly and informative. Breakfast was in a restaurant/bar nearby and was quite good. The B&B is a two minute walk to the Spanish Steps and walking distance to all other attractions.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is an incredible good location near the Spanish steps. We were met by Diego, the most helpful host you can have. He made our two days in Rome enjoyable. The room is very nice, quiet, with a small balcony overlooking other " palazzi". The bed and pillows are very comfortable. We were unhappy with the breckfast solution ( a bar nearby did not have good standards according to our wishes), and Diego provided us with the perfect solution : breckfast in bed!!!!.We wish him the best of luck. He deserves it for all the responsibility and dedication he brings to this job.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My fiancee and I stayed here in August 2016 and absolutely loved it. The location is right next to the spanish steps and central to all sights. The room was lovely and spacious and the breakfast at the local cafe was a nice touch. Complimentary coffee in room and the mini bar prices are reasonable as well. Upon our arrival in Rome, our luggage was lost and Diego went above and beyond to help us retrieve it back. He drew up a map of the main shopping areas to buy essentials, he provided us with an italian mobile and sim card with topped up as well as his personal mobile number for anything we needed. When our luggage hadnt arrived the next day, Diego called the airline himself and spent most of the day chasing it down, not because we asked but because he wanted to make sure we had our luggage bag and the best time in Rome. We couldnt have asked for a better owner and if it wasnt for Diego I'm pretty sure we wouldnt have had our luggage by the end of the trip. When Diego realised it was my partners birthday he also surprised us with a complimentary bottle of bubbles in our room. Again unexpected but a lovely surprise. All the little personal touches at QT suites made it a wonderful stay and i'd highly recommend it to others, we couldnt fault anything.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: QT apartments are situated close to the Spanish steps and central to all of the key tourist areas of Rome .The rooms are spacious ,furnished immaculately and are a real showpiece .Great place to relax after walking Rome .The owner Diego makes you feel very special and with 3 apartments you will receive great personalised service .Nothing seems to be too much of a bother . The breafast down the road at a local cafe is a real treat and allows you to experience the local Roman culture .However if you are there on the weekend the Sunday breakfast prepared by Diego is fresh and out of this world .having been to Rome many times QT apartments are a real find and it will be my place to stay for future trips .Also men and women do yourselves a favour and visit the Aqua di Palma boutique shop at the bottom of the Spanish steps
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good and the service was top notch. Diego Leo was very kind and helpful. Hi took his time to give us great welcome and introduction to the place and the city! The guy is really professional and very friendly. The people at the breakfast restaurant was also very friendly and gave as good service.
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rome was the last city in our trip in Europe. My wife and I arrived Rome very late at night after several hours drive from Florence. The owner of QT Suites Diego waited for us until we arrived, he took us to the room and kindly introduced everything inside the room and let us know the arrangement of breakfast and some attractions nearby (the location of QT Suites was very good). We were very impressed as it was really late at night.The room was clean and tidy, it was a very comfortable place to sleep.In the morning, a very rich breakfast was served inside the room, the food was more than enough! After the breakfast, Diego told us where we could return our car, where we could visit, how we could get those places, he searched all information for us! Because QT Suites did not serve the breakfast during weekend, Diego clearly told us the arrangement for breakfast which was served in a restaurant just one minute from QT Suites, everything was properly planned and arranged.As our flight leaving Rome was a late afternoon one, Diego let us occupied the room few hours more and arranged a taxi to take us to the airport.The QT Suites was/is/will be a perfect place to stay in Rome because of a delicated owner, Diego, who managed QT Suites well and took an excellent care of visitors, most importantly, he was kind, polite and attentive, his attitude was very positive.Diego was the best owner I had ever met. QT Suites is highly recommended to stay in Rome!!!
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So happy to have found this hidden gem only a couple of minutes away fromthe Spanish Steps. The QT Suites are situated in a beautiful building. We were greeted by the owner, Diego and he was the perfect host. The building has a lovely old fashioned lift or you can take the old marble stairs to the second floor. The suite we stayed in was absolutely beautiful and everything is finished to a very high standard. There is everything you could wish for, comfortable bed with loads of pillows, lots of wardrobe space, double glazing, a beautiful umbrella to borrow ( but hopefully not needed), full ironing board and iron, a proper full sized hairdryer that you can plug in, an excellent coffee machine with complimentary coffee, a full mini bar with snacks at reasonable prices, nice toiletries and a good shower. Breakfast is served in a cafe around the corner and you can choose from different options, scrambled egg, bacon, croissants, pastries etc. It was nice to have breakfast in a local place with predominantly Italian people popping in for their morning coffee. Everything was on our door step and the place is very centrally situated. We walked everywhere and did not have to use public transport once. We decided to get a taxi to and from the airport and it is a flat rate of €48. We had the most wonderful time and would like to thank Diego for being so helpful. I would totally recommend a stay here- it was wonderful!!
hotelName:
11    QT Suites & Apartments
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were all super nice and helpful.Just off the motorway and easy to find. Nice pool, comfortable, well-equipped room with good breakfast. Lots of safe, free parking. Free shuttle to the station was great for exploring Rome.There is another hotel about 800 metres walk away to go for dinner, as the Castle does not have a restaurant. Another reviewer commented about the neighbourhood but we thought it was fine and had no concerns about walking at night.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fabrizio and Stefano provide excellent service. Good sized rooms, clean and quiet atmosphere. I would recommend this location. Access road is a bit of a challenge. Fabrizio is good for English speakers.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The whole stay was excellent. Fabrizio and the team are really helpful. On arrival late on Monday, we were given a map of Rome with some tourist hotspots to check out, and spoken to on how to get there. We speak very minimal Italian but the team were excellent at communicating with us and explaining everything wonderfully in english. The hotel will drop you to a train station near by (Labaro) for free And also pick you up later that evening. Also giving you advice and help along the way (told us about being a public holiday so how to get back etc...). The team are friendly and always want to ensure the guests are happy. We arrived late at night on Monday and they ordered us a takeaway pizza and rang our room when it arrived so we could collect and pay which we really appreciated. Breakfast has a good selection and the croissants are excellent. Flaky and delicious! The room was a nice size with a comfy bed and a good bathroom. Shower was powerful and a good size. Room has a mini-bar in which we didn’t use but it was useful to have if required! TV in the room comes with Netflix on so we could log in and watch some shows late evening when we got back to the hotel which was great as well. Cleanliness of the hotel was top notch. They also have a gym area where you can go at any time and use for free. We will be recommending that people stay here when they go to Rome. Thank you Hotel Castle for a brilliant service whilst we stayed there.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You really cannot fault the service at this hotel. The owners and other staff are so helpful. You can read previous reviews about the shuttle service to and from the train station; it is an excellent service and the train is easy to use and only 15 minutes to get you to the centre.The hotel provides a varied buffet breakfast, if you have dietary needs let them know, they really look after you. The coffee is good too. We moved from a suite which was not good for us after the first night, the room they allocated to us was large, light (balconies on two sides) and comfortable; with a spa bath and shower over it. There are safes and mini bars in the rooms.Although the hotel is very close to a motorway the noise in the rooms is not intrusive. We live in the middle of nowhere and noise for us is a problem. It was not a problem here. I am not sure whether it would be possible to get an undisturbed night’s sleep in the centre of Rome; it seems as if the ambulances drive around in circles nonstop with their sirens on.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a amazing holiday , we really enjoyed to stay in this hotel so Much,the room is so clean , breakfast nice and they have lovely pool, and all personals is so friendly and helpfully . They have shuttle service till train situation and being honest they make great job and they made our holiday perfect. Hope to see you soon.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent one night in order to avoid traffic jams the next morning on our way to Tuscany.Very clean and efficient hotel with plenty and free parking and a swimming pool (which we did not use). Our room was quiet, large and very comfortable on the ground floor. Very well located just outside the highway. Breakfast was fair and satisfyingץVery well located just outside the highway.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Castle hotel for 3 nights. The hotel arranged for a driver to pick us up from the airport late in the evening which was great. They arranged some takeaway food to be delivered as well.Nothing is a problem for the staff here. The rooms are large clean and comfy beds. They have a big pool to relax in after touring or spend the day at. The hotel will drop you at the railway station and pick you up on your return home. Easy access from the station to all tourist spots. There is a restaurant within walking distance which offers great choices. Breakfast was plentiful. If you are visiting Rome this is a great place to stay at for a reasonable rate with great access provided by the hotel. They even have the train tickets for you. It is all too easy.Highly reccomended.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was at Hotel Castle for a few days after I had stayed in downtown Rome for a work trip and I wanted to move hotels as I was on my own expenses and wanted to stay a little longer. I honestly didnt have too much expectations but what I experienced was really awesome. The place was nice and very clean and the staff really made me feel comfortable and definetly went the extra mile. Any questions, any requests were always answered with patience and no matter who I spoke to I always got the help I wanted. If I wanted to go downtown I got a a free shuttle to the nearby train station, bus and subway passes were available at the reception and they also helped me with booking a transfer to the Airport. The place is located on the outskirts of Rome but I can definetly recommend this place to anybody that is looking for a nice, safe, clean and affordable place to stay at while spending a few days in Rome. Thank you Hotel Castle!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is a relatively quiet and roomy one. It offers good experience that certainly values its price. And the service there was probably the best in my trip.The breakfast was tasty as well as the drinks they offered. The room was quite spacious, and the facilities were better then the average.We checked in at the dinner time. We were really staving at the time but the hotel did not have a restaurant for dinner and it was raining heavily outside so it is not possible for us to find a nearby restaurant. The reception then suggested us to order some take-out and gave us some menus of the nearby restaurant. Since I am not able to speak Italian, the reception kindly helped me to order the food(by phone calls) that we have selected on the menu, and sent it directly to our rooms, with plates, knifes, folks and a friendly smile. I had no cash on me, so the reception also paid the bill of the food for me, adding the fees to the check out charge, which was also helpful.When leaving, the hotel gave us a chance to take a free rider from the hotel(not sure about this), an sent us directly to the train station with free of charge. This saved us at least an hour to walk there with heavy luggages.I strongly recommend it.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel castle has probably one of the best service a hotel can possibly have. Me and my girlfriend stayed there for 6 nights and the stuff-owners there where kind enough to take us to the station by car every morning and take us from there at the evenings. This has made it really easy to approach all sightseeing places with the train combined with the metro!!! The only pity is that we could not live the nightlife of Rome because the last train returns at 10:40!! Highly recommended!!! ☺
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great place to stay during a girlie holiday in Rome. We've had 6 days/nights where we've split the time into sightseeing and relaxing by the beautiful pool area, every moment was excellent. The owners/staff are so friendlly and helpful and we found the hotel to be exceptionally clean. The buffet breakfast covered all our needs each morning before heading out and there's plenty of parking with the location being easy access into the City. I'd have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to anyone and will certainly use it again if I return. Jules
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First & foremost, thank you for upgrading us to better room! This hotel might seems a little bit far from central of Roma, but it exceeds every of our expectations! The room is spacious & comfortable (which is very unusual for a 2-star hotel). The front desk & bar is so helpful & friendly. It's very sweet to have the staff approached us & ask "would you like something to drink?" during our breakfast time. In my whole Italy trip, this is the first hotel to do so. Well done!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel castle is in a great location just 30 mins from the centre of Rome. The hotel itself is clean and charming. The staff are friendly and helpful, overall this is a great base to discover Rome. 10/10
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have just returned from my second stay at this hotel. I took my parents for a four day break and Hotel Castle was perfect. The hotel is small which means the staff can give quality service to its guests. They are extremely helpful and really want to make your stay perfect. My parents were impressed with the driving service to the local station and the prompt return pick up. We had rooms opposite each other. They were cleaned daily, they were spacious and the bathroom was stocked with all you need so no need to bring your own. The hotel has a pool though we didn't use it. It is situated about twenty minutes from Rome centre ideal for those busy days in the centre and quiet relaxing evenings. The staff are amazing they can't do enough for you. I can't wait to return again. Fabulous Hotel
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Three night stay for a mini break to Rome. Try as I must I really won't be able to write the review this incredible hotel deserves. Offers free shuttle service between local station and hotel at any time of day up to the last train. Just phoned hotel and only took a few minutes for their car to arrive. Sells train tickets which enables you to travel on train, bus and tram. Makes life simple if you don't speak Italian to try and buy a ticket. Reception staff day and night were always incredibly accommodating with our every request.The room was lovely and the bed was at least a Queen size. We didn't see the maids as left by 10am and returned late each night. Our room was tidy, towels and toiletries refreshed daily. We were on the ground floor which was handy as I have a walking stick. Continental breakfast served in ample amounts and very tasty. In the lobby there's the Reception area and also a bar that sells alcohol, coffee and offers bar snacks. Also on offer are copious amounts of small boiled sweets. This hotel is 10 stops on the train which sounds a lot, but goes very quickly as the stops are very close together. Took 25 mins from hotel to Flamino station. Make sure on your return journey to the hotel that you board the Montebello train and press the orange button by the doors, the station before Larbaro as the train will not stop unless button pressed. A lovely family run hotel with a friendly little dog. As we've thrown a coin into the Trevi fountain we shall be returning. We will definitely return to this hotel. Should be a FIVE STAR HOTEL.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for one night during a trip to Rome last weekend and had 3 rooms (6 kids 4 adults). The hotel was a real gem, a bit outside the center of Rome, but for us getting away and having a break was ideal.After a long, hot day sightseeing, the pristine pool was such a welcome place to relax and cool off! Breakfast was great. The staff was excellent, providing detailed information on the area, and was very willing to help us with any request (extra towels, etc)Hotel was easy enough to find via car with ample parking.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here recently for 6 nights whilst in Italy. Whilst the location is a bit out of town, I cannot recommend a better place to stay! The Owners (Fabrizio and Co) went well out of their way for my wife and I. Picked up and dropped off at the nearest Metro Station everyday , even a cell phone with which to call them when we arrived at the station in the pm. I had to attend to some business whilst there and I was offered their front desk computer to use after hours! So accommodating! Thanks Fabrizio! Highly Recommended !!!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is all family, they keep the hotel in great shape and they are very helpful. They shuttle you to the rail station when you're ready and the'll pick you up when you comeback from downtown or sightseeing free. The place is clean and comfortable at all times.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, large rooms, very clean. Service is their strong point, providing car service to the closest train or nearby restaurants. They even provided a cell phone so I could call and get a return ride back!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed for 4 nights/5 days during the first leg of our European adventure. This hotel set the standard pretty high for the next hotels we would be at.
