The hotel is no where near close to any of the major major attractions (ie: Colosseum, Trevi Fountain). I don't think walking to the attractions would be good either, maybe a few hours of walking? The hotel is less than 5 mins by car to Labaro Station, which any of the hotel workers will gladly drop you off to. With a simple call to the hotel front desk, they pick you up at night from the station. We also we're able to purchase train tickets from the front desk. By train to the city center, about 10-15 min depending if a lot of people are coming on/off along the stops, convinient we thought.Every morning they do a breakfast you buffet which was the best we had compared to all our other hotels. Plus free unlimited cappuccinos made at the espresso bar. I believe their brothers that we mostly interacted with that ran things, who also were very informative about attractions and walking amongst the city center.We also arranged with the hotel for airport transportation which was so convenient. The neighborhood around the hotel is a quite and cute with very few shops and a few cafes we saw on our first day but we preferred the hotel's espressos bar.Overall, we thought the hotel was a good base to come home to after a full day of adventuring thru Rome. We'd definitely love to stay
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel distinguishes itself by providing really good rooms combined with excellent service.We were fly-driving to Italy and stayed in Hotel Castle for the first two days and the night before we left. This hotel is perfect if you have a car and wish to go to Rome without the parking hassle.The staff happily ferries you to the station and in the evening until 11:00 o'clock there is a car present at the station to take you to the hotel.On the last day we really had to leave early and the staff made sure we had the full breakfast. I can only say that in terms of service and quality, this family hotel earned my respect and appreciation.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This family run hotel is a fantastic place to visit. Is has a swimming pool which was perfect for our young girl to cool down in and play after walking around Rome. They make your stay hassle free regarding the trains into Rome. The rooms were so clean and fresh. Wonderful people and place. Would recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with 4 of my friends in June 2015 for 2 nights. The hotel aces on everything. Have beautiful rooms with great bathroom and huge balcony. Clean and great swimming pool. Lovely breakfast with lots of choices. Above all staff are every so friendly and accommodated our every needs. They offered us free pick up and drop off to the nearest station everyday, anytime we wanted. They gave us a mobile phone with local number so we can call to let them know when we're coming back so they can pick us up from station. I never had such a service in my entire life. If I go back to Rome again, I will definitely stay in this hotel. I have already recommended to all my friends and family to stay there.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PLEASE PLEASE- if you can arrange transportation with the hotel to pick you up before hand, DO! the taxi cabs are just outrageous, trust me we payed for it. If you have to get a cab do it, but just saying you can save money by arranging before hand. Again, we chose this based on the reviews. We were blown away. This place is not city centre, but you dont want to be. It is busy, for some it can be too busy. Therefore, staying at this hotel was just a nice way to bring your day to a close. This hotel is family run and they will go out of their way to make sure your stay is nothing but pleasant. From arrival all the staff were so attentive and nice. They spoke English and had maps, tickets to the train station, etc. TRUST ME, get tickets ahead of time whenever possible to all major attractions because lines are just long. Specially if you are traveling with kids or want to maximize your day.They also take you to and from the train station which is vital. We bought the train tickets that were for 72 hrs and you can hop on and off as many times as you want within those 72 hrs. Kids under 10 are free to ride which is nice. The rooms are nice and clean with a great view. The pool is also very nice. Breakfast is also nice and plentiful. If you dont like pastries I suggest you open your mind and try them because they are just delicious. We stayed for about a week and had a great positive experience. The bar is also open so makes it convenient if you want a drink and you can have pizza delivered to your room, which is nice. Overall, definitely recommend this place whether you are honeymooners or a family. You wont be disappointed! BTW we traveled to quite a few places in Italy and Rome has the best gelato!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Communication prior to Arrival was excellent and when we arrived was even better.Nothing is too much trouble with attention to detail and customer service being a natural incredient for your perfect break away from home from all the staff @ this hotel.Our Room was Ultra Modern,Spotlessly Clean and Spacious with Mini Bar,Constant Hot Water,Free Safe etc.The Reception Area was welcoming and the Breakfast each day being Fresh and plentiful.Outdoor Swimming Pool perfect for that Midday dip or just chill the staff will deliver anything on request without the feeling its inconvenient and with speed.Our Free Daily transfer to and from the Rail Station took 5 mins and the Journey from Labaro to Flaminio central rome was exactly 15 minutes every time and trains every 20 minutes last one being 10.20 pm but check times Urban Rail Flaminio to Montebello train only absolutely went perfect without inconvenience (Fare Euro 1.5)Local Restaurant within walking distance.In conclusion you would pay three times more euros for the same hotel in Central Rome and i would class this Hotel as a FOUR STAR for cleanliness,Service and no trouble attitude of the owners.A BIG THANK YOU to Fabrizio and All for making our trip to Rome more memorable.Until Next Time as its not Goodbye,Just see you next time.Bob & Jackie Bee Rotherham South Yorkshire.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed 3 nights and enjoyed the hospitality and room. While it was not right in Downtown Rome, the short drive to the train station (a few minutes) and quick train ride into the Flaminio station made this hotel perfect for the beginning of our 3 week driving trip through Italy and Croatia. The service and English speaking assistance made our stay very enjoyable- the hotel breakfast was alsoreally good. Would stay there again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing place, the service is second to none, and all the family who run this hotel are lovely and do everything they can to help you and make your stay pleasant. The swimming pool is in lovely surroundings. The deluxe room is very nice indeed and well furnished. The rooms are quiet. The area is a bit out of the centre of room, BUT DONT LET THIS PUT YOU OFF. The train tickets are very cheap and can be bought at the hotel. A free car will take you to and from the train station quickly and in comfort. The money you will save by being in a nicer and safer hotel rather than the centre of Rome makes this a no brainer. We will be sure to return when next visiting the eternal city.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love this hotel, the location, the staff, they were all very nice to me and I felt welcome. The staff are all helpful and speak a fair amount of English. It's not exactly in the city centre, as you have to take a small train to get to the hotel and vice versa, however you are picked up at the train station by the hotel staff and they drop you to the station from the hotel. If you booked tours like I did, they can organise a taxi to pick you up at any time, of course you will pay a bit more, but this is more than compensated for in what you pay to stay at the hotel. Breakfast is also included in the cost and you have a wide variety to choose from. Once you get off the train you are smack in the city centre and can walk to almost everything. If you plan to stay out late at night, taxis are always available to take you to the hotel, so keep in mind the last train times. The front desk also sells train tickets so you don't need to purchase at the station.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just checked out of Hotel Castle and could not wait to write this review. Upon arrival we were a bit concerned that the hotel is not in the center of Rome but after checking in we knew we had made the best decision on where to stay. This is a family owned business and the family places high importance on guest satisfaction. Once we checked in we were given a map with all highlighted must-see sights without even asking! They also let us know that they drive guests to the nearest train station to get into the city - extremely convenient! Hotel Castle also has a connection with a local company for rides to both of the airports. They even sent us an email a week before arrival to confirm and printed our flight itineraries. Great experience! Clean, convenient and great value! You won't regret staying here.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at hotel castle from 20th February for 3 nights with my partner for my 30th birthday. Hotel emailed me before my stay to see if I wanted to arrange transport with a 3rd party - this was a great help as it took the hassle out of getting to the hotel (guy waiting with your name at arrivals) and was fairly priced at 45euros each way. Greeted at the hotel by very friendly guy who promptly booked is in and gave us a brief overview of the main sites and transport links in Rome. I was a little worried as this hotel is a little out of the city but the staff were lovely and would take you to and from the station in an instant! The room we stayed in was lovely and spacious, spotlessly clean with a power shower and two (!) balconies!! Over the course of the weekend the various members of staff we met were very helpful, welcoming and nothing was too much bother. Breakfast was traditional European and plentiful with juice, fruit, sweet pastries, cereal, toast, ham, cheese etc...few downsides but nothing serious...wifi signal was poor in our room, not a deal breaker but would have been nice to have, pillows were a little thin (even with the extra provided) and not many places to eat near hotel if you fancied a night out of the hustle and bustle if Rome (but not the hotels fault). All in all had a fantastic stay in hotel castle. Hotel is definitely stand out by the service provided by the friendly (and very good looking!) front of house staff! Even when my fiancé forgot the room key as we left for the airport! they were very understanding and arranged to pick up the key from lost property (so sorry about that!). Would definitely recommend the hotel to all for a reasonably priced, hassle free stay in Rome :)
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I liked this Hotel bacause it is not too far from the city and you had safe and free parking. In the morning I drove into Rome at rush hour and it took me about 40 minutes; not badIt is easy to find ; room are comfortable; owners and staff are friendly and helpful. The good news is now there is a nice new restaurant near by that can be reached by walk. Food is excellent and staff are friendly and professional. I enjoyed very much my stay and I will be back next time I will pass by Rome.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in Rome by motorcycle so we didn't mind that this hotel is not in the city centre. It is a very nice hotel. We had a beautiful room with a very comfortable bed and a great bathroom supplied with everything we needed. The breakfast was rich and very good. The hotel also had an open pool in the courtyard but we didn't have time to try it since we were exploring the most beautiful city in the world!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was backpacking through Europe with my sister and Rome happen to be our last stop. I'm so glad I did the research and booked our hotel stay here. I found the service and hotel stay to be just as the positive comments have described it to be in the TripAdvisor comments.We were a little worried about it being outside of the city center but, once we got there the 15-20 minute train ride from Labaro station to the Flaminio station (city center of Rome where Piazza del Popolo is located) wasn't a problem at all. Having someone drive you to and from Labaro station helped a lot and made travel less stressful. Hours of free transportation between hotel and train station were from 7:00-12:00 and 19:00-23:00. Check with the hotel for up to date hours of operation on this free and incredible service they provide. If you don't mind staying out of the city center of Rome and taking a train into Rome, I would definitely recommend staying here for service, cleanliness, and price.There were some minor miscommunication I ran into with pick up from Roma Termini station to the hotel but, it was resolved....I called the hotel and I found the driver and was driven to the hotel. I also arranged for their private driver/taxi service to the airport and it was fine.This was my first time to Rome and staying at this hotel have left a positive experience as part of my travel. I would definitely stay here again if I visit Rome again. The hotel price is very reasonable, the rooms were always clean, the variety in morning breakfast is decent (my cup of cappuccino, banana, yogurt, and toast w/butter left me happy and ready to start my morning exploration of Rome), the staff were very accommodating and professional.Thank you Fabrizio, Stefano, Maximo, and the rest of the Hotel Castle family and staff for the amazing stay! Rome is such a lovely city and Italy is a beautiful country. I hope to visit again in the future!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights October 14 - 16. We booked this hotel due to the reviews on tripadvisor. We were not disappointed the reviews were totally correct.The family run place was exactly what was needed after a long day of touring. The two sons are as helpful as can be. They got us tickets for a guided tour of the vatican on their computer and printed out the tickets for us. We did not have to wait in line and we knew what time to get there for the guided tour. They also got us a cab very early in the morning so we could go see the pope on Wednesday for his general audience. We needed to get there very early for a good seat to see the pope. We were able to get very close and he passed right by us.The room was very clean. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious. We had a car and the parking is free another plus for this hotel.We will not hesitate to stay here the next time we visit Rome.Thank you for a great stay.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Castle is Family owned and run and as a result it is spotless with teh attention to clients you rarely get at larger hotels especially in the city. Its a 15 minute rail ride from Rome so bear that in mind, if you want to step out of the Hotel into bustling Rome this is not for you. However they drive you to the nearest rail station; Drop off between 0730 and 12:00 and collect you in the evening between 1800 and 2300, yes the driver is just waiting there for you....he just waits there for groups to come back (its a 3 min car ride back to the hotel). Moreover they sell day or weekend tickets for the trains and will book attraction tickets on-line - we paid the €16 each and skipped the queues at the Colosseum.Breakfast is Buffet style; cold meats, lots of pastries, fruit and yoghurt and wonderful wonderful coffee.As with many European hotels they like a hard mattress....a few carafes of red wine in Rome's city centre put pay to that. There is also a pool which I imagine in the height of summer is a relief. They will order food deliveries for you if you feel the need to escape and eat at the hotel and they have a small bar for beers wines when you return.We chose to have the driver collect us from the airport (Fiumincino) at €45 each way its a bit of cost but well worth saving the effort of a train journey into Rome then out to Labaro (local stop). especially when you are only there for 3 days. All in all a fantastic hotel and will definitely stay there again!!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a couple we finalised this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and it turned out to be a great choice!! Here is why we liked it:- great ownership: Seems like a family run place and they really want to be on the top.- fair room size for Rome - we stayed in room 133 for one night on 11 oct. - location is ok but they make it "good" with there pick and drop service: We were dropped and picked up from the Labaro train station which is close to the hotel. A train from Labaro goes to the Central Rome area. Someone is waiting for you at Labaro to take you back to the hotel when you come back in the evening.- pick up service from the airport: we were picked up from the airport in a cab and they charged a fair price of 45 euros for the distance. The cab turned out to be a merc.- attention to detail in the hotel:a comb, slippers, tooth brush, shampoo, body wash, soap...nearly everything you need... Though a moisturiser was missed- neat and clean bedroom and area around.- great communication: quick response to all email queries sent - very helpful: we had an early morning 5:30 am checkout which meant missing our breakfast. They accommodated this by letting us have breakfast a day earlier. Also, all our interactions were met with a smile and very helpful inputs. - free toffees everywhere: my husband had a bad throat and he really liked them being around and used quite a few- value for money: given the service and hospitality, this is a GREAT value for money Summary: will I stay there again? yes. Personalised service is what we really like and these guys know how to give that and keep folks on a vacation happy..... What else to ask for when on a vacation...
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The one thing that worried me about this hotel were the reviews about how far away it was. The great thing is, your only a 20 minute train ride away from the center. The staff will bring you to the train station and be waiting when you get back up to 1100 P.M. If you are going to stay in the center longer, you can get a taxi back.If you do decide to tale the train, plan ahead and make sure you get on the right train. Not really anything negative to say about the stay. The room was smaller but perfect for myself and my wife (room 133). If you gonna stay in Rome for three or more days, book this hotel. It's totally worth it.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed for our 25th wedding anniversary...fabulous room and such helpful staff. A shuttle takes you to and from train station in morning and will collect you 7 till 11 in the evening. A lovely restaurant about 400m away, lovely breakfast and we cant wait to go back.We can see why it was so highly rated ...thoroughly deserved tooThey can arrange a cab from the airport, however we came in by bus (11E return)and by train to Termini, then go down 3 floors to the metro to Flamini (get 1.50E ticket) to Labaro and make sure you get on the URBANO train (not extra urbano as it doest stop at Labaro although does stop at other stations so you can get off and just wait for the next train)
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed 4 days in Rome and booked here based on the great reviews by Trip Advisor. We found the hotel to be extremely helpful and the family who runs it willing to do everything possible to help. They had metro tickets available, helped with tickets to the various sites and even stopped to purchase train tickets for us on our departure. The only downside was the distance from the city (15-20 min by metro) but there was a car and driver available at all times to transport 5 minutes to the metro line which ran from very early morning until 11:00 p.m. Always a driver there at night when we returned. The basic room we had was clean and adequate with a mini fridge. WIFI was great and no charge. No coffeemaker but a wonderful breakfast and coffee downstairs. We did not spend much time in the area but not a touristy location.I would recommend it highly if you don't mind some local experience in your trip!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the first stop in Europe for my honeymoon and staying at Hotel Castle got our trip off on the right foot. 1)They put me in touch with a car service to pick us up from the airport and take us to the hotel on a good rate. 2) we stayed in room 222, which had 2 balconies and was VERY spacious 3) the property and our room was very clean 4) AC worked well and shower was hot and had good water pressure 5) free breakfast was good 6) staff was extremely helpful and informative and provided drop off/pick up to/from the train station. Didn't give 5 stars only because the location is a jog from the city center. With the drop off at the train station and navigating the train lines, you can get to the city center in 20-30 minutes. Your day needs to be planned accordingly. Also there aren't a lot of dinner options around the hotel that are in walking distance. All of that is reflected in the price. This was a great value and I tip my hat to the staff.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just stayed 2 nights in September 2014. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. The staff was fantastic. We arrived later than planned and beyond their normal shuttle time to the local train station on the first day. After checking in and getting settled, they gladly whisked us off to the local train station anyway. The day was not lost as we exited right at the Coliseum and enjoyed the rest of the day and early evening. The car, as promised was waiting for us when we returned and brought us back to the hotel. BTW, tickets for the rail service sold right at the front desk. (I found the rail here to be the best value in all Italy) Because of the free parking and shuttle service, my vehicle remained unmoved until I checked out. No need to try and navigate the narrow streets of Rome. Breakfast was wonderful at the hotel, drinks at the bar when we returned, even local takeout ordered by the night clerk Davide (hope I got his name right) all make the service here outstanding in my opinion. The pool area and landscaping were very inviting. With only 2 days in Rome and so much left to see and taste I can't wait to return and see my new friends Fabrizio and Stefano again at the Hotel Castle in the near future. Keep up the good work friends!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 3 nights in September 2014. We arrived at Roma Termini via train and the hotel had arranged a car waiting for us at the train station. The hotel is family owned so the service is incredible, the staff was extremely helpful. The rooms are clean and big. Breakfast is included and very plentiful. They have a car service in the morning that'll take you to the train station ( 15mins ride and you are in the heart of Rome) and there is someone waiting for you at the train station when you come back in the evening and it's all free! We had an early 6am flight so we left around 4am and they still had pastries and coffee available for us. Will for sure return and highly recommended for future travelers.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a four day reservation at Hotel Castle and had wonderful stay in mid September. What is truly remarkable about this hotel is the outstanding service. The staff did everything possible to make our stay pleasant and accommodate our needs. Special thanks go to Fabrizio and Attilio for helping us in every regard and the drivers who were waiting for us at the train station every evening to take us to the hotel. I recommend taking the hotel's taxi service from either Termini or the airport. We tried to go by metro/train from Termini but it was too difficult to do. The woman at the Termini information desk was rude and unhelpful and even tried to discourage us from staying at Hotel Castle ("your hotel is not in Rome!"). This is not true, but it is best to take a taxi to the hotel and once there the staff will orient you on how best to travel to Rome and back. The rooms were comfortable, quiet and very clean. The breakfast was plentiful and varied. I would definitely stay here again and highly recommend it to others.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed the Castle Hotel with my partner after a cruise, the Hotel Castle is truly deserving of the rating it has on trip advisor. The hotel is out of the bustle of Rome's city centre but very accessible especially with the shuttle service the hotel provides back and forth to the local station, from there a short train journey brings you to the centre.The hotel and the rooms are bright and so fresh and clean. The rooms have all the amenities and more you need when away from home and efficient air-con. A great breakfast is served and the pool area is beautiful and relaxing.The staff could not be more helpful and charming, I would recommend this hotel to everyone. During our stay everyone constantly commented on how great the hotel is and on how great the staff are.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed here for my birthday and had a amazing time the two guys here are so helpful nothing is to much trouble the hotel is very clean and decorated very well all the little extras in the bathroom were a nice surprise would recommend this hotel to everyone I knowPLEASE ALL BE AWARE WHEN GETTING ON THE TUBE IN ROME CENTRE THE PICKPOCKETS ARE VERY QUICK GIRLS DONT CARRY A BAG AT ALL IF USING A BACKPACK PADLOCK IT
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really can't say enough good things about this hotel. Great location, helpful staff, delicious breakfast, and a swimming pool which was absolutely lovely to use under the hot Roman sun in July. We are going to recommend this to all of our friends who will be visiting Rome, as you simply can't beat the value, location, and quality.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. To say the staff are exceptional doesn't cover it. Always attentive at breakfast, a cheery welcome, helped to book trips out using their PC and printer to save queues in Rome, will do anything to help (including ordering us a takeaway when the local restaurant was shut!). Was my boyfriends birthday and our anniversary and they let us have an upgraded room. Great to be located out of the busy center as its calmer and has a swimming pool and it is only 15 minutes to Rome on the train (with a free shuttle to the station in the morning and evening) Free wi-fi, comfy and clean rooms. Effective aircon which in peak of summer was needed! 10/10 - an absolutely fantastic hotel, thank you so much!!!!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Swimming, fab breakfast and the amazing shuttle service run by lovely family....all for free...we could not get over this place...rooms so clean and spacious...3 nights here paying so little for hotel with 2 stars that should really be 4 stars..loads of parking but forget your car because you won't need it....this is the perfect place to stay to see Rome...a wonderful family run establishment that really needs to be put on the map...situated 15 minute train ride into the centre..tickets 1.5 euro return...buy at reception in hotel...they take you to station in car and then pick up again turning up to meet all trains coming in....all part of service....this is the kind of place you really look forward to coming home to after hours of sight seeing and walking...wonderful..
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We discovered Hotel Castle on trip advisor and opted to stay here rather than central Rome down to price difference in busy July. Whereas it is a little way out of Central Rome the free shuttle service to local train station compensates. Our room was spotless and comfortable, the twin beds were narrow and our feet dangled out the end but we found this to be the case everywhere we stayed in Italy. What sets this Hotel apart is the excellent customer service. Family run, friendly and helpful staff ensure all needs are met, even down to selling train tickets. The breakfast was sensational, coffee excellent .. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights in this hotel. The staff was fantastic, went way beyond the basics to make sure our stay was comfortable. In the morning, they drove us to the train station so we could head into the city, and were waiting for us when we arrived back again. They gave wonderful recommendations for restaurants, and explained clearly how to get around the area. The room was nicely appointed and had a modern feel to it. The only negative at all for us was that the mattress was a bit too hard for us. We found it difficult to sleep comfortably and soundly. If you prefer hard mattresses, this would be the perfect hotel for you. Overall, we were delighted with our stay there.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in the suburbs but as promised by other trip advisor reviewers the hotel offers a free shuttle service to the train station and we were in the centre of Rome within half an hour! A three day ticket for the train was sold by the hotel at 16.50 euros. They also collect you from the train station and a car is waiting for every train from 6pm -11pm. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. Another plus was free parking and a pool! I would not hesitate to recommend to others- if you are looking for a reasonably priced friendly hotel in a quiet residential area and don't mind a little bit of public transport thrown in then try this hotel.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff attentiveness and overall facility were fantastic. It was easy to get to the train into Rome and they dropped us off and picked us up--even sold the train tickets there at the hotel. This was really a 5-star location, but for only one reason I must downgrade it to 4-stars. The reason is the mattress is way too hard (I mean really hard!) making it difficult to get a good night's sleep. If they put better mattresses in, I would have no hesitation giving them 5-stars and returning again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed with our family of four (children aged 13 and 7). The rooms were clean and spacious, but more importantly, the hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Free shuttle to nearest train stop (urban line), which will get you into downtown Rome within 20 mins, plus they sell tickets at the hotel. Internet and breakfast included. Highly recommend for future visits.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights in this lovely little hotel. The staff was very helpful (they bring us when we need to the train station to go to the down town.Clean room, nice breakfast and cheap this is the perfect deal to visit Rome for a good price.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Castle
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in Odiniese this new, modern hotel provides a good base to explore Rome. Well organised, spacious rooms and a straightforward breakfast makes this hotel definitely 5 star. Only 7 minutes to the Pyramide metro which gets you into the centre of Rome easily. Plenty of bars, restaurants and the best ice cream shop in Rome nearby. We will return.
hotelName:
13    Gasometer Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property seems to be my 1st accomodation place in Rome which is not old. Modern interior, good service, enough scuare meters. It is a bit a way from the main atracction of Roma but easy to rich by public transport (reccomend to idę moovit app).
hotelName:
13    Gasometer Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 3 nights in this new hotel and so far has been the best hosting experience in Rome I had.It is a brand new building with design forniture, young and nice staff, spacious rooms and good facilities.The location in also nice in the piramide neighborhood with a lot of good bars and restaurants.Absolutely recommend
hotelName:
13    Gasometer Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very enjoyable stay at Gasometer - good service from all the front desk receptionists. Hotel seems very brand new and the room is huge compared to other hotels in Rome. Breakfast is also good with selection of good and hot items. Would reccomend it. Only negative side is that the hotel is not in the centre but there is a metro near by approximately 10 minutes by walk.
hotelName:
13    Gasometer Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a trip to Rome with my girlfriend and we chose this hotel based on its proximity to the city and sights. However, the rooms and the hospitality exceeded my expectations. Huge rooms with a fantastic shower. Nice shades and furnishings and an overall sense of good taste. All the reception staff was very helpful and really gave us tips to go around Rome and for that matter, around Italy
hotelName:
13    Gasometer Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at gasometer for 4 nights in September. Really modern rooms, super clean. Reception staff very friendly!Located just outside of the touristy areas so if you want to stay where the locals live then this is ideal. We ate at local restaurants which were reasonably priced, gasometro 34 in the next street to the hotel was amazing food, would highly recommend. Porto Fluviale is a restaurant over the road from the hotel which has a lovely outdoor area too! Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
13    Gasometer Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really well appointed hotel, friendly staff can speak English, my Italian is rubbish, free soft drinks and snacks in reception, bottled water in room fridge.Breakfast was included and good coffee and usual continental breakfast.Modern and just great. Location also really good, maybe 10 to 15 minute walk to train but the area is good, some excellent local bars and restaurants.Highly recommended
hotelName:
13    Gasometer Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My girlfriend found this hotel, and I was a bit skeptical about it because it didn’t have many reviews, but it turned out to be the best hotel I’ve stayed on in my life so far:-) The location is great because it is only 2 - 10 minutes away from restaurants, cafes and a loca supermarket.If you need to visit Via Del Corso, which is a huge open market, you can take the bus. The route took 15 - 20 minutes.
hotelName:
13    Gasometer Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just stayed at Gasometer Urban Suites for two nights. The hotel just opened a week or so ago and somehow we scored finding this place! Not only was everything brand new but the bed was so comfortable and the place was quiet - just what we needed after long days of being tourists. Tiziana at the front desk made our stay even better as she made check in easy and always was there to answer any questions we had and provided us tips on where to eat. I recommend this place to anyone traveling for business or pleasure.
hotelName:
13    Gasometer Urban Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice stay as part of a large tour group. Not really close to anything, but for the last night before flying home, this place was quiet, modern, and served up a quality and substantial breakfast buffet. Some of the kids on our tour were delighted with their multi-room suites with balconies, though others had some issues with other guests being loud and/or semi-clothed. Not an issue with the hotel though. In fact, the reception staff should be complimented for not continually rolling their eyes or hiding at the noise our group made in the lobby when checking in and waiting for our bus to the airport.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel provides transfer service to and from central Rome,But you can get one way in 1.50 euro. From hotel take bus B 447 or 437 up to Rababia same ticket is valid for total journey time of 100min in bus and underground which gives you plenty of time to reach to your favourite destinations. Hotel staff are very friendly they gave us all the idea. Depending upon what we want to do, they even suggested best places to eat we tried them and they were nice. If you fancy eating near hotel there is a place called PBP where you can eat, or can eat in hotel bar. Lidl is about 15 min walk away from hotel. Hope this helps.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Domidea Hotel for two nights in April.Found the room to be comfortable and the services also good.Complimentary breakfast was adequate - although there weren't all my favorite foods, breakfast was ok
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did enjoy to stay in this hotel, breakfast was very good, large room and bathroom, kind and open personal, very good parking in hotel area, feel safe, close to the shooping center, far from center but no problem for who has car.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent place for the money. Two bed room was spacious. Didn't eat breakfast there, so not sure how it was. Don't eat at the 999 place next door. Terrible food, buffet style, all dried out and disgusting. Staff at hotel are friendly and helpful. Room was very clean. Check your credit card afterwards though. I had a charge they could not explain. In fact, said it wasn't there, but they charged me $22.31 three days after my stay. Had to dispute it since they couldn't explain it or reverse it. Easy walk to bus stop.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent one night at this hotel on our way to Rome. I must say the room was huge and the bed quite comfortable. Bathroom was normal, it also has a fridge with some stuff in it. Staff was friendly and always ready to help. The real problem is during breakfast, dining room is crowded and it’s kind of difficult to get some food. Next to the hotel there is a restaurant probably same hotel’s owner, has some interesting dishes suggest visiting it. Clearly T’s avoid it if you wish to visit Rome, it’s far despite the fact there are some buses that ride you downtown
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was perfect.Ms Martina in reception, Condition of the rooms, Brekfest, we are planning to visit this hotel next time and recommend it for our friends. We were a group of 12 people and everyone of them has the same opinion.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: And by that i mean littterally other side of the world. The location wouldn't have been such an issue if not for the hotels lies on their website. The words "courtesy car" in English in their website mean: "free ride to the nearest metro station" it does not mean we will receive you and abandon you in a dangerous refugee area of Rome and then when u arrive you will discover that we are going to charge you a fortune for a ride to the nearest metro.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Domidea is a lovely hotel. It clean, with very pleasant staff. The breakfast was lovely each morning and is served from very early. My only problem is that it is very far out of the city. It is easy to reach the city, bus stop next to the hotel which takes you straight to the Metro station. Metro's are frequent and very cheap. It took about 45 mins to get from the hotel to the city center. I felt that once you made this trip in the morning you wouldn't make it again in the evening. Normally we would do a days sight seeing and return to the hotel and get showered and changed and head out again. With the Domidea by the time you got back to the Hotel we found we couldn't face going back through the bus and metro again. This may be just us but I wouldn't stay there again. Its a lovely hotel, staffed by very pleasant professional people, its just its location that lets it down.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel, located outside but train station 2 mins away. Lovely staff, clean but little noisy room to room. Breakfast was great with lots of choice. Remember there is a city tax to pay on top of the price, so bargains on booking.com need this factored in
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice big room and just want we needed. It is classed as a business hotel however didn't really know the difference little out of Rome and takes about 45 minutes to get there. Can get the metro blue line to rebibbia and then get the 437 or 447 bus to the hotel pretty easy. Breakfast also included which was great and desk staff really helpful :) and good price!
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I committed to staying in this hotel for 3 nights. The room for 3 people is spacious, clean and comfortable. The young lady on reception is lovely.Unfortunately I must bring my own food to the hotel due to an allergy. I asked if I may borrow some plates, mugs and cutlery for the room but was denied without a reason. In addition to the room costs we had to drive to a supermarket to purchase a kettle (no kettles in the room?) plates, mugs, cutlery, a chopping board and knife as advised by a supervisor/manager. We also tried unsuccessfully for some ice but were told we would have to wait until the evening when the bar opens because not one staff member in this hotel can walk behind the bar and fill a bowl of ice. After spending hundreds of euros for 3 nights in this hotel and with a service promise to make our stay as comfortable as possible, we feel unwelcome in this hotel.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a beautiful business hotel, unfortunately in an industrial area. However, the public transportation is simple to maneuver and, with the exception of the strike one day, readily accessible and available. Giulea is a wonderful asset to the hotel. She seemed to always be there to answer our questions and assist us in anything we needed...we were a party of six in three separate rooms.Our one complaint about the hotel is the location. With the exception of breakfast, there is a limited dining choice nearby. There is a dinner bar buffet, but it is only opened on weekdays. The Chinese buffet next door is ok, but not for every meal (we were there five nights). There are some choices about a one mile walk away, however, for elderly visitors that might not be a feasible option. The hotel is modern, clean, and welcoming. The staff is knowledgable and helpful. The breakfast buffet and weekday bar dinner buffets are great, with options for all. If you don't mind using public transportation, this is a great deal during your stay in Rome.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time I've stayed here with a group and it was just as good as the last time. The rooms are large and the showers have ample hot water. A huge bonus is the wonderful selection of breakfast foods!! Not close to the city center but is worth it. Group consisted of teenagers so there is no trouble for them to get into which is another bonus.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here 4 nights recently. Firstly this place is in the middle of nowhere if you're visiting as a tourist it's easily 30 minutes plus by cab to the city off peak. It's over 60 minutes to get to the airport.Now, the rooms. The place is in need of a refurbishment. Air conditioning didn't work and there was no heating. We were cold during our entire stay and got sick. The dinner buffet was empty and we had to go elsewhere at 9pm. Ridiculous. There isn't even tea and coffee in the room.Not even a mug or kettle.The place is an outcamp for the localPolice who are constantly around in droves. Walls are paper thin and we could hear conversations and more from other rooms.Made a big mistake booking here and won't recommend it to anyone.Definitely not a 4 star in my books or worth the price. Very disappointing experience.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights during a recent business trip and hotel was worth the money. Spacious rooms, great variety for breakfast and 2 nice restaurants next door (Chinese/Oriental and Italian). Would definitely recommend staying here and only 8.5 miles from Rome Ciampino airport. My only complaint was the bed which was quite hard and left me with a sore back for a few days but overall a good 7/8 out of 10.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 2 nights at the Domidea and had a great stay. All the staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was large and very clean. The hotel is slightly out of the city centre but has excellent transport links that makes getting to the city centre very easy.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was great time for the family to spend there, great location and nice staff trying to help all guest, every thing was cleaned and everybody feel the special attention treated, the one thing need to be improved is the breakfast which we didn't found any type of cheese in there.thank you all
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is pleasant enough, with good size rooms and a decent breakfast. unfortunately it is a long way from the City Centre ( about E25 from the main train station). There is a bus from near the hotel to the nearest railway station, but it only seems to run every half hour, and the train line was closed at the weekend, so had to take another bus - all in all over 1 hour from the centre
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went as part of a group on package, the hotel was very clean and the staff were all very polite and helpful. The hotel was quite away out from the Rebbibia metro and it didn't help that the bus service had to detour because of road closures and then when we did catch one of the busses recommended it didn't actually stop at the hotel. My friend and I then had to be told to get on the bus behind which took us so far before being instructed to get off and which direction to follow to the hotel on foot!The room we had was basic but very clean but my biggest negative was there was no kettle for making my normal hot water or a cup of tea/coffee. After a long day of walking it would have been nice to come back to being able to have a nice hot drink.I did ask for a hot water which was kindly provided unfortunately this did not taste very nice (it had a peculiar taste which was very unpleasant). Perhaps not a fault of the hotel, maybe water in Rome?! The water from the drink machine at breakfast was fine!If you're staying at this hotel be prepared for your eyes to be opened by its surroundings as we thought it a very run down area and somewhat dirty (I think we're spoiled in England)! I thought my bed was very comfortable but my friend thought hers was too hard, can't please everyone I suppose!Unfortunately you can't eat at the hotel for an evening meal, we were told to visit next door for food, but the menu was quite pricey for food that didn't appeal. We bought crisps at the corner shop!As said nice hotel, pleasant polite staff, more a business hotel (I believe) but needs to think of the weary traveler if putting their business to them on deals etc.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reason why I booked this place is because of the many good reviews of customer service!! And that's what this place is!! Exceptional customer service very friendly and inviting!! It makes visiting a foreign country not so foreign if you know what I mean!! Yes it is a little ways from town but they have a bus route right down the road you pay 1.50 Euros and it takes you to the subway which you than you catch the subway using the same ticket straight to the heart of everything!! It's very simple and easy!! And plus side note for all y'all big people out there, I'm a big guy and I hate walking but this was not to bad for me. There is also a little shop/bar like right down the road where you purchase your bus ticket on the same block which stays open 24/7 which of course sells drinks and sandwiches incase you get a little hungry at night or can't sleep so a few shots will remedy your insomnia. One thing is remember to have a little cash in hand as you will not be able to use foreign cards there from my experience. Also before I forget. Additional side not just incase seeing as this place is pretty far from the airport, Iv come to realise that any kinda of shuttle transportation or anything of that nature is super expensive! When you arrive unless you have the money and are willing. Do watch out for individuals at the airport offering their service!! They are a ripoff and can be very convincing with their words and sometimes looks. Haha but iv found that the cheapest way is either call an uber which will still be expensive but not so expensive as the airport shuttles will charge or, you can arrange with the hotel before hand to have them pick you up.. either option is the same price which if I remember correctly is 60 euros one way. Anyways place is nice!! Free breakfast in the morning all you can eat on the first floor, food served is yummy!! well maintained and clean, it's safe as you will come to know, there is police everywhere lol sometimes I think some of them actually stay there as I always see them every hours of the day lounging around haha.. and once again exceptional customer service!! Enjoyed our stay here. Definitely recommend.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was Perfect and more than GREAT. All the staff were really friendly, helpful and professional (receptionists, waiters,cleaners,shuttle bus driver) . Me and my three daughters especially loved mrs Gulia at the reception. The prices were really reasonable comparing with other hotels in Rome).The 2 rooms we had were clean and very comfortable.The breakfast was delicious and variety.We also had fantastic dinners.We stay in the hotel for 6 days and always there was space for our car to park.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visit the hotel for 3 days with my family and i was very satisfied of the cleanses and of their big room, breakfast very good!!CLEAN AND TIDY HOTEL!!! Only the the distance was little far from the center of Rome but the bus and metro station was very easy to get there.Excellent choice for business people.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a very comfortable and clean room for 4 people. Hotel staff were very helpful and always ready to assist. A good selection offered for breakfast. Wifi is available for free but is rather slow.The location of the hotel is close to motorway and only about 15 min away by car to the nearest metro station but the neighbourhood is not ideal for say taking a walk after dinner. The hotel could do with a games room or a pool table.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great hotel for relaxing and business but if you are thinking to be close to city center I won't recommend this hotel.But overall, rooms and architecture was great. Staff were really helpful and kind.The nearest public transportation is a bus stop about 300m walk away.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 5 days during October with our 2 children.The rooms were spacious with a mini bar and a balcony.We stayed in a comfort room .(free shuttle to Metro included)We also enjoyed the complimentary wine ( when you book directly through the hotel website).Unfortunately there were no coffee or tea making facility in the room.The reception staff was very friendly and helpful.( even printed out tickets for the Vatican muscium)Breakfast was very good with good choice. As it is not mass produced food tasted better ,especially the scrambled eggs.The shuttles to the Rebibia metro station is an added benifial. We used it every day in the morning ( pre booking required ).The buses out side will also take you to the metro (447,437).It's about 30 min away from Central Rome and with regular buses and metro trains we did not find the location problamatic.There is a supermarket few bus stops pass the hotel(447) .The restaurants near by but we ate most of the time in Rome centre resturants.We also did a Day trip to Florence and certainly recommend it.Overall I would definitely recommend this 4 star hotel as a good base for visiting Rome.Hope to return to the Domidea hotel again as we could not throw a Colin to the Trevi fountain as it was closed for renavation!
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel but way out of the center. Not really a problem public transport is oke Takes about 30 minutes ex the wait time to get to termini. Room oke We booked through booking.com. the pictures of the room were not the same as the room we got. The desk told us that it were pictures of a 4 pers room So be aware. The shuttle service is non existent
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Concierge upon arrival left a very bad impression from the start. Having arrived from a delayed terrible flight, I was looking forward to just relaxing. However, when I was being checked in by a lady named Teresa, she was not very welcoming and not very helpful at all. Unless you are there on business, I suggest you not stay here AT ALL. The room was so stuffy, there were no windows you could open - the air-conditioner was a complete FAILURE. It wasn't functioning properly throughout the night we couldn't sleep! We overheard a couple complaining about the same thing the same night we stayed. Never again. The only friendly people that were there was the bell boy and their van driver, otherwise, I would never stay here again. The location is so far from the city centre and the surrounding neighbourhood was pretty scary!
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the location was terrible. amongst graffiti on crumbling buildings and some kind of slum area with people appearing to live in shacks just a mile way. It was also about 25 minutes drive (25 euros in a taxi) from the attractions of Rome. Once in the centre of Rome, some taxi drivers refused to take us to the hotel because of its location. The hotel hallways had red carpets with dark stains on. the bedroom had a view of the wall of the kitchens with steel pipework 3 metres from us. The bed was two singe beds and two single mattresses pushed together. it came apart slightly if we moved and made sleep uncomfortable. The shower was tiny and barely enough room for one person. It was also very slippery and I fell over nearly putting my leg through the glass. The only good things were the breakfast buffet which offered a large range of food and the reception staff. They were very helpful, very polite and were always happy to help us with any questions or advice about where to go for food etc. They staff were lovely but the hotel was not. I would never recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was extremely good in terms of; cleanliness, professionalism, quality and value for money! The only problem with Hotel Domidea is its location. It is located very far outside the centre of Rome, with travelling to and from the hotel taking a while, in order to visit the main attractions of Rome. However, the transport services to and from the hotels location and the centre of Rome are very efficient. A bus stop is located just around the corner from the hotel, which takes you to rebibbia metro station, which takes you to the centre of Rome. The transport is also very cheap, which is always a bonus!! If I was to revisit Rome in the future, I wouldn't stay at this hotel again, only based on it being too far from the centre of Rome. However, as it is a business hotel, I would recommend it for any travellers to Rome, who are on business rather than pleasure.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is definitely outside the city, but we were traveling in a group and the rooms were huge! The breakfast was very good and had significant choices. We had a chartered bus so the distance was not a problem for us. Traveling with high school kids was great since there was no where else for them to go.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a nice hotel, however, there is NO way this is a four star hotel. It is clan and neat. Book online as the reception tries to charge more for breakfast, parking ect. It is a good 2.5, 3 star at best. Not sure why it's marked four star. No pool, fitness, or anything extra, very basic and far from the city. Its a great 2 star hotel in US
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Following raving review of this hotel on Booking.com, I booked this hotel relying on other people' comments. OK, we drove from London as we preferred to do so, rather than fly like all our other holidays. The journey was not 16 hours like the brochures say. Be warned on this, as it also costs an arm and a leg in toll charges and extra fuel as well.We were late for our hotel check-in so we called ahead.We arrived on our day of check in at around mid night. We kept calling the hotel reception asking for directions. Small details like where we were in relation to where we were going would have helped rather than being asked have you passed the Tolls yet. Domidea Hotel is down as 4 Star Hotel. Certainly, it deserves its star rating. Having always stayed in 4 star and above, the hotel has the ambience of a 4 star, in both value and facilities. Reception staff on arrial were very helpful and knowldgeble as well as we needed to save time on deciding on where to go next day. Staff gave us appropriate information in terms, of shuttle bus from hotel to Rebbibea Train Metro Station and sites to visit. The free shuttle from the hotel to the metro station only runs early morning and stops at 09:30. The is a Bus stp round the corner with 2 buses direct to Rebbibea Metro Station. There are 2 buses but not always regular.Breakfast is a typical Mediterrenian Breakfast....not our usual UK fry up. There is tea and plenty of coffee. There seemed to be only one waiter on hand, albeit sufficient for a small hotel. Breakfast consisted mainly of sweet cakes and fruit on the side. There were 4 different types of fresh juices. Plenty of water even to take away.Our only negative about the hotel is that travelling with a baby, our baby needed to have his bottles sterilised and we do this in the microwave. The waiter allowed my Wife to use the common microwave but when one of the reception female memmber found out, we got told off and we stopped. Fortunately we were leaving the next day.There is a Restaurant nearby, Food is Love but it was shut when we were there. There is also a bar and restuarant 777, which aslo was closed. Both closed for summer holidays. Not very helpful that was. We then had to walk in the middle of the night to a nearby restaurant (Tito) which was recommened by hotel staff. The next day, we found it easier to drive there. I will review the restaurant separately.We will be returning to this hotel next year. Overall the hotel is good value for money!
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The title says it all really. Hotel Domidea offers excellent value for money. The rooms are finished to a very good standard and are immaculately cleaned, every day. The service is the real stand our in this hotel though. The staff are warm, approachable and incredibly helpful. Breakfast was fab- a good selection of continental favourites. It would be nice however to have a little more of a hot choice. The only downside to this hotel is it's location. It is a considerable journey from the centre of Rome. Requiring a short walk, a bus and a metro train. Once you get in the routine however, thus is not a problem. I will go out of my way to stay there again. I will probably hire a car next time!
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a "Red light" district, some distance away from the nearest Metro terminus. We found a distinct lack of places to eat at night other than the odd cafe/bar style food. There was a recommended place next door however most of the menu was crossed off & priced high. The "free" mini shuttle bus to the metro was charged for on the final bill!! We found the sights of Rome wonderful ...but watch out for "pickpockets" we were robbed of my wallet cash & cards, police said it is common. Taxi drivers say they have no meters & charge almost twice the proper fee to tourists. Be prepared to queue for 2-3 hours to see the Vatican which is miles away from the hotel. Overall the hotel is in an industrial area well away from the centre of Rome so most of the day is spent traveling to & fro on filthy overcrowded graffiti smitten underground systems .On the positive side the most helpful member of staff being the multi lingual barman who was so helpful & knowledgeable (Diran)We would not return to such an out of town place, our nights were spoiled not being able to enjoy evenings in Rome!!!We did loose some clothes too? & if late to your breakfast 8-30am no orange juice or bread left. (breakfast opens & closes 6.30 -10 am)
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a modern, very nice hotel but is far removed from most of what you want to see in Rome. I'll base my comparison of this hotel on the American hotels I frequent but that will not figure into the ratings. It's just so that those in America planning a trip have some idea what to expect.I stayed here in March and it was the first hotel my wife and I stayed in of the 4 throughout Italy and this was my favorite based solely on the hotel room. The room was large, like suite large, with a nice sitting area, fairly large bathroom with a great shower, nice bed (although a bit hard for the wifes taste), free wi-fi that you could access in the room and the only hotel that allowed us to set the air conditioning in the room. Breakfast was typical continental for Italy which was prociutto, cheese, bread, and a wide selection of pastry, cake and fruit. Do not expect eggs because none of the hotels provided any type of eggs. There was also american style coffee, espresso, cappucino, hot chocolate and a variety of juices and the sitting area for breakfast was large enough to sit 40 people. There was also a small bar area that had hot food at the front of the hotel but I didn't explore that at all so besides telling you it's there I can't provide much. The staff was friendly and efficient, not overly so but not mechanical either.The worst part of this hotel was the location as it's about 30 min or more drive time from the sights in Rome and the Vatican.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was a little off the beaten path but was otherwise great. Breakfast was great for a continental breakfast. Room was large but otherwise very modern. Wifi worked great! Highly recommend as long as you have transportation into the city accounted for.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a week here with family and it was a nice hotel, the room and breakfast were adequate, the shuttle service was useful when we discovered it but it was a fair distance from the nearest station and far from the city centre - not ideal for tourists.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a week in this hotel during New Year holidays. I would like to start with the location, which was unbelievably inconvenient. This is not Rome, it suburbs and definately not a very safe one. If you are travelling without a car, you will have to spend about 45 minutes on the metro to get from the centre, then wait for 15-20 minutes for a bus and finally have a bumpy ride for 15 minutes in it. If you don't want to be robbed, I also won't recommend you to return later than 10 o"clock and try to conceal any packages from expensive boutiques. There is absolutely nothing near the hotel except for a gas station, casino and a club Cleopatra, which suspiciosly look like a stripclub.The rooms are not very big, poorly furnished, with very very uncomfortable small beds and tiny TV. Our air conditioneer didn't work properly, so the tempreture was a surprise: we could wake up in the middle of the night because it's suddenly 15 degrees and freezing or on the opposite because it started to raise the temperature up to +29. To be fair I should mention, that the room was however always clean.When you leave the room check your lockers on the luggage twice, because we sometimes had a strong feeling that someone was looking through our stuff.As for breakfast, I think it is a very big word for that dry ration that they give to you (no hot meal, sometimes even no cheese for bread, only lots of kinds of bread and buns).In the conclusion I would like to say that maybe in some cases it worth to visit this hotel but only for its reasonable price, for a short period and ONLY if you have your own car.It is definately not a 4 star hotel, max 3-.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we booked the hotel under the pretense that we would be able to sleep 7 people in one of the suites. When the hotel found out that we would be 4 adults and 3 children, they made us pay for another room, even if it was only for one night. We paid 151 euro for one night in a room that was way too big for two adults and two children. The rooms were huge by European standards and very clean. The wifi worked okay. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. However, they really do mean it when they say "only 4 people" despite the fact that the couch turns into a futon and you can sleep 7 comfortably. I would not stay here. We've had better hotels for less money.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a total let-down and is no way anywhere close to the claimed four-star level. The rooms are small, my laptop screen is bigger than the tiny television, the shower is flimsy and lacking in hot water, there is no assistance for luggage, parking is minimal, the breakfast does not measure up, and the internet is a joke.I booked two rooms. One was a Double (Single Use), and it was clearly marked as such. There was even one single silhouette so there was no confusion. The other room was a Double Use, there were two silhouettes, and there was no mention of single use. When we arrived, we were told there would be a 25 euro fee for the second person in the second room. I complained, and I was told that it doesn't matter what is said online, this was their policy. I looked again and saw that the same room for two people was only 10 euros more than the room for one person. I had to fight and enlist Agoda's help, but I did finally get the price reduced to 10 euros more per night instead of the 25 euro.This hotel is listed as a business hotel. For a business hotel, the internet was unusable the entire first day. I got online, and it took me an hour to send three short e-mails responses (I had to wait and wait for the messages to actually be sent.) Then it died completely. I went to the staff, and they insisted it was working, suggesting I should come to the lobby. I showed them it wasn't working, then they realized that their own internet was not working. At this point, the receptionist literally threw up his hands and bluntly told me that the manager would be in at 10:00 AM the next morning, and he would have to take care of it. As a "business" hotel, we need internet. Not having it is unsatisfactory. Aside from business, I check out restaurants on Tripadvisor to make sure we pick good ones, and I could not. Hence, we just picked four at random, and only one was adequate. As I had no internet, I had to make three toll free calls. The hotel charged 3 euros each for a free call, even if their internet caused the issue.One reason we picked this hotel is that it supposedly had parking. The hotel has 89 rooms, but less than 20 parking spaces. We had to park out on the road away from the hotel as all the spaces were taken by 6:00 PM.The hotel website indicates that they have a free shuttle to the nearest metro station. What they fail to mention is that the shuttle does not seem to be available much, and it is only free if you have an upgraded room. For the standard room, you have to pay.I have never stayed in a four-star hotel nor a business hotel that did not have CNN, CNBC, BBC, or some international news. There was one English-language station that showed standard entertainment series, and that was it. Of course, with the tiny screen, even that one channel was pretty much unwatchable unless you sat at the end of the bed.On a more minor note, the reservation was supposed to be all inclusive as far as price, but there was an additional three euros per head per night tax added to the bill.Service was impersonal and even rude. The cleaning ladies were nice, and the early morning receptionist went out of her way to be helpful, using her iPhone to pull some phone numbers off the internet. I wish I had her name as she was a bright spot in this very disappointing stay.All told, this hotel was extremely substandard for what is was supposed to be. I cannot recommend to anyone that they should stay at the hotel.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two nights and were upgraded to a comfort room so cannot comment on the standard rooms. Our room was enormous, two double wardrobes, plenty of drawers, full length mirror. We had a small balcony which looked out over the bus depot next door, however it you looked further there were views of the countryside around Rome. Our bathroom was lovely, large shower cubicle, brilliant shower with hot water, plenty of towels and there was lots of storage space for toiletries. Breakfast was good, plenty of choice. The coffee was a bit of an issue as there was only one machine so there was a waiting time. There was filter coffee but it was not fresh, this is what british and german people like and maybe they should consider making coffee pots available to save queuing at the machine. That said, it was a good breakfast and I would recommend this hotel for business travel and for visiting Rome if you are fairly self reliant and happy to use public transport. The price was really good, I had paid more to stay in a so called 4 star in Latina the night before and this hotel is way above the standard of that hotel. Just one thing though, the public areas have strange doors that look as though they belong in a sports centre.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All in all, this was a comfortable quite location with a very good breakfast for most places in Italy. They had a lovely buffet that did not run out of food every a.m.! Staff was pretty helpful for little things we needed and questions in general. We stayed in Rm 128, which was small but adequate for two people. it had good closet and drawer space. The biggest downside of this hotel it that it is at the END of one of the tram lines PLUS you then have to take a 15 min. bus ride to the hotel. We figured we spent at least 90-120 min each day traveling back and forth to get to the highlights of Rome that we really wanted to see. We probably did not save enough money overall to make it worth the extra cost of the transportation either.We had one issue with the room. Every night the AC went off automatically so we had to get up at 12:15am and turn it back on because there were no screens on the windows and bugs that would have come in, so we had to leave it on.Next time we go to Rome we will for sure stay closer to the actual city rather than a hotel with nothing but a restaurant and bar close by.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel last May 2012 and was quite impressed with the hotel. Location wise it was about 10/15 mins drive from the nearest metro but the hotel provided a shuttle service which solved that distance problem. We liked its location of next door to a restuarant as well as a mini supermarket where we were able to buy all our food without relying heavily on the hotel food. Rooms were clean, spacious and new and would recommend this hotel again and again!
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled as a family group in two rooms, From the moment we arrived to the moment we checked out the service was impeccable. The rooms were spacious, comfortable and extremely clean. You will have read reviews saying it is too far out and in an industrial area etc. Rest assured it is very easily accessible by public transport or the free hotel shuttle. Personally I dont check into hotels to look out the window and watch the world go by, so I am not bothered by the view being a semi industrial one. If you are looking for a 4+ star experience at a reasonable price you cant go past it.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my third stay at the Domidea, and unlike other hotels it's quality is consistently high. All the staff I encountered have a good command of English - great for us lazy brits (myself included) who often cannot be bothered to learn a second language.They are always polite and friendly, and nothing is ever too much trouble.In particular the barman, while always professional and courteous is also quite happy to chat in between serving other customers, and will point out new beers he has in stock for you to try.The young lady in the breakfast room is equally excellent at all she does, single-handedly (or so it appears) supplying a vast array of meats, pastries and other typical continental fare with spotlessly clean tables, cutlery and crockery. Equally as friendly and welcoming as the barman (but much more attractive!!!!). Personally I have not encountered the "really long queues" for breakfast as commented by one reviewer, although once it was a "little busy". Having said that, I am usually having breakfast just after 6:30 when it opens!!!!I have stayed in three different types of rooms, the one for this visit being a quite small room on the ground floor. Not a problem for me on business on my own, but possibly a little cramped for a couple on holiday where you are more likely to spend time in the room than I. For me, however, even the smallest room was perfect. Again, like the rest of the hotel, it was spotlessly clean, great shower (possibly a minus for people who like baths - I am not sure if any rooms have baths.) and a comfortable bed.Love the free wi-fi with no fiddly passwords on small phones, great signal in the room and in the public areas and no "one device only" restriction.A minor downside is that other than for breakfast, the hotel has no restaurant of its own. However, there is a resaurant literally less than a minute walk from the hotel, (for a UK reader, you will know what I mean when I say "like a Premier Inn"). I have never used the restaurant so I cannot comment. The reason being is that the bar serves 5 or 6 different pasta dishes, and I find them quite tasty and the quantity is just right. And two of the three times I have visited this hotel I have been on my own, and I really cannot be bothered to sit in a restaurant waiting heaven knows how long for a meal to come. Whereas the pasta at the bar arrives in an easy 10 minutes - on a bad day!!!!Although I see holiday makers at the hotel, I would class it more of a business hotel - there are no nice views, no pool, no spa, but that is assuming you require such things - although a nice message would be good at the end of a long hard day in the office!!!!!!As a business hotel, I think it is absolutely excellent. Never had to even think about complaining about anything, and being what I believe to be an independant hotel, they clearly try harder than a hotel that is part of a chain. And for me, they succeed - big time.I have to confess that I found this hotel by accident - the hotel I normally stayed at was full and I was looking for another hotel in the same area or very near to it. However, the Domidea is now my first choice whenever I go to Rome. I would definately recommend it, especially to people on business.OOPS!! I mis-clicked the Fitness Centre (they don't have one) and Room Service (Not sure if they have it but if they did I did not make use of it), so PLEASE IGNORE the "Terrible" for those two items below.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a Greek so I am used in a bit maniac way of driving but I think that for the most of the tourists it' better to avoid driving in Rome. For the rest, I suggest considering Hotel Domidea as a good option for their stay in Rome. Staff is excellent. Parking and W-Fi are free, rooms are big, new and clean and the breakfast is very good. Depending on the location of the sights to visit someone can use his owned or rental car or public transport combined or not with hotel's bus.
