You need only 1,5 euro to get a 100 min. ticket and in normal conditions, about half an hour of driving or 40-45 min. of public transportation to Colosseo. However, traffic to Rome (by car) or to Rebibbia station (by bus) can be heavy. In general, I think that hotel Domidea is one of the cheapest options for a good and clean hotel at Rome.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel for a visit to Rome. Free parking which we needed, a bit out of the city center but a quick but bumpy bus ride to the Rebibbia metro station and everything is easy to access by metro. Don't forget to flag the bus you want otherwise it will just drive past...Clean, large rooms, good size bathroom and plenty of closet space. Breakfast is quite good with many options. The hotel location is a little questionable but generally feels safe.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for few days in last August. Hotel is very new and modern. (it is only couple years old). For some people location might be deal breaker, you won't get a room with the view in there. Most of the rooms have windows overlooking inside patio. But that's probably the only minus. Rooms are very modern and quite spacious, with very well furnished/finished bathrooms. Breakfast is served in 2 places: breakfast room and reception bar. In the bar you are getting barist service for duration of the breakfast. Coffes are just amazing, especially Marocchino. Bus stop is just outside hotel. It takes few minutes to get to metro (subway) station. There is also complimentary bus shuttle service. By metro you can get to all main attractions in Rome. It takes about 15 minutes to get to Colloseum. You can buy tickets next to bus stop. Nearly next door there is "discount" grocery supermarket. Bottle of water is just 15cent for 1,5 litre. For those with bit higher budget next door there is one of the best reviewed restaurants in Rome - FIL (Food is Love). If traveling by car hotel is very closeto motorway, which makes is very easy accessible.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for an affordable, yet modern hotel in Rome I would highly recommend hotel Domidea. Its slightly out of the main city center but very easy to reach by public transport. We traveled from Rome Fumicinio airport by train to the termini station for €14 each, use the fast ticket machines in the station for the cheapest tickets rather than the information and ticket desks who try to combine packages for extra money and they are not worth it. Make sure you purchase your ticket before you get on the train, once on board you cannot purchase a ticket and will be fined €50 per person if you do not have one. Also make sure you stamp your ticket before boarding, there are small green stamping machines on the platform. Once at the termini we purchased a weeks travel card for the metro, around €24 each but valid on all metros, trams and buses around Rome. We bought this from one of the newspaper stalls inside the station.We took the blue metro line as far north as it would go to Rebbibia station, then had the option of the number 473, 474 or 075 bus to take us to the stop by the hotel. The hotel does advertise a free shuttle to Rebbibia station but it is actually €1 per person but we never used it as the public transport was only a two minute walk away and free with our metro passes. In all, from the hotel to the city center it took around 35 minutes travel time which we didn't mind for the price we paid.The hotel rooms were modern and comfortable, there was a TV which picked up sky news in English but we didn't really use it. Free WiFi in the hotel was useful although signal was poor in some areas of the bedroom. We found sitting by the door was the best spot to get good signal. There was a fridge and a good sized bathroom with lovely power shower.Breakfast was good, the breakfast room is quite small but there was always a table for us and good was replenished quickly throughout the morning.We had a great holiday and would book this hotel again if we returned to Rome.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good room, we stop for one night after arriving in Rome at night to continue trip by car the next day, two adults and two kids. Family room was perfect with internet connection and very good breakfast the next morning.+ Family room.- Maybe far from Rome center.+ Easy access to Rome Highways.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Last christmas i decided to visit Rome, along with some friends.After seeking for some cheap hotels, Domidea came up, and it was my primary choice.Well, it was a pleasant stay, i enjoyed Rome very much, although it's a bit expensive city, one of the most expensive cities all over UE.About the hotel, very clean, pleasant, nice.Employees are nice and effective.Beds are cleaned every day, rooms are just big enough, along with air conditioned, tv, wireless internet, everything you could wish for.Continental breakfast is just fine, with plenty of food.The hotel price is a must.About the location, you have to drive by car, just like we did, however, not so far from the centre.There are a quite few Italian restaurants nearby.Oh, there is always free parking for the car, inside or outside the hotel.If you ever decide to go to Rome, this hotel must be one of your primary choices.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 5 nights and we were fully satisfied. We stayed in a double room in the third floor , witch was very big, modern,cozy with all the comfort that a 4 star hotel can provide you, they cleaned our room every day, it was in a quiet place, it had a 26" LCD TV, also it had free wifi. The breakfast was perfect, it consisted of EVERYTHING, saulty and sweet.The shuttle bus was very usefull, and the service hours were appropriate. The reception people were very kind to us and very helpfull. The hotel was big, new, and modern.The total price was very good.The negatives were that it was far away from the town, witch was not big problem because of the shuttle bus. It was isolated, there is only a restaurant near the hotel and a super market, but there was nothing else to do.Also the elevator many times was out of order. Last but not least, even if we asked for a double bed, our bed was consisted of two small beds united. In general, our stay was perfect, and we would choose it again.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all this hotel had a fantastic price offer for the week end. Must say that you can chose it only if you have the car since is just inside the GRA (the big ring around Rome) and is pretty hard to reach it with public transportation (by the way they have a shuttle too). On the other side I have to tell that the hotel is a very good balance price/quality. Not a super 4 stars hotel, but clean, new, good facilities (i.s. free wi-fi in the room, free parking ...). The breakfast is also good and with many things to chose (especially cakes). Well I strongly reccomend to book this hotel and check before for the offer. Also after the first visit they give you a voucer that you can use as discount (6%) in your second visit.
hotelName:
14    Domidea Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this charming place for my fiance as a birthday treat and we couldnt have asked for more.Gianluca is the best host you could ask for and cannot do enough for you day or night. He will give you a great itinerary based on your likes, dislikes and how long you have to stay and also give you tips on quiet places to purchase tickets and times to visit. The rooms are perfect. Clean, comfortable, quiet and you ate spoilt with free coffee, tea, biscuits and a few bottles of water and cans of drink in your room. There is a lovely little terrace on the roof for breakfast and night time star gazing and the location is amazing.TipsWhen you find the block you enter the building and go through the glass door in your right and take the lift to the top, thats where the rooms are.Everything is either walkable or a few stops on the metro away and you are on the vaticans doorstep. There are also loads of local shops, restaurants, a 24 hour bakery and gelato within 2 minutes of the place.There is a metro and bus stop next to the hotel.You can get a 520 bus from the airport to cinecitta for a few euros and then the metro to ottaviano which is the stop by the hotel. This journey total can take 35-45 minutes or if the bus drivers a looney like ours, it takes 25 minutes.Make sure you have cash for the metro as you cannot buy tickets with card.Book all your tickets for the vatican museum, coloseum, forum etc beforehand as the queues are a nightmare with no shade.Gianluca will recommend a gelato place near parliament that is a must. The selection is huge and it tastes amazing.If you are after luxury and waiters and receptions in a large hotel this isnt for yoy. If you want a lovely clean, spacious and quiet place with excellent transport links and great hosts (including an excellent hrrakfast cooked how you like it by gianluca) i highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gianluca and everyone at QuodLibet were welcoming, accomodating, and thoughtful. The home is clean and inviting. The location is convenient, only a few short blocks away from a metro station. QuodLibet truly felt like a home away from home. We hope to come back to Rome one day and we wouldn't hesistate to stay at Quodlibet again in the future.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The quodlibet guest house Roma is good accommodation for traveller and trip of us. I will come back again to stay in here in Roma. This place was wonderful comfortable and near St, Peter church and Vatican city.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the location is very near Vatican & metro. Gianluca is very nice and helpful when we got some troubles in our trip. The room is very comfortable and clean. We hope to meet u again and will choose the Quodlibert next time
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay very much. Very friendly og warm owner. We had our little babygirl with us and is was very convenient with a kitchen at our disposal.Big, clean room and clean bathroom. There is and elevator and a bakery and a restaurant close to the bed and breakfast.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: QuodLibet was the perfect place to stay in Rome. We loved the location, close to the subway and Vatican, but in a quiet neighborhood. It was sparking clean, the owner is super kind and helpful. The breakfast on the terrace was our favorite on our 2 week Italy trip. It was a perfect, lovely stay! Thanks Gianluca!!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Short review: Don’t bother looking anymore, just book Quodlibet now!Longer review: Our first time in Rome so, having decided to stay on the Vatican ‘side’ of the river we chose Quodlibet. It took about 2 minutes, from meeting Gianluca and seeing our room, to realise we had made the right choice. The guest house (on the 4th floor with a rather quirky lift) is spotlessly clean with a great roof terrace for breakfast and a kitchen where tea, coffee, biscuits & pastries are always available (in addition to a Nespresso machine and a complimentary mini bar in your room).Gianluca, ever friendly and obliging, then spends 20 or so minutes explaining Rome with use of a map (and a selection of coloured marker pens!). This became our ‘bible’ for our three day visit and not once were Gianluca’s recommendations (sights, restaurants, transport etc.) wide of the mark.We leave it to you what to see in this amazing city, and our only suggestions would be to make sure you pre-book the Vatican (includes Sistine Chapel) and the Colosseum unless you like queuing for hours. Other than that do yourselves a favour and book into Quodlibet and let the excellent Gianluca be your advisor, guide, and helper - you will not regret it.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly, professional host. Not too involved in the guest's endeavors - as some B&B owners might get. Gives advice how best to roam the city.Modern, luxury, clean rooms, not too spacious, but not cramped either. Beds are a bit small (1.80m long). Windows properly insulated. Airco silent and effective.Roof terrace, embraced by tree tops and granting a slight view of the St. Peter Basilica, has a lounge set and is therefor a nice escape when one would prefer a moment of solitude away from the busy city. 5 min. walk to Metro station. 15 min. to Vatican. 30 min. to city centre where the major highlights are.Infinite restaurants, trattoria and gelato surrounding the premises.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was very good and clean. John Luca was a great host and extremely helpful. Located just a few blocks from the Vatican lots of good restaurants. Will recommend to our friends. Stayed for 3 days, great morning meal. Next to Great bakery that’s open 24 hours.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four nights here in the beginning of June and it was absolutely amazing. At check-in Gianluca sat down with us and showed us where different sites were in relation to the B and B and explained the best ways to get to each place. He also showed us several restaurants. The rooms were spotless and had good air conditioning. Breakfast was insane. Delicious pastries, blood orange juice, coffee, meats and cheeses, eggs, etc. The location was very close to the Vatican and a metro station, so we were able to get just about everywhere with ease. I cannot stress enough how amazing the hosts were. They truly made us feel like family. If there were an extra star above 5, this place deserves it.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t say enough good about this Bed and Breakfast and it owners Gianluca and his wife. From the start to end of our stay, we were made to feel welcome. We arrived late at night long after the check in time and were warmly greeted at the entrance of the building by Gianluca who was waiting to assist us with our luggage. He was very knowledgeable and provided us with important information on all the major attractions in Rome, the best restaurants for the European experience and the different and best means of transportation. This information was invaluable, and as a result we were able to explore quite a bit of Rome on our own. He made our trip one that we will not forget soon.QuodLibet is centrally located and particularly close to the Vatican. Our room was large, comfortable, and very nicely decorated. The European style breakfast served each morning on the roof terrace by our wonderful host was excellent. He was patient and graceful and always at hand if we needed anything.We stayed 6 nights, and had a great time. I would unreservedly recommend QuodLibet and would definitely stay there if I am ever in Rome again.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Ginaluca was phenomenal. He was so sweet. The rooms were all brand new and very clean. The rooms were cleaned on a daily basis as well. Breakfast on the rooftop was my favorite part. I will be returning for sure!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved it nice location walking ditance to many site. Rooms are large comfortably clean and welll maintained. Breakfast on patio and a glass of wine to end your day. Fantastico. Well place near Vatican it a regular busy neighborhood so just jump in and go about your business.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a most enjoyable stay! Gianluca made us feel so very welcome and his hospitality was second to none. He also gave us a most useful orientation of Rome, which saved us a lot of time when we were out. The rooftop breakfast was also very good, as was the atmosphere. The B&B is also close to major attractions and public transportation. Would definitely stay there again and happy to recommend.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an absolutely amazing time and I will definitely give Gianluca the credit due to his amazing hospitality. The B&B also happens to be in a perfect location and the rooms are immaculate, spacious (especially for Europe) and very comfortable. The terrace upstairs is an amazing bonus where an incredible breakfast is cooked for you morning! Absolutely wonderful hosts that made Rome 1000x better!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is simple and not big but clean and nice. The personnel was very friendly. At the roof of the building located small veranda - a pleasant place to have breakfast or just rest. Great location - very close to the metro, about 10-15 min walk to Vatican.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 5 nights, great location next to metro. The rooms were clean and beds very comfortable. The breakfasts was amazing. the hosts were amazing, helped us with directions maps and where to eat. we would definitely stay here again. we were made to feel very welcomed
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is amazing, 3 min walk to the metro and 10 min to vatican. Gianluca is an amazing host and we had and super time in Rome. We followed all of his amazing recommendations and we had a great culinary experience also
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the QuodLibet with a couple of friends and had a really wonderful time. The location was very convenient to visiting the Vatican and was really close to a major metro stop. The rooms themselves were clean, well appointed, and very comfortable. What makes this place so special are the hosts. They were wonderfully welcoming, offering great tips along the way. We looked forward to breakfast each morning on the terrace. We definitely recommend staying here and hope we can visit again soon!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for the second time at QuodLibet. Once again a friendly and efficient registration. Rooms very comfortable with everything you need. Delicious and generous breakfast up on the roof. Best of all, a real locals knowledge of the city, with great recommendations for bars, restaurants and icecream parlours. We will definitely be back
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 nights at Quodlibet during the BNL Internazionali tennis tournament.The location was very convenient to the Foro Italico as well as the Metro, the Vatican,shops and restaurants. We stayed in the Spring room which was very clean, quiet, comfortable and cozy. Rooms in Rome tend to be on the smaller side, but our room suited our needs very well. Actually, there was also satellite TV so I could watch the matches when we came back after dinner. The check-in process was straightforward.The rooms are on the 4th floor accessible by a couple of steps and an elevator from the building’s lobby. Gianluca, the owner was most helpful getting us settled into our room, explaining how to use the electronic thermostat etc. The weather during our stay was a little cool, so we were using the heat. The ventilation system looked modern so I think the air-conditioning should be good as well. Quodlibet is well-located for walkers and the Metro. This year, for personal reasons, I needed to use taxis to get around and Gianluca showed me how to use the taxi app on my phone. He was also very thoughtful in bringing lactose-free milk, cheeses and yoghurt when he saw that I carried my own lactose-free milk. Breakfast on the rooftop patio had plenty of choices and provided ample fuel for a full day of activities.  The shower had plenty of hot water and the bed was very comfortable.Upon our checkout, Gianluca had a small parting gift for us to remember our stay.We have been in Rome many times previously and it was very pleasant to stay at Quodlibet where we felt at home.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quad Libet is a very nice and welcoming apartment. Gianluca the host is a one of a kind, he is so helpful and sees to make your stay quite relax and easy. Gianluca was helpful with great restaurant suggestions and even mapped us with the best routs to visit all amazing and gistorical places in Rome. The rooms are always clean and organized. Also Gianluca needed us to switch rooms on the last day regardin maintenance issues, they were very professional to have switched all our belongings while we were away. The area is quite safe aswell. And what about the breakfast, exeptional!! Simple, filling, fresh and delicious. Would highly recommend as I will for sure select it over and over again on my future stays in Rome. One last thing that was really sweet and thoughtful from the host was a small goodie bag they prepared for us to take back home. So rateing my stay was 10/10. Loved it!!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is clean and quite. Gianluca is so friendly to give us informative advice and suggestion on different route for sightseeing in Rome. The breakfast at terrace is nice to provide fresh bread, fruit, cheese and coffee.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this lovely guest house 2 nights and had a very pleasant experience. Room was very modern, clean and comfortable.Owner of this place was helpful , he gave us map of Rome , advised best way for us to explore Rome and what to see too . Location was perfect walking distance to the centre of Rome or if you wish to use tube it’s only 5 min walk to station.Area full of nice and cheap places to eat .And probably one more of key points was downstairs bakery with best Italian cakes I ever tried.When we was leaving this guest house Galuka gave us bag of goodies as a present to remember.That was really nice . I hope to come back again soon.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I HIGHLY recommend QuodLibet B&B for those who want to do Rome on their own schedule and not a tour. My wife and I exited the metro less than two blocks from the B&B and arrived late afternoon April 4th and checked in with Gianluca. He showed us to our room and explained the facilities. The room was as shown on the website, clean and enough room for my wife and I. We then went to his office and sat down to plan our stay. He laid out a map of Rome and pulled out colored markers and proceeded to tell us how Rome is a very walkable city. With one colored marker he laid out a path starting from the B&B ending near the Spanish Steps, hitting all the popular sights along the way with places to eat and times to walk between the sights, that was one day's exploring. He then did two more different colored routes that were spot on for the next two days of our stay. We walked so much and didn't even realize it until we returned to our room and then the tiredness hit us. We were recharged the following morning by the breakfast that was plentiful and back on our way. Gianluca's recommendations for restaurants were exceptional, prices were reasonable and the food delicious. All in all, a very pleasant stay at QuodLibet and the care package Gianluca sent us on our way home with was a very nice touch as he bid us farewell early in the morning. A wonderful man with a generous heart. Grazie mille Gianluca.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful stay me and my 12 year old son had at Quodlibet b&b. Spacious and clean room, excellent breakfast at the roof top terrace, and above all, very friendly and helpful hosts! Highly recommended! Karin, Malmö, Sweden
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We read the reviews and weren’t disappointed! From the initial email contact and offer of pick up service, to the fabulous restaurant recommendations and we did a lot ! Superb!Smallish room but entirely adequate for a few days in this amazing city. Only a 10 min walk to the Vatican City.Gianluca was a wonderful host and the extra mile he went to with a map with recommendations, a lovely bottle of wine for my birthday and on leaving we received a goody bag with some pasta, coffee and biscuits ! So thoughtful. Thank you! we threw our coins in the trevi fountain so will definitely return and would return to the quidlibet! Tony and louise
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very well situated Guest House near all sites but in a quiet area, with a friendly and informative host. Gian Luca contributed to our trip with his local knowledge of restaurants and how to get the best out of the city. The spacious accommodation was comfortable and well equipped with everything we could need. The breakfast on the roof terrace was delicious with fresh pastries from the next door, 24 hour bakery and set us up for the day. We can't wait to return.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our Son and his wife recommended Quodlibet Guesthouse; as they had stayed there back in October 2018. SPECTACULAR!!!!! Marvelous!!!!Wonderful location. Gianluca contacted us by email a day before our arrival to see when we would arrive. We actually ended up in Rome a day early and they made accommodations for us to stay an extra day. Arrangements for a taxi pickup was made for us from the airport. Recommendations for Restaurants in the Area were given to us along with a map and explanation of where everything was located. We ate some of the best dishes at the recommended restaurants. Breakfast on the rooftop every morning was beautiful. The smells of the bakery close by kept us smiling and full. Our family will only stay at the Quodlibet while visiting Rome. They even gave us a going away gift. We felt like family!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was so great! Its only 3mins far from a subway station. The host knows very well about Rome. The map and introduction from him was so much helpful especially to tourists! Definitely stay again!! :D
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful 2 days in QuodLibet guest house. Apartment is big, nice equipped with all you need. There is a common kitchen where you can cook or drink coffee or tea. Hosts were very welcome. They serve us nice and big breakfast on the roof. Also we were pleased to get define information on all places we must see. How we can go there. What are the possible routes. Help to this in one day we managed to see everything must seen. We really feel at home in your welcome house. Wish to come again. Thank you!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well- kept bed and breakfast, with very kind owners.Located in a nice building, short walk to metro station and close to major attractions in Rome.Spacious rooms, delicious breakfast on the roof of the building and useful guidance from Gianluca for a perfect Rome itinerary.Thanks for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really love Gianluca, he is the kindnest and warmest host that i ever met. When we arrived, he gave us a champagne because he knew this was our honeymoon trip. And he gave us some tips, advises about the city. This is the things that make the difference from all the host. The room is clean, nice and very pleasant. The location is 5 star!! Very close to everywhere. Breakfast is good. We really recommend to all guest to stay at Gianluca. And we will come back for sure next time. Thank you Gianluca for the chocolate when we check out. Please contact us when you go to indonesia. Thomas & Jenn
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for a week while on our 25th anniversary trip in December 2018. Upon arrival, Gianluca sat with us to go over tips and advice for our visit including safety, restaurants, and transportation, and the best plan of attack for visiting the "must sees" of Rome. Not only did he give us a list of the best restaurants to visit, but also how to recognize and avoid tourist-trap restaurants vs. authentic restaurants that locals frequent. Every one of his recommendations was excellent.The B&B location couldn't be in a better place. We were a block and half from the metro station, across the street from the tram and bus station, and about 6 blocks from the Vatican, and a few blocks from some of the recommended restaurants (a 24 hour fresh bakery was located in the building next door!). Yet, we felt it was a very safe and quiet area at night. The room was immaculate and roomy with private bath. Each morning we enjoyed breakfast on the rooftop terrace. It is closed in and heated, making it a very comfortable experience even in the cold of December. The staff was very friendly and an absolute joy to be around. They allow you to eat at your leisure up until around 10 in the morning.Overall Gianluca and his staff made Quodlibet feel like a home away from home, and we would highly recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My Brother in Law recommended this B&B to us after they stayed here previously. GianLuca was very helpful and informative. He went out of his way to assist us with everything from highlighting all the sites to see on a map of Rome, making a restaurant reservation, reserving a taxi and even checking us in for our flight including printing our boarding passes. The rooms were nice and clean, the breakfast on the roof was wonderful and both of my teenage daughters were thrilled to have WiFi that actually worked very well. Finally the location was perfect, especially for visiting the Vatican. Including, it's across the street from a Metro station. If your looking for a B&B in Rome, we highly recommend the Quodlibet!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this guest house solely off of reviews, and was not disappointed! GianLuca was so attentive, helping us with so much and giving us excellent tips of the city, and even a great map and getting reservations for us at restaurants. The breakfast was over the top, making it nice not to have to worry about one meal. The room was very comfortable, and couldn’t beat the location. We loved our stay here and would recommend it to anyone! Thanks again Martini Family!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a two night stay at the QuodLibet and would certainly recommend it to others. The "Winter Room" was spacious with large bed, table and chairs and excellent bathroom with toiletries supplied. Breakfast was taken in a heated area on the roof and set us up for the day.Location is perfect for walking to the sights but the Metro is only a couple of minutes away should you want it. Final words to say a big thank you to our hosts who were welcoming, friendly and gave us very useful information about where to eat and other suggestions to make our visit a success.The leaving gift was a lovely gesture. You should pay them a visit !!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visiting Rome in the off-season, we stayed three wonderful nights with Gianluca at Quodlibet, a few hundred yards from St Peter's. His excellent recommendations and fascinating conversation over the excellent breakfast in the roof-garden every morning were as much highlights of our stay as anything else in Rome. The rooms are impeccably comfortable, with hot powerful showers, espresso machines, a full shared kitchen, and a peaceful atmosphere. You get conversation when you want it, and quiet when you need it. I cannot recommend it more highly. I will be rushing back at the next possible opportunity.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No surprise QuodLibet has so many outstanding reviews. This place is amazing and the whole team at QuodLibet makes your stay an incredible experience. From our arrival, Gianluca provided maps and walking itineraries, as well as restaurant and gelato places to stop along the way. The location is perfect. Just a quick walk to the Vatican, or to keep going across the river to anywhere within Rome. Also just steps away from the metro, although we never used it. Breakfast each morning was delicious and the girls were helpful in providing anything you'd need. Everything about our stay was fantastic. Next time we're in Rome, we'd definitely look to stay here again.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful time while in Rome, and Gianluca made our trip less stressful. His attentiveness was refreshing as he mapped out walking routes and offered local suggestions for restaurants, shops, gelato, and local specialties. The apartment was immaculate and very comfortable. Every evening we returned it was refreshing to walk into a clean fresh smelling room that you could tell they took pride in cleaning. Every morning Gianluca welcomed us onto the roof terrace for breakfast and asked us about our time and answered any questions we had. It was a 2 minute walk to a train station and about 10 minute walk from the Vatican. I will recommend QuadLibet to everyone I know going to Rome and would stay here again.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very close to Vatican and all other tpuristic place. Very clean and large room is very good for family stay. Staff is so helpful espacialy owner Gianliuca try to help you for all your needs Even he is like your special guide for place to visit.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gianluca is a wonderful host providing a comfortable surrounding as well as excellent information of some ways to explore the city. Location is very close to the metro but walking is ideal and few day trips walking allowed for seeing most of the city.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You are welcomed personally by the hosts of this bed and breakfast. They provide you with detailed instructions and tools to navigate Rome; provide you with breakfast in a lovely rooftop setting (heated off season), provisions in your room (water, expresso, toiletries); and wish you goodbye with a gift bag filled with Italian treats. Highly recommend staying here!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the most brilliant decisions that I made during my honeymoon in Italy is choosing QuodLibet. It takes just 15 mins to Vantican by walking and it's facility is almost perfect. The host is quite friendly and helpful, who gave us a lovely self-designed city map and other useful recommendations and made us fantastic breakfast. What's more, he kindly prepared some high quality Italian presents for us. I'll definitely book it again whenever I go to Rome.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stood at Quod Libet in November 2018 for 5 days. Gianluca was an amazing host. He gave as a super good overview about things to do and to see in the city and we enjoyed a lot all of the conversations we had with him. The breakfast is another special, it is served on the roof top (in a heated room in winter), with a great view and amazing fresh goodies from the bakery underneath. Our room was very clean and nicely decorated, we felt really at home.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This quite B&B close to Vatican City and metro links offers the perfect place for travellers to Rome. Good room, location, price and our host was most gracious. Being a gay couple it can be challenging at times finding places to stay, but we felt most welcomed. Would highly recommend this B&B!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Personal welcome in the guest house and very surprised by the private atmosphere. It's almost like coming home. The premises are very nicely furnished. The breakfast on the roof was also at this time of year pleasant and more than adequate. The subway is about 180m away. The Vatican can be reached in 10 minutes by foot. There are enough restaurants in the area.The towels and linen were very well washed.There are a few small things but to improve .... The toilet brush and mattresses should be changed.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fabulous stay with Gianluca and his wonderful staff. It was perfectly located for the Vatican and to explore Rome. The room was large and nicely made up and the breakfast on the roof was a highlight. We had an excellent stay and would highly recommend staying.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gianluca's warm reception and availability to help us settle in for our entire stay in Rome was a special highlight in addition to lovely customized, very clean and comfortable rooms. Having a fully equipped apartment kitchen was convenient for gathering with our family and serving up afternoon snacks or later evening dessert. the rooms are easily accessible, spacious quiet with lovely amenities. This hotel is private, very secure. Breakfasts are delicious with yogurt, cheeses, eggs and more. Excellent coffee is prepared to order for you. The owners go way beyond to make certain you have the very best experience. I would absolutely return to stay at QuodLibet and highly recommend it.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Quod Libet in October for 3 nights. We arrived late and were met by Gianluca at the door. We were showed to our superbly clean large room (comfortably sleeping 4 of us) and talked through all we needed. The children were tired but hungry so we went next door to the most wonderful 24 hour bakery! Who knew such a thing existed. We also asked him where we could get a bottle of wine at this time of night and Gianlca emerged with a bottle of beautiful Italian red and 2 glasses which we took upstairs and drank on the lovely roof terrace feeling very continental. They provided complimentary water and soft drinks in the rooms and there was a communal kitchen were you could have tea and coffee should you desire it. We had a very peaceful night's sleep. The next morning we had breakfast on the roof terrace which was plentiful with nice coffee, pastries from next door, fruit, yoghurt and gorgeous coffee and hot chocolate and then Gianluca drew us various routes - walking and then metro transport home to take in the main sights. He spoke impeccable English. The tours were amazing and encompassed the best tiramisu, the best ice cream parlour and coffee shop as well as all the breath-taking sights.. The Vatican is only 5-10 minutes away and was magical to be able to go at night to see it all lit up and pop in when the queues had died down. The metro only a few minutes.We had a very comfortable stay and when we left we were given a parting gift to remember our stay. Such kind people and what wonderful hospitality. A real gem near the centre of Rome
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is ideal for metro, restaurants and shops in one of Rome's more upmarket residential neighbourhoods. Bedroom was charming, quiet and very comfortable. Price no dearer than many of Rome's lower-end hotels with advantage of good breakfast on the enclosed roof terrace and complimentary real coffee and biscuits at any time of day. If that's not reason enough to want to stay then the real clincher are the hosts. They are infinitely patient, friendly and knowledgable. Give Gianluca a list of your interests and what you want to see and he will come up with an itinerary based on how much time you have, how much walking you are prepared to do and what other sights he thinks you shouldn't miss. His recommendations, including those for local restaurants, ensured that we got the most out of our short holiday.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we entered QuodLibet, we knew we were in the right place. Gianluca walked us through every detail to make our stay perfect—even lining up transportation to and from—which can be a challenge when you don’t speak Italian! His attention to our sightseeing plans as well as our accommodations was so appreciated! Breakfast in the terrace was delicious and lovely. The room was quiet and comfortable. We look forward to another visit to Rome and to this ideal port of hospitality in the busy city.
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This short break was one of the best yet, our accommodation was just perfect, our breakfast was perfect, but most of all our host Gianluca made our holiday. Such care and knowledge to help us with our visit. We can't wait to return. Thank you for a great time
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From your arrival through departure Gianluca and his wife are amazing hosts that treat you like family. Gianluca's recommendations for sightseeing, local eateries, etc. are truly second to none. The location is prefect to visit the important historic and modern day sites in Rome, shop, etc. The rooms and many little extras combined with the exceptional morning breakfasts on the roof top make your stay something to truly remember and return to!
hotelName:
15    QuodLibet
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Star of Rome in the group of four. The room was big enough and comfortable. Bathroom big and clean. Room service makes the beds every day and changes the towels every second day. Breakfast was good and plenty. Budget to chose from. Very nice cappuvino served by the staff every morning! We needed to check out 5 am in the morning and we had some takeaway breakfast prepared for us upon request:) location is very convenient for sightseeing. 5 stops to Vatican, 10 stops to Plaza Venezia. Bus stops very close to the hostel. Also there is a supermarket nearby as well as some cafes and delicious pizzeria!
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The b&b isn't so bad. Only really annoying point was the sounds in the evening. The b&b is positioned close to a busy road and the sound of the cars never stop. When someone else is showering or using the toilet in the b&b a really loud sound is happening. It made us awake and not being able to sleep.The day of departure the man who worked there was really rude against us. We will never come here again.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were travelling by car and would not have found the accommodation had our hosts not spoken to us and directed us. There is only a very small sign outside as the accommodation is just a few rooms in a residential apartment block. It could not be described as a hotel and did not have the personality of a B&B, more of a hostel vibe.Staff were very friendly and welcoming and gave us a useful map. There was free WiFi which worked well and plugs beside the bed. The bathroom was small and smelt terrible. Everything was very clean. There was a fridge in the room with some bottles and cans you could buy.Breakfast was basic. There only ever seemed to be enough for one croissant each left out, although there was plentiful slices of toasting white pan.The accommodation is close to transport links and within walking distance of the Vatican.Staff were helpful but we felt they could have done more - for example when I asked them to order us a taxi we were instead pointed to the nearest taxi bay and told to walk there and wait.On our last day they very kindly let us leave our bags so we could spend one last morning in Rome. When we arrived back there was no one at the reception area and no answer to either phone numbers. We eventually found our bags in the corridor outside our room.Overall an adequate stay for the money.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is not a hotel, it is a BBB. We must say that the building is offices and residences. Room was very clean and staff very nice. We were there for three nights and everyday our room was cleaned to perfection.Did not like the breakfast, noisy area at night.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got a great find here, only about a 20 minute walk to Vatican City which means your out of the way of all the somewhat annoying reps lol. The room was massive and spotless and the breakfast that was included was plentiful and lovely. The staff were very helpful...Christiano in particular......and being that it was our first time in Rome he explained the transport we could use and where to get it from etc....also included a very helpful map which we used all the time lol.Would definitely recommend this b&b to anyone, keep up the good work guys :)
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 6 nights at the Star of Rome and we enjoyed it very much. The owners are very nice and they will go out of their way to help you to enjoy your time in Rome. Our room was facing the street but the windows have double panes so we absolutely never heard street noise. This hotel is not very near the major tourist sites but I like living like a local and being away from the mainstream tourist areas. The location is still very good because the bus stop is just outside of the hotel and the metro is about a 10 minute walk. It's really a great value and I would stay there again.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were really helpful and supportive, they provided whichever we asked they had provided a nice cot for our baby before our arrival the map provided by hotel was really great, I recommend airport transit of hotel, it is reasonable
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived in Rome late on a Friday afternoon only to find that our pre-booked (and paid for) accommodation had been cancelled on us. Desperate for somewhere to lay our weary heads, we tried a few B & B's but they couldn't accommodate us at such short notice. Then we phoned Michael at Star of Rome, and we're so glad we did. With such short notice, he wasn't able to put us up for the four nights' we needed in Rome, but he provided us with a superb room for two nights. The room was quiet, the bed very comfortable and the bathroom well equipped. What really made our stay so memorable was Michael. He went out of his way to help us during our stay at Star of Rome, including finding some equally great accommodation for the remaining two days of our stay in Rome and arranging a pick up for us so we weren't inconvenienced with the changeover of accommodation. We can't speak highly enough of him. If you travel to Rome, and are looking for great accommodation at a realistic price, then this is the place for you. Very highly recommended.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would highly recommend this place to stay in Rome .It within walking distance to the Vatican The staff are very helpful and polite The rooms are clean and have there own bathroom There is a very good restaurant 500m away with friendly staff and very good food Dont be put off by the fact it's a b&b there is a very personal service and I will be booking with them again when I'll come back
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 5nights over Easter the rooms were clean and comfortable. Staff were friendly and more than helpful. I emailed several times before our arrival with different requests, I received a reply the same days and each time every effort was made to meet my request. I will definitely stay here again
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Do not get confused by the outer look of the building - the rooms are wonderful, new and modern. Everything was good. Personnel was very helpful with anything. They deliver that little extra value that you do not get normally and that makes you feel great. Room was awesome, clean, spacious, with it's own huge terrace, well isolated double windows, bathroom spacious too and exceptionally well equipped, room service was excellent. Vatican is 5 minutes by bus and the center of Rome about 15 minutes. Parking free outside. Bottom line: you do not need to go looking for anything else.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was a good size and clean. It can get a bit noisy but not to bad that I didn't sleep. Upon arrival the staff watched our bags as the room wasn't quite ready, we had an early flight to Rome. The staff took the time to explain the area around the hotel, including recommendations of places to eat, and the best way to get to central Rome and the Vatican.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights and it was a great choice.The hotel and room was very clean and offered everything we needed, fresh towels,air con wi-fi,tea and coffee and a tv.The staff made a great effort with maps of the city centre and sub way which is a ten minute walk away which will take you to piazzale flaminio.Make sure you have change if using the sub way as it does not accept anything bigger than 5 euro notes.The bus stops outside and it goes past the Vatican and terminates at piazza Vittoriano.There was a good choice on offer every morning for breakfast.They reserved and printed our tickets for the Vatican which enabled us to skip a very large queue and saved a lot of time.The airport transfer is worth paying for as it saves a lot of hassle.The hotel is really good value for money.This holiday in a stunning city was made special buy the effort and friendliness of the staff at the star of Rome and we would definitely stay there again.Thank you guys for a great holiday.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights mid-July. Very friendly welcome and great info on the area. Room very clean and towels changed daily. Air con and shower both good.Great info on area given by staff including details on metro, bus service and areas to eat. Remember you need to buy a ticket in advance for the bus! We had a nice joyride on our first bus as we didn't know!Only criticisms of this hotel is that there was not much variety at breakfast - however the croissants and cereal were very good and if we were to return then we would stay on the other side of the river as it was a tiny bit far out for us.20 mins on bus to Piazza Venezia, 5 mins on bus to Vatican. 10 min walk to metro and then 10 mins on metro to centre. Overall brill hotel and I would recommend.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed at this wonderful friendly sanctuary just a few bus stops from the Vatican. We loved it- it was like having good friends looking out for you after the hustle and bustle of central Rome - yet it was close enough feel very much a part of everything. The generosity of the staff/owners, who run the set up, was absolutely amazing, from getting my washing done in less than 24 hours to helping to solve even the smallest problem- even an early breakfast before we left for the airport. And they drop off and pick up from the airport for a very reasonable price. Top marks thank you boys
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The BnB is in a nice, safe location, the rooms are spacious and clean, but the best part of the stay was how friendly the staff were. They made sure we felt welcome and comfortable, and were available for help anytime we asked.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, good value for $, a bit far from city center, but walkable to Vatican and close to public transporation. Sufficient breakfast is provided and a good airport transfer option is available to/from.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great choice for us. the room was very clean everyday! Very close to bus stop that will take you everywhere! A little far from the metro!! They had breakfast ready early everyday and was ok. very large bathroom and nice shower! Really happy with this B&B and would stay there again! Always felt safe!
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my partner came to Rome for a short break away and had this hotel recommended to us by a friend. We weren't expecting much as the prices were generally fairly low but I can't be happier with our service, the rooms, the location and especially the helpful and kind staff. We were picked up from the airport by a very polite man whom the hotel had arranged, and were taken to the hotel around a 20 minute drive away. When we arrived the gentlemen on the desk, were just that - gentlemen! And took care of every one of our needs; which including staying late after their shift had finished because our flight was later. Still, he Talked us through everything we needed to know about the bus stops, the metro how to get to the main attractions and handed us a map to help us too. He then took us to our room, (which was absolutely pristine and very trendy) and told us if we needed any more to just ask! The next morning we went for breakfast, which was all you need, toast, cereals, eggs, meats cheeses and coffees. Very good to start off our busy days! Even the staff in here were kind and welcoming always asking us if we wanting anything else. When we went downstairs the man on the desk explained more of the hotels surroundings and even made sure we had a mobile phone on us and gave us their number and if we got lost and they could help us back! Generally, the hotel is in a fantastic location, just ten min walk to the Vatican or a very short bus ride and only a 20 min bus ride to the colleseum. The gentlemen on the desk will show you exactly where everything is anyway if you are a bit clueless like we were,to help get you started. I will recommend this hotel time and time again and would not hesitate to return here as it just made our stay in Rome even more fantastic.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The guys were incredibly helpful, available to answer questions/help out 24/7, explained everything we needed upon arrival. The room was impeccable, beds comfortable, sheets crisp and clean.The bathroom had all toiletries provided and again very clean. Although the B&B is near a main road, the room is very quiet and peaceful. Wifi is very fast. There was a mini fridge in our room which was very convenient for keeping a bit of extra food. Location is fantastic- not right in the centre but 5 minutes to the Vatican and 10 minutes to the centre via bus.There is a nice supermarket just across the road if you need to buy water, fruit, some extra food e.t.c. Fresh coffee/cappuccino is served for breakfast which was very nice. Overall, we had a fantastic 3 days in Rome, thank you to the guys from Heart in Rome!
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B was superb!!! It was very, very clean and the staff were friendly and helpful! The breakfast was fresh everyday - very appetizing and a perfect, filling way to start a busy sightseeing day! I cannot say enough good things!! I recommend it highly! I visited with my son and he was impressed with the hospitality also!! We will stay there again.....  Also within a 15-20 minute walking distance to the Vatican. Plenty of buses to take from the corner to the Vaticano and the Colosseum. It comforted me to know that all I had to do was get back to the Vatican and I could find my way back to the hotel without getting lost! Also had a McDonalds across the street.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So just quickly, staff - the Italian boys were great,all of them friendly, very helpfull so perfect! Room...I ve never seen so clean room,even with that,that you come at the evening and everything is clean again and even your clothes are folded! So perfect again!I dont know how the price is at the main season,but now at Febuary, it was really cheap + basic breakfast...for students perfect!Thank you for freat 4 days spend in your Star guys :)
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were surprised at the excellent level of service, large comfortable rooms and cute arrangements of the towels for the low cost. We will definitely return and recommend to anyone wishing to stay in Rome. Although 20mins walk from the Vatican it has great local transport links and offers a friendlier more real experience of Rome, far better than the stuck up reception we received in the posh areas of the city. 5 stars.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an excellent bed and breakfast in the city of Rome.The only thing that was not so comfortable is its position because it is in an area that isn't so popular.But this doesn't mean that reaching all sightseeing was difficult.I would recommend it in general.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful Welcome and hosts. First room for 5 small but were moved for last 2 nights without hesitation. Breakfast pleasant and coffee excellent made by host. Room spotless bed comfy bathroom and toiletries provided. Mini bar in room. Location was easy bus ride from Vatican and central rome or metro 10 min walk away uphill!!!! Restaurant underneath rooms but not connected. Hotel is actually 3 b&bs in 2 floors of an office block which is a bizarre experience but it didn't spoil or take anything away from our stay in fact it was a great value hotel for the price very near the Vatican. If arriving to ciampino use hotel arranged shuttle as once paid for transfer coach to termini then taxi oin it works out the same. I would have rated this hotel 5# if it was a conventional hotel layout and reception/facilities but still comfy well located for the price and woouild return
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel not far from the vatican very clean the staff his very helpful situated in a center with several option of buses every where in the city the bus stop is few meters from the hotel the metro is a littel bit far the breakfast is good .
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is a 15-20 minute bus ride into the centre and 5 mins from the Vatican with an excellent service day or night.The room was spacious very clean providing a comfortable bed and a good size bathroom with shower. It is on a busy road but the room has two sets of double glazing making sleeping easy. Breakfast was very good better than many hotels I have stayed in.fresh ham, cheese, boiled eggs, croissant, fruit and cereal and more was always available with fresh coffee of your choice.I cannot speak highly enough about the staff. All the guys that work in the reception will do absolutely anything they can to help you. They booked tickets for me to the main attractions, advised on transport and costs that actually saved me money.I have travelled extensively in Europe and recommend this hotel without hesitation.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: ok, i'm going to keep this short and sweet.Arrived and thought, oh god, this can't be right - we pulled up outside a random, almost disused building which wasn't very aesthetically pleasing. Walked in and was greeted by a extremely nice, well mannered enthusiastic host who filled us with relief.So, basically the owners seems to be buying floors or whatever of this old style hotel and then completely transforming them into very modern, clean, stylish rooms. They have 3 floors all finished to a very high standard. The owners are great, very helpful, speak brilliant english, are available and at reception from 7 till 7, just brill. Make it so you can get straight into your holiday.We stayed in room 15 i think, Caesar. Twin sink bathroom, walk in shower, real modern decor, sofa bed, wardrobe, king size bed in the adjoining room, balcony, TV, fridge - you name it. The hall of each floor is well lit, clean, warm with a communal computer for web access - and of course there is free wifi.Breakfast is your standard continental - the staff always offer you fresh coffee and keep refilling. Nothing is too much trouble.Ok, Rome itself. The place has been ruined by migrants. every tourist attraction has groups of them - if not trying to sell you a selfie stick, trying to sell you tickets to beat the queues for something you don't have to cue for. They get up in your face and start shouting at you in the street. Do not buy anything from the street traders - find the souvenir shops and mini markets, around 1/10th of the price for some things.The traffic is mental - if you don't have your wits about you, you will be killed. red lights and crossings mean nothing, everyone uses their phone even on motorbike, the road markings are ignored, its an absolute free for all.The buses are the best way to get about but the signage is awful. it will take you a while to figure out and you will get lost - they are cheap however and regular. Food everywhere is just pizza pasta and tomato sauce - but I have to say our italian restaurants are much nice. Find the right place though and you can pay 3.50 for 1/2 litre of red wine! Beer is expensive and McDonalds is a god send, low prices and reliable food. Architecture is stunning, history is breathe taking. When we went however, the spanish steps were closed and the privy fountain or whatever was switched off with scaffold around.It rained all day saturday and the streets can't handle it, you end you walking in a puddle everywhere you go.Top top tip - don;t go for the weekend only, we went Thursday to Sunday. Luckily did the vatican city and st peters church thing on the very first day - didn't queue for anything and walked around very easily. saturday we walked past the same places - 3 hr queues and absolutely crowed with people - could definitely spoil the weekend.Rome is a must but is certainly not the place we imagined it to be - can't make a romantic weekend of it but will certainly be taken back by the history of the place.The Star of Rome certainly gave us somewhere to go which felt very comfortable and allowed you to relax and catch your breathe. Very clean and modern - a true hidden gem.Oh, room has air con and make sure the ladies are covered up when visiting places with picture of Jesus in. shoulders cannot be on show, boobs mustn't be either, lads can't wear shorts etc.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My brother and I visited Rome a couple of months ago and we stayed in this excellent hotel. This small B&B is located very close to the main part of Rome and is right next to the bus stop that takes you there. The staff is extremely friendly; when my brother and I arrived, Christiano gave us a map and explained how to get to all the main attractions downtown. The hospitality we were shown was outstanding. The rooms were also extremely clean whenever we would return to our room at night. The breakfast was also excellent, and the staff was very friendly and helpful with providing refills and making cappuccinos every morning. The Star of Rome is an excellent small hotel at an unbeatable price. I am looking forward to staying here again the next time I visit Rome.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean modern rooms, with excellent transport links into the main part of Rome (Metro or buses), and within walking distance of the Vatican. The staff were very friendly, welcoming and knowledgable, and we're always helpful. Some good local restaurants with reasonable prices in area too. We used their airport transfer service such was very good value for money and meant no worries about finding the hotel. We'll definitely come back
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is only about 20 min bus ride away from downtown and the bus station is just outside the hotel. Staff was very friendly and helpful with directions to downtown. Room is clean. Restaurant downstairs is awesome.Great experience...
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this fantastic B&B and the very helpful and kind young men that run it . Excellent location with clean, spacious and comfortable rooms and good breakfasts. Bus stop, Macdonalds and grocery/wine and liquor store just across the street and the best pizza ever at Pensa Re!
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Star of Rome are lovely. Very friendly and helpful. Christiano was by far my most favourite host during my stay in Italy. He was always happy to suggest places to go in Rome and his cappuccinos were delicious! The only downside of this b&b is the distance out of town, we could not figure the bus system out so struggled to get to town and back. Otherwise a great place with well maintained rooms, comfy beds and a delicious breakfast :)
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had 2 rooms on the third floor. One had a double bed and one was a triple room. Both rooms were modern and clean and so were the bathrooms. We had AC too. Breakfast was simple but nice. There was a selection of cereals, croissants, fruit, yoghurt and toast. There is a bus stop across the road which we used everyday. There is a local restaurant down the road which is really good too. Staff were excellent. Would come back here again.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, modern and clean hotel (B&B) with Helpful staff, near by bus station to the city centre. The noise in the room from the street throughout the night. Still the same breakfast. Generaly we were very satisfied! We can recommend this hotel
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To be honest, when I read all the reviews of the Star if Rome I thought there must be a catch, that the owners had bribed their family and friends to boost the ratings. Rest assured though, that everything written about this excellent little B&B is true. The location is good, 15 mins walk from the Vatican and on the main bus routes. The rooms are spotlessly clean with nice and powerful showers. The breakfast buffet was enough to set us up for the day. Best of all, the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful, always available to assist and answer any questions. Recommended and we would definitely return.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful B&B! We were greeted by extremely kind and helpful staff. We booked two rooms and they were both very spacious, modern and luxurious, good beds and above all very clean.The private terrace of the room was a pleasant surprise.At breakfast there is plenty of choice and the cappuccino is delicious.The staff gives very clear explanations on busses , sightseeing and tickets.We felt very welcome and thank the staff for the pleasant stay that they gave us.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived at the B&B, we were greeted by extremely friendly and helpful staff, who showed us to our huge, newly renovated room. Everything was new, and the bathroom looked like a showroom. The staff are great and always happy to help as much as possible.Although the B&B is a little out of town, it is very easy to hop on a bus into the centre, and you could walk if you really wanted to.We used the airport transfer service to take us to Fiumcino- a very reasonable price and very efficient. All in all, a great stay.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very happy with the star of Rome. The people that run it are extremely helpful and friendly. They shared with us all the best places to see and how to get there. The room was a good size with a decent bathroom. The rooms got tidied daily with fresh towels. There is a bus stop literally outside the hotel which gets you to St. Peter's square within 5 minutes and the colesium in 25 minutes. I would definitely recommend this place as a great place to stay if you wanted to visit Rome.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room had a very modern feel. Team especially Christiano was very focused on ensuring guest satisfaction & he provided us with guide on where to go. Christiano is the star of Star of Rome. Grocery stores & restaurants are nearby. Try the Ristorante La Forchetta which is a 5 min walk away as it serves great grilled seabass. Rooms were kept very clean. Additional bed was fixed for us free. Breakfast can be much better & varied. Shower is slightly small. Be sure to clarify the time you arrive ie at Termini or at their hotel so they have someone ready at reception. Overall, a good experience.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect place to stay and only 5 stops to the world famous Coliseum, hotel was great my room was spaces and had my very own patio. The staff are very friendly and I would recommend the star of Rome to anyone. I would return to Rome and stay at The Star of Rome
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very happy with our stay at the Star of Rome. Our room was exceptionally clean and nice for our family of four. The complimentary breakfast and cappuccinos each morning were a wonderful start to each day.Thank you Cristiano!
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is review is a little overdue. We stayed at the Star of Rome in March 2015. Don't be fooled by the exterior of the hotel. The rooms inside are super clean, modern and absolutely adequate. The size of the rooms is good. The breakfast is adequate and the cappucino served is awesome. The location of the hotel is slightly away from the city centre but it is very easily accessible. All the major sights can be reached easily using public transport. It is very near to Vatican. There are cafes n restaurants around the hotel. We took the airport pickup service provided by the hotel n it was very good n easy. Coming to the last but the most awesome part of the stay - its the people. The staff at Star of Rome are the actual stars. They are super helpful. They helped us plan our days while in Rome, suggested restaurants and also helped us book tickets to sights. Rome was the first city we visited during our 14 days holiday and the superb experience at Star of Rome set the tone for the vacation. A big thanks to Cristiano n the others!!
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They are located in a nice secure building, kind of like staying in a condo. We stayed for 3 nights. The rooms are meticulously clean and have private baths, each room has coffee, tea, a refrigerator, cable tv and free wifi. Our rooms had balconies, so it was nice to sit outside in the evenings.I'd originally booked for 2 nights, but due to the room not being available for the 3rd night we moved to another room for the last 2 nights. The original reservation was for a triple, it was a beautiful and clean room, large shower and comfortable bed. The room we moved into had a queen bed, the room was nice as well. The shower was a bit smaller and the mattress was uncomfortable; you could actually feel and hear the springs. The last night we slept on top of the comforter in hopes of a more comfortable sleep. The breakfast was fantastic, pastries, fresh fruit, as well as yogurt, cereal, breads, boiled eggs, ham and cheese; and of course my daughter enjoyed the Nutella. They make you cappuccino and espresso's to order. They will make adjustments if you have special dietary needs.I found the staff exceptional. They are available 8 AM - 8 PM, and even responded by email at 10 PM. They helped us with our luggage, recommended some terrific places to eat, and gave us great directions on how to navigate on the bus. By bus they are located minutes from the Vatican, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps, as well as easy access to little markets, pharmacies and restaurants. Right across the street is a fantastic gelato shop.I highly recommend The Star of Rome for anyone that is looking for a nice place at a reasonable rate. It has everything you need, plus a wonderful and helpful staff. It's close enough to enjoy the sites, and easy access to the train, buses and airport. I would definitely stay here again when in Rome.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights and it was just wonderful! Damiano and the rest of the staff were so friendly and helpful from booking on-line to the end of our stay. The twin room my daughter and I shared was roomy and well-appointed with a small balcony to enjoy. Breakfast is included in the price and was a great start to the day.The location is convenient to all the sights of Rome with a bus stop just a block away and the metro about a 10 minute walk. For those more ambitious, the Vatican is also walkable in about 15-20 minutes. There are also great restaurants and shopping within blocks. Was fun to be in a real part of the city rather than in a tourist zone. Can't wait to return!
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff, the room, the breakfast...all were BRILLIANT!!! Especially the staff; so friendly and really helpful when it came to getting advise on getting about. This was the most convenient place to stay for a visit to Rome. It had a conveniece store opposite, mcd's on the side and various travel cards stands/shops. Very residential but only a 15min walk away from the Vatican city. We walked everywhere, albeit some places were upto an hours walk away. Still worth the stroll! Nice park (pamphili villa) 10mins in the opposite direction to the tourist attractions which was nice to do once we'd exhausted all other places. Highly recommend this stay AND the shuttle service from airport to anyone looking to travel to Rome.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first time in Rome became easy and enjoyable as the staff of Star of Rome were truly helpful and accommodating. Their service is beyond bed and breakfast. They really know how to take care of their guests. Rooms are always clean and breakfast served with warmth and hospitality.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my friend staied here for two nights. This B&b is based in a safety area of Rome close to Vatican. All staff inside is new and always clean. New matresses on bads, spacious bathroom. Wi-Fi connection worked well. Breakfast which was included was fresh and tasty. But the most we like the staff - friendly and wellcoming! They even helped us to move our luggage to the next one hotel by car (we prefered to stay at Star of Rome longer but they were booked fully). We strongly recommed this place in Rome for staying!
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Before travelling to Rome, I was a bit unsure as to which accommodation to stay in. Some were in my view way overpriced and rooms didn't look too great. I spent hours researching some were to stay that was close to the centre of Rome, a good neighbourhood and easily accessible transportation. Star of Rome certainly ticked all those boxes. Once I saw the reviews online I contacted the hotel directly speaking with a very friendly and welcoming individual by the name of Damiano, he explained transport links were close by which was exactly as stated no more than 7-10 minutes to the Vatican by bus/20 mins from Termini station. The rooms were modern which was exactly as stated the rooms were clean, modernised and well priced. Damiano even went through the trouble of organising a taxi at the airport. His colleagues/management despite closing at 8pm waited for me outside the hotel when I arrived at 21:40 pm. There are so many positives about this hotel that I would love to say but I think the reviews say it all. Exactly as described my first time in Rome and I will def return here......Also your looking for somewhere close and nearby theres a restaurant at the very top of the hill about 10 mins walk, 2 stops on the bus called Grileria La Pizzeria food is great, good prices (£15-25 a head /20-35 euros) they do steaks, pizza pasta, cocktails, wines, deserts.Enjoy!.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one week at this B&B with a friend and we really enjoyed our stay at Star of Rome. The room was very nice and always clean, the staff was very nice with us, helpful, polite and they always gave us really good advice. The place is a bit remote from the center of the city by foot, though you can get quite easily to Plaza Venezia taking the Bus. Anyways, we stronlgy recommend this B&B to anyone who wants to stay in Rome and we would gladly come back.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice place. Our double room was nice and modern, also very clean and spacious. Breakfast was good and the guys at the reception very helpful and kind. We decided to walk to the Vatican, it's located about 10 or 15 minutes away; though buses might get you there quicker. We enjoyed our stay very much.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We got a really good deal for this hotel - our room was very clean with a comfortable bed. Breakfast included - continental - not amazing but nice and did the job! The location is on a busy road but the traffic didn't disturb us - a couple of good restaurants, supermarket, chemist and bus stops all within 2 mins walk (and McDonalds if you're of that inclination)!5 bust stops away is St Peters, or follow the bus to the end of the line to Piazza Verona where you can walk down to the Colusseum. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful, polite and friendly - they were great.I'd definitely go back to this hotel should I be lucky enough to return to Rome.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
