review_body: The Best Best Best of best!!!!!I stayed 10 hotels and hostels during this trip.Star of rome is the TOP of the top hotel!!Pick up service was so wonderful(very reasonable price).The staff always be ready to help us. They were sooooo kind and spoke in English well so I could get some tips for travel of rome.The room was very nice and cozy. Elegant, fabulous, amazing, clean room.Every service was Perfect!!!! Breakfast was also fantastic! They served many kinds of food and drink,etc.I was so surprised because I paid resonable price!!! (The price was same to other hostel 'dormitory'.. I stayed 'double room' at star of rome! I couldn't believe this amazing situation!!)Absolutely, totally, definitely the best stay at europe. Thanks a lot the staff!!!!!This hotel is near the vatican city. So it's easy to get there(about 10 min.) And I felt that this area was so safe. I want to stay there again and I will recommend this hotel to every friend who want to go to rome.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I travelled to Rome for a four-day city break and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Prior to our arrival, Cristiano arranged for an airport pick up to and from the B&B. As it was our first time in Rome, we thought it was great that they offered this service. The driver Massimo was cool and we ended up using his vehicle more than once during our stay!We were a group of 8 and had rooms located on the same floor which was a bonus. The B&B has quite a homely feel to it, and yet had the same standards as a 5* hotel. The rooms were spectacular, simply and yet creatively decorated, each with a different artistic theme. They were always cleaned to perfection and fresh towels were provided each day. Breakfast was also good. Simple but tasty food including a selection of bread, cheeses, meats, pastries and fruit. Every morning we were offered fresh coffee which I thought was a nice touch.As it was only a weekend away we didn't spend much time at the B&B, whenever we did the staff were friendly and very helpful. My cousin and I are usually great at planning, however on this occasion we didn't have an itinerary for our trip. On the Saturday morning, one of the guys gave us a map and literally a plan for the whole day which was lovely of him. I’m from London, so I found Rome to be quite a small city. This is a positive though, as the B&B is quite close to the centre – perhaps 10/15 minutes via public transport. You can hop on a number of buses outside on the main road. There are multiple shops conveniently located close by, including a Mc Donald's for you fast food lovers! As a group of 18-25 year-old's we did a good amount of site seeing! Rome is a remarkable city, with tons of museums, restaurants, bars and historical sites & the Star of Rome was a great base to explore the city. All in all we had a wonderful stay at the Star of Rome. This small, yet boutique B&B will definitely be my first choice when returning to this city.
hotelName:
16    Star of Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights at the beginning of my trip to Italy. It was overall a nice but not outstanding stay.First, the junior suite was large, but there were no drawers for unpacking. The bed linens were scratchy. The shower was tiny. The toilet didn't flush very well and required several flushes after each use. Also, while the pictures made it look like the room was colorful and bright, it was actually all grey and black and white. There were a number of stairs to climb with a heavy suitcase.Also, there is not a staff member on duty for most of the time. There's a little office, but usually no one is in it.The breakfast was basic and didn't taste fresh.The location is fantastic, and the little balcony was lovely.Overall, for room size and location and view, choose this place. For amenities, I'd choose another hotel.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as a recommendation from friends who have also stayed here! More services apartment than hotel but this adds to its charm! Some of the rooms have a balcony that looks over the Piazza Novena - so you can sit there and just gaze at the beautiful buildings... listen to some street music and just people watch. Room was modern, clean and functional. Staff were wonderfully friendly and spoke excellent English. They are not on site 24/7 but are contactable via phone if needed. Very central Rome, all main tourist sites are 5-30 minutes walk away no need for transport. About 30-45 minutes from airport. Luggage storage available if needed and an excellent breakfast of coffee, pastries, yogurt, cereal - definitely will keep you going until lunch. Restaurants are a stone throw away from your room. Aim for the ones in the street where you enter the suites rather than the more touristy (and more expensive) Piazza Novena The suite also has a mini bar, soft drinks are free. Despite being on a main piazza full of life, the windows are double glazed so you don’t hear anything when shut. Cannot recommend this enough!! Service and suite were excellent.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great stay at this establishment. Wonderful view of Piazza Navona! Not just a view, sitting on the balcony you feel like you are part of the view. I was worried about the noise level. They have double pane windows that keep the noise and cold out. It was a clean, modern, spacious, warm room. A very charming place! I felt like a local staying here. It's an old palace. I had the pleasure of being welcomed by Tomas who was wonderful. He took the time to help me plan my evening and gave great recommendations. The location is amazing - shops, restaurants, cafes and you're staying on the piazza!! I highly recommend this place.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back and all I can say is this hotel was awesome and the balcony view of piazza Navona was amazing. Breakfast served every morning drinking my espresso from the balcony watching all the people was worth every penny.Every staff member I care in contact with was very polite and helpfully. On the last day 6 in morning I left my passport and money in the room along with room key as the cab was waiting outside I called and they immediately showed up to open the door as staff isnt always on premises. Rooms are spotless and for the most part modern.I would recommend very highly staying here.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from an amazing weekend in Rome where, as usual, the service from everyone at the Palazzo De Cupis was fantastic, the room (Junior Suite) is comfortable, breakfast is delicious (especially the choc au pain) and the view is breathtaking!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a hidden little gem, the location is unbeatable and the view from the window was breathtaking. We had the superior room with the window overlooking the Piazza and it was amazing, every day we sat at our window watching the people and the buskers. All major attractions are so close and within walking distance. The back streets were great and provided plenty of choice for lunch or dinner. Breakfast was delivered to our room each morning at the time you choose, starting from 7:30am and the selection is more than ample, although croissants were a little uneatable due to their burnt crisp state. It was an added bonus to have a fridge in the room with juices and soft drinks free of charge. The room was modern, generously spacious, spotlessly clean and the beds were super comfy. Once the shutters were closed we heard no noise from the outside or the room next door. We only ever saw the staff at check in, check out and when our breakfast was delivered, so just be aware no one is physically there to assist during the day/night. We would definitely stay here again - an unforgettable stay. TIP: get the private transfer from the airport, they will deliver you direct to the front door which would be hard to find without them pointing it out. Make sure you confirm your arrival time with staff. We waited at the entrance door buzzing for a good 15 mins till someone came along and were told the buzzer goes to another apartment.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a beautiful room, and the view from the room with its own small balcony was charming. The room was very quiet, the bed was comfortable, and the location provided a great central location to explore Rome. The conditions of the room however needed some attention; the bath and shower needed some maintenance and repair (signs of minor damage on floors, shower, and walls); the balcony was not swept of previous guests' cigarettes; egg shells were found in the hot water kettle, and the cable stations only showed a few local Rome stations and Arabic-language channels. Breakfast was not good: coffee, snacks, yogurt all were better obtained elsewhere.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Returned home from a four-night trip to Rome yesterday. My friend and I booked this hotel and requested a twin room. When we arrived we were showed to a room with an amazing view, but a double bed which we did not want to share. As there were no other rooms available the owner said he would sort it out. We unpacked and went out to take in the sights and have some dinner. When we arrived back, we were delighted to find a brand new single bed had been made up in our room. You would think that the room would now be cramped, but it most certainly was not! With a spacious shower, fresh towels every day, tea/coffee and a selection of soft drinks, continental breakfast served in the room (which we ate on the balcony) crisp cotton sheets on comfortable beds, free WiFi......need I go on!Definitely a 5 star location, but the 6th star is awarded for the extra effort made to make everything as perfect as possible for our holiday!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Rome last weekend and I could not fault this place! Fantastic location, extremely friendly and helpful staff, the place was completely spotless, perfect breakfast, amazing views from the balcony. I would highly recommend anyone to stay here... we will definitely be back!!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Palazzo de Cupis for 2 nights in August and we loved it.The location was perfect right on piazza Navona so very central and within walking distance of all major attractions.There were plenty of lovely restaurants nearby, and the train station was a 10 minute taxi ride away.The room was lovely, spacious and clean as was the bathroom.The breakfast was continental and served in the roomThe host was lovely very helpful with tips of where to go and what to do, and communication was very good leading up to our stayI would definitely recommend to stay here
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my 3rd visit to Rome and this is by far the best place I have stayed. When I return I will definitely book here again. Our room was spotless clean, had everything we need, amazing location within walking distance to all the sights of Rome- and the best part is the balcony overlooking Piazza Navona. I always dreamed of sitting looking over the square enjoying a prosecco and this place made my dreams come true. The staff are amazing and go out of their way to help you with anything. The breakfast is delivered to your room at a time that suits you, and was absolutely gorgeous. There’s not one negative thing I could say about this place. Choose the deluxe room with the balcony if you can as the views are just amazing. Thanks Palazzo De Cupis we look forward to seeing you again next time. Thanks for making our first wedding anniversary so special.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned this morning from Palazzo de Cupis and i have to say it was fantastic. All the positive reviews are well deserved. The location overlooking the Piazza Navona is beautiful, a wonderfully vibrant piazza to watch over with a glass a wine but because of the soundproof windows, easily blocked out if required. Because there is only 3 rooms we didnt see another guest until the morning of our departure which suited us fine. The concierge service was great, who arranged our transport to and from the airport which i would recommend as the entrance is in my opinion difficult to find. The restaurants just outside the entrance were amazing, our personal favourite being Ponte e Parione. All the landmarks are within walking distance. I really cant speak highly enough of the place, a real gem and would now be the only place i would stay on my next visit
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the the Palazzo de Cupis Monday to Thursday and I would definitely recommend this hotel! There are only 3 rooms, two of them have a balcony, we had booked the room with no balcony which was fine as the window opened and looked out onto Piazza Navona square which is always buzzing. The guy who met us and checked us in was super friendly and really helpful. I’ve not given full marks just purely because of internal noise and water pressure. Positives:-Amazing location, so central, safe and convenient -Booked our car to and from the airport using their concierge service that they offer, again this was faultless and only a few euros more than faffing around trying it get a taxi (this also meant the driver knew where to drop us off as the hotel is discreetly hidden!)-The windows completely shut out the noise from the Square outside-King size bed-Mini bar with free soft drinks-Continental breakfast is brought to you at a time you choose-Very friendly and family run, didn’t see another guest!-Good air conNot quite so positive:-The walls are thin so while there is no noise from outside, you can hear people coughing and running water in their bedroom or in the corridor-The shower pressure wasn’t great, washing hair would have taken a while!Tips:-We didn’t eat in the Square but had a very expensive drink at one of the bars...go round the corner and get a €5 Aperol Spritz and a meat and cheese board from the amazing I Pizzicaroli ! So cheap but top quality deli meat and cheese and very friendly-Uber is almost non existent and expensive, although we did find one at 3am after going to Stadio Olimpico for a gig -Download MyTaxi app, it’s great for whizzing around, we didn’t use public transportI would definitely return to the hotel if in Rome again.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unique little, 3-suite, gem overlooking the Piazza Navona. Great fun sitting on your private, small balcony watching all the activities and the tourists. And at night when you close the balcony door, its super quiet and sleeping is no problem. And at 5am the Piazza is completely empty with no people, just fountain and street lamps. Very cool.The suites are quite modern and comfortable with everything you need. And breakfast is served in your room at at time you designate. A word of caution, though, there is no one present after noon, so checking in requires calling Fabrizio to meet you there. And there are several flights of "palace style" steps to get to the rooms. This building is an old famous palace, so hence the steps. The entrance is a bit hard to find, and the access street is crowded with patio dining for several sidewalk restaurants that served what looked like horrible "Italian" food. I would never eat at any of these places. An interesting place to stay with a perfect location close to most major attractions. Try the Junior Suite, since it is fairly big and comfortable. Cant't beat the view.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 1 night here. The location is perfect and the room size is large, especially for Europe. The balcony was great for people watching. The windows were great sound barriers. The internet didn’t exist and I looked several times. I didn’t contact the office to complain or have it fixed. Luckily, I have international data on my phone and was fine with that for only 1 night. The plumbing makes a horrible sound with any running water in the bathroom. I’m guessing and electric pump is behind the wall. It was fine since I was alone. Sharing a room would definitely wake up the other person. I had an early departure so I didn’t get breakfast but it was offered after 0730. A nice place with a location that was perfect!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had reservations here for 2 nights. After the first night we checked into a different hotel. Could not put toilet paper in the toilet, how unsanitary. The water pump made a horrendous sound, neither coffee pot work and no hot water after one shower. I had to take a cold shower and was not happy. The owner notified Booking.com that we did not check in which was not true. By doing that I could not review them on Booking.com. How clever but I can do it here. Talked with the owner and agreed to pay one night and he charged us for both. He said he didn't care if we gave him a bad review. So much for customer service.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in Rome and we stayed a week in room 103 at Palazzo. When coming back I will definitely stay here again. I do agree with the other reviews telling you to avoid eating & drinking at the Piazza Navone (very expensive and not very good) but to sit on the balcony and watch all the buzz was very nice! and yes, when you close your doors its silent in the room! The room itself was of a good size, big closet, nicely decorated and very clean :-) Breakfast is served at your convenience (usually between 8-10) and contains yoghurt, cornflakes, croissants, pain de chocolat, juice and coffee/tea - i.e. not a big hotel buffé, but for us it was perfect - as we then anyway had big italian both lunches and dinner! and gelato in between.. The couple running the place were ever so sweet, helpful and flexible. We could check in right upon arrival (3 hours ahead) and when I had forgotten the key in the room one night they answered right away and where there in 10 min!! (thanks again!!) In my opinion I strongly believe we just couldn't have found a better place in Rome to stay! Nice personal touch, clean, ideally located - and with a nespresso machine and a fridge with free water/soft drinks and very moderate prices for the wine!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend and it was everything we could have wanted. From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel very welcome, our room was clean and tidy. This is the first time travelling abroad that I have felt perfectly safe when staying in accommodation. The mini bar offers you free water and fizzy drinks, the breakfast was a light snack to get you started for the day ahead. Our bed was ridiculously comfy, shower was relaxing and the hairdryer worked a treat! The accommodation is in a great location if your using public transport or walking to get around, it's not ideal if you hire a car due to nowhere to park. I would highly recommend this place for couples for a get away break. Thank you to the team for making our stay so wonderful!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I have just recently concluded our third stay with this property, and with each and every stay, we are happier and happier. My wife and I as we have done in the past, rented the Junior suite, which is large, clean, beautiful, and provides a balcony, with a stunning view of Piazza Navona. The changes for our stay this year was that my extended family rented out the remaining two rooms, as well as we brought along our six month old son. Ramin and Silvia were extremely accommodating, and went the extra mile, as always to assist us with anything we needed, and could not have made our stay, and made us feel welcome with the baby on this trip. Breakfast is served at the time of your choosing, and offers enough to get you started for your day, assorted pastries, cereals, and coffee. The rooms and facility are extremely clean, and well maintained. Free drinks within the mini bar, soda, waters, and some assorted wines and process for you. Two of the three rooms provide stunning views of the piazza with their balconies, that are large enough for a few people to hang out on. As well as the third room which provides a great view of the piazza through its large windows. All of the rooms are provided with noise proof windows for those loud nights in the piazza while you are trying to unwind, no worries there. The hotel is set in an ideal location, as all of the major tourist attractions are located within a 20 minute walk for you. While you are set within Piazza Navona, and its great views, and its abundance of high priced, mediocre food, you can escape that just by simply stepping out back of the property and wandering through the beautiful cobblestone streets. Once outback of the hotel, do yourself a favor and take advantage of the location and the overwhelming amount of delicious restaurants away from the tourist traps. You can step outside of the property and wander the streets for hours feeling like a local. There is also a nearby grocery store, multiple pharmacies, as well as wine stores within a minutes walk if necessary. My wife and I have traveled to Rome on several occasions, and there is no other property that we would stay at. A few years back we hit the jackpot when I discovered this place, and as previously stated, Ramin and Silvia are incredible hosts that will go out of their way to provide you with the best service and memories for your trip. The hotel hits all of the boxes to make your trip perfect, from the location, to the service, the nearby food and wine, to the stunning views, and to the ease of the walking to all of your favorite sites while in Rome.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in room 102. It was perfect. Just my wife and I in Rome. A small balcony big enough to sit out and people watch. A mini bar where the soft drinks were free. A whole list of places to eat within 50 metres. The room was small but had everything, the bathroom was a stand in shower. Be mindful of the steps getting in and out, you may stub your toe. The concierge service was efficient and helpful. WiFi is free. Breakfast is bought in at a time you request. I thoroughly recommend this area for culture and location. A walking distance to the bus routes and other landmarks.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I thought about giving this hotel a 4 star review. I mean the breakfasts compared to most in Italy are very modest. But, come on. The communication from booking on was excellent. Ramin met us and let us in on arrival after our trans-Atlantic crossing. Our rooms were excellent. We booked the two rooms with balconies for 4 nights (family of 4). The beds were comfortable, the AC worked well (though in late May we didn't need it that much), but the view from the balcony. Oh my. Sunrise. Sunset. Mid-day. Evening entertainment. Stupendous at all times.The location in Piazza Navona is perfect to walking almost everywhere in Rome.So, maybe the breakfast could have been a little more robust. But everything else so much more than made up for it. Five stars it is.Thanks for a great stay.Bill
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three days and had a fantastic time. The apartment has a balcony overlooking the Piazza Navona and drinking wine there is worth the price alone. This is a good base to visit St Paul's Basilica on foot and within easy reach of bus stops for Rome tours. The room is air conditioned which works well however you need to ensure the doors are shut and the outer blinds are closed. When we were there the temp was 34 plus and getting hotter. Tips - get a taxi if you travel by rail from Termini station 16 euro, private hire 35 euro. There is a taxi rank near to the apartment. We got a taxi at 0900 on a Sunday. Whatsapp is used by the conceierge and is a great way to make contact before and during your stay. The pgotos show the view from the balcony.This is an excellent place to stay and thoroughly recommended.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the junior suite for 4 nights, having the balcony was an absolute treasure. Most nights my partner and I bought a bottle of wine and sat watching the world go by at night on piazza navona. The room was smaller than anticipated but perfectly formed. The only fault (and only one) was the lack of cold air extracted from the air conditioning unit. It was constantly set at 16 degrees but the room never felt cold, something we needed in the 34 degree heat outside. Great breakfast, usual continental, pain au chocolate, croissant, yoghurt, coffee and juice. This is brought to your room at an agreed time. The mini bar juice and water are free with very reasonable prices for wine, beer, snacks etc. The winning point for this hotel is the balcony which are rare to find. I would highly recommend this hotel. A++
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location - personal service - romantic - central! Personal service, with breakfast in the room makes the morning perfect :D Lovely and romantic rooms, clean, the best view from our lovely balcony. It is so central, and you can walk to se most of what is to be seen in Rome. What can we say? We miss it already... We can not find anything negative, even if we try hard. We are 47 years old and celebrated our 25th. anniversary, and this was the best hotel from our point of view. This must be the perfect place for any couples, wether is it for a holiday, or a honeymoon. And we will be back!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The balconies overlooking Piazza Navona can't be beat. This hotel is clean, comfortable and the owners are friendly and accommodating. It was quiet with the balcony doors closed, even in the late evening when there were crowds in the Piazza below. The location is perfect for walking to major sights in Rome. A family of 5 ranging in age from 15 - 76, all loved this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As we were a little early the guys from the adjoining restaurant took us and our luggage in and served drinks. This proved to be a great find as an eating place.When Ramin arrived he carried our copious amount of luggage up the stairs into a lovely room, the crowning glory of which was the little balcony opening out onto Piazza Navona.There is no noise from the Piazza once the windows are closed but it is a pleasure to sit and watch the world go by from here, glass of wine in hand of course.The room is kept in an immaculate condition, plenty of clean towels, free juices, air conditioning and a comfy bed.Piazza Navona is a brilliant place to stay with lots of Rome's attractions within walking distance being half way between the Vatican and the Pantheon.We have loved being here.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited for three nights with my husband. Communication via email and whatts app was great. Taxi from airport dropped us right outside. Rami was ready to meet us at the property. Amazing location overlooking the Palazzo Navona. Walking distance to all main sights. We chose room with the balcony although it's not huge Ioved sitting in sun drinking tea in the morning watching the hustle and bustle. When doors were closed you could hear no noise at all. Decor was modern and tasteful. Dry clean
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I just returned from a three night stay during our honeymoon. The first night, our plane was very delayed, but Aram was very kind and accommodating to greet us at the hotel past midnight. The room was perfect with a fantastic balcony view of the Piazza Navona. Despite being directly above the busy street, the window was completely sound proof, and we were not bothered by noise at all. The location makes the Palazzo De Cupis the perfect place to stay in the heart of Rome. It is just a short walk away from all the must see spots in Rome, so we only had to use a taxi to get to and from Termini. If we ever make it back to Rome, we know where we will stay!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a fantastic two night stay at Palazzo de Cupis. Perfect location for seeing all the main sights, beautiful view and surrounded by great bars and restaurants. We won't look for anywhere else to stay the next time we head to Rome.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are almost finished here with our very first (and certainly not last) trip to Rome. On the strength of reviews here we felt good about booking this hotel - we were not disappointed. Simply put the majority of reviews here are correct - this is an outstanding property that absolutely lives up to its billing. Our trip got off to a great start - using their concierge service via WhatsApp they arranged transfer from the airport directly to the property (which can be hard to find or describe to someone who is not familiar with it). We were greeted at the door by Fabrizio who showed us our room and made us feel very comfortable immediately. The room was exactly as described. Immaculately clean with an updated and very clean and spacious (by European standards) bathroom. The view is, by itself, worth every penny to stay here. Our room's balcony overlooking the Piazza Navona is what vacation dreams are made of...in fact, I am typing this review as I sit on our balcony overlooking the square. The staff was very attentive to our needs and breakfast was served right on time each morning. We have been able to easily walk to all the major Rome attractions (Colosseum/Forum/Palatine, Borghese, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and the Vatican. I can't recommend this property highly enough. In fact, when we are next in Rome this will be the only place we will stay!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I just concluded our second stay within the Palazzo De Cupis, and just like our first stay, we could not have been happier. There are three great rooms within this property, and we have stayed in two of the rooms. Our first stay was within the Superior suite, which does not provide a balcony, however two large windows that open up directly to beautiful Piazza Navona. The windows are also set up for you to sit on a stoop and unwind after a long day with a glass of wine.This last stay, we were fortunate enough to stay within the Junior suite, which is a phenomenal room, while my father in law stayed within the Deluxe suite. The Junior suite, along with the Deluxe suite, is a very large, clean, and spacious room, that provides a large balcony on the second floor. For any travelers that have been to Rome, balconies are not easy to come by when booking a stay, and having this second floor balcony, with its view, is amazing, and only adds to a great vacation. For the traveler who loves to just sit back and "people watch", grab a bottle of wine, and unwind on the balcony, as you will not find a better place to accomplish your "people watching". The breakfast provided is served at a time of your choosing each morning, and is more than enough to get you started for your day of exploration. The two gentlemen who run the property, Ramin and Fabrizio, are extremely accommodating, and more than willing to answer any questions you may have, or to assist with transfer services, tours, or any further accommodations. The location of the property is perfect, for those of you who wish to explore Rome by foot, all of the major attractions are reachable within a short walk:Pantheon - 5 minutesVatican city - 10 minutesSpanish steps - 15 minutesPiazza Venezia - 15 minutesColosseum - 20/25 minutesThere is also a taxi stand about a hundred yards from the back door of the property.Outside of the property, within the Piazza Navona, are an abundance of restaurants. However, unless you are just looking for a glass of wine, I would steer clear. While they provide a stunning view of the Piazza, just like your balcony, they are tourist traps, the food will not be as good, and the prices will be higher. If you are looking for a real Roman experience, and restaurants, there is an enormous amount of options just outside the back door of the property. You will find cobblestone streets, off the beaten path, that you can wander for hours, and find great restaurants and wine. This will also help you get away from the large tourist areas, and help you feel like you are getting a real Italian experience.My wife and I have travelled to Italy several times now, and since discovering this property, there is no other place we will ever stay again while in Rome. We love the property so much, that we have already reserved our room for our next vacation. As well as my family has rented out the remaining rooms, as they have also fell in love with this property. One recommendation I would make is to arrange a private car service through the Palazzo de Cupis. The car service will bring you directly to the rear door and entrance to the property, as it can be difficult to find without.Thank you again for a great stay, and already looking forward to our next trip to Rome.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a 3 night stay and everything from the service, breakfast and the room was perfect, we couldn't fault anything and would love to stay again! The location is perfect and central and the balcony had a fantastic view over the Piazza Navona - would definitely recommend!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent three nights here and would definitely stay again. Large, clean room with balcony onto Piazza Navona, within walking distance of the Vatican and the forum. Lots of good restaurants nearby (ask the hosts for recommendations-we really liked il Corallo, maybe a 5 minute walk). Was a bit worried about noise from the piazza, especially being only one floor up in a 16th century building, but balcony door was absolutely soundproof! Be sure to stroll down Via dei Coronari off the north end of Piazza Navona for nice shops, restaurants & gelateria. It's on the way to the Vatican or Castel Sant'Angelo.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for only one night as we had traveled to the Amalfi Coast prior and on the return, we of course needed one more night in beautiful Roma before flying back to the states. We found this amazing gem of a hotel online and it did not disappoint. Having said that, we contacted the hotel staff prior to departing to the Amalfi Coast (we had been in a different location in Rome for 3 nights.) and asked if they wouldn't mind storing an extra,rather large suitcase for us. We did not want to lug it on the train with us if we did not have to. He more than obliged,kept it safe and had it placed in our room upon arrival. Now that is quality,attentive service! The decor is nice,modern and is spotlessly clean. Our view was beyond amazing.Our only regret was not being able to spend enough time in our room ( last minute shopping and eating filled our day!) It is not very often you can see Piazza Navona in the way that we were able to with the gorgeous view that we had.We had to sadly depart the hotel at 6:am so we were not able to have the breakfast that was offered.Defiantly a place to book again in the future.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great hotel! This place is small, very small! Only three rooms. All rooms are very nicely decorated and very comfortable. Two rooms have small balconies overlooking Piazza Navona, the other room has a window overlooking the piazza and also the side street. Service is good, someone is there to meet you and is available via whatsapp throughout your stay. Breakfast is delivered to your room at your specified time. Fantastic central location within walking distance of all the sights. A great change from the standard chain hotels.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent a lovely 3 day weekend in Rome, travelling to Sicily for our main trip. This hotel met every need and beyond; exceptionally clean, awesome location overlooking Piazza Novano, absolutely breathtaking; modern finishes; concierge service. We couldn't quite ask for a better Roman Holiday, a true diamond in the rough. Thank you!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved this hotel and it's location. The room was excellent. A small balcony overlooking Piazza Navona was perfect for an evening bottle of wine and watching people and the vendors. This was reasonable priced, clean and had everything we needed. The guys that worked there were very accommodating, easy to reach and took care of all our needs. Breakfast was included and very generous. The only small issue was, as an American, I could not get the room cold enough. The air-conditioning was working but could have been colder. Other than that it was perfect.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you you look for a special location then we really recommend this boutique hotel. The junior suite has a balcony to the Piazza Navona where you can have your breakfast or a glass of wine in the evening. Although the Piazza is always crowdy and busy, the windows are very well noise protected. The room was spacious and the furniture exclusive. The location is just perfect, all sights are in walking distance. I definitely would stay there again.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend the hotel. Location of the hotel is excellent, in front of Plazza Navona. Short 10-15 minute walking distance to many tourist sites - Pantheon, Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, the Colosseum and the Vatican. The room was spacious and clean, and the bathroom had a modern design and was newly renovated. Staff was nice and helpful with restaurant recommendations. Note the room on the left does not have a balcony, as the other two do, although it still has a view of the Piazza. My trip was during winter anyway, so I didn't mind.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although it really is all about the location – and the location is second to none – this place is really nice. Since it is a 3 room inn, it has some quirks. But it is a real value and a treat to be able to stay in the middle of one of Rome’s best attractions.I like to review with pros and cons, so here goes.Pros:1. Location. Overlooking fountain of Neptune! All the pics that have been posted of the rooms are accurate. Have included ones of the balcony, which I’m not sure was covered as well. Couldn't resist adding some of the view too.2. Quiet. They installed some really good windows. Couldn’t hear a thing from the piazza with it closed.3. Spacious. Okay, we booked the suite, but all 3 rooms are good sized.4. Nicely appointed. Very tasteful and comfortable, though some furniture is a bit basic.5. Hosts. The guys that we met were friendly and helpful.Cons:1. Ran out of hot water for 2nd shower on day 1. There were odd pumping and whistling sounds behind our room. Old building with renovated plumbing. Like I said, there are some quirks.2. Breakfast. It is okay, delivered, and should be adequate for most. OJ is very fresh. Would be helpful if croissants were not burnt and hard. If breakfast is your thing, just skip it and go out for breakfast. Don’t miss this place because of it. Teapot in room is great, and some might like the Nespresso machine.3. Front door knob. Do something different for access here guys. This thing is a bit past quirky and can be downright hard to operate. The outside and room doors are fine. Use something similar on the front door.Other:1. Shower is not as large as you might think from the pics. Also, it could really benefit from a shower caddy of some sort to hold shampoo, soap, etc.2. Balcony is really tight. Works best if you move the small folding chairs and table in front of the door (for the suite), but then you can’t close the window blinds. Still better than nothing. And I’m guessing there are strict limitations on making any changes.3. This is a second floor walk-up / walk-down. Be prepared for some stairs, but it is not on the 5th floor so should be fine for most.4. This is not a hotel and is not staffed at all times. Should not be a problem, just know what to expect.Did I mention the location is fabulous? Stay here and enjoy! Just expect some quirks and don’t expect a 4/5 star hotel and you will love it!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed for one night in a suite overlooking Piazza Novonna. The location was great. We were the same distance by foot from the Colosseum and the Vatican---about 30 minutes. We also were able to see the Trevi Fountain and several other piazzas by foot. We had trouble with the entry door in the afternoon but the manager was able to help us. The room had a sleek modern decor with a small balcony overlooking Piazza Novonna. The bed was comfortable and the AC worked great. The bathroom was large with amenities. Breakfast was delivered promptly at 7:30 a.m. as requested. The hotel was able to arrange car transportation for a fee from the airport on our arrival day and was able to arrange a car transfer to the port at Civitavecchia. This would definitely be the place to return to if we had more time to spend in Rome.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel in a great location. Very central to everything you would want to see.While not like a traditional hotel with a central manned reception. It wasn't a problem and the breakfast in the room in the morning was lovely. it was very nice to fin all soft drinks in the fridge free of charge.Everybody was very friendly and helpful . would certainly like to visit again
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved it here. Amazing location. Private. Super clean, beautifully decorated. Small continental breakfast in room, just what we like. Very Tiny terrace overlooking Plaza Navona. But the best seat in the house. Easy to get to, once you know where it is.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Within walking distance of all the major attractions, right on the Piazza Navona, this group of rooms is everything one needs to be comfortable in hectic Rome. Clean, well appointed washroom, comfortable bed, and did I mention the entertaining view of the square? The hosts are helpful, the breakfast is nice, delivered to your room at an appointed time. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a pearl, the location can´t be better, the rooms are perfect, comfy beds, balcony facing Piazza Navona, great staff. Breakfast in bed every morning at a time you decide, concierge that helps you with all you want. The place made us feel like real Italian people, like it was our home we went to every night. We love it!!There is only balcony in 2 rooms sp make sure you book one of them !
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location right on Piazza Navona cannot be beat! The room we had was a double with a little balcony. The balcony was great and the room was fine. It was also incredibly quiet even being right on a busy piazza! It was super tiny, but functional. They really needed to put some tissue and extra toilet pater in this room. The breakfast was sort of sad, but nice to have it included and delivered to the balcony. I am in LOVE with Rome and would like to live there if I could figure out how. Walk the city with a rough agenda and enjoy getting lost on the little streets. Eat at Cantina Lucifero and thank me later! Have the mushroom risotto with truffles. :-)
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, all the rooms overlook Piazza Navona. Noise is not an issue, however; there are very good new windows. Room was very comfortable, spacious, and clean, with ample closet space. Lovely bathroom with good toiletries provided. Very good breakfast that is delivered to your room when you request it. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The only negative thing I can think of (and it was not an issue for us) is the number of stairs. I would not recommend anyone with problems climbing stairs to stay here. Thank you, Fabrizio, for a wonderful weekend stay. Best of luck with your endeavors!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Clean, breakfast included, excellent location. The staff of the hotel was very friendly and helpfull.It has a perfect location for most of the important historical sites We really enjoyed our stay!! I shall return one day!!!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First, the location and standard of accommodation are excellent. The balcony looks out onto Piazza Navona with its spectacular Bernini fountain and bustling restaurants and bistros. The room is comfortably large enough and the bathroom well fitted out. The bed is one of the most comfortable I've ever slept on. The staff are very pleasant and friendly, but for me the place falls down a little on the level of service. After we'd checked in and the staff had left we found leftover toiletries in the shower itself and half used drinks in the fridge from the previous occupants, so for me the standard of housekeeping is poor. One of the bedside lights was not working, and when we mentioned it in the morning on delivery of the breakfast we were told it would be replaced during the day. It wasn't, apparently because the bulbs are unusual and they don't keep any spares in stock. As for the breakfast, the croissants/pain au chocolat were bordering on disgusting and helped not at all by the fact that over 2 days all of them were burnt to some degree. The 'toast' on the other hand was only toasted on one side. The sugar and soft drinks from the in room supplies were not replaced, so we couldn't even make tea. Having said all this the for me the place was still saved by the location and standard. I would come back but would hope to see more effort over the small stuff
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When I fantasize about having an apartment in Rome, this place is in my dreams. The Palazzo de Cupis is a 3-room hotel right on the Piazza Navona. Our room was gorgeous - large, well-appointed, with a modern bathroom - and it had a balcony on which I had my cappuccino every morning.Breakfast was included and brought to the room each morning. It included cappuccino, yogurt, Melba toast (rusks), corn flake cereal, croissants, and juice. It was almost too much - we never finished it all.The room was immaculate, with gleaming hardwood floors and a spotless bathroom. The location is central and within walking distance to everything. The piazza is bustling with people and musicians but it was quiet with the balcony doors shut and locked. The wifi was free but spotty - it kept dropping off, but that is a minor issue.I'm almost sad to post this review because I'd like to keep this hotel as my own secret place!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful weekend staying in a beautiful hotel. Location was perfect and the picture perfect view of the piazza navona was the highlight. Very small, intimate hotel with breakfast served in your room at whatever time you choose. A hotel for people who want minimal fuss in a stunning location. Great value for money. Thank you!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just 3 rooms here so didn't feel like a hotel. Staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was cleaned daily to a very high standard. Best location for sight seeing ever. View unto Piazza Navona was lovely. Would recommend it to anyone for a winter break.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Personal attention by the staff; best location in Rome, in my opinion; small balcony right on Piazza Navona!; ultra clean and comfort; breakfast is served to your room; 24/7 support via whatsapp! One small tip: notify the hotel about your check-in and check-out times some hours in advance.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at the Palazzo De Cupis! Well appointed rooms with plenty of space and a gorgeous view of the Piazza Navona. We felt like we were coming home to our own little flat instead of a hotel. Excellent location - lots of good places to eat and shop nearby and we could easily walk to many of the sites. Taxi stand is at the north end of the Piazza for your convenience as well. We would definitely stay here again if we are lucky enough to visit Rome again in the future!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best location for exploring Rome, or simply sitting on the balcony watching others exploring Rome! We loved this spot - the room was large and clean, the breakfast is delivered to the room, but the best part is the location. We walked everywhere, including to the Galleria Borghesi and back. The activity in the Piazza Navona ends around 10 p.m., but at any time the room is completely silent when you close the doors. We also booked the car service from the airport and it was great!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely boutique suite in a central location in Rome. The suite has comfortable beds , is fresh and clean and looks directly over the piazza Navona , one of the best areas in Rome I think. Our room didn't have a balcony and I would suggest booking a room with the balony if possible.Francesco looked after us really well ,we arrived early in the morning and forgot to let him know when we were due. He immediately let us in and gave us somewhere to leave our bags until our room was ready. If you want a central location and an " old style" boutique accomodation I'm sure you would enjoy the palazzo de Cupis.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right on the Piazza Navona you could not get a better location. Our suite had a balcony overlooking the Piazza so we were part of the action all the time. The suite was very large and comfortable, newly renovated with free wifi. They did bring a "breakfast" in the morning to your room but it not very palatable unfortunately. The host was very kind and helpful but this is not like a regular hotel or B&B. They are only available at certain times of the day (mornings unless pre arranged ) so you are on your own to get what you need whether that be a taxi or reservations on the fly. Fortunately everything is right outside your very large green door!!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent 2 nights and we have nothing but positive things to report. The room was clean and had very cold AC (Rome was over 100 degrees both days we were there!!) Great location right in the middle of Rome with an awesome view of piazza navona from the room. Tons of great small restaurants in the immediate vicinity. They let us leave our bags for a few hours after we checked out since our train wasn't until the afternoon which was very helpful.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location right on Piazza Navona - our room had a private balcony looking right over the square. The balcony is a great location to have breakfast, or in the early evening sit with a glass of proescco and people watch. Being so central the hotel is great for site seeing in Rome - for example the pantheon is 5 minutes walk away, and the Vatican 20 minutes. Service is great, our rooms was very large with a nice bathroom and comfortable bed. There was in room mini bar with free soft drinks, and very reasonable alcoholic drinks. Its a very small hotel - 3 rooms - so nice and quiet. As not one for you if you want an in hotel 24hour concierge, bar etc. Breakfast is very nice, and served in your room, but again as its a small hotel choice isn't as large as at a giant hotel.Recommended if you want lovely romantic place right in the middle of Rome.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On the whole, this place is great. We stayed for 5 nights in the junior suite and loved the location and having a small balcony overlooking Rome's most vibrant piazza - it's a people watcher's dream! It is also reasonably priced compared to other central rooms with a balcony.Piazza Navona is smack in the middle of central Rome so everything is walkable. The room is immaculate and the bed is huge and comfy. Breakfast was very good by Italian standards - you can tick from a list which includes pastries, fruit, yoghurt, toast, ham, cheese, conserves and cornflakes. Even though there's a Nespresso in the room, they make cappuccinos for you as well, which is a nice touch. (However, we found the coffee quite weak so we added an extra shot from the Nespresso machine.)The bathroom is clean with a good shower and a bidet as well. It'd be good if they had liquid hand soaps as it seems wasteful to have new soaps every day.We had a couple of slight niggles though... the bathroom was about to be fixed when we arrived. This didn't take too long but we were exhausted. Note - you cannot flush toilet paper down the toilet so there is a covered bin that you need to use. (This is quite normal in many parts of Europe.) They also installed double glazed windows while we were there so we had a slight wait to return to the room. The plus side is that the room is now incredibly quiet (which you'll need as there's an accordion player and a guitarist with 5 songs on permanent repeat - you'll know who I mean).Finally, we booked an early morning tour of the Vatican museums and Sistine Chapel through the manager, who did his best to get us the booking. Unfortunately, we waited over an hour and were never picked up. :( This is not the fault of staff at Palazzo de Cupis, but carefully research who you are going to do any tours with and book well ahead to avoid disappointment.Despite these minor niggles, it's a really good option and the guys who work there are friendly. They also had good recommendations for where to eat.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The facilities were comprehensive, including a minibar with free soft drinks and the bed was large and very comfortable. The bathroom was modern and very clean. The breakfast was served in the room and was sufficient but didn't offer the choice that a hotel buffet might offer. The concierge service was excellent and very helpful.I would recommend getting them to book your taxi from the airport as it would be difficult to identify the entrance on first arriving.There is a bit of late evening noise as it overlooks the Piazza but this is worth putting up with for the view from the window.The central location meant we could easily walk to all the main attractions.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful small boutique hotel with balconies and windows looking out onto Piazza Navona. We were made very welcome, our junior suite room was wonderful with a balcony on which we enjoyed evening drinks and breakfast. Very comfortable bed and good bathroom facilities. Staff were wonderful. Somewhere special for romantic getaway, highly recommend.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved the attention we received from the two owners of Palazzo De Cupis. While initially is was difficult to locate, it was cozy, with windows facing the plaza. Great place to stay! Let's go again!!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The most beautiful Suite with a view of the Piazza Navona., Very modern, and spacious the Junior Suite with a balcony makes you feel like you live in Rome, and not just a tourist. As you sit on the balcony the music,the people walking by, the sound of the fountains, the artist in the square, all add to the feeling of being a part of this beautiful eternal city! I can't imagine a better place to stay in Rome, The staff is amazing, and willing to meet all your needs. Breakfast is delivered to your room every morning on time, with the foods of your choice. Every primary attraction is within easy waling distance from this central location. So many family owned places to eat, just steps away. Water, and juice from mini bar where complimentary . coffee, and tea maker also available in your room. Beds where very comfortable, and the room was kept spotless every day. I wouldn't want to stay any where else while in Rome !!!!! Thank you, Ramin, and Fabrizio, Hope to see you again soon.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this place! Ideally located within walking distance of most of Rome's primary attractions, the lovely room #2 has a small balcony that is big enough for you and your significant other, a table, and a bottle of wine. Overlooking Piazza Navona, we spent morning, early evening and night watching the fascinating crowds in the Piazza. Artists and artisans, waiters, street vendors, musicians, joggers, priests and nuns, and tourists will keep you entertained as you relax from your long walks and tours of Rome attractions. There are wonderful restaurants very close by - outside the front door for instance. Be sure you take the 5 minute walk over to Campo di Fiori during the day for a delightful display of color and Roman personality. You will be taken care of by the staff as if you were royalty! Let them arrange your tours and other needs and they will not disappoint.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a 4 night stay in this lovely accommodation. We stayed in the Junior Suite which was very modern, spacious and lovely and clean (very important to me). Loved our balcony overlooking Piazza Navona, which is great for people watching and enjoying our delicious breakfast which was served each morning to our room. The staff were all welcoming, friendly, polite and helpful, offering great advice on places we wanted to go and good restaurants to eat in of which there were many within a 5/10 minute walk away. Coffee, tea and soft drinks were freely available. The suites are very central, we walked to all the main attractions and really enjoyed discovering the not so popular areas of Rome too. Our bed was extra large and really comfy, we both had really good nights sleep. Wifi connection was free and fine, we had no problem connecting.Staying at Palazzo De Cupis was the icing on the cake for us after a busy day discovering Rome, we loved the fact that we were not returning to a busy hotel but to our beautiful relaxing room a real bonus.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our suite was spacious and modern, it overlooked the piaza navona and was amazing.The staff was so friendly from arrival to check out.Easy walking distance to main Rome attractionsWe had an enjoyable stay and would highly recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Accommodation was clean very modern in a typical Italian setting, had a lovely Balcony to people watch in the Piazzo Verona, within in walking distance of all sightseeing tours and very welcoming staff.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed a 3 night stay here and didn't want to leave! Everything was perfect, from the welcoming and friendly staff to the wonderful room. Loved having breakfast served in the room. We had the junior suite which overlooks Piazza Navona-perhaps one of the best views from a Rome hotel room.Great area to wander around and easy access to other places of interest. Will certainly be back
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful stay, breakfast was outstanding and served in the room. Spotlessly clean everywhere. Room temperature was excellent. One small disappointment, it was my birthday and this was known by Management. A token of this was not experienced in our room. Apart from that our stay was excellent and I would recommend highly.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Been to Rome for work multiple times and this is the first time I've been thoroughly disappointed. The hotel was in the center of the city, if driving a car, think again, there is no parking close by, so you need to park 15+ minutes away and find your way to and from hotel. There are only three rooms, all very close together, and the lobby is in the middle so you can hear the other rooms very easily. The price for the value of the hotel is not worth it, if you're willing to pay this price, find a different place.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A hidden secret in Rome. Very nice, clean and tasteful rooms with a balcony on Piazza Navona, one of the most beautiful squares in Rome. Very friendly hosts and fresh breakfast in your Rome.Stunning!
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great, just over piazza Navona. The view is absolutely amazing, including the beautiful room! I'll definitely come back every time I'll be back in Rome. Delicious and fresh breakfast in the room! very friendly and helpful staff
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautifull hotelfantastic locationvery nice rooms very clean and comfortablecentrally locatedgood breakfasthelpfull and english speaking staffthe best choise of our trip.we defently will choose that hotel on our next visit to rome.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for Christmas Eve, and it was very romantic, quiet, and beautiful! The room was spacious with an amazing view of Piazza Navona and the bathroom was the largest we have seen in Europe! The breakfast was great as well and served right to our room at the time we chose. We loved this place and will definitely go back.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this boutique hotel is just unbelievable. we stayed in the Junior Suites and we had our breakfast in the balcony with the view of Piazza Navona.Ramin and Fabrizio made our stay even better giving us all the right information and sending us to the right spots. They even serve breakfast in our room!!the rooms were brand new and clean. the wifi was working perfectly and was for free.
hotelName:
17    Palazzo De Cupis - Suites and View
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself is plain , found the rooms to be cleanIf you take the breakfast offered , itwas lousy ! It not. In the hoter but in a coffeeshop next door. They give you 1 croissant only ! biscuits and pre prepared toast in wrpappers with jam or butter a coffee/tea and orangr juice and some sort of cut fruit. But the best thing about the hotel is the location Just a shirt walking distance from All the main attractions and sites
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a monastery before being converted and certainly has that feel about it. It’s very clean and really well positioned to get to many of the main sites. I’d recommend it for those wanting somewhere clean and comfortable to stay, but don’t expect the full hotel service.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here October, 2018. Made reservations online for 141 Euros a night under the impression this was a hotel on Via Veneto. On arrival my same rooms were advertised for same period at 58 to 62 Euros a night. When I complained I was given a 2 Euro breakfast voucher. This was a monastery. It is very clean but only service is cleaning. Internet works in lob by not rooms. We asked for pillows and were told to come get them. They have no service other than checking in and limited cleaning. Better and cheaper to rent an apartment, they will give you more service. This was blindingly overpriced for a medium sized room with monastery décor. That is to say, nothing but one cross. It was very noisy and would have been OK for 60 Euros but I was taken to the cleaners price-wise with no recourse and every time I put on my computer, the hotel came up on Booking.com at less than 1/2 what I was paying. I guess those good reviews came from people not used to staying in actual hotels. This place should be listed as a pension not a hotel. They had some nerve charging me what they did. Not a holiday season or high season. I felt I had just thrown 350 Euros out the window. The only positive is that we found some good restaurants in the area. The place they sent us for breakfast sucked.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Little conflicted about Casa I Cappuccini. First of all let me say, the staffs are amazing and very helpful. The location is just perfect. You are in heart of Rome near everything. Is very clean but!! Not sure if this is hotel. It feels little more like pension. Very simple, not much of furnitures. It have monstray ambience (not in good way) and the mattress are hard as rock. We had to rearrange the beds because I felt I was sleeping in hospital especially with cross hanging above the beds.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location next to metro stop. Close to good restaurants & attractions. Great staff. Very helpful and friendly. Clean & safe rooms. Very good restaurant on ground level for morning coffee & croissants and after dinner drinks. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was located steps from Piazza Barberini and the Metro. It was convenient. The rooms were clean and comfortable and the staff were helpful, especially Rosa. The stay included breakfast, which was at the restaurant in front of the hotel. It was only coffee and bread. There was not even cereal or yogurt. Good place to stay but eat elsewhere.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: They said breakfast included, but you only get one croissant, one cookie, coffee, juice and biscottes. Beds are very small and no cleaning done during your stay, only the basic. Very quiet and located only 1 minute from Barberini metro station. Staff are somewhat rude, but they can accommodate some time. To get into the hotel, you need to walk by the restaurant, look on your left and you will see 2 green doors and a ring. Ring the bell and they will let you in, then after you can use your room card.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed the simplicity of the hotel. Room was nice, very good bed. Clean room and bathroom, solid wifi for free.The staff in hotel was always pleasant and friendly.Location is great-nicely peaceful, yet in the centre. Just the breakfast-sweet croissants, coffee, juice and some biscuits. Some ham, salami, cheese would add a significant value.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel without breakfast. The hotel is close to a metro station and many bus stops are around the corner. As we had no breakfast, we bought some sandwiches which were offered near the big square in front of.The receptionist was friendly and it took less time to do the check-in and check-out.The room and bathroom were clean and with average size. It was located to the street. Of course there was noise from the street and the pub below but nothing unusual for a Capitol city. The room had AC, hair dryer, small fridge and a tresor. However we missed a mirror and used the one in the elevator instead. The bed was comfortable.The performance of the cleaning staff could be increased, especially the cleaning of the floor which wasn't done during the 4 days. As well the staff forgot their cleaning utensils in our room two times.However due to the good location and the small price we would choose this hotel once again.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 4 nights in this amazing 3 Star hotel, given the cost it’s one of the best options in Rome. I highly recommend this hotel, I had a great stay their. Also conseidering the cost, it’s the best!I listed below the most important points:PROS:- Great location, metro was just next to the hotel. - All Hop-On Hop-Off bus stops are right next to the hotel as well as the metro- Staff were Amazing! Very helpfull and friendly. You feel you are talking to friends especially Rosa and Gian Battista (Thank you guys).- Room was above expectations, very clean and daily room service. Two big windows overlooking the road- Lots of restaurants and cafes next the hotel- Safe was available on the room - Hotel was safe to stay and keep things at. It’s worth saying this is a religious houseCONS:- Internet connection was a bit poor and cutting off sometimes- No water, tea, or mini bar, just an empty room- Only spanish channels on TV, but I’m not there for TV- AC was not working in winter, room gets really hot unless you open the window which will turn into a bit noisy room due to cars on the rood, but that was fine.- If you are getting the one of the rooms overlooking the road, you will likely wake up every morning at 4am on the garbage collection noise :-/ 10 munites and you may try to sleep again.Just request for a room on the otherside.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let's be clear upfront: we were very disappointed. We had booked as a group and were expecting a minimum for a substantial price. The positive note: a great location in Rome and good bed comfort. For the rest, I have to say that- there is no phonic insulation and you will be very unhappy if your room looks to the via Veneto- the decoration is not existent and the general comfort very basic- there are no amenities in the room, not even the minimum expected in a 4* hotel- the tv channels are exclusively in Italian- I had not had such basic breakfast for decades (no fruit, no eggs, no yogurt, second hot drink charged extra, etc...)To be honest we shall not return there.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed at the Casa i Cappuccini two times- October 2015 and December 2016. I will only stay here when I travel to Rome. The hotel is in a great location, very close to the metro stop, or within walking distance to most of the sites if you prefer to walk. The room is simple, yet very clean! The front desk staff is very friendly and takes the time to talk with you, which allows you to learn about other cultures. Breakfast is available at the restaurant across the street.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our hotel room was clean and quite and the hotel itself is located in a great central location - in walking distance to most of the famous Rome landmarks. Very good value for money. The staff was also friendly and helpful.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two days in Rome and this hotel is wonderfully located close to Trevor Fountain ... we've walked all over Rome and the max distance we've had to walk was about 2.5km one way.The only issue I've had was that the front desk staff was not too helpful or knowledgeable ...
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a beautiful hotel located in a quiet street just 4 minutes walk from Piazza Barberini . All staff we encountered were friendly and professional and nothing was too much trouble , especially we would like to thank you the guy from Armenia for his warm ospitality . Our room was beautiful and very clean . The breakfast was perfect.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in three hotels during my visit to Rome and Florence and I absolutely have to recommend Casa i Cappuccini.First off, even before I arrived, I had some issues with my credit card and the hotel's management graciously agreed to not cancel my reservation either way. Not only that, we arrived to warm greetings and an energetic receptionist (GB!) who answered all of our questions enthusiastically. The rooms are quite large and extremely clean and the bathroom and shower are excellent and super hygienic. The only thing I would say is missing is mirrors (we were three girls so it was important :D)We also met Rosa and Julia, two more amazing staff members. I have to mention that Rose helped us deal with random and tedious requests (even calling the Apple store and staying on hold for ages to help us book an appointment) while also having to deal with a terrible flu. She did all this with a smile and genuine interest in helping us. The vending machine at the reception is extremely convenient and the hotel is located directly next to a metro station and a taxi stop and several bus lines. The area is perfect for shopping and we reached all the main areas of Rome on foot.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Through Monasterystays.com we found the most unexpectedly amazing hotel in Rome! The Casa per Ferie Cappuccini was clean, beautiful and the Barberini area was so central to many wonderful sights, such as the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps, just to mention a few. There was many restaurants right on the street, and the Metro and bus lines were right there. The tree lined street and wonderful ambience was everything we hoped for.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came here for a weekend trip. Had everything you want. Close to great restaurants and not far from most of the tourist sites. Very comfortable bed. Very clean and nice and quiet. Air conditioning wasn't cool at all, we spoke with reception and they told us it was working.. it still wasn't so we were very hot and had to sleep with the windows open. Shame as everything else was perfect.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good news - Well equipped bathroom, very clean and more than adequate water pressure.Convenient to retaurants.Unpleasant news - Rooms facing Via Veneto suffer the roar of traffic 24 /7.Air conditioning is either regulated to prevent excessive power consumption, or it malfunctioned. After the thermostat was set to lowest setting, 18, very cool by most standards, but the room remained uncomfortably warm and humid.If you find that the A/C works for you, be sure to request two "key" cards, so that one can be left inside the room within the electrical control slot - otherwise the A/C reverts to standard settings while you are out and about, which may be much warmer than you prefer. These are high ceiling rooms requiring much time to cool down.Beds are very narrow, making it difficult to turn and sleep on your side. Electrical outlets require old style converters."Breakfast" is limited to coffee/juice/croissant.All cable channels are limited to only Italian language content.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If this is the area you want to be near (Spanish Steps), then this is a really good hotel. The rooms while simple, are cosy and very clean. Bathroom is good sized and room is larger than other 4 star hotels around the same area which I had stayed at before. Beds are extremely comfortable. Breakfast was ordinary, though. Reception is friendly and helpful Booking directly with hotel was easy. They were immediately responsive to queries. The church and crypt have also been restored and worth a visit. There is a lovely pasticerria, gelato shop and restaurants at the hotel. The location is walking distance to the Spanish Steps and all the shops below the steps. There are many restaurants around the area. The metro station is also at the doorstep. Easily accessible. Would definitely return.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 2 nights as a part of a school trip. My stay here was more so a negative experience because of what the people around me were saying - that the room looked like it was from the movie 'The Exorcism' and that during the night they had a HELP button glowing red.
