The bathroom light also turned off by itself when I was looking in the mirror, which totally freaked me out.Besides those aspects, our room only had 2 beds and there were three of us, so I had to sleep on a fold up bed with a rock hard mattress that was incredibly uncomfortable. The wifi was really dodgy so we had to sit around in the reception room to check our social media. Our windows also backed onto a large courtyard, so if someone else had their window open and was talking loudly it would echo. However, the hotel was conveniently located as it was only a short walk to the train/subway station, and there was a gelato store near the entrance of the building - which was a plus.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at I Cappuccini on October 8th for 5 nights. We were greeted by Rosa, with a big smile and treated us like we were friends. The rooms were as described, clean and comfortable. Breakfast was served in the restaurant in front of the hotel or across the street. The hotel was centrally located on Via Veneto next to Piazza Barberini where there is an entrance to the metro (5 minutes to Termini station or the Vatican). The Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain were about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Every morning Rosa would talk to us about our activities the day before and what we had planned for the day. Rosa gave us recommendations and even texted me to see if we found our way. Rosa introduced us to Gianbattista, whom I communicated with via email, and Gianbattista greeted us like old friends.With the cleanliness and comfort of the rooms, central location, and especially the warmth and friendliness of the staff made us happy that we stayed here and recommend this hotel. Next time we visit Rome we will definitely stay at I Cappuccini again.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect B&b, A little bit difficult to find, i we had to ask for the door, but once you are there, it is A perfect place for stay in Rome. The metro at piazza Barberini is 20 meters away, the taxis 50 meters. The rooms are big, interior minimalistic,but well functioning and the bathroom big, new and as you stay in A 5 star hotel. And the Internet is working well, which often is A surprise in Italy. Location: superb. We stayed for 3 nights and will return.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These accommodations are well located near Barbarini Plaza, the Spanish Steps and the US Embassy. Well maintained and comfortable. On a well traveled, lively street. Great value. We would happily stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located within walking distance of public transport and located close to many of the attractions of the city, which were easily visited daily. The hotel itself was excellent, rooms were comfortable and a lovely restaurant was provided, overall the stay was very enjoyable.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked via an agency that handles accommodation in monasteries, although you can book this place through booking.com too. However, it isn't a standard hotel experience. There isn't a 24 hour reception (your room key also opens the front door), there is no room service, phone in the room or laundry, and wifi only in reception.Also, the conversion of the building is not yet complete, there were workmen still much in evidence on the ground floor when we stayed. However the room itself was beautiful and clearly there has been a lot of investment in high quality fixtures and fittings. The room was very spacious, tastefully and simply decorated. The bed was large and very comfortable. The floors were a lovely warm stone. Room and the splendid bathroom were spotlessly clean. It was also very quiet, despite being almost on top of Piazza Barberini, as it looked out over an internal courtyard. The whole place had a lovely calm atmosphere.Breakfast is at the Cafe Suggestum opposite. Unless you have a very sweet tooth ask for a plain croissant, otherwise you'll get one filled with custard, or even worse, Nutella.The staff were very welcoming and helpful and the place is extremely good value for money in an expensive city.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located tumbling off the Barberini Metro Station, the lovely hotel is new and welcoming to the weary traveller on the wonderful via veneto. Trevi Fountain was quite close, Piazza Novona & Pantheon at a walkable distance. 1 metro stop away from Termini meant getting in was relatively easy.Room was well appointed with the much needed air con, comfortable beds, spacious bathrooms and clean linen. The staff was very friendly & sympathetic especially since my wallet was stolen near Porta Portese Flea market. The breakfast across the road at the cafe was adequate to kickstart the day..In Italy, you need room to stuff your tummy as well! Via Veneto itself is very charming and has a relaxed yet upmarket vibe. Do check out Villa Borghese gardens which are nearby. If ever back in Rome, I'm definitely coming back to Casa I Cappuccini.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Casa I Cappuccini in May 2014. Newly open, I found the hotel quite wonderful. Located next to the Capuchin Monastery, near the Piazza Barberini, on the Via Veneto, it is very well located. The rooms are spotless, the staff was helpful and kind. The only Wi-Fi is in the neatly appointed lobby and breakfast provided in a charming café across the street. It is near enough to walk to the Trevi and several good restaurants can be found near by. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked 4 rooms--1 for 2 nights and 3 for 4 night--directly with the hotel. This property was renovated in 2013 and is very nice. The rooms were large and the bathrooms larger than normal. Some of the rooms had additional beds in them. Breakfast was across the street at the Suggestum Cafe and consisted of juice, bakery item, and coffee or tea. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. Laura, at the front desk, was very helpful and patient with us. We arrived around 10 am and were able to check-in as the rooms were already available. Locations is good--next door to the Barberini Metro stop and the buses stop out front. The rate we paid was better than anything else I found and my charge card wasn't charged to hold the rooms until a few days before arrival. I would go back.
hotelName:
18    Casa I Cappuccini
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just completed our trip to Europe with a stay at the Hotel Colosseum and we were a walk or bus away from all of the wonderful sights we planned to visit. Great value and clean rooms. Diego and Massimo at the reception desk were courteous and kind in helping us navigate the area. They even arranged in advance for a larger taxi to pick up our group of four with luggage - the driver offered interesting and insightful information about Rome as we made our way to the airport. Breakfast offered a wide array of options for any palate and the staff in the dining room was friendly and welcoming. Can't say enough about the rooftop area to see beautiful Rome in the late afternoon and evening (temps were very hot whilst there). Lots of wonderful restaurants near the hotel as well. If you plan to join a tour of Vatican City or the Museums from the hotel, either by bus or taxi, plan on lots of walking and extra time to get to your meeting point. We were a half hour late to our meeting point, so missed the guided tour and had to walk around on our own. Expect lots of crowds this time of year, but well worth the trek!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We just completed our stay at the Hotel Colosseum and we could not have been more pleased. It was perfect for our needs in every way. And to top it off, like icing on the cake, the rooftop terrace was a wonderful way to end each evening. The view was spectacular! We highly recommend the Hotel Colosseum. It was indeed PERFECT!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay, excellent staff - in particular Massimo, at the front desk was exceptionally helpful. The rooftop is great in the evenings and night. Easy walking to all major sites. The A/C worked very well - it was in the mid to high 90's, when we were there.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is beautiful, we arrived at 12.30pm and our room was ready for us, its modern clean and definitely value for money. Breakfast was amazing catering for everyones needs. The rooftop pool was a god send due to the heatwave, with an amazing view of the colosseum.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location near important sites and fine restaurants. Charming with beautiful views from rooftop deck bar, available only to guests. On a quiet side street. Includes a bountiful breakfast buffet with American coffee available.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Will stay again if going for another Roman Holiday. Staff was really nice and helpful - Colosseo and ruins next to it, great restaurants and vibes with old cobbled quarters nearby. The ice cream parlour and coffee shop downstairs were awesome for such an affordable price compared to other EU countries!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend Hotel Colosseum!The location of the hotel is fantastic and an easy walk from the Termini station. The staff at the hotel were very professional and knowledgeable and were able to provide us with some delicious restaurant recommendations and some suggestions about Rome. The hotel was exceptionally clean. We also really enjoyed to complimentary breakfast. The rooftop patio was a fantastic place to enjoy your morning coffee or unwind in the evening with a drink (or just to take in the spectacular views!). We also appreciated the complimentary luggage storage as we arrived much earlier then check in time and we departed late in the evening. The rooms also had air conditioning which was necessary due to the summer heat in Rome. Highly recommend Hotel Colosseum! I would not hesitate to stay there again or to recommend it. Enjoy your stay!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is really centrally located in downtown historic area of Rome. I loved the atmosphere of the hotel. The rooftop bar is really nice with good views and reasonably priced drinks. It was quite busy every night from all the guests from everywhere. Nice happy hours. The rooms were clean, and the beds comfortable enough. They stored the bags for us until check in time became available.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our 3rd trip and we still haven't seen it all. This hotel is a great value. It's clean, centrally-located, and has great employees. I'd highly recommend it! We're a short walk from Santa Maria Maggiore and less than a mile from the Colosseum itself. A convenient Metro stop will get you anywhere you can't on foot.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel was wonderful. They were always helpful and accommodating with a friendly smile. Our room was clean and had a double bed and a single which worked great to use for luggage as this was our last stop on 2 week vacation and needed to organize before flight home. 7th floor provided nice view of Rome from our window. Also only a few steps up from our room to the lovely rooftop bar and terrace. We loved relaxing and taking in the view here with cold drink. The location was very good. Front desk was great about calling taxis for anyplace too far to walk and they were there in minutes. Also taxis were not too expensive which was nice. There are many restaurants and bars close by this hotel. Again the front desk was a big help for us. The breakfast was good and service was excellent. Overall this hotel was an excellent value in convenient location and would definitely stay here again and recommend to others.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the hotel 6 hours before the check in time of 14:00. As the rooms were not available, we had to wait for almost 4 hours before the room was allocated and we were not offered any drinks or beverages too. The receptionist was kind and arranged a room 2 hours before our check in time. After 13 hours of travel and 4 hours of waiting in the lounge, we were very much disappointed at the first glance of our room. It just fitted our luggage and there was no space to walk around. The room was extremely small and so was the size of television which was more like a computer screen. There was not much staff and therefore we had to go down to the reception to collect the things we wanted like plates and spoons. The location of the hotel is however nearest to one of the attraction of rome but the room view was also not that great to compensate the inconvenience.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very close to one of the pick up stops on the hop on hop off buses. Two blocks and with a two day pass we did not need a taxi to get around. The desk staff are very professional and the room was clean and comfortable.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel located on a smaller road off the main road, on one of the many hill slopes in Rome. We chose the hotel partly of location, but walking from the Termini was not quite as easy (due to the slopes/stairs). However, upon checkout we decided to walked to the Cavour Metro station and then took the train (1 stop) to Termini, which was much easier. Shops and restaurants are nearby along the main road, and indeed, the Colosseum isn't very fair either. Off the main road, so it's relatively quite. Rooms are clean and comfortable enough. Breafkfast was decent. The rooftop bar was lovely -- especially nice for lounging to the sunset over the city. Did not interact much with the staff except to drop/pick up the key whenever we went out/returned, but they were polite.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a excelent location. Near Colosseum and Santa Maria. Very quiet and nice neighbourhood. Subway is nearby hotel, but the shortest way is wery difаicult. It's a very welcoming and friendly hotel. The room was enough cleanliness, comfortable and not noisy. The breakfasts were very nice with greate choice . But the thing of this hotel is rooftop with stunning and magnificent views. It's a really romantic place. May be the price was overpriced, but it was worth it.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with my daughter. Quiet hotel, lovely stay, good breakfast. Its quite close to church Santa Maria Maggiore. Restaurants and mini marts next street over. Very informative and helpful staff. Fab rooftop bar with views of Roma ❤
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is within easy reach of the city sights, the Sightseeing bus stops a 5 minute walk away and it is 10-15 minutes walk to the Colosseum. There are numerous Restaurants in the Hotel vicinity. The staff in the hotel were very friendly and provide useful information on arrival. The hotel provides transport to the airport at a reasonable price.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed in this hotel, very clean, easily accessible and staff very friendly. The rooms are small but got everything you need and the breakfast is wonderful.This hotel is in the best location for exploring as it’s 10 minutes from the train station and the collosseum. We managed to walk to all the big attractions with the longest one being 30 minutes. Lots of restaurants close by that have fabulous menus and amazing drinks! Would 10/10 recommend this hotel to anyone going exploring in Rome.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our group of 2 couples enjoyed 4 nights in May. Great location although a little difficulty in finding the hotel even though very close to the train station. After that all was really good with welcoming front reception staff the cleaners and food services staff for breakfast where all excellent and helped us if needed. Loved the roof top terrace. Unfortunately a bit cold when we stayed so the roof top was used quickly to take beautiful sunset photos and have a quick drink. Thanks to the bar staff at night. Will definitely stay again if going to Rome.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Outstanding location with an amazing rooftop for views and drinks. Would have gotten 5 stars, but rooms were super small and shower was unconventional (handheld). Service and staff were amazing and it is super clean.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Colosseum is very comfortable with old world charm. Rooms are small, but adequate. Good location in Rome, within walking distance of the Colosseum. Nice continental breakfast. Desk staff was friendly and helpful. There was no porter, so you must be able to carry your own luggage.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We a couple of senior citizens stayed in that hotel for 8 nights at the end of May 2019.We got room No` 74, a spacy room, nice bathroom, excellent shower, good beds, and a large open air terrace.The location is excellent, close to public transportation stations, touristic attractions, and Italian restaurants.Since the hotel is located in a side street , it is off main street traffic noise, the room was very quiet It seems that the hotel was recently renovated, because all the building items were new and well operating.The receptionists, Massino and Damiano were very helpful and solved us a serious problem.There is a pleasant atmosphere in the hotel, not luxury but decency and good service. We liked the hotel and recommend it.The breakfast buffet was nice, the food of good quality, only one disadvantage, almost no vegetables, that should be changed.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a week at this hotel and were wildly impressed. The staff was exceptional and could not of made us feel more welcome. They had a nice breakfast every morning where they too treated you to perfection! The room was nice and the location was fabulous!! Thank you for a making our trip to Rome a wonderful experience!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I just returned from a visit to Rome and stayed in this lovely small and quaint hotel. The staff was superior in every way from the initial booking of our reservation to our check out. They readily responded to any email inquiries I had before our arrival. Our room was very clean and tended to daily. The rooftop terrace/bar was an added bonus. If I had to find something negative, I guess it would be that the shower is too small, but that is the only thing that comes to mind. A wonderful experience!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our group enjoyed our stay at Hotel Coloseum. The staff were lovely. The front desk staff spoke good English and were very helpful with maps and directions. The breakfast ladies were so gracious and lovely.Our rooms were comfortable and we enjoyed having a drink every night up at the rooftop bar.Location was good with a short walk to the open air buses, trams and Coloseum and plenty of restaurants everywhere.Good mid range hotel and would stay again.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room was fine and very clean. As was suitable for the weather conditions we slept with the windows shut and were hardly disturbed by any outside sound. The hotel was very centrally placed for public transport. The receptionists were most helpful with all our requests for information. All the staff were helpful and friendly.The roof top terrace was great for a view over the city.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely hotel, it’s so quaint and the rooftop bar is really pretty with amazing views and very reasonable prices. The reception staff are extremely helpful and nothing is too much trouble. The waitresses in the breakfast room are delightful and the food is just right to start your day. The rooms are comfy and spotlessly clean. I would thoroughly recommend this hotel which is in the perfect place to explore the fantastic city of Rome.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Colosseum was a great little spot - wonderful location! The rooftop bar in the evening is delightful! The marble floors are wonderful - and the staff is most helpful. The arranged shuttles to/from the airport were wonderful, with the driver providing all kinds of historic details on the ride. GREAT spot!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is best i ever seen. Here rooms are so clean and tidy. Here rooms are so big and here Free WIFI is available. Free parking is available in basement. high security is available for cars and bikes.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a couple days. It was within walking distance to several things. The rooftop bar view was amazing and a it was great place to relax. It was immaculate and the desk was very helpful. Will definitely come back.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent roof top bar, a wee gem and a lovely surprise . Room was large and very clean . Very comfortable bed and large en-suite . Excellent location for many bars and restaurants . Hop on bus not far away either. Be careful with taxi from station as took a long route for a short distance. Check price before you get in. Excellent 4am taxi to the airport
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I found this hotel for our trip to Rome. We had a great time there. The staff are very helpful. The hotel is a two minute walk from a beautiful church you will see as you drive in. Its about a ten minute (very straightforward walk) to the colloseum area of rome. Lots of nice restaraunts around it. The entrance is off a side street, not on one of the higher traffic streets. The rooms are clean and simple, with what looks like recently updated bathrooms. They are not particularly large, which i have come to expect from thia kind of hotel in europe. Their claim to fame is their rooftop sitting area and bar, which does have amazing views. I have already reccomended this hotel to another family member traveling here and will do the same in the future.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: -reception is open 24h a day which is a big plus. However the welcome was a bit cold but correct. No smiles.-location of the hotel was just off the main road but not too straightforward to find. It's between the main train station and the Colosseum up a hill.-The view on the terrace was nice, but I would not chose the hotel for this reason. You get better views from other buildings/cathedrals. You can just about make out the Colosseum.-the room and bathrooms were nice and large. The walls however quite thin. We were woken up every morning by someone showering and scrubbing? At 5.45 am.-Breakfast- nothing to complain about. If you want your coffee from the kitchen you have to approach the waitresses yourself. They won't ask you automatically and they will not do it with pleasure either.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back form a few days in Rome. We stayed in this very good hotel and had a very enjoyable and pleasant stay. As the name suggests it's within walking distance from the Colosseum on a quiet street off via Carvour. Via Carvour itself within walking distance from the main railway station, Termini. Staff were very helpful, Thank you Diego for researching some restaurants/areas to eat for us on our last night. Our room was a little a small but adequate, we were out so much we just needed a place to put our heads at night The room was very well service for us on our return after a long day exploring Rome. Very decent breakfast, clean dining room and smiling staff genuinely wishing you Buon Giorno !All in all, I think the title above covers this great hotel in Rome - try it !
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Colosseum Rome delivers what it promises. It provides a comfortable base to explore ancient Rome and is about half a kilometer from the train station as well as the colosseum itself (we could see the top of the colosseum from our fifth floor room). the parthenon neighborhood is a couple of kilometers away so you'll likely need public transport to get there. There are two metro stops a couple of blocks from the hotel. Adequate places to eat also a couple of blocks away on the main drags as well as off the piazza facing the basilica nearby. Our room faced East so in the morning you could open the double shutter style windows and let the sun in while looking out over the tile rooftops; quite pleasant. The neighborhood was quiet at night (although the Blue Moon strip joint is around the corner). rooms are an adequate size, euro efficient, clean with high ceilings and good bathrooms (very small shower). Believe the property is seven floors with a tiny elevator that won't operate with more than four bodies on board. A white marble staircase runs from the lobby to the top floor terrace. Compact lobby with adjoining public room/bar. Breakfast room is a good size and offerings are adequate with juices, coffee, scrambled eggs, bacon, pastries, some cereals and pastries; need more fruit selection. All front desk & breakfast staff are accommodating and helpful. Enjoyed our three nights.Sam & KathyVancouver, Canada
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were attracted to this hotel because of the rooftop bar that’s open all year round and although the views were amazing - it was a little too chilly to stay up there for too long (the blankets up there were very much appreciated!) The hotel itself was absolutely spotless and ideally located in a quieter neighbourhood of Rome however not far away to be able to walk to a number of great restaurants, bars/pubs, gelato places / bakeries and shops / supermarkets. Also only a 10 minute walk to the colosseum and Roman Forum. We stayed on the 2nd floor and had a little balcony which made a good addition when we opened up the doors as the rooms are fairly compact but in saying that, they had enough space for our 4 night stay. We found the bed extremely comfortable and extra pillows / blanket were in the room if needed. Our room had a small in-room safe (not large enough for an iPad), tea and coffee facilities and a hairdryer. The shower was great and always hot and in its separate room and I liked the green marble look to the bathroom. Breakfast was lovely, although it was a continental breakfast there was plenty of choice and also the addition of bacon and scrambled egg which was a nice surprise. The two ladies that worked the breakfast shift were very friendly and attentive. The rest of the staff we came across were also welcoming and happy to help with organising airport transport and also giving recommendations. A big Thankyou to all the staff and especially to Diego who kept us entertained and topped up with drinks until the early hours of the morning. A great base on a city trip to Rome.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Colloseum is a lovely bed and breakfast hotel,this was our third visit, it is situated within easy reach of central Rome, termini, great restaurants nearby. Comfortable room with balcony, warm and spotless. Staff are all really helpful and pleasant. Great little bar available. Thank you, I’m sure we’ll be back.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first time to Rome, and had a bit of travel delay and luggage issues, but we checked in and the staff was amazing and make our stay less stressful! Wonderful food recommendations, help us book tours. The rooftop terrace what a view! We will definitely same here again! The location was so central to everything from the Colosseum to the Spanish Steps! The rooms were cozy and loved the towel warmer, and our outside sitting area!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a Very nice hotel with very friendly staff. It is very clean, and they serve a nice breakfast. There is a beautiful rooftop terasse with a fantastic view of the city. The hotel is perfectly located on a quiet street, very close to the Colosseum and Forum RomanumWe give the Hotel Colosseum our very best recommendations.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I decided to head to Rome for a short break as she received a new bag for Christmas. Opted for the Hotel Colosseum. The roof top terrace was an attraction as the city views looked amazing. We were not disappointed.We arrived via Terravision bus transfer from the airport, drop off at Termini station and took the short walk to the hotel.The hotel is welcoming, staff are friendly and give useful information. Our room albeit on the snug side had the basics which all functioned as they should and was clean! The room did have a safe, not a combination lock but with a key. It is 3star so not luxury but covers all the basics well. It is a central location with easy access to attractions on foot. Colosseum, Sant Maria Maggiore, train station, hop on hop off bus root, we also walked to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain from there. Also a good selection of places to eat within easy reach.With the central location comes city noise, our room was at the front of the hotel and even though the hotel is located in a side street it can still be noisy. Mainly Friday night for us. It was eased by closing the window.Breakfast was typical continental style.For a city break the hotel is in a great location, the staff are very pleasant and helpful and overall I would recommend it and happily stay again.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed staying at this hotel. It is old and decor is traditional but still has a great feel. Staff were all very friendly. Rooms were clean and linen good quality. It’s easier to walk everywhere in Rome and from here we walked to Restaurants, the Coloseum, Trevi, Pantheon and Capitale Museum. There are no views from the rooms however there is a rooftop bar area with great views of Rome. No fridge in room, no room service, no meals except breakfast - bar available anytime. Small bathroom - might be a challenge for larger folk. Breakfast was good range of continental/European plus bacon and scrambled eggs. I recommend this hotel for a mid range priced hotel. I would stay again.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very polite and friendly staff, clean and pleasant hotel. For me the pillows could have been softer but no complaints about anything else as far as service and cleanliness.The approach to the hotel is a little narrow on the pavements due to parked cars so care is needed especially at night.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel had a great location for the metro, Maria Maggiore, Colloseum, trainstation etc etc.The breakfast was lovely and full of choices.The food top area was nice and had a great view.The price was decent for Rome.The room was big enough, very clean and nice bathroom.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful little gem right in the heart of Rome! Price is very reasonable for a downtown hotel so close to everything!! We were able to walk to nearly all the major attractions. Such a beautiful little boutique hotel!!! Staff was friendly and very helpful. Added bonus was our little balcony with an amazing view! Also can’t beat the rooftop bar!!! Well worth every penny!!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was central to all we wanted to visit, some of which was within walking distance. Room was very clean and fabulous shower! Staff were friendly and curteous. Roof top terrace was fab especially the views and bar also available. Nothing was too much trouble.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I picked this hotel for the name and it's proximity to the Colosseum. When I come back to Rome it will be to here. The rooms are well maintained, the breakfast excellent (all tastes covered) and the staff lovely.It is well placed for a short walk to a number of top attractions and many good cafes and restaurants. I will be recommending this hotel to others for good value and great service
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: what did you expect? the best for its prize. incredible. more travel is what you need if you think that this is a bad hotel. not every hotel is 5 stars, remember that. good service, everything clean, close from everything... what else can i say? everything i needed and 0 problems.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel near all attractions walking , very clean and safe, Its breakfast buffet is great and the view from the terrace amazing , the front desk arrange a night tour when the ones a hire already cancel on me , Stefano did a amazing job in 2 1/2 hours showing us all Rome at night , I definitely would stay again here
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with friendly staff, especially Diego on the front desk.Our room was very clean with everything that we needed, including a terrace and hot, powerful shower.The breakfast was good and the roof top terrace and bar was a lovely place to unwind after a days sight seeing.Easy walk from Termini train station, Hop on, hop off bus stop and the Colosseum.Lots of reasonably priced restaurants nearby and a good supermarket.Would stay here again, when in Rome.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is situated within walking distance to see some of Rome's finest areas. Close to the Hop on Hop off tours. The rooms were clean, the staff friendly and the view at the top of the hotel is gorgeous. Breakfast was ok - nothing special, however gave a bit of a good start to the day.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just average. It is about a 10-15 min walk to the Colosseum. You are better off staying closer to the pantheon which is more central. We stayed here for one night before going to florence. Then came back and stayed at hotel pantheon. Hotel Colosseum is ok. Nothing luxurious or amazing about it. Bedding was fine, average furnishing. There is a balcony but the view was not great. The rooftop area looks great in the pics but is disappointing in reality. Breakfast is ok, comparable to other hotels.I wont stay here again. Currently priced at 733 per night on Expedia, dont do it!! Its a 200 per night hotel at best!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From arrival, we were taken to out room by the porter who helpfully showed us how everything worked. Very well equip room and really clean. Waitresses in the morning were very welcoming and plenty of choice. Diego was extremely professional and gave us some great advice. Hotel is well located for majority of the sights. I would definatly recommend and also would return. If you stay make sure you visit the roof terrace. Amazing views.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was awesome for many reasons. I think the best reviews have pros and cons so here it goes:Pros: absolutely WONDERFUL staff (shout out to Stefano, Diego and Fulvio (spelling?) who made our stay so pleasant) -- they were super helpful and hospitable, air conditioning, complimentary champagne at check-in to celebrate our anniversary, central location - not too far walk from train station, great restaurants, shops, attractions (such as Colosseum and Forum), clean rooms - awesome cleaning staff, hair drier in bathroom, extra pillows/blankets in closet, completed bathroom with warming towel racks, good/typical European breakfast, super accommodating, rooftop with an amazing view of Rome, car service in early AM (5:30am) to airport! *I feel like I'm forgetting something, but these are the main 'pros'Cons: no fridge in the room, we were hoping to upgrade our room but none were available the day of (which was totally fine and excepted so last minute and our room was great anyway!). We will definitely come back to stay if we get a chance to come back to Rome and I will be sure to recommend to friends and family!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we stepped in to the hotel, the hospitality was fantastic.Excellent English, Warm friendly and perfect location.Its close to the colosseum about 10 min walk, and 20 mins walk to the Spanish Steps/Trevi Fountain.The roof top bar was lovely and would be amazing in the summer months, a little chilly but lovely views.Hotel is clean, pleasent breakfast, and Staff were helpful and accommodating.I would deffinately recommend this hotel
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First I would like to mention that there are two things I look for in hotels, friendliness and cleanliness. Hotel Colosseum’s hospitality was amazing, they helped my husband and I book the tours to colosseum and The Vatican, They even confirmed our airport shuttle for us. Our hotel room was clean and had a wonderful view from the window. The Colosseum is about a ten minute walk and there are many restaurant options in the area for some wonderful food. On National Women’s Day, we came into our room to find some beautiful mimosa flowers they had left for me. I would recommend this hotel to my family and friends back home, the people were super courteous and it sits at a perfect location! Thank you Hotel Colosseum for a wonderful stay in Rome! We miss you guys already!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was perfect. Well located to the main railway station from the airport and also wellLocated for the Colosseum.Receptionist was lovely and knowledgable.Rooms very clean and had everything we needed. Breakfast good. Roof top bar is a must with vast views. Overall well impressed for the cost.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We originally picked this hotel due to it's location, it's about 10 minutes walk from the Colosseum and has the Basilica di Santa Maria Maggiore at the end of the road. There is also a Tiger (Flying Tiger) nearby if, like me, you forget your charger cable. We arrived before the check in time but the hotel has a room where you can leave your bags so that's exactly what we did and then went off for our first exploration of the city of Rome. Later in the day we returned to check in and the greeting was friendly and a porter showed us to our room on the 7th floor (lift is available). The room was big enough and clean with a nice clean bathroom and includes tea/coffee making facilities. The linen on the bed was clean, as were the towels and some wash products were also provided (soap & shower gel). We had what I consider to be a nice view out over the roofs of Rome so the windows were opened and we had a coffee.  The view from the rooftop was also nice, although it was a little breezy for us so didn't stay long. We had a little problem finding where to plug in our chargers until I realised they are just behind the bed side tables. The room also has a safe (free of charge), TV, a double wardrobe with hangers, a hairdryer and a chair. Extra pillows/blankets were in the cupboard above the wardrobe. The rooms come with breakfast which included the usual cereal/eggs/bacon/toast along with fruit, yoghurts, pastries and juice so, as vegetarians, there was plenty for us to select from. The room was cleaned every day and we always found the staff to be friendly and helpful. We used the hotel as a base to walk all over Rome and loved our stay here, and so we wouldn't hesitate to recommend
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Colossaeum is a very old 3 star hotel. We were not really expecting great things. However the hotel was quite charming. The room was pleasant, with clean sheets a powerful shower and coffee making facilcities (added after some of the reviews we read). We stayed in February and the room temperature was perfect. We suspect it may be quite hot in the middle of the summer.The breakfast restaurant provided a good start to the day, and the roof terrace was perfect for those in-between times before going out in the evening. Perfect or a little sun worship or reading a book. The staff were extremely helpful, showing all the sites in the map and explaining some of the tips locals use on the busses. The location was great - within 10 minutes walk of the central rail/bus station (Termini) and within easy wak of the Colossum and the Roman Forum. Lots of good restaurants near as well. Not too expensive either.We opted for a shared shuttle from the Airport to the Hotel, which was good as we arrived late and the last trains are at 11:30pm. If you arrive early then the train is much quicker and less bumpy and only 10 minutes walk away. All in all, highly recommended for a 2-3 night visit.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel via an easyJet package and was drawn to the location and rooftop terrace. Arrived prior to the 2pm check in but wasn't an issue to leave our bags in the dedicated room so we could head out to explore. We had a room on the fifth floor overlooking the city for me and my wife which was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was a good choice between cereals, fruit, cold meat and cheese with some bacon, scrambled eggs and sausages. Staff are all very helpful and pleasant.Top tips - The metro is 5 minutes away, head out, turn right and follow the road down. Take another left and walk down the road to the Metro. If you plan on going to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Vatican you need the station on the right and go to Termini Station (One stop away) before changing. It's very easy and if you are buying a ticket make sure you have coins or a 5 euro note, nothing bigger.If heading to the Colosseum you can walk, it's on 10 minutes away.Forgot to mention, when you walk to the metro you'll pass a supermarket on your right for cheap supplies.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place, wonderful location BUT BEWARE THE BFC CURRENCY EXCHANGE SHOP IMMEDIATELY NEXT DOOR to hotel. They ripped us off terribly. Use the hotel desk itself or your ATM or a bank. BFC business stole an extra $80 from us during a $400 exchange.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Goldmine of a hotel and at worst, a €15 taxi to St Peter’s Sq. A comfortable walk to the Colosseum, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and many other beautiful sights. The ‘hop on - hop off’ buses are a rip off, and independent and in no way connected to the Hotel. The Hotel Colosseum clearly states 3*, but in our own experience, we think its worthy of another star. It is spotlessly clean, our room was cleaned every day and not one thing of ours (iPads etc) were touched except to clean under, then replaced. We forgot to put euros back in the safe in the room, before heading out for the day, the room was gutted as usual and the clear bag containing the euros hadn’t even been touched. Don’t let photos of the low pillows mislead you,(which I was dreading) but they are actually very comfortable. I doubled up but was genuinely more comfortable with the one pillow. And the huge bed was also extremely comfortable. The ladies in the breakfast room were absolute stars. They simply could not do enough for the guests. But the unsung heroes of the hotel are the maids who change our beds and cleaned our room, shower room and toilet room every single day.Sadly we didn’t get to experience the rooftop lounge as I was a little unwell the night we intended to go up. (Nothing to do with food etc to clarify - an underlying condition that decided to play up!).When we return to Rome, (which as the legend states, if you throw coins from your right hand over your left shoulder into the Trevi Fountain, you’re sure to return to Rome soon) we will definitely book into the Hotel Colosseum again. Loved it ❤️.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely little hotel, fantastic location, rooms clean and comfortable, only small downside was there are no irons in hotel, and no milk in rooms. And the rooftop bar was closed. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Despite the dubious ‘back road’ location, this is a lovely little hotel. Nice pleasant rooms, a lovely roof terrace to enjoy the magnificent views of Rome. Good location, near to Termini. Nice breakfast and very pleasant, helpful staff.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were way earlier than our check in timing but luckily there were some entertainment (chess) at the lounge for us. The staff helped us to check in 1.5 hours earlier. Another staff was also kind to initiate to help us throw some rubbish. Overall the staff and service was good.As for the room, we had a really pleasant and comfortable stay. Room was clean (including bathroom, showers, bed, furnitures), comfortable, smells good and we had an enjoyable time.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights recently and found the hotel to be everything we required. All amenities needed were within walking distance, the breakfast was very good, the staff all extremely helpful which all helped make our stay very special
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights last week and we were well pleased with this hotel. Staff were very helpful and friendly and the buffet breakfast was excellent. 10 min walk to the Colosseum and near to good restaurant's and shopping.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in a central location.15 min walk to ColosseumNo restaurant but there are plenty nearbyRooms are very clean.Views from the rooftop bar are amazingHighly recommendedWould definitely stay here again if we return to Rome
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location close to everything, shops,restaurants, and of course all the site seeing which is 5 mins walk away. Staff really freindly, and room was perfect we even had a little terrace off it which was great as we both smoke. Room was always clean to a high standard. Would definitly stay there again. And its a lot cheaper than the hotels around it as well which was great.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the first welcome to the goodbye all staff where friendly and helpful ...Damien in particular was exceptional ...we booked the bus from him and fab restaurant recommendations..very helpful at all points ..beds comfortable and rooms very clean ..roof terrace gorgeous though unfortunately not open when we visited but we did pop up in the morning for the view and would highly recommend / great value for money
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Awesome views of this amazing city from the roof top. Requested a balcony room, unfortunately they only have 2 and was told it wasn’t available. However, I never saw any signs of them being occupied during our 3 night stay. The roof top was a great place to enjoy sunrise daily. Coffee service in our room was great as breakfast generally didn’t start till 0730. However, the morning we departed (early), there was another early departure and breakfast was up and going before 0730. That was very nice. Floors 5, 6 & 7 will give you great views. Almost everything within walking distance. Only took taxi to get to Vatican City area. Also a short, easy walk to Termini Station. There are plenty of food choices close as well. Would have liked the hotel staff to be more friendly, but they were helpful when we needed assistance. Give them a try and enjoy the rooftop views anytime of day or night.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 3 nights here as a birthday Suprise for my wife. Great location,room good and decent continental breakfast. Went for a high floor for the wonderful view of the Rome skyline. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful location! Central to many of the main sights Colosseum, Trevi fountain, Pantheon, walkable if you are able. Hotel clean and very well presented. Staff welcoming and accommodating. Great view from the roof! Breakfast sufficient. Would really recommend for a city break. Fantastic value for money.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Third visit to Hotel Colloseum, for 5 nights, we arrived late morning, room not ready, but not a problem, we left our cases in storage, and went to retrace favourite places and walks. Staff at the front desk are always helpuful and ready to answer questions, give directions etc. We had a lovely room with balcony, and lots of space. Hotel warm and comfortable, room was spotlessly clean, fresh towels and sheets most days, and we even had a kettle and tea/coffee which was an absolute welcome bonus. Breakfast is continental breakfast with plenty of choice and lovely coffee. The hotel is situated a short walk from the Colloseum and not far from the termini. There are plenty of resteraunt nearby with good quality food, and a supermarket down the road also if you just want a buffet on the roof terrace etc. What can I say, I love this hotel, I'm sure we'll be back there soon. Thank you hotel Colloseum for making our trip great!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you to all the staff and management at this wonderful hotel. 10 minute walk to the colesseum and 10 minutes to Termini train station. Very clean and friendly. So easy to get to the rugby. Oh, one tip for the rugby, there is a small coffee shop/bar half way on on the main road to the stadium. Every round of beer we had, they fed us bread, meat and sometimes chips. Didn't need to eat anything else. (Although my wife sampled their wonderful lasagne).We will be back.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled from da Vinci airport by train to the main Termini station in Rome. This was €14 each one way. We used google maps to locate the hotel which was easy enough to find even in the pouring rain. Was around a 10min walk. We had arrived around noon but rooms weren’t ready until 2pm. We could leave our bags in storage. We ate in a nearby restaurant called Le Base which was very busy but nice food and fairly reasonable. Once we were able to check in Diego was helpful. Our room was quite small but clean and was serviced daily although I don’t think it was necessary to leave fresh towels daily. The single beds moved apart easily and IMO were quite small. The room got quite warm at night but there is AC. The breakfast offers a range of continental items and is more than adequate. The location of the hotel is excellent and is in walking distance to many sites. We didn’t use the rooftop although I did have a look and it would be nice in summer. I probably wouldn’t stay here again just due to the small single beds but if that isn’t an issue for you then I would recommend it.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights in this charming hotel, perfectly located for sightseeing. Clean rooms with coffee/tea making facilities, a safe, hairdryer and plenty of wardrobe space. We had room 25 with a balcony.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a 3-nights stay at the Hotel Colosseum at the end January. The hotel is withing 2 minutes walk to a metro station and around 15 minutes walk to Termini central metro Station. The staff were very friendly and always ready to help when needed. The room was clean and the location well within walking distance to most of Rome's tourists attractions.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of 17 of all ages, the staff were very patient and helpful. The hotel was clean and generally nice all round with great roof top views. It was my 50th whilst there so after a long day sight seeing I returned to a bottle of Prosecco which was a lovely gesture. Would definitely stay here again if i return and recommend to friends mainly due to its back street quiet location yet still within a short walk from all the attractions, public transport and the airport shuttle bus.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we really enjoyed the stay, the staff, especially Deigo were very friendly and helpful, gave us good recommendations for eating out, nothing was to much trouble when you asked questions, we received 5 star service from a 3 star hotel and we would stay there again and again, great location
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3 nights here as a couple. Very pleased with this hotel for an excellent price. Very central so can walk nearly everywhere or get to the main station in 10 min. Very clean, quiet and cosy with lovely staff and a good breakfast.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the location of the hotel, nearby the centre and the highlights of the city. The staff is lovely, helpful and very friendly. Hotel is very clean, breakfast was a buffet and for everyone something nice to eat. We love to come back in the future. We had a great time thank you all
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just got back from Rome and we stayed at the Colosseum hotel, Great location. TV is all Italian but remember 943 or 945 for UK News.In brief, very friendly hotel, breakfast was not my normal Full English but toast and Pastries ok. Rooftop bar was closed but you could go up there and they said they would bring you drinks, wear a Jacket! I thought Rome was a warm place but I stupidly only took a selection of smart jumpers with a fixed collar.Big Thank you to the front desk chap with a moustache who made us feel very much at home and couldn't do more for us. we shall return one day!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel Colosseum is astually that close the Colosseum but it is a very nice hotel. It's on a quiet street off Via Cavour. Close to the metro so getting round Rome is easy. Breakfast is simple buffet but good. The room was clean with a nice shower. The best thing is the roof terrace. The roof terrace bar obviously isn't open in winter but the views are fantastic. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent close to $100 per room and I expected water will be included. I stayed in one evening to rest my aching knees and became so thirsty. When I called down to a pot of tea, and water, I was charged. Otherwise, the stay was good. The hotel was clean and the staff courteous and very helpful in terms of recommending tours and restaurants. This was my first Roman holiday and the hotel was smack in the middle of a 20-minute walk to most of the sites. I would go back but will work the cost of hydration in the budget.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We first stayed in a two-bed room which was just about adequate. Shifted to a three bed room which was far more convenient. The hotel does not have catering or facilities for making tea/ coffee in the room which is something that could be looked into, although they do serve drinks and the complementary cold breakfast is adequate. The best part of the hotel is its location which is just 10 minutes walking from the Colosseum. The staff are also quite helpful and polite. Over all, it made for a great and comfortable stay.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So I stayed here for a couple of nights and was comfortable enough rooms were clean and had a good shower in the room! The breakfast was ok pretty basic but enough for me! There’s not much going on in the hotel or at least when I was there (November) it has a great rooftop terrace with some pretty amazing views! The location is great and only a 5/10 min stroll to the colosseum and that leads you to everything else so I found it very good value for money! There are plenty of coffee shops and restaurants close to the hotel and the hop on hop off bus (BIG BUS) stops very close to the hotel if your legs have had enough walking for one day! I would stay here again!!
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 3rd stay at this hotel and not disappointed. Great staff, clean rooms, plenty for breakfast and central location...... been with rugby lads and family and we all enjoyed it. Back in February and looking forward to it.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On a quiet back street,off Via Cavour. It's a 10 minute walk to the Termini, first stop on Big Bus City Tour and the Metro which are all in close proximity to each other. Hey, this ain't no swanky 5 star hotel but then again it doesn't profess to be. What the hotel is is clean,reasonably priced and well positioned to use as a base. The room we had was spacious, furniture is basic and that's fine, we went to Rome to see the sites, not the bedroom ceiling. The bathroom (which is always the first room I review before choosing where to stay) was very clean, towels being changed every day without prompt. We think the bed linen was changed every other day during our 5 night stay. Staff were very courteous, nothing too much trouble. Breakfast was continental, which you'd expect. Would I recommend this hotel? For sure. Would I stay here again? When in Rome....
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had a great stay at the hotel. Our room had a nice balcony that had a great view of the city. We enjoyed our nights on the balcony. The front desk was super helpful and polite. The breakfast was good and the staff there friendly. I highly recommend a stay here if you are in Rome.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the staff, as they were so helpful and friendly. Very clean and tidy. The room was very tiny but clean. The shower was small and confined. .Although the room was very small, we were only there to sleep and shower.The concierge staff was very helpful in showing us our destinations on the local map and when I wanted to go to a store that sold Murano glass jewelry, the concierge was kind enough to look it up online for us.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found the location convenient for arriving and leaving via Termini which is a short enough walk to carry bags. Walk to the forum, colosseum and capitol is reasonable. If you want to use the red sightseeing bus there’s a stop by Santa Maria Maggiore a few minutes away. You’ll need bus or Metro for most other destinations. Plenty of local restaurants in the area.The rooms are basic, but shower/toilet was recently renovated and clean. Breakfast offer is only cold buffet with toast, fruit, cereals and cold platter. The hot drinks are not conveniently set out and could do with more thought to give access.
hotelName:
19    Hotel Colosseum
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This 5* is completely accredited to the best property manager, Giulia, who is attentive and hospitable. I felt very welcomed and comfortable to ask for anything I needed. She speaks terrific English and is very helpful and accommodating. The bed is comfy, the room and ensuite bathroom was pristine, and the location was perfect. Thank you so much for this wonderful experience!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice little oasis in Rome's center. Quiet courtyard with lovely plants. Nice and clean. Large rooms with comfortable shower and toilet. You will be looked after by the owner in the best way. The owner cooks the breakfast herself to the guests. She also gives you specially selected travel tips. I have traveled for over 30 years but have never received better service. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed in Casa di Silvia in late May/early June this year, and we were so happy with this place! It is very close to the next metro stop, but we are healthy and active and liked to walk to the Colloseum every morning and continued walking to the different sights from there. The price is excellent for the proximity to the inner city. All of the staff were very friendly. There was a yong woman at the reception, Iuliana, who gave us very good advice on how to get around the city and which sights not to miss. The other staff also were very sweet and friendly.The room was clean and comfortable and had a fridge that was stocked with water, juice and milk, and we got tea and little snacks like cookies & pastry for free. The building was very old-fashioned and beautiful and the nights were quiet (which is very important to me).The only thing I wasn't 100% happy with was the breakfast - the room was too small for all guests and the food on offer was very plain - but on the other hand, this is a B&B and not a hotel, and for the price it was okay.We'll definitely stay here again next time we return to Rome!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything good and clean. Clean economic rooms . Near Center. Giulia was direct Kind and trustful Person .thank you. Rome Center Termini only 2 Stations from San Giovanni. Giulia offered us everything to be satisfied .
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at Casa de Silva was wonderful. Guilia is so helpful and friendly. SheJust wants her guest to be happy and comfortable. Our room is very clean and she even provides coffee, tea, water ,juice in our room free of charge. She is sohelpful in showing us where to go and where to eat at very low cost. Casa di Silva is near the metro and the colosseum , walking distance to shopping centres. Guilia is a fantastic host, she even arranged our transport when we arrived and left the airport. We are going to ParisIn 2 days and we wished we stayed longer in Rome because Guilia made us feel at home because she is so helpful. I would recommend her bed and breakfast to all my friends and will surely comeBack. Thank you lovely Guilia ❤️❤️❤️
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is very clean and smells very nice. There is plenty of soup, shower gel and towels in the bathroom. The location is central about 5 min walk from San Giovani metro station. The room is a little bit small and you can hear some noise from the street, neighbours and water in pipe lines, but it is ok. There is a fan in the ceiling; no air conditioning. The host is a girl named Guilia from Romania, she is simple WOW... She is very freindly, helpful and cheerful. I had with her very nice chats during my stay, she gave me maps for the city and answered all my questions about what and where to do things in Rome. She gave me her wats app mobile number to contact her anytime. She makes delecious cookies and cake leaving them outside at the reception area with lots of candies, coffee and tea where you can take whatever you want whenever you want during your stay for free. You can leave your luggage and take it anytime later on day of check out. I didnt try the breakfast, but Guilia said it can be served in the breakfast room or your own room if you liked.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bedroom and bathroom were very clean. Breakfast was not expensive and very good. Very good situation. Not far from metro(San Giovani)15min from Colosseo.In a quiet area.Thanks Iuliana for this welcome. Audrey
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a long day of walking around and exploring Rome coming back to a room with air conditioning was phenomenal. The rooms are well kept and clean, stocked with a mini fridge, TV, hairdryer, safe, and ensuite bathroom. Silvia was extremely accommodating and helpful. She answered any and all questions we had for her and helped me and my friend plan the best routes to see all the sights. The B&B is located about 7 minutes from the metro in case you don't feel like walking around, although you get to see much more of Rome if you choose to walk. The breakfast room is open every morning from 8-9:30 where you can enjoy a classic Italian breakfast as well a nice chat with Silvia; who is there every morning making sure you're enjoying your stay. When it was time for us to leave she arranged for a taxi to take us to the airport. The average cost from Rome to Fiumicino is usually about 50 euros but with Silvia we got it for 45. Over all we had a fantastic stay. I will definitely recommend Casa di Silvia B&B to any friends going to Rome, and will definitely stay here again if I come back.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and comfortable room, quite easy to find. quiet room and the airco was needed. Location is great, walking distance to the coliseum. The host, Giuliana very nice person and breakfast is ok to start the day.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for three nights and thought this place was perfect for whay we wanted. 5mins from a metro station that takes you to most of the sights-or a 25mins walk gets you to the colosseum. Our room, and more importantly bed, was very comfortable and clean. My partner was pregnant and the bed was plenty big enough for the 3 of us. The en suite shower was lovely and there are tea/coffee making facilities in reception. The property is part of a gated complex and felt very safe-we had no problems with noise either. We didnt bother with breakfast-opting for cappuccino and home made croissants in a local bar instead for just 1.50. And then there is Guilia-such a wonderful host. She made contact before we arrived and made sure we knew we could contact her if needed at any point. After welcoming us she offered advice and tips for our stay and then gave us our own keys so we could just get on and explore. She will arrange transport to/from the airport but we opted to get a bus to the main station and then metro from there (30mins from the airport, 5 mins on the metro-very simple and much cheaper). If younare looking for a comfortable, not too fancy base for exploring the most incredible city on earth then casa di silvia is perfect
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the best host ever! Juliana is such a caring person and gave us a lot of good information where to go in Rome and hot spots for good food. We enjoyed the room atmosphere and for sure, this place makes it easy, to really feel like home.She placed drinks in our room and even small snacks. We are very thankful for her best star service.Mil grazie.By the way, the location is very close to everything, you can walk to the Colosseum in 20minutes.Greetings,Franziska
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister, her two kids and my baby and I stayed in the quadruple room. It was a spacious room and cleaned almost daily. It had two single beds stuck together to make a double bed (which was surprisingly comfortable) and two singles.However, with hindsight I wish I had booked a separate room, as we did need our own space. But this was my fault really.The room did get noisy if you opened the windows, but once we shut them and asked for the fan switch we were able to sleep contently.The breakfast was okay, if you have a sweet tooth, which luckily or unluckily e I do, but could've done with healthier options such as fruit or unsweetened muesli. However, there is a supermarket nearby and a fridge in the room to store your fruit in.The landlady Juliana is a hardworking and helpful lady who did her best to make things comfortable for us. She was helpful with giving us tips of where to go and eat. We also had access to complimentary snacks and hot drinks. She even arranged for a taxi to take us back to and from the airport. Bottom line I would stay there again if I return to Rome.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have recently just returned from a wonderful visit to Rome. My 15 year old daughter and I stayed at the Casa Di Silvia, which I chose after reading several reviews on this site. Let's get the easy part out of the way first, Julia is simply wonderful. From the time she sent a cab to bring us from the airport until we left via the same transport, Julia made our stay extra special. Nothing was too much trouble for her and her infectious enthusiasm is the perfect tonic to start your day in Roma. Rooms are cleaned every day, but if you'd prefer to sleep late (15 year olds) then Julia will keep her distance and leave you some fresh towels. The room was fantastic, hot water in the shower and the all important WiFi (15 year olds) worked really well.The Casa Di Silvia is situated near the San Giovanni Basilica, Metro station is a two minute walk away. This is a quieter neighbourhood where the locals stay so you get the real flavor of Roma. Julia will help with places to eat and drink; within a ten minute stroll from the B&B you can enjoy at least a dozen restaurants. When I go back to Roma I will for sure return to Julia and the Casa Di Silvia.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super comfortable room,our host Guilana speaks English, this b&b has tea coffee & cake. facilities. Breakfast is a simple start to the day.Situated within walking distance of metro & bus services, I would recommend multiple use tickle.Most enjoyable stay here.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are one of the best, clean,and restful. The hostess, Giulia is a very nice and helpful person, always ready to give good advice and to take care of her clients. Some people mistake a B+B service, for a hotel service. There's a difference to take into consideration when here.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At first it seemed like aika nice place, for the very first evening. The place was not easy to find in dark but after finding place things got smooth. Unfortunately we found out the very first night that the ventilator in bathroom was not powerful enough for four people showering and the room got humid as the bathroom was like a cold steamroom. Partly because of that room got cold at night and I woke up with sore throat.While looking for the place we were informed by the booking site that room has a ceiling fan and air con. No fan and the air con not usable. We contacted Giuliana to consult her but all she said was: "Look, the room is hot and the air conditioner is for summers only." When trying to continue her about the problem Giuliana repeted her words and cut me off the line. Couple days later we run to her on the street and all she could do was to complain why didn't we come to her before like she'd heard this all first time just then. We asked to use the air con even for 30min after showering even with cold air but were denied. Giuliana only rolled her eyes and started to explain about her home and every house in Italy facing the same situation. Seriously, the air is so humid that even the wallpaper is sticky glue getting through of it.The booking site and confirmation also pointed the beds to have selkeät comfort mattresses. Out of two single beds and one double bed only the other single had. Other were with hard strings. Surely the beddings are also not "top end quality" but worn and even sligthly broken. Room did have fridge which was very convenient. Electric waterkettle was common for all the rooms and very much dated with no automatical switch off and water leaking off the bottom when in use. There was also no place to wash used cups. For our last night the kettle disappeared thou'.Room was spacious and pretty well cleaned with normal (a standard worldwide) dust under the bed. Room was also nicely renovated and a huge plus for four glazed windows! It also had a hairdrier but it was taken from us the last day because we had used it to dry couple pairs of socks which we urgently needed and would have otherwise taken 48 hours to dry. Yeah, we tried the old fashion way. Okay, no hairdrier but that game was so childish that if this is their way to handdle differencies (cut off the line, take hairdrier away) then these girls still have a lot to learn about business.Without Giulianas childish and unpolite behaviour when facing problems with a paying customer I would have rated the place better. Also we were not satisfied with the other girl who obviously had no interest to first open the locked safebox (locked when we arrived) and explain us how it works (no introduction in the room). You are most likely well off in this place if you have no complaints. The location could be better but our children were okay to walk from Vatican to here so you should be okay too.If you travel with kids remember children under 10 don't pay city tax. We were asked to pay at first for a 7 year old but Giuliana fixed it when we told he should not pay.The last note: If you are allergic to scents or dogs find another place. Dogs are welcome and they use a very strong scent in the corridor. Seriously, the smell is worse than in a parfumeria. Just a note for those whom it might be a real problem.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For my a good experience. It was my first time in Rome it was easy to find the place is near to the metro station San Giovanni. Is also easy walk to the Colosseo and highlights in Rome. I really recommend Casa di Silvia the room is such a nice place is spacious, clean, comfortable and you have your own bathroom. Luliana is an excellent hostess. She gave me a map and she always helped me, as well as her sister. If I go back to Rome, I would like to stay in Casa di Silvia. Thank you Luliana
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We did not except, that Juliana will welcome us so friendly. She took care of us since the very begining with a fresh, cold juice. She introduced us to the city sightseeing and the hotel plan in detail. What's more, the staff is really helpful, always kind and smiling. Ready to solve each problem of their guests. Apartment has been cleaned every day (hall and rooms smell always fresh). If you need a recommendation regarding to the place, where you can eat or have a romantic dinner, go for evening walk or you don't know how to reach particular place in Rome, Juliana is willing to provide you with such information.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We exchanged with Julia by email about our arrival but she didn't understand. So when we arrived, she was not there. We tried to call her. She was not happy because she understood another hour...So during our stay, she didn't make us very comfortable.The b&b is well located, near the metro and buses.The bedroom is not well : too much hot, too much noisy...Now, we will take an airbnb for sure.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has to be the most friendliest, welcoming place I have been. Giulia was absolutely lovely and gave us lots of information. Rooms were spotless and it was like staying at home. Do not have one single fault with this b&b and it's close to everything you need to see Rome
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing stay at Casa di Silvia! From the start we were welcomed and explained everything we needed to know. Giulia helped us with everything we needed including calling a taxi at 5am. I can not say enough good things! Highly recommend!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Did a last minute one night booking at this B&B and I had a wonderful stay. Guilia patiently waited for me as I arrived late from a delayed flight. Room was spacious, Wi-Fi was realiable and the location was ideal. What made my stay really wonderful was the great customer service I received from the owner. Will definitely stay there again when we go back to Rome in March.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Janine was very attentive to our needs before we even arrived, We arrived later than we expected, and she waited patiently, and made us feel very welcomed. She helped us with our parking, and that is not easy in Rome. The B&B is located close the center of Rome, and within walking distance to the Colosseum. Janine provided invaluable information about every facet of our stay at Silvia's, and the historical sights. If we are ever again in Rome, we will stay at Silvia's B&B.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great place to stay! Julia was so helpful and friendly which made our trip so much better. The rooms were lovely and clean and breakfast was great too.
