The location was excellent just walk out and the Metro is on your doorstep. We walked to most places as it was so nice to see everything.There is also shops right by and a great place to Eat Julia will let you know about that great place. I would stay there again for sure.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B&B is located in a typical large Roman house where it occupies one of the appartments. As we flew into Rome late, the hostess Giulia had arranged a taxi for us. She is a very kind lady who took good care of us.Breakfast is served in the room. Since Giulia is not there during the night, we had the feeling we had our own little appartment in Rome. Definitely recommend it.Do take into account a 20-minute walk the Colosseum if you insist on walking. The San Giovani underground station is only 5 minutes away. Ask for a room away from the street if you are not comfortable with the sounds of a city.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a bit difficult to find - only 3 stops from the Termini. From the start when you meet Julia she is full of information. Julia is incredibly helpful and will do anything to help you out - nothing is too much trouble. She is great with communication too.The room is pretty basic, although it has everything you would need - fairly roomy too. Bed is pretty comfy. There is a fridge, a wardrobe, a safe, the TV has loads of channels and has the function where you can change the language to English!We were in a block of 3 rooms. One of which is bigger and has the ensuite. Otherwise you get the communal bathroom.The breakfast is basic, but all good. They make everything for you on the spot. But there is also a kettle left out and some snacks for you available during the day and evening.All in all for the money - its great value and Julia is the most accommodating host.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Casa di Silvia after reading all the positive reviews of Tripadvisor - and I'm so glad we did! We are a couple in our mid 20's, visiting Rome for the weekend on a reasonably tight budget. The stay was everything we could have asked for.All I can really do is echo what other reviews have said about the owner Giuliana - she was an amazing host. Our flight from Gatwick got delayed and we had a nightmare getting there from the airport, meaning we didn't arrive until 1.30am local time - not only did she wait up for us but as she couldn't be there in the morning she took the time to draw on a map all the places she would recommend we visit. We ended up relying on her map more than the guide book!Room was ideal for what we wanted and fantastic value for money, cleaned daily and included most mod-cons like hairdryer, Wi-Fi, TV etc. in room cost. Breakfast was simple, but very much did the job. Location wise, although it's not bang in the middle of the Centro Storico, all major attractions were in walkable distance. We only got on the metro once all weekend, to get to Vatican City, and even then we walked back from there (it was a bit of a trek though!).I would absolutely recommend Casa di Silvia to anyone who wants to see Rome without forking out for a plush hotel room. If you read this Giuliana, thanks once again for a wonderful and memorable stay - we hope to see you again sometime!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Casa di Silvia Bed & Breakfast for 4 days recently. and we were 4 people. all of us loved the place so much. It's very central and you can go to most important places by walk. or you can use the subway which is very close. added to that It's very clean. Everyday it is cleaned. But the most important fact is Julia :) She is working at the hotel and cared of everything. She is very nice and friendly, helpful. she cared of us like we are her sisters. kisses and a very special thanks for Julia!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location great for city centre, only a few minutes walk to metro station. Reasonable prices. Beautiful old building, very tidy room, fresh renovated. Only thing I didn’t like in the room was too high hangers in the closet, but everything else was fine. Enough choices for breakfast, and very attentive maid, but she was too close… I mean more self service would be nice. More than helpful reception )))) when we weren't sure about anything such as directions, schedules and open hours, Giulia took the time to search places for us online, and gave us all possible information. She was extremely friendly and welcoming, even picked me up and accompanied me to the train station at the day of departure. Well done Giulia!!! Next time we in Rome will definitely stay there again and I would recommend you to my friends and family.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked our Stay for a total of 5 nights at Casa di Silvia.The owner, Iuliana was so extremely friendly that we felt at home right from the start.She gave us a map of the city center and told us how to get to all the different tourist landmarks which proved to be quite useful as we came to the city quite unprepared. She was also so kind to recommend the best Italian restaurant we've ever been to which was 2 minutes away from the B&B. it was a nice family owned restaurant without any toursist and with amazing food. We ended up eating there every evening for the whole stay in rome.The room was quite spatious and had a view on the inner garden which was really calm and quiet at night. The Bathroom and the Bedroom itself were extremely clean and tidy. Breakfast was served in the room and was very good. It included cereals, croissants and as many toast with jam as we wanted. Also there was a huge variety of coffee, tea and biscuits available any time of the day you wanted. We had read, that booking some trips in advance would be a huge help especially for the Vatican, in order to skip the line. Iualiana helped us with the booking and printed our tickets. This was sooooo helpful and totally worth booking in advance, once you see the line there is to get into the vatican Museum. The location was great, as it was not in the historical center of rome where you could avoid all the tourists but still get to the center in a very short time. The colloseum was a 10-15 minute walk away (depending on your pace) and the rest could easily be walked to. alternatively there was a very convenient metro Station 3-4 minutes away from the B&B which lets you get to any tourist attration within a few minutes. All in all the price/ Location ratio was extremely good!! I can only say positive things about the service, location and amenities. If you are looking for a budget friendly stay in rome with excellent hospitality and the best host you can imagine then you should definiltely contact Iuliana.Also, listen to all the recommendations she gives. They have all proven to be extremely useful and made our trip all the more worth while as we skipped quite some lines and saved quite a lot of money. This is definitely a place I want to return to one day!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We originally looked for a place like this for a very long time and picked it mainly because the area looked clean and was near historical sites. We were very pleased with the neighborhood which is basic Rome, busy yet interesting. The location was very good right next to a small convenience store, a little bar/cafe and some other things including two Metro stations. There is actually a Saturday local market not too far which is far better than the tourist one in central Rome. It is a great local and access is easy.But to the best part....the little B&B run by Juliana the best host anyone can imagine. She is without a doubt the most caring and enthusiastic host we had. We wanted to take her home with us. She is sweet, but efficient, attentive but caring. This young lady places her whole heart into this operation and its attention to detail. The room was great, the service beyond compare, wonderful breakfast we could never finish and served in our room. What a great find. I really recommend this as opposed to something right in the center of Rome, it has easy access to all the sites , but you can find the real Rome here too...walking the streets, seeing how they live. Juliana we await your email to tell us you are coming to see us in the United States....Grazie Mile Jerry & Julia...PS to any traveler just ask Juliana for anything to make things comfortable and right and she is on top of it...::))
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived, Julia made us feel welcome and offered her help in every way. The room was the largest she had as she knew there were 4 of us. It was quiet at night (we slept with the windows closed and the AC running). Over the course of our 4 day stay, Julia gave us restaurant recommendations (listen to them!), helped us print out some reservations, made sure we had breakfast when we were leaving early, and even made us tea to aid our digestion when we had overindulged while visiting family. We will definitively return when in Rome.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent location - easy access to metro and buses.Hostess is great, very helpful.Breakfast is decent, cereal croissant toast juice etc.Internet is very poor to non existent inside the room. She said its because of the iron door she is using, so it becomes like a faraday cage. We had to keep the door open to get some internet. But the connection kept dropping again and again, frustrating everyone.A/C is a small indoor room kind, low power, unable to cool the room at all. All other B&B's have split A/C but not this one. She said her association doesn't allow. We had tough time sleeping on hot nights.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first met with the host was a disaster! I don’t feel the hospitality! We understood we might make a mistake that caused her trouble, we apologised; there was no need kept on repeating, nagging and lecturing us during out first met conversation! We are not barbarian! Her attitude as such was really spoiled our holiday mood! My family felt unhappy with this kind of service!The B&B owner not even introduce herself but unhappy, kept on complaining we did not inform her our arrival time, not answer her emails, she had been waiting us for hours blah blah blah during our first met. I have stayed in other B&B before, the hospitality of the previous host and so many positive reviews of this B&B in Tripadvisor made my decided to stay in this B&B. But, the attitude of this host was eyes opened for me!We reserved rooms in this B&B via Booking.com. There is no information mentioned that the B&B guests have to inform the host their arrival time neither in Booking.com nor B&B website. We were extremely busy with work until the day before our vacation. Rome was not the first stop during our vacation. How can we answer email during our vacation as the check-in time mentioned in Booking.com is from 13:00 to 20:00?She not in a good mood to give us a "nice" introduction for example the interesting places to visit; she was circling the places on the map in light speed as she just wants to get rid of us. During the premises explanation tour, she did not miss a chance to satirise us for not checking and answering her emails, reminding us this is not a hotel but B&B, lecturing us what differences between a hotel and B&B, nagging how tired she was as she had to woke up at 6am because a group of guests arrived at around 6am blah, blah, blah.Is this the way a B&B host treated their guests? We actually looking forward the host will recommended us places for a budget and good meals, but her attitude made us no mood to have more conversation and the rest period of our stay.We did not have a good night sleep during out stay. The rooms are a big nightmare for light sleepers like us; we ended up sleep with earplugs! In Booking.com, it mentions the rooms are soundproofing. No, they are not! The traffic noise can be heard clearly as early as 6am with windows closed tight, the conversation of others can be heard clearly even the rooms are facing the yard. This is not soundproof room!In Booking.com, it says rooms are air-conditioned. No, it is an air cooler instead air conditional, and generating bloody loud noise. The host informed us Italians sleep with windows open, there is no need any air conditioning. She has the air cooler unit in the room just because of the tourists. Yes, she is expecting all her B&B guests should sleep like Italians.The worst, when the air cooler was turned on, no other electronic devices should be plugged in the power plugs. If not, the whole floor will be black up.This B&B is near to metro line A, about 5 minutes walking distance from the San Giovanni metro station. The B&B rooms are facing to a yard.The size of double bedrooms is reasonably big; the room facilities are basic, and a mini bar in the room. The toilet, bathroom and toiletries are standard.The breakfast is served in the room; the host prepares and brings the breakfast to the room in the morning between 8 to 9:30am. An early breakfast can be arranged. The breakfast is basic; the breakfast coffee is not freshly brewed but instant coffee.I rarely wrote strong negative review about hotels & B&B I stayed, as I believe owners have their difficulties for fulfilling every requirement from their guests. However, this B&B host was really ruined our stay and vacation!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had such a lovely time staying at Casa di Silvia. Giulia was exceptionally lovely and accommodating - she waited for almost 2 hours for us to arrive after we had travel delays! The room was always clean and comfortable and if you are looking for a convenient location, the B&B is only a 20 minute walk to the colosseum or 5 min to the A line metro station. If you have any questions about the place, email Giulia before hand and will be most helpful. Also try the place Simonetta that was recommended to us round the corner- amazing authentic Italian food with an atmosphere to match! Thanks Giulia for making our stay in Rome so comfortable!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were on the last leg of our 5 week honeymoon and booked this little quaint B & B for 2 nights hoping for a comfortable and pleasant experience. We got that and a whole lot more! Iuliana (the owner and host) is a warm, professional and funny lady who obviously takes great pride in her B & B. We found the location was superb - a 3min walk to the Metro, 15min walk to the Colosseum and short Metro ride to Rome Termini (where we arrived from Sorrento).If your looking for a comfortable accommodation, tasty breakfast made and bought to your room, a great location and very reasonably priced this is perfect for you. Iuliana will also leave a lasting and positive impression on all who choose to stay there just as she did with us. Thank you Casa and thank you Iuliana it was wonderful!Greg & LaurenSydney, Australia
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After reading the reviews here and on anther web site, there as no way I could go wrong right? WRONG! Lets start with location. OK not too bad. The neighborhood is heavily covered in graffiti. It's still more like a 25-30 walk to Colosseum and not the 10 to 15 as advertised. pretty close to the Metro so that is a plus. Julia is a welcoming host. Showed us to our room, the 5 keys needed (front gate, building , B&B door, room and bathroom) but all in all pretty decent. Julia was helpful with many things especially our lost bag. What would a trip to Rome be without lost luggage. In fact. it was a carry on that Air Canada decided was too big to fit ( thats another story al together tho!) She called the airport a few times to aid in getting our bag returned. (WARNING no matter how much anyone says they will deliver your luggage, its up to you to go to the airport and get them)The "fun" began when we went to sleep. Yes its July in Rome so its warm. The ceiling was about 15 feet up with a ceiling fan.. great. too bad it was so small that, not only did it not cool the room, but we couldn't even feel the breeze. Cant open the steel shutters because we are on the first floor and we were told "this is Rome, so shut them at night" So it was hot... bad hot. Ok lets get some sleep. Our room was across the courtyard from Julianas flat. Which means our window opened to the street. and oh what a busy street. Cars, trucks, motorcycles, trash collection and then around 2:30 till 3:15 or so.. a group of Italians having a conversation VERY loudly on the corner. Well they might as well been in our rom they were so loud. Needless to say we didn't sleep well and could not wait to get out of the place. A quick yogurt and coffee and we were on our way. Also had to pay cash since she does not have a credit card machine.Although Julia is great, I can not recommend this B&B
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: iluiana (pronounced Julia) is a very warm and generous hostess. Right from booking with her, she tried her best to make us feel welcome through her emails and answered every question. We reached her B&B late at night. She was waiting for us and personally escorted us to our room and considering we had not made any special request we were pleasantly surprised she had read our needs and allocated a large room to us since we were traveling with our 13 year old son to ensure our comfort. She took a lot of pains explaining everything. She even sat down at the late hour and chalked out our itinerary for the next three days, with how to reach major Rome attractions, what to see, which metro lines to take, etc. even recommending how not to waste money on buying drinking water (there are plenty of drinking water fountains available throughout the city). She helped us in ironing out some problems we were having with our car hire agency and organized a taxi for us to their office when it was time for us to leave giving us a very warm and loving sendoff. I will never forget her.Any time I go back to Rome, I will only be staying at Casa Di Silvia for Iluiana.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my 3 children in a beautiful, big room with a private bathroom. Giulia greeted us as if we were part of the family and made us feel right at home. Giulia was very helpful in giving us directions and tips on how to get around. The B&B is near the metro which is easy to take to all the different attractions. We had such a short stay, but if I come back I will definitely come back here! Thank you Giulia for making our stay in Rome so wonderful!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For my husband and I, staying in this B&B was the highlight of our 3 city trip- and was our favorite place to stay out of all the places we have been in Europe (several countries and cities since moving to Germany a year ago)! We LOVE this B&B for so many reasons- but the top reason being the wonderful owner (I don't know how to spell her name so I won't even attempt it!). She honestly feels just like a good friend and takes care of you like you're family. From the improvements throughout the B&B she has made (German double-pane windows to take care of noise, complimentary cakes/tea/coffee out all the time, special lighting in the bathroom for makeup, etc.) to all of her personal assistance daily (constant communication through apps, breakfast in our fridge the morning we left early for the airport, restaurant recommendations, great conversations, etc.), it is easy to tell that she truly cares about her guests and her business. You can not go wrong staying at this B&B just for these facts alone. Add in the great area of the B&B, near San Giovanni, filled with nice shops, cafes, gelaterias, trattorias, etc. a metro stop right down the street, and the easy 15 minute walk to the Colosseum, and you literally can not pick a better place to stay in Rome. If you have any other questions: Yes, the beds are comfy, yes the area is safe (and inside a gated community), yes the breakfast is filling, and no, there is nothing lacking! If you come across this B&B, you should book it right now, don't even bother researching anymore!!!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'll preface this review by saying i've been travelling to Rome for the last 13 years of my life for work and i've stayed in many, many hotels, from the 2 star ones right up to 5 star luxury. Honestly, I enjoyed my stay here at Casa di Silvia more. I had a lovely big room, with a private bathroom- both were incredibly clean, far cleaner than the usual hotels. The host, Iuliana, is an amazing and inspirational girl who has both the charisma and ability to run this little gem both efficiently & professionally and yet, there's a personal touch to it that makes it unique. In a city which is more commonly known for it's inefficient and chaotic approach to everything, I cannot emphasise enough how impressed i was with this little oasis of privacy and calm. The location is right in the centre in one of the more posh areas of Rome, and you can easily walk it to the Coliseum from there. I will definitely be returning. So go ahead and book, because you will not be disappointed by this seductive combination of simplicity, privacy and value. Thank Iuliana, a presto! FabioC
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my friend stayed at Casa di Silvia for 7 days, Dec22-Dec29. Our room was facing the inner yard and thus very quiet. The room had a big wardrobe, a fridge, nice comfy bed (+ we had an extra bed but for us by Iuliana). Iuliana's breakfast was delicious and lasted us half the day =). She also has one kettle for her B&B that you can borrow & that was very convenient.Casa di Silvia is 5 min walk to St.Giovanni metro station, St.Giovanni in Laterano church, 20 min walk to the Colosseum. Iuliana is truly a very welcoming, chatty and helpful host. She even gave us a bottle of champagne for X-mas! ))) So nice of her. I would definitely recommend this B&B to anyone who goes to Rome.PS: if every room in this B&B had a tiny kettle - it woulbe be paradise ^_^ Love Iuliana!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All the reviews are right, we just had such a great stay at casa di silvia! The location is great, three minute walk to the metro and 20 minute leisurely walk to the colosseum! Great breakfast (I meant to take a picture but it's cereal, yoghurt, toast, coffee juice and croissants in your bedroom), cookies and drinks in the reception area were lovely! The woman who runs it is very helpful and accommodating! I would definitely stay here again, perfect for the price. It's nicer than I expected, in a beautiful courtyard area in a sweet part of rome :)
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Julianna makes this B&B like going to a friends home for the vacation. She was very helpful and generous. There was always tea and a freshly baked cake around for any evening cravings. The room was a bit small for me and my family of four but the greetings and the location definitely compensated for that. The location is across the street from the bus station 85 at Rimini street. This bus takes you past many of the main sites. About 500 meters from the B&B there is the Metro station as well. The colosseum is about a 15 minute walk away.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Casa Di Silvia for 4 days in early October. The facility itself is very nice, located on first floor of the building. There is an elevator, but since you only have to go up a few stairs, you may not need it. Our room was very clean and fairly large as European B&Bs go. Bathroom was nice and also a bit larger and it actually had places to set your toiletries. The place is located in a mostly residential area and has a beutiful courtyard between the gate and the entrance to the building.The location is excellent, within a block or so of the San Giovani Metro station and walking distance to the most of the main sights. We did use the Metro to Visit the Vatican, but walked to most of the others. if you prefer not to walk, Metro service is easy to Spanish steps and Trevi fountain, as well as to Train station. Walk was easy to Forum and colosium.The real highlight of this B&B, though, is Giulia, the owner/operator. We have stayed at quite a number of similiar establishments throughout Spain and Italy and she is by far the nicest, warmest, most helpful and enthusiastic person we have met. I am not including details and directions in this review because I know that Giulia will explain and show you, give you maps, draw you maps, and do what ever it takes to get you where you want to go. She speaks fluent English, by the way. I should mention too that she serves an excellent breakfast by European B&B standards, with all the coffee you want. She really is the best and you will just have to go and meet her to appreciate what I am trying to describe. This is an excellent value and a great experience.We left feeling that we had made a friend for life.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Casa Di Silvia with my mum for 4 days on the beginning on September. We came from a 3 star hotel in Venice and with the hurry we forgot our money and passports on the safe. We realised about it when we arrived in Rome, called them several times but the hotel management refused to go and check the safe and help us getting our documents back.We told Iuliana (the manager of Casa di Silvia) about this traumatic experience, she took her mobile and made few calls to the hotel. It went back and forth for few hours and at the end she managed to get a courier with our documents. Love at first sight!!! Iuliana is a caring, helpful hostess, amazing customer service. The B&B is centrally located, 5 min walk from the tube station, in a quiet neighbourhood, all recently refurbished and super clean! I will go back to Casa di Silvia next time I go to Rome and I recommend you to do the same.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cheerful and fun loving host- Juliana. Very helpful too. Condition of the room is excellent. Location is very near metro station, San Giovanni. Good value for money. Overall, we would recommend staying at this b & b as it is priced reasonably for the cleanliness and location aside from the great host.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 民宿主人Silvia非常熱情，我們入住當天因為交通問題所以遲到，他還是很開心的迎接我們，有任何需求及問題也會盡量幫忙。房間相當乾淨而且布置的很有個人風格。交通還算便利，從地鐵站出來步行大概十分鐘。推薦給預算較少的背包客with a very good location. the host is a very king girl with passion.we had wonderful 3 days here.the room is just fantastic and comfortable. also you can get any information about Rome from Silvia.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Looking for an accommodation in Rome, by happening I could find Casa di Silvia;It was first time sleeping at B&B; Very clean room (the entire flat and building), toilet, very comfortable bed, generous space; But over all these I was very pleasant surprised by the amiability of the host woman, by her name Iulia.For those who are looking for the best variant "service vs rate" this could be the best option.I can recommend without hesitation Casa di Silvia like a very nice place for sleeping in Rome.Mihai Vaduva
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: very very very clean rooms.julianna was an excellent hostess.she gave us a map and information about everything.very good location -you can use metro as well bus.its better with the bus because you can see all the sightseeings!!!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i booked this place mainly because of the reviews about juiliana and i was not dissapointed! i needed a someone helpful because im booking for my parents and its their first time in rome. she replies fast, very very helpful,she has airport pick up service...rooms are clean and location is great according to my parents,. she even baked a cake for my dad´s birthday! who does that nowadays??! thank you so much juiliana! im looking forward to meeting you next time!
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rome was made that little bit better just by staying at this B&B as Guilia made us feel very welcome and was very helpful in explaining how to get to the places we wanted to visit. She brought a breakfast (consisting of cheese, bread, cereal, biscuits, yogurt, tea & juice) into our room every morning and recommended local places to eat. The room was cheaper than I thought it was going to be for accommodation right in the centre of Rome. If you'd prefer to stay with the locals in a block of flats (think Amelie) rather than a large commercial hotel chain this is the place for you. The rooms are spacious, clean, colourful and just look like a bedroom at home. The place is definitely secure needing a variety of keys to enter the building (once the gate at the front is closed at night) and there was also wi-fi available too for those who want to message those back home. There is no air-con just a fan but that did the job!I thought the location was good too as it was only a few minutes walk from the Colosseum and the ancient part of town, and the metro was literally down the street, which took you straight to the Vatican city. I'd stay here again if I came back to Rome as it was value for money.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a very nice and clean place to stay in Rome, the location is good and safe.Close to everywhere, 3 stops (metro) from central train station.Silvia is the excellent host, she waited for us late evening (after 9pm) as we were late on arrival. She has answered and explained every single question.Very recommend.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just wanted to take a minute and recommend this wonderful B&B in the heart of Rome.Casa di Silvia was everything I was looking for in accommodation during my stay in Rome. This Bed and Breakfast is inexpensive, well furnished, spacious and clean. The owner Juliana is a wonderful, smiling, caring, hard working individual who does everything possible to make sure both your stay and your trip are enjoyable . She provided me with a map, recommended local eateries and made sure I knew where I was going. In fact it was the positive reviews of Juliana that were the deciding factor in my choice to stay here. I can't say enough nice things about this person as she really helped me out during my stay and it was a pleasure to have met her.Each room has a lovely new renovated private bathroom w/ shower, flat panel T.V., small dining area, closet/hangers, mini fridge, room safe, iron/board (upon request), fully opening windows and locking doors. The rooms are a perfect size for one or two people and can accommodate up to four. The B&B itself is located in a secure building of a secure courtyard just outside the Aurelian Wall near St. John Lateran's Archbasilica. The metro/subway is a two minute walk and is the BEST way to get around the city. Bus stops are near the subway entrance. The Colosseum is about a ten minute walk and very easy to find.A free continental breakfast is provided daily, to your room, consisting of coffee, juice, milk, cereal, yogurt, biscuits, jams and spreads, chocolate filled croissants and cookies! Its a great boost of energy to get you going in the morning, I never left hungry. The owner Juliana is such a sweetheart she even prepared my breakfasts the night before (because my tours often departed very early) Also there is 24/7 complementary/self serve coffee, tea, fresh fruit, treats and pie available in reception. If you're in Rome and you're looking for a GREAT Bed and Breakfast Casa di Silvia is the way to go.
hotelName:
20    Casa di Silvia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic place with great service and breakfast was brilliant good healthy food. Eggs anyway you like them. Great coffee and other options also.Good location if you don’t mind walking in lovely area. Definitely recommend.Rooms are small but large enough for traveling.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Palm Gallery exceeded our expectations in every way. The staff was very attentive and helpful, scheduling taxis, suggesting restaurants, etc...Rooms were well appointed. The Pool area was fantastic and very much appreciated after a long hot day of sightseeing. Felt like there were no tourists in this part of town. Great restaurant options within a walk. Close enough to bus and subway. Would definitely return to this hotel.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Palm Gallery Hotel with its lovely little gardens and swimming pool is a perfect refuge from the crowded center of Rome. The hotel is small but has a nice glass enclosed sitting room on the first floor with white chairs. The staff was attentive and I would go back there.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a great find in Rome which when we visited was incredibly hot. We chose the hotel because it had a pool which was a god send with the hot weather we experienced. The hotel was clean and tidy and a lovely space on the outskirts of the city centre. The bus stop into central Rome was a five minute walk away from the hotel which was very handy. The pool area was quite as polished as it looks like on the official photographs but was lovely. The pool had been cleaned and refilled on our first day and was too cold to use but heated up throughout the week. The staff were lovely and very helpful and always seemed happy to help. On a couple of occasions when we were using the pool area I came back to the room and found the keys in the door of the room. I know it was a quiet hotel and well staffed but I felt security was an issue especially as this happened twice. On both occasions I took the keys back to reception. Also I wasn’t happy that when you left the hotel you left your room key in a bowl in reception. On three or four occasions we came in, collected it and no one was about and anyone could do the same and get into your room. Apart from security for its price and level of hotel it was a good choice.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mother and I had a great stay. The hotel and garden are beautiful, in a very nice area outside of Rome (with plenty of nice restaurants there too). The connection to historic centre by public transport was perfectly doable. We would recommend palm gallery because of the unique 'tropical' vibe and garden, diverse breakfast and most of all the great staff.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I returned to Palm Gallery after 9 years! It was a pleasure and privilege to return! If you are a "Traveller" and not a "Tourist" you will love this gorgeous hotel in the lovely residential neighbourhood of Trieste in Rome. Away from the tourist crowds but in easy reach to transport to explore the city of Rome. Part of the travel experience is catching the local buses. Enjoy the genuine italian restaurants and local shops of the area. The warmth, hospitality and professionalism from all the staff, the beautiful decorated rooms, breakfast patio and pool area, lovely breakfasts. We stayed 4 nights on this trip and we did not want to leave. I regard it as my "Home in Rome"
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place was perfect for our family. A small boutique hotel, decorated so perfectly. It is tucked away in a quiet, beautiful section of Rome. It is away from the chaos that is the attractions and thousands of people. We would spend our days being a tourist and spend the rest of our time at Palm Gallery feeling like a resident of Rome.The room was perfect. They cleaned it promptly everyday and gave us anything that we needed. There are tons of small gardens to sit and relax, the pool deck was so tranquil and filled with plants. The hotel really had a bohemian vibe and we just loved it.At night it is lit with candles and cool light fixtures that just make it so chill and cool.The staff, so let me say we never went without a glass of wine or cappuccino in our hands. They were so gracious and accommodating. Nima and Daniel, who worked the reception area were absolutely fantastic. From telling its what to see and do, to making sure we had those drinks, to just chatting with us about our day and what we saw. They really made our trip better. Make sure to ask about the most famous gelato shop in Rome. A 20 minute walk, but it was beautiful and worth it. Another great recommendation from the staff.The breakfast, OMG...Tony and Alli provided amazing fresh food, from pancakes to omlets and croissants. We were truly spoiled.And Peggy, the resident feline. My 11 year old daughter and I grew quite fond of her, while my husband and son grew quite fond of the white wine.Very special place, with a very special staff.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you for a very nice trip. A very nice family room, very good breakfast and very good service. A Little bit long to the city center but the hotel was super. Thank you for nice champagne and nice welcome.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at the Palm Gallery Hotel for our 4-night break to Rome. I researched hotels online and found the reviews of the hotel to be encouraging, so made the reservation. The hotel is small and intimate with all the staff we met being very friendly. The included breakfast was nice and the omelettes were particularly tasty. Prior to making the booking we were fully aware of the location being a bit out of the city centre, but in hindsight found this to be a bit too far for our needs, and in future we would choose a more central hotel. Unfortunately the weather was not great during our trip, so we only managed to have breakfast on the outdoor terrace on one occasion in 4 days. This was a shame as the terrace looked a lovely place to start the day. Similarly, the outdoor pool area looked nice but we did not have the opportunity to use as a result of the weather. Our terrance room number RD on the ground floor was of ample size with high ceilings was nice with a comfortable bed, but being just behind the public reception/bar areas did have minor noise issues. One thing I would recommend though is blackout blinds and the room was very light from dawn onwards. Overall a nice hotel which is exactly as described, but we unfortunately could not experience at it's best because of the weather. We would however stay closer to the city centre next time.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very glad that we chose Palm Gallery Hotel for our stay in Rome, as they really put customer experience as paramount-- Right after I made the booking, they sent me a list of documents of all useful information-- Prompt response in email for my additional booking of airport dropoff-- Promptly asking for my arrival time to prepare my room-- Very warm welcome -- Super helpful and friendly staff-- Delicious breakfast-- On time pick up for airportYou may find the location is a bit off the track , but it was really quiet and charming. And as a matter of fact, once you figured out the bus, it is very convenient to travel to Ancient Rome, Centro Storico, Trevi and Vatican.A headsup, I didn't see the newspaper stand near Bus62 stop open at all to sell bus/metro tickets. But there are a few tobacco shops nearby where you can buy the tickets -- but they close after 5 or 6pm.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Every detail about this place is perfect. The gardens, the pool, the blue and white tiled bathroom. I only stayed one night, but will return when in Rome. My mom and I had an early flight and the hotel arranged for us to have coffee and breakfast even though it was hours earlier than they normally served breakfast.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely garden view accommodation. Hotelier Luigia is gracious Roman host. All the staff were extremely courteous and attentive. The morning breakfast, served til 11AM is varied and delicious. Best coffee. Can’t say enough Good things about it. Wish we had stayed longer. Thanks!
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want a peaceful respite after a full day in Rome, this is the place to stay. The gardens, patio and neighborhood is very quiet and relaxing. The staff are so helpful and friendly. Nothing like coming back to some wine on the patio and then heading out for some great local food. Easy access to transportation- the metro, bus and tram are all available. Breakfast outside in the morning is absolutely wonderful!
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Agreat place to unwind after a full day of Rome. The staff is very kind and helpful. The rooms (we stayed twice) were outstanding. The breakfasts were delicious and made to order. The garden was very beautiful and was a great place to sit.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there after trekking around the country quite a bit and it was the perfect place to recover: beautiful rooms, delicious breakfast, super friendly staff and absolutely lovely neighborhood. We will come back for sure!
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived late at night, only to find the proprietress up and waiting. She poured us a glass of wine and explained the surrounding area and transportation, and made arrangements for dinner the next two nights. In the morning, we took the bus to the center, about a 20 minute bus ride, and a taxi back from the Vatican, a 20 euro trip. The rooms were clean, with high ceilings and beautiful light, and the breakfast was good, served in a small but sunny dining room. The neighborhood is nice, and safe for evening excursions, with shopping and restaurants nearby, and the local park, the Villa Torlonia, has some interesting history associated with it.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just about everything was great. The decor was different and very well done. There was plenty to eat for breakfast. I had my first omelette in Rome and it tasted good. Above all the manager Daniel really did everything he could to change what had been a very difficult day for us until we arrived He was kind, helpful and caring. We couldn't recommend him or his hotel highly enough. As for the parking, well it is Rome. But again Daniel worked very hard for us organizing a spot for us.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and helpful staff; comfortable and unpretentious rooms; a delicious and varied breakfast; a great location -easy access to the centre but far enough out for genuine restaurants and local shops. We would happily stay again.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A little far away from the city center, small clean rooms. All the basics are provided. Personel are welcoming. Its a cosy little place. We were asked to leave the keys at the reception when we were leaving the hotel, so they know if we are at the hotel or not. (I guess they have their reasons ) . The hotel is close to the area where st agnes catotombs are. They are small catotombs compaired to the famous ones, it is still a good one to visit.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love the hotel, the personnel was very kind and very helpful. You feel like home. Nice house, rooms are big and well decorate. The breakfast includes a great variety of food and different options.I will go back there. Is Not in the city center but is well connected. Nice restaurants around.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (me, my partner and her 11 year old) at Palm Gallery in October.Great little hotel; room was well appointed if not massive for a family room. Breakfast was ample and the staff really friendly. The hotel has a small outside pool and it was still just warm enough for us to get some use out of it!The hotel’s situated a little bit out of the centre; about half an hour walk or 10 mins to the nearest metro. That said there were plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. As a result the street was pretty quiet and relaxed. We would certainly use this place again if we visit Rome!
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic small hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff -- feels like coming home to family. Well-appointed room and bathroom. Great neighborhood away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Will return.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: you have to take a bus to all attractions, the bed was cracking like hell, but all the rest .was wonderful! very helpfull and kind stuff, very good breakfast' more beautiful in the pictures, yet very nice for a 3 stars. walls are so thin... we enjoyed it anyway because of the great stuff.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here in 2010 while renovations were still on going, and loved it. Now that those renovations are complete it's better than ever.I had a large room off the garden in the back that was very comfortable. The bedroom. And bathroom were spotlessly clean.The staff were very friendly and helpful, just like last time. The breakfast is even better than it was in 2010 with cereal, cheese, meat, pastries, bread, caprise salad, and custom eggs (including omelettes). The coffee was great.The only issue for me was that I needed to leave the hotel very early to get to my meetings, well over an hour before they normally serve breakfast. Nevertheless, they opened up what they could for me at 6:30 and I never left hungry. On my last day at the hotel I had the full breakfast experience.The room was quiet and the heat pump was also almost silent so I was able to keep the room comfortable for sleeping.On check-in they gave me a map with all the good local restaurants and some recommendations of their favourites. I tried tow for supper and they were both great.The hotel is quite close to the major tram routes and buses. It's about a 15 minute walk to the Policlinico Metro station which will get you everywhere.I'll certainly be staying here if I get back to Rome.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had four nights here and had a lovely room with doors to a private garden area with pool access which was lovely to relax in after big days exploring the city. The staff could not have been more helpful. A little out of the city centre but close enough to walk everywhere.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely two night stay at Palm Gallery. Far enough away from city centre to get some peace and quiet but also close enough to walk in to the town (if you don’t mind walking as it is about 30minutes). Lovely welcome from Vincenzo who took us through some handy good-to-knows, we had a welcome drink & we were also offered an upgrade if we wanted it (I actually preferred the smaller room - D1, so we opted to stay there).Mytaxi app works really well in Rome so that’s always an option if you don’t fancy waking. Free Rome Tours is fab too! Maybe don’t try I Buggeti unless you’re going to have steak) on list of recommendations - as I’m sure there would be better nearby. We didn’t get chance to go but Pepe Verde at end of street looked lovely! Overall a great base to explore Rome and communication from start to finish was fantastic!!
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed four nights at this small hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Our room was small - but clean, quiet and sunny. Nice breakfast. Nice outdoor spaces which we did not use due to the weather. We found the location difficult to find and got lost a lot. Probably we're not the best map readers.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in a quiet neighborhood in Rome. The rooms were nice, and the outside space was amazing for relaxing after a long day of sightseeing. The staff went out of their way to make sure our stay was wonderful, and we would highly recommend.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything went well.The room as described in the webpage.The service even better.Ideal location only a few minutes away from Rome CenterNice and small place with most of the features found at other hotels
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a pretty decent place to stay. The breakfast was good. Room was nice. The lady that helped us at check-in was really nice. Would have given the place a better rating if we could have been given complimentary bottles of water. Also, check-out was early and even though we were told we could get something from the fridge, we couldn't get into the main building to get into the fridge.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited Rome earlier this summer for a friend's wedding, and we went back to Palm Gallery given our amazing first experience, and we are so happy we did! Wonderful rooms, the pool and sun deck--we almost never left! In fact the other couple traveling with us had such a relaxing and wonderful time, they extended their day to enjoy a few more days of sipping cocktails by the pool. Both the owners and staff are wonderfully friendly and accommodating, which made all the difference. We would go back in a heart beat.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This lovely boutique hotel has 13 rooms only. It is a converted villa tho is a fusion between old and new. Stayed in a large oasis room which was well appointed. Good wifi. There is a small pool with sunning area surrounded by plants. However it is in shade by mid afternoon. The staff are extremely helpful and friendly. Rome is a bustling metropolis so it is nice to be surrounded by quiet and greenery. Breakfast is good though I wasnt too keen on things in plastic bottles, containers and wrappers. The croissants were delicious. It's about a half hour walk to most attractions but you can catch the nearby metro. Recommended.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Charming hotel, the staff is very kind. Louisa is so welcoming. The garden is wonderful, the pool is welcome at the end of the day.It feels like home.The hotel is located in a quiet area, close to public transportation. perfect breakfast.Ideal hotel for us, we will return.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet area and really nice small garden/pool area. Great breakfast. The host Vincenzo was really nice and helpful and made us feel welcome. The reason for not giving 5 stars is the room which was a bit moist and dark (not much light) - because it was on the lower floor. Maybe different if on higher floors with more sun light. But the room was spacy and nice furnished. Overall we recommend the hotel and will consider to come back.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our recent visit to the Palm Gallery Hotel. It is a beautifully transformed villa in a quieter suburban area of Rome, but still very close to the centre (within an easy bus ride). Loved being able to escape the heat and busyness of the inner city at the end of a day's exploring and come back to this sanctuary.Apart from the room and beautiful garden, what really sets this property apart are the staff. Brilliant. Helpful, friendly, and accommodating. Many thanks to you all.Terrific breakfasts too. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with my husband for a 4 day trip to Rome,the hotel looks great on the website but on arrival it looked very tired. The staff were lovely,on arrival Daniel was very welcoming and helpful,his list of local restaurants was very useful. Our room (RS) led out up to the pool which was nice but the step up was very high so not possible for less mobile people. The wooden decking up there was very loose and there was also a screw sticking up around the side of the pool. I work in Safety and I did wonder if anyone was doing any checks for things like this. I opened the wooden shutters in our room to see what the view was only to discover a dumping ground for old furniture,old tubs of food,just general mess which is not nice outside your window. The outside areas were nice but needed revarnishing and tidying up. There is a beautiful resident Cat who sadly was full of fleas, I found a flea on the bed one night. The hotel is not far from the metro but too far to walk from the Train Station,it have us a good base to see the main attractions of Rome. It has lots of potential so I gave it 3 stars mainly because the staff are so lovely but it needs some care to make it look like the website pictures.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and My husband stayed at The Palm Gallery Hotel for our Wedding Anniversary. We had a downstairs room under the pool. It was very nicely decorated and clean with a fridge , plenty of hangers in the Wardrobe and very clean. The breakfast was fabulous , fresh eggs cooked how you wanted, between us we had omlettes, poached eggs and boiled eggs all lovely and hot. There were plenty of cereals, and fresh fruit and pastries. Yoghurts in the fridge and a choice of smoothies I had the watermelon and the detox one both very nice. The best part of our stay was the pool. It was just what we needed after 3 full days to have a rest day and just spent it in the pool was perfect. The Hotel is very near the bus stops and we used these all the time. Its just 1.50 Euros each for a bus ticket and the trip took about 10-15mins to get to the centre of town. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again in an instant. Special mention to Daniel who was so helpful with maps and bus routes etc but all the staff were so helpful nothing was too much trouble.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The structure is very cozy and homely with welcoming staff. Vincenzo was extremely helpful and kind throughout our stay and we enjoyed the quietness of the area which was also well connected to the city center.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a small yet super classy hotel. It's friendly staff, lovely grounds, and homey atmosphere made it a perfect base for us in Rome. We especially loved the pool- such a treat in the afternoons. I also recommend the terrazza room with access to the pool. The hotel is family friendly, has a resident cat, and the palms that give it it's name. I would recommend hot water pots in the rooms- it was annoying to have to go out at 9 only to find that there was no one to heat up water for a cup of tea or coffee. That is probably my only pressing recommendation.The breakfast is good, and generous. We had no issues going into town. Everything is a quick bus ride away: 60, 62 go straight to the city center. Also do stop at La Romana, the best Gelataria in town, which is a nice, 10 minute evening walk from the hotel.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room on the third floor was lovely, spacious and had lots of natural light. It overlooked the pool but was very quiet due to double glazed windows. Everyone was very friendly and accommodating. Vincenzo makes an amazing coffee! Thank you!
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed staying here, the moment we arrived the hotel looked well kept and we received a warm welcome from Vincenzo. All the staff were friendly and Luisa was very helpful. Breakfast was served in a lovely outdoor garden with plenty to choose from. The pool area was also good. We would definitely recommend this place. Located on the edge of the city and cost approx $12 euro by taxi to or from city to hotel.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Palm Gallery Hotel is a small hotel in what used to be a large family villa in a quiet area. The area is not in the historic center, but it is easy to get to the historic sites with subway, trams or buses - or even on foot. Rooms are spaceous and nice, the breakfast is sufficient, omelettes can be ordered. You can choose to eat inside or outside on the nice terrace. There is even a small pool to refresh yourself on hot days. The owner and her staff? Absolutely fantastic. They will do all they can to help you and make you feel welcome. I use this hotel both for business and pleasure. Remember to go to Fontana di Trevi and toss a coin into it over your shoulder - then you are sure to return to Rome one day. It has worked for me a number of times - and I always stay at the Palm Gallery.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 6 (including my 2 kids and their grandparents) loved our stay at Palm Gallery Hotel in August 2018. This is a very small hotel located in a quiet neighborhood of Rome, and the calm neighborhood was a good respite after spending the day sightseeing. The rooms are nice, and the beds are comfortable. Importantly, the hotel offers family rooms to accommodate a family of 4. Every employee with whom we interacted during our stay was exceptionally friendly and helpful. Breakfast was good, and we loved sitting on the beautiful terrace in the mornings. We also ate a light lunch at the hotel on a couple of occasions. There is a limited menu, but the food was quite good. The pool area in the back is small but lovely with plenty of seating. We walked to a few different restaurants (including I Butteri and Bruto) close to the hotel for dinner, and also walked to a wonderful gelateria, Guttilla. I highly recommend this hotel and would love to have another stay.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with our two children (9 and 12yrs old) for four nights in july. We had a corner room with direct access to the pool. The roome was a good size that works for kids this age or younger. The hotel is a converted villa with a lovely little pool located just minutes outside of Rome center. The owner and staff are wonderful and helpful with top service. Email communication was prompt and efficient. We arrived later than planned (after 11pm) due to flight delay but it was still no trouble for the owner to make a snack and a delicious simple pasta dish. Daniel and Vincenzo and the rest of the staff were always there to ensure everything we needed was looked after. The terrace/pool area was a great treat after a long and hot day. The bus stop to get to the center is a short and easy walk from the hotel (6 minutes maybe) and tickets for the bus can be bought on the way. There are plenty of restaurants in the area all in what we consider an easy strolling distance (10 to 20 minutes). We did take a taxi twice and believe we paid about 13 euros to get back in the evening from the Pantheon area.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited as 2 couples for a 2 night break. This hotel is faultless in every way. From the second we arrived we were looked after from welcome tapas type food and the drinks bought to us around the pool which continued all afternoon. Both the food and drink prices for a hotel is very reasonable too. We decided to upgrade to the slightly larger rooms which were magnificent with bare stone walls and a large window overlooking the pool and terrace. We spent most of our 3 days around the pool as it was so peaceful and relaxing. Ali our waiter for our stay was exceptional going over and beyond with the service we received. I would rate this service the best I have ever received from any hotel or waiter ever. Luisa and her husband own the hotel. What beautiful people, both friendly and helpful and went out of our way to ensure our stay was amazing. We ate at a restaurant Elenora D’Arborria (which was recommended by someone who also stayed at Palm Gallery) which is a short walk around from the hotel. This restaurant is a must. The waiter suggested we have the Seafood Antipasti for starters! Wow wow wow is all I can say! The food was outstanding and the service impeccable. The hotel is probably a 10 minute taxi ride from the centre of Rome which is perfect to get out of the hustle and bustle of the town. The day we left, was my friends birthday. Luisa the owner had spent the morning baking a birthday cake. Before we left all of the staff came to the pool dining Happy Birthday with the cake complete with a candle. I have to say the cake was delicious. This hotel is amazing in every way. We can not wait to return. Luisa and Co especially Ali. Thank you so so much for making our stay special.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After reading some great reviews about this hotel I was excited to see if it could possibly live up to its reputation. And did it? YES and more. I can’t rave about this hotel enough. A short bus or metro ride away from the bustle of the city and the palm gallery brings calmness and serenity in an amazing setting. From the moment we arrived in early evening and sat on the terrace for our welcome drinks we knew we’d chosen well. The gardens are lush and you just feel that all is right with the world. Lots of helpful information and a recommendation for a quick local pizza that night. We stayed in one of the panoramic rooms as we were travelling with our two teenage children. Sleeping 4 comfortably. The rooms and indeed the decor of the whole hotel is beautiful. Beds were really comfy, as were the pillows. We had a view of the swimming pool from our room which was perfect. Breakfast is served either inside or sitting in the garden. Tranquil and a great start to the day. Breakfast is plentiful and of a high standard. Cereals, bread, meat, cheeses, fruit etc. Fresh fruit smoothies a great addition. Freshly cooked eggs, omelettes and pancakes were also really good. The staff were also brilliant. So friendly. Special mention to Vincenzo as he was so lovely to our children. All the staff were fantastic without exception. The swimming pool area was lovely. Big bean bags, comfy chairs and hammock made the whole setting a great place to chill out. After a hot, sticky day in Rome to come back to such a beautiful place and jump in the pool was just perfect. If you’re looking for a hotel in Rome, stop looking. You’ve found it.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Palm Gallery hotel is a lovely place with great and friendly service in a relaxed environment. The room we had was nice and tastefully decorated, with a nice patio and direct access to the small pool, perfect to cool down from the hot July-days in Rome. The breakfast was plentiful with a good buffet and made to order omelettes. It is some distance away from the main tourist areas, but I consider that a plus, especially since the area has lots of residential life, like restaurants and bars to offer.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I made a last minute decision to stay at this lovely hotel and let me say it was the BEST DECISION EVER... The pool was great to have after long hot days of sightseeing or for an evening chill with a glass of proseco and some snacks. The staff was amazing, especially Daniel, he went above and beyond to ensure our comfort, event helping us book last minute skip the line tickets to the Vatican Museum. Breakfast was great overall I had a fantastic stay at this hotel and will definitely be staying there on my next visit. Only con was that the wifi didn't connect in my room, perhaps because I was on the lower floor but it wasn't much of an issue as I was able to connect in the main lobby. I think that was actually a good thing as it helped me truly disconnect and enjoy the vacation.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent six delightful days at the Palm Gallery and enjoyed every minute. The hotel is a tastefully converted villa in a lovely part of Rome, easily accessible by bus from the city center. A particular joy was the sincerely friendly, helpful and efficient staff. The breakfast was delicious and the room comfortable. Much appreciated at the end of long and hot days was the small pool to cool off.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel to spend 6 nights in July 18 for a family of four.The team was extremely welcoming, with Vincenzo and Ali (& all others) always there to ensure everything we needed was looked after.The position is lovely and the rooms & area are delightful.Great local restaurants, fantastic breakfast at the hotel topped off an amazing week.After a hot day of touring Rome, it was always great to come back to a pool, grab a campari and let the kids play in the pool area to cool down. The deck & pool are just delightful.Thank you all very much for the wonderful stayGeorge
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: LOVED this place. If you want to experience a little piece of heaven in Rome - this is it! Beautiful small hotel in an old 19th century villa with a rooftop swimming pool, great breakfast and service. The owners live on the top floor of the villa and gave our stay an extra flavour of the
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't know where to begin...we loved EVERYTHING about our stay here!The hotel is located outside of the busy tourist area of the city. At first we wondered if the location would be inconvenient because we usually try to stay close to a metro station. We never once found it to be a problem. Taxis were cheap, buses were easy to find and located nearby, and it was worth a little extra effort to go "home" to this beautiful building, garden, terrace and pool after a day of walking the city. Additionally, the hotel proactively provided a great deal of information via email prior to our arrival and during the check in process that we felt we were so well prepared to enjoy Rome. They went out of their way to make sure every question was answered and they provided a variety of recommendations (restaurants, grocery stores, etc.) so we could easily navigate the neighborhood.What makes this hotel truly stand out is the staff. From the moment Vincenzo greeted us we were so impressed with every staff person we met. Vincenzo and Daniel went out of their way to make sure we had everything we needed and enjoyed our stay. Ali went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and at home. He frequently checked in to see if we needed anything and he always made time to chat with us, which made us feel like more than just a customer. Maybe we just got lucky, but we also found the other hotel guests to be so pleasant. By the end of our week in Rome we felt like we were leaving friends...not just staff and guests at a hotel. We feel grateful to all the staff for making our visit to Rome so wonderful!This is perhaps one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. You can't go wrong booking here!!!
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are unsure whether to book this hotel for your trip to Rome then don’t delay any longer. Go ahead and book it. You won’t regret your choice. It is the perfect calm and peaceful retreat after a busy day in the centre. My feet couldn’t wait to get in the pool at the end of each day. We spent very relaxing times in the pool area playing backgammon and drinking cocktails. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. They ordered a taxi for us each morning to get into town but they also explained which bus to get and where from. Breakfast was served outside in the beautiful terrace full of lush plants and flowers. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Rome. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated just outside the city center, but easily reached by several buses, this hotel is a real gem with its tranquile location, excellent service and delicious breakfast. The rooms are nice and with the pool and the sun chairs, this hotel met our high expectations and then some. This is the place to stay in Rome!
hotelName:
21    Palm Gallery Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing 3 night stay at this B&b room was lovely, breakfast was great, location was brilliant and staff were so friendly and helpful going above and beyond to help thank you so much we hope to be back!!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay here . Fantastic location . Wonderlful location , so close the the metro and all attractions. Great breakfast in the morning and very informative host. Very clean room and bathroom also.Can’t wait to return !
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time to Rome with my partner. We had a lovely experience. We were in a perfect location being 2 min walk from the colosseum. Beautiful room, clean and comfortable.Very helpful and caring team offering tourist and travel information. Would definitely return and recommend!!!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I spent 4 nights at the B&B. The host was so kind, he was truly very sweet. The rooms were clean very clean. The curtains thin so it got bright early but we had eye mask allowing us to sleep in a bit. He served us a lovely breakfast each morning, I will day I wish we had more protein, even a hard boiled egg but that’s a personal preference. Everything he serve was delicious! The location was good as far as being near transportation and main tourist sites. the picture of the sunset is the view from from our room, the breakfast, the wine and water for when we arrived, and the room.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a long weekend in January, arriving Thursday night and leaving on Sunday morning. It was a little bit hard to find, as there was no sign, but someone was waiting for us outside and showed us in. The room was lovely - minimalist but very spacious, and we had a view of he colosseum from our window (if you craned your neck a bit). All of the staff we encountered were exceptionally friendly and laid back, and breakfast was served in the room and consisted of fresh coffee, fresh juice, toast , fruit and pastries. It was very cute and perfect for a couple’s getaway weekend.It’s very conveniently positioned in relation to the metro, buses and of course the colosseum. I’m sure they could charge double the price for this place and still be fully booked.Would 100% recommend and will definitely be coming back here if I get the chance!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was on my first solo trip to Europe and this B & B was the perfect spot for my 4 days in Roma! A magical city. Marco one of the host was so sweet and the daily breakfast was fabulous! The rooms were spacious and the bathroom was huge! I loved this place and location and would stay here again. I walked everywhere from here and enjoyed the amazing sites just moments away! The Colosseo is a beautiful sight! I will be back to this wonderful spot!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights at La Finestra Sul Colosseo, walking to the B&B was no problem, it's 10 minutes away walking distance from the Metro and the closest stop to the Colosseum.. you literally are looking at in front of you as soon as you step out of the Metro station! Jaw dropping and amazing! We stayed in the room facing the street, the building across from our window was beautiful and traditional and if you lean a bit out of the window you can see the Colosseum in all its glory. We enjoyed the continental breakfast cart that was delivered promptly to the room every morning with delicious coffee and tea.The Room was spacious and airy, decorated with white walls, linens and curtains. The ceilings are high and arched with exposed brick, it made the room feel massive and traditional... very cool. The bathroom is huge with a large window and fogged glass for privacy, comfortable vanity, standup shower, toilet and bidet... very pretty! Most improtantly my 6'3" tall fiancé was able to fit comfortably in the spacious queen size bed :). On arrival we kept in touch with Aldo via text, email and WhatsApp, he was in constant communication with us and was very helpful making sure we found our way to the B&B. The Building is secure and has a functioning elevator. The neighborhood felt very safe, we walked everywhere day and night. Ancient Rome is right outside of the doorsteps, the location is amazing! We loved walking to all of the sights. We are heavy sleepers and loved having breakfast in front of the open window so the street Rome was our preference, for light sleepers the B&B also has room facing away from the street. Overall, would highly recommend this lovely B&B and would stay here again :)
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Colosseum only a few minutes walk away at the end of the road!Beautiful light and airy room and lovely bathroom in an ancient apartment block. Aldo, the landlord,was really helpful and served an appetising continental breakfast in the room. The hotel was excellent value for money and will be our choice of hotel next time we are lucky enough to go to Rome.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a lovely 5 days in Rome, massively helped by our 4 nights staying in B&B La Finestra Colloseo. The location is fantastic and we walked everywhere. On the one day we went to the Vatican (a little further than most sights) we hired bikes from a place just 50 yards from the front door. Marco and Jason were excellent hosts providing a fantastic breakfast delivered to the room each morning and happy to offer advice on where to eat and where to go. We had two meals based on Marco's recommendations and both were great. I would strongly recommend.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with my Family and we had wonderful time. Aldo was in constant touch with us while it was Marco who attended us daily.Must say they served us one of the BEST CAPPUCCINO for breakfast during our 18 days in Italy.. We faced some issue with Hot water at night and reading my message Aldo made sure that the issue was resovled. That was appreciable.Breakfast is served in room and was again very very high quality.Room / Bathroom / Bed were very good.Marco, thank you for recommending places and restaurants which certainly helped us tremendously.Made our Rome stay memorable and yes... again miss that coffee ..Wish you the best...
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on our vacation to Italy and couldn't be happier with our choice. The room was comfortable, with breakfast provided in our room each morning. The Colosseo metro stop is only a few blocks away, a bus/trolley stop almost right out the door, and many restaurants and cafes within a short walk. Marco was a wonderful host and took great care of us!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fastastic location close to all major historical sites and close to the trendy neighbourhood Monti where you can find many bars and restaurants. Excellent service from the lovely staff. We highly recommend!!!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife & i spent 5 nights here for 25th wedding Anniversary, close to the Colloseum, Manzoni metro station just up around the corner. Beautifully clean & Marco, Aldo & the rest of the team provide a lovely breakfast in your room daily. Free wifi & air conditioning was a godsend as nightime temps where up in the 20's.Fantastic service from them from start to finish.We look forward to going back.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just went back after 6 years and this place is always the best and has improved with Jeson bringing you the breakfast in the room with a cart full of goodies.This time I stayed in room 5 and the bathroom was huge, very quiet at night and safe neighborhood.Aldo is always willing to give you tips were to go eat where loco goes.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Many thanks for the nice assistance of Marco. Every morning he prepared a perfect breakfast and gave very good recommendations for the day. The breakfast was served in our room. Our room and bathroom were bigger than expected. The room was well renovated. The style was very nice.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location made this the perfect place for us. Being able to walk most places and with a local metro station to take a us to the Vatican when needed was great. We were able to stroll around in the evenings and found some lovely restaurants to eat at. The room was clean, tidy and very spacious. We were in room 5, we had no views but that did not bother us. Upstairs clearly have a very energetic child who could be heard running around but by the time we were back to bed at night that was not a problem.
