Breakfast was amazing, a great selection, it was the perfect way to start the day. The hosts were great, we had asked prior to our arrival if we could leave our bags at the b&b after checkout as we had a later flight which they allowed us to do. They also booked taxis for us from the airport and back to it when we left. It made our trip seamless and ensured we had nothing to worry about. They also provided us with a handy map with info on the location of the sights, great neighborhoods for restaurants and stations for the metro and stops for the buses.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B is not in the heart of it all, which is fantastic. It is quiet at night (although the child that lives upstairs could use some sleeping pills), and a short walk to the colosseum. We were in suite 4 which did not have a view of the colosseum, so if you are concerned about that, suite 4 is not for you. I didn’t care, the bed and the bathroom is all I care about...you step out the door and there’s the colosseum! Speaking of, the location is nice because it is a very easy to remember walk into the heart of Rome. You walk Via Labicana until it turns into Via Fort Imperiali at the colosseum, and it seems every street eventually hits Imperiali. You can get to Trastevere easily, although I recommend a taxi or public transport (nearby) for Vatican City. It was 16 euro for a taxi from Ponte Sant Angelo to the B&B (sore feet).The breakfast was excellent, pastries, fruit, meat and cheese, juice and cappuccino. It was great to have it in our room as we planned our day. The bed was cozy, and the bathrooms are HUGE. Only issue with a bathroom that size is the echo!!!Also, don’t think you can walk from the train station to the B&B unless you’re backpacking. You’ll hate it. I did. I thought, looking at the map, it could be done. I was wrong. A taxi is less than 10 euro, just get one.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B is amazing and the pictures don't do it any justice. The room is much larger than the pictures show and the bathroom is enormous. Everything is beautifully decorated and super clean. They have a small kitchen where they prepare breakfast and bring it to your room in a cart - just like heaving breakfast in bed. It is located within walking distance from the coliseum and Roman forum but away from the touristy areas. Would definitely recommend it!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here for 4 nights and it was easily the best place we had stayed for our whole trip. The room was immaculate and peaceful with a very comfortable bed. Breakfast in bed was amazing! I was not expecting it to be such an affair arriving on a trolley and helped us to really relax during our stay. The hosts were very kind and helpful with everything we needed - providing plenty of very good restaurant recommendations. There are only 3 rooms so it is very quiet and private. It is walkable to everywhere - we only used public transport to get to the vatican. Highly highly recommend staying here and would definitely stay here again on another trip to rome!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 350+ reviews have given this b&b nearly fivestar ratings. It is #16 on TA among all of Rome B&B's. I find this utterly confounding. We reserved "suite2" direct from their website. So please note that this was not a bargain basement economy room reservation. This is relevant because the place is called 'window on Colosseo'. Our window opened into the bldg's courtyard and even in broad daylight all lights had to be on. We couldn't tell if it was day or night. It was like twilight zone. So that's the first - that misrepresentation. Forget Colosseo. We had no view of the outside world, period.Next, positives:- modern, updated interior- large bathroom (was important for me)- unique barrel ceilingThe rest of my comments are not necessarily things I want to categorize as 'negative'. I leave it to the reader to decide that. For us these things were not ideal. - The building foyer & staircase smelled of urine. - the room appeared clean due to the colors of floor tile etc but my shower sandals revealed otherwise everyday as the water made all the grime stream out from them. - mold all over the walls of the bathroom. - accidentally I got a whiff of the mattress. It smelled so bad! The rest of the time I was cursing myself cause you cannot ..unsmell..that! Yuck. What were we sleeping on? - the whole system for the trolley breakfast is funny at best and dysfunctional at worst. Forget the stale pastries. The fact that there is no place to have/serve breakfast makes it clear that this apartment is not set up right to sell itself as a b&b.- the location is good if you like looking at the Colosseum from standing in front of the building..it is in fact visible at the end of the road. But that is deceptive when it comes to actual walking distance. I would rather prefer a place closer to a metro stop. The trams c3 & c8 run along the street. Bus 85, 87 and the circulator line also stop near by. But we ended up having to walk to most places because Colosseo was not our main priority this time. Manzoni stop is the next best alternative. Not a short walk though. Esp after a full day of walking.- there is no onsite staff. This is just a side business for a couple of locals. Most reviews refer to 'staff'... What staff? Jason who comes in to set up the breakfast trolley for two rooms from 8-10 am? That's a strange assignment anyway.- there is a room that has the tea coffee maker but it is locked except for breakfast hours and only for admin use.- they do not own a credit card machine which is fine but in 2017 they don't use square or similar to process payment. I'm still somewhat stumped by this place. I don't know what it is or why it is ranked #16 on TA. Why such low expectations? Is it now a privilege.. being allowed to pay people for a room? I don't understand. Is a free bottle of wine the clincher? It is important to remember that in Italy coop wine is at times cheaper than restaurant water. So I hope this review helps someone with the facts presented to make an informed choice. I felt let down by the 350 rave reviews.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A short walk from the Colosseum metro, only a matter of a few minutes, found us at the door of this place. The external surroundings and hall were a little rustic. We were met at the door by our host, who,like the others we met, were fantastic. Our room was beautiful, clean bright and spacious with high terracotta coloured brick ceilings, and the welcome bottle of wine, water and fruit in our room was much appreciated. Our host spoke excellent English and gave us lots of useful tips about where to go, how to get there, and good restaurants to try (we tried a few of his recommendations and they were really good).Breakfast was served daily at a time to suit us and set us up perfectly for each of the five days of our stay. The room was cleaned and the bed changed daily. Bottles of water are left in the room each day.Little touches by our host in checking that we had all we needed each day, and coming to say goodbye on our last day added to the quality of the experience. All the information they have us was perfectly accurate.There is something magical in stepping out on to a busy Rome road each morning and seeing the mighty Colosseum only a few hundred meters away.After we checked out we found that there was a transport strike affecting trains, the metro and some taxis. We were understandably concerned that we may not get to the airport on time. We needn't have worried. I rang our hosts to ask their advice and they arranged a taxi to take us to the airport (taxi fixed price Rome to Fumincino airport is 48 euro). The taxi arrived bang on time and the driver was very polite.The whole experience was excellent and one which I would recommend to anyone wanting to explore this beautiful city and prepared to swap the trappings of expensive hotels for a beautiful room on the doorstep of one of the wonders of the world, coupled with a high quality personal service delivered by wonderful polite people who go the extra mile. Thank you Marco and Aldo.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found the rooms to be beautiful, simple, and spacious. The bathroom was modern and spotlessly clean. We had not originally cared about whether or not there was breakfast, but in the end it was a huge treat to have the breakfast delivered to the room. The location is great. The innkeepers were kind and helpful. Overall a really great stay.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were looking for accomodation close to the marathon starting/finishing area. Perfect.Suite-1 was a quiet room (no traffic or other noise) with comfortable mattress and pillows. Bathroom was spacious and the extensive hot shower (lying, sitting, standing) after the run made me walking through Rome´s touristic spots the same afternoon again.Staff was friendly and helpful offering water, juice and fruits on arrival. Located between access to both metro lines A and B and close to some bus lines.Offered private taxi service from airport worked well, so it took us just half an our to arrive.Certainly, some improvements would be possible: A mirror in the bedroom, a shaving mirror in the bathroom, a dish for shower gels,...Accomodation is in a residential building with an inner courtyard, a good old-fashioned elevator giving all of it a kind of Italian flair, thus better than many anonymous modern standard hotels made of glass and concrete. That´s the reason for the fifth star. "Grazie" for a totally uncomplicated stay in Rome.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A fantastic B&B right next to the colosseum and local transport links with loads of resturants around. Aldo and Jason were fantastic hosts and arranged taxis both to and from the airport for us. We arrived into Rome on a late flight and Jason and Aldo were very flexible and accomodating our late arrival The room was absolutely massive and very nicely decorated, the ensuite bathroom was just as big with both rooms having a fantastic brick ceiling. We got up early on Friday to get to the colloseum before the crowds and Jason arrived early especially to serve us breakfast before we left which was a nice gesture. Breakfast we very substantial and had a great continental selection.All in all a great stay made better by fantastic hosts. Will be visiting again!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay at La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B! The room was clean, light and beautifully decorated, as shown on the pictures. Marco & Also were lovely hosts and provided us with tips, directions and a delicious breakfast every morning. Really felt like home for 4 days and the locations was perfectly situated. Would definitely recommend it!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here two nights and wished we could have stayed longer. Aldo met us upon arrival and gave us a map of the city with tips on his favorite restaurants. He showed us to our room and explained the breakfast process. We were very happy with our room. It was spotless and beautiful. We loved the tiled ceiling. In the morning we were greeted by Jason who served us breakfast. He was so polite and delightful. We loved that the breakfast was served in room. It allowed me to eat in bed in my pajamas. The variety was good too-toast, fruit, pasteries, yogurts, cheeses and meats.We cannot wait to return.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B was by FAR the nicest accommodations we encountered during our 12 day in Italy. The room was beautifully appointed and our breakfast was fantastic. Our hosts met us at the door when we arrived and we're more than accommodating during our entire visit. The location was perfect for us, a quick walk to the Colosseum as well as to the Metro which took us where ever we wanted to go. Short taxi rides from many of the other sites and attractions made everything easily accessible. I did not see any of the other rooms for comparison but our room was wonderfully decorated and very welcoming. We will definitely book this B&B again if we find ourselves in Rome.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were met on arrival by Marco who made us feel very welcome and pointed out the sights of Rome on a map and made us a cup of coffee. The room was very clean, nicely furnished and spacious as was the bathroom! The bed was extremely comfortable (nice firm mattress). Only two downsides: 1. We overslept on the final morning till 10 after all the walking (but were woken by a knock on the door to check we wanted breakfast); 2. I didn't like having breakfast (although very nice) off a trolley in the bedroom.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love returning to the same hotels and cities. I feel as if I am home. So it is with La Finestra sul Colosseo, a B and B in Rome near the colosseum. The B and B is beautiful,outside the throngs of people in Rome so you have a place of peace to return to. Aldo, Gioia and Marco make your stay perfect. We will return in November. You ought to go there too.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After reading everyone's reviews - I would say that I agree 100%!! The rooms are excellent, lots of room, very modern and clean, breakfast is lovely too. The hosts Marco and Aldo were extremely welcoming giving us a map and spent about 20 minutes going through the sites with us when we first arrived, we received a personal service they even booked us a taxi to the airport when we emailed them late in the evening. The location is excellent - 5 minutes away from the Coliseum - don't hesitate to book !!!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good communication from the day my daughter and I booked. Aldo was very helpful with travel arrangements. Met at the accommodation and given a map and tourist information from Marco on arrival. Really central location with very quiet, tasteful room. Loved the shower and vast bathroom! Quirky breakfast arrangement which my daughter and I found charming. Very friendly and helpful hosts, nothing was too much trouble. We would happily stay with Aldo and his team at La Finestra sul Colesseo B&B again, they really made our stay in Rome comfortable and fun.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On arrival we was unsure what to expect due to the outside of this accommodation, it didn't look appealing & was uninviting. We was tempted to book somewhere else. Once in though the room was lovely, clean & functional. We knew already that the owner wasn't on site full time which didn't bother us, he did help us settle in & gave us a few hints & tips whilst visiting Rome. He returned again at breakfast, which was served to us on a trolly, we personally thought the breakfast was nothing special & the fruit we had was bruised & the same appeared again the same day. If I was the owner I would just leave it at room only. However the location is good for visiting all the sites.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We felt spoilt staying here, The location is 500m from the colosseum if that, our room was spotless, modern and beautiful. The breakfast buffet was the cherry on top and all these factors made our break superb. The curtains block the light out well and we had a good nights sleep, Id certainly stay here again!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights from 5th May 2016, this is a hidden gem, once you are inside the rooms are stunning, you have all day access to your room and breakfast is served in your room when you are ready. The staff were very helpful and give you tips on the best places to visit. The Colosseum is 5 mins down the road. This will hold special memories for me as my partner proposed whilst we were there.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Suites 1 & 2 for 7 nights with our family of 4. (Actually labeled rooms 4 & 5, on the 2nd floor (which is actually the 3rd floor to Americans). The location is wonderful, about 1/2 mile from the Colosseum, and close to the Metro lines and restaurants, cafes, shopping, and sights. The room was reasonably quiet, comfortable, loved the showers and breakfast. There is a locking safe in the room, and laundry facilities are nearby, as is the pick-up point for Enjoy Rome tours (about 250 steps away!) We took a day trip to Pompeii through these tour shuttles, and found it a very convenient and stress-free way to enjoy that site. When you arrive at Via Labicana 72, ring the door buzzer for La Finestra Sul Colosseo and they'll let you up!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Prompt and useful communication from Aldo before our arrival meant our arrival was simple by the Leonardo Train (14E each single journey) then two stops on either Metro line gets you within about 500m of the B&B. Doesn't look much from the outside, it's within a typical continental block of apartments but inside our room and bathroom was spotlessly clean and both were also spacious. The buildings channel up the road noise, which isn't that busy, so we shut the windows at night but the air conditioning meant any temperature isn't a problem. We had a double view of the Colosseum if you poke your head out of the bedroom and bathroom windows, it is at the end of the road and made for an impressive walk home after eating out in the evening. We were met by Marco who was very helpful and informative and gave us the best tips on where to eat (he's right!) he brought us our breakfast of toast, fruit, yoghurt, ham and cheese and pastries in the mornings. Nothing was too much trouble.The accommodation is in walking distance of the sites if you don't mind walking and is situated between the two Metro lines within a 5/10 minute walk if you do. You can get to the landmarks easily using this and it's only 7E for a day Metro pass.Fantastic value for money, hotel standard for a fraction of the price. Wouldn't hesitate to go back or to recommend this accommodation.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything that has been said before is true. I would not hesitate to recommend this place to anyone especially if you like to be independent.The location is fantastic but so are the buses that serve Via Labicana, making it extremely easy to arrive at Termini (85) but also very easy to get about the city to visit all the Rome 'must sees'.It is also very easy to walk to a number of restaurants in nearby monti and also closer.Do not miss the church of St Clemente as it is also nearby.I also have to say that the staff at La Finestra were extremely helpful
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had some difficulty getting to it as we were held up at Rome Airport, but as we drove up Via Labicana there was Aldo waiting to greet us and help with the luggage, having waited for an hour. We found the room everything we could have wished, spacious enough for a couch, a desk and a large double bed. Continental breakfast was brought in on a dumb waiter each morning and set us up for a great days of walking around Rome. everything was clean and well laid out - I recommend it for anyone. As the entrance is on a main road that is well lit it is quite secure as the outer and inner doors are both locked and you have both keys. There is a great ice cream/coffee/cake shop about 150 metres down the road towards the Colosseum.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of this b&b is ideal, not in the centre of town so not too busy, but an easy walk to all major points in Rome, or an even easier walk to two local underground stops.The room was beautiful, very spacious with a huge bathroom. Bed was comfy, and slept soundly all 3 nights.Breakfast was continental style - various pastries and toast, with preserves, some cheese and meat. Juice and choice of tea/coffee. The b&b is a converted apartment, which offers real privacy. The hosts were fantastic. I had much email correspondence with Aldo before arriving, who was always helpful. At arrival and during the stay Marco was extremely friendly, with great suggestions of places to visit.Cannot recommend highly enough!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: what you see is what you get. we loved our room, which was full of light and very clean. the location is Amazing. we didn't have the breakfast at the b&b so can't comment on that, we prefered to find different places everyday. definitely would return. noise levels are ok, btw (was afraid before going).
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in November 2014. This is an unusual place in a number of respects. The room and bathroom are really nice and while it is in the historic center it is in a rough looking apartment building and at quite a walking distance to subway stops and places of interest other than the colosseo. The young entreprenuer couple running the B&B are said by most to be exremely pleasant and supportive. Perhaps because we ran afoul of some of their rules ( e.g. left the external door to the apartment unlocked in error one night in over a week's stay, late to breakfast), our experience was not so friendly. My wife left her cell phone in a cab as we exited it in a part of Rome unfamiliar to us. She called the owner to get help to call the cell number and instruct the cab driver where to meet us. He told her to call the police and to forget the cell phone as Rome was not like the U.S. We called the cell phone number and luckily the cab driver answered. In very limited Italian I was able to tell him where to come to return the cell phone. This was not an easy transaction as he spoke no English and my Italian is terrible but with a lot of good will on the cab drivers part, we were successful and I tipped him well. In sum, the room was large, well decorated and comfortable with an excellent price. The location was not near anything of much interest to us and it was a long walk to the subway. Cabs were quite difficult to hail unless you walked a distance as well. This is basically a small apartment with no services available on site except for a two hour window for breakfast in the morning or if you call the owner. Otherwise you are largely on your own. If you are a great walker and don't make many errors or require assistance, this may well be a great value for you as it apparently is for most people..
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B is awesome! It is a 10 minute walk from the metro station at the Colosseum and is in a quiet area with great restaurants nearby. It is a very small entrance into what seems to be an apartment building, and once you are inside the B&B you are so thankful for the wonderful air conditioning. We were in contact with Aldo before arriving and then taken care of by Marco during our stay. They were both incredible hosts. Marco gave us some great suggestions for dinner, especially some good local spots that were not touristy at all! In terms of the room, the bed was really comfortable, the AC worked great (it was July and it was HOT), it was very clean, and it had great decor. The breakfast each morning is brought over to you and you can have breakfast in bed, which my wife was obsessed with. It comes with a fun assortment of pastries, juices, fruit, and coffee. It was delicious!Overall, we loved our stay at this B&B. We loved the cozy room, the quiet location, and the yummy breakfast. We hope to be back soon!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B&B was perfect - it exceeded our expectations in every way. The room was spacious, exceptionally clean and extraordinarily comfortable - especially after a long day in the Roman heat! The location was great too. A wonderful breakfast was served each morning - wheeled right into your room at your convenience. Marco did an incredible job showing us places of interest and recommending restaurants that were traditional and reasonably priced. Each of his recommendations was 100% correct! Rome was our last stop on an 11 day Italian trip and we truly had some of the best food of the trip while in Rome. I would recommend this B&B without any hesitation whatsoever and my wife and I will definitely stay there again if we are lucky enough to return to Rome!.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rome was our final destination in our 3 week tour of Europe (London, Paris, Milan, Lake Como, Cinque Terre, Florence, Rome). We were tired of packing/unpacking, public transportation, small rooms and after almost 3 weeks we were ready to head back to Southern California . . . but we had one more stop (wife asked if we could skip Rome and go home) to make Rome. We were pleasantly surprised at how huge our room was!! The high ceilings added to the grandness of the unit (Room 1, the Colosseum view). Highlights: service was over-the-top. Aldo stayed in touch with us through email. Marco met us out front, provided neighborhood information and brought breakfast into our room. Aldo's father even pitched in on our final morning by preparing breakfast for us. Our flight out of Rome was not until later in the evening and we had asked if they can keep our luggage until our departure. They initially agreed and then, surprise . . . they did even better and allowed us to checkout later in the day so we could even shower before we took the shuttle (Terravision out of Termini to FCO). La Finestra is about a 10 minute walk to the Metro stops or 3 minute walk to the bus stop (recommend the buses since you can access all of Rome easily). Extremely helpful, spacious accommodation (Room 1), close to public transportation, and did I mention all of this at a very competitive rate. I am looking forward to staying at La Fienstra again, next time I'm in Rome. Thank you Aldo and family, for a wonderful end to our memorable European vacation.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed in Rome on many occasions and this b&b was by far the best value for money place that I have been to. I have stayed in hotels and apartments in ever district of the city and this has been the best. Only 5 minutes walk from the Coloseum, the apartment was very quiet very clean and tidy and tastefully decorated (and the air con was excellent). Breakfast was served on a tray in your room and was very good quality. There was an abundance of restaurants within easy walking distance and if you wanted to go further afield the taxi rank at the Coloseum was available and 10 euros took you just about anywhere in the city. I highly recommend this place, check it out.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This bnb is a lovely unique tranquil haven only 5 minutes from the metro and the colleseum. The rooms are spacious, and light and although on a main road no disturbance from the outside traffic. The breakfast is so cute, wheeled to your room less than a five mins from telling aldo your ready and The coffee was great just what you need to set you up for a day of walking around the sites. lots of nice places to eat within 5minutes from the bnb, but if your not sure aldo has many recommendations. 2 out of the 3days we stayed it poured it down which was such a shame especially as there is so much walking involved. (don't ever worry about packing an umbrella the minute it rains on every road is a man selling one for cheap or selfie sticks! ) one tip if you are visiting the sites especially the Vatican the ques are ridiculously long, like over 3hours and in the rain wouldn't be much fun so pay a bit extra to skip the que otherwise you will waste most of your visit waiting to get in. We had the Vatican/omna card which was good to skip the lines but I didnt realise the nearest office to the bnb was closed at the weekends so we had to go to the St Peters square office and there was a que to collect the card so make sure you go early. There is so much to see and you certainly will need a second visit. For me the St Peters is just incredible but also go see the a amazing ceilings in St John lateran the cathedral church of rome not far from the bnb. It is the oldest church in the west. rome is so fantastic and your trip wouldn't be complete unless you stay at la finestra or unless you get proposed to under the arch of Constantine during your evening stroll!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A superb b&b just a few hundred yards from the Colosseum.Run by Gioia & Aldo, a very pleasant and helpful couple. We had complimentary fruit, water and wine on our arrival. Breakfast was served in our room on a trolley each morning. The rooms are spacious and a huge bathroom and great shower,tv,a/c and a lovely bedI would recommend staying here.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Rome with my family early this year and found this great B&B near the colosseum. Our expectations on this location were surpassed and that in a very positive way. The quality of the rooms (cleaning services, modern furniture, high-quality materials etc) and the warm-hearted hosting made this a very great experience which we would repeat at any moment.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small B&B is a wonderful place to stay in Rome: Near to many attractions, restaurants, wine bars etc. And, the real gem is the owner/host Gioia. From the moment she greeted us upon arrival to our departure, she was friendly, gracious and a veritable font of useful information. We were provided with maps, recommendations and handy tips. The B&B is situated in an apartment building with a small elevator. We stayed in one of the two suites on the second floor. There are 3 more on the fourth floor. Our room (Room 4) was a decent size with a large bathroom. We had no view of the Colosseum as our room faced into the courtyard. We were not bothered by the noises from the apartment above where a family with children live. But, if you are sensitive to children's crying and running about, ask for another room. An ample breakfast is wheeled into the room on a trolley in the morning when you request it. As other reviewers have noted, there is no onsite staff from about lunchtime until 8-ish in the morning. However, the owners are accessible by phone at any time. This is, after all, a B&B not a hotel. We were delighted with our experience and would not hesitate to return here if our travels again bring us to Rome.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We already knew we wanted to stay here but it was only available on 2 of the 4 nights we were in Rome so we picked a nearby hotel on our first 2 nights and concluded our stay at this lovely B&B. So glad we did, our room at the Mercure a few steps away paled in comparison to our suite here!The building looks a bit old and outdated but didn't bother us. From the entrance, we were buzzed in. We took the lift from the left side of the hallway; it’s tiny but can fit two people and 2 medium-sized luggage. We were greeted by Gioia and were given a map and recommendations on where to go and restaurants to try. We had Room #1 (Colosseo view Suite) and it was gorgeous... the most spacious room we’ve had in our entire stay in Europe. The ceiling was in a concave shape with bricks tiled over it (how do they keep this so clean?), the bed was immaculate and the windows did a great job keeping out any noise from the street. We went in early October and the sun was still out like a maniac so the air conditioning was appreciated. The room doesn’t have a mini bar but it has a wine chiller. The bathroom is spacious with a heater. The only thing is whenever you turn on the faucet there’s a big mechanical sound that vibrates and resonates from the walls- probably a water pump. Didn’t bother us but was wondering if the noise reached our neighboring rooms (I’m sure if you email about it they’ll be able to clarify). The foyer has a couch and some magazines, books and travel pocket books in case you need it. WiFi was fantastic. Never saw or ran into another guest and we always had the elevator to ourselves, so we felt like we had our own private flat in Rome.On our first morning, we were so hungry (our body clocks still stuck in local time) so I knocked on the door and asked if we could have breakfast. I didn’t realize I had asked for it too early (I think breakfast was supposed to be served around 730 or 8AM and it was only 7AM), but Aldo’s dad was kind enough to serve it within 5mins of asking for it! Breakfast was ample- your choice of coffee, some fruit juice, a few slices of ham, a little bit of cheese, yogurt, fruits, two croissants, some toast and a sweet pastry. No phones in the rooms but you can just just knock on the pantry door to ask for your breakfast to be wheeled in. There’s a small restaurant right next to the main building door (forgot the name but they have a “P” sign) that we frequented- lovely people…loved their Pizza and Panini, we must have eaten there at least 4 times in our entire night stay in Rome. There’s plenty of convenience stores nearby so you can grab a bottled water to take with you to the room. Didn’t see any Tabaci stores nearby when we were there so we’d buy BIT tickets in the nearest subway station or the many tobacconists near the Coliseum (there are plenty in Via Cavour).Upon check-out, we asked for help in calling a taxi and were even given a small discount on the rooms (thanks, Aldo!) Our taxi arrived a few mins early in front of the building and we arrived at Roma Termini in about 10 minutes (it was a Sunday) and paid about EU15 (which was a good deal to us because we didn’t want to have to lug our stuff around all the way to Manzoni station- it’s easy to get there, but maybe not with medium luggage). Colosseo station seemed too busy for us so we always took Manzoni Station to get around. BTW the elevator can only be accessed if you’re coming into Manzoni, but if you arrive at the station, you will have to carry your luggage up two flights of stairs to get to the exit near Via Labicana- so better to pack lightly, or take a taxi if you want to save time and effort. This shouldn't discourage you from booking though, It's a great place with some of the nicest people managing it. I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After looking at what felt like a thousand hotels and b&b's in rome we finally came across this wonderful place. Aldo was very helpful in replying to our emails and getting us booked in and helping us with any queries regarding getting there. He gave us and full guide in getting there using public transport however we opted for a taxi as we had never been to Italy before and we're unfamiliar with the public transport. When we arrived at the place it did look a little run down from the outside however the rooms are absolutely perfect! We stayed in room 4. It has pristine white decor, an absolutely amazing bathroom and the comfiest bed I have ever slept in! There was no view or balcony but if you step out the door of the building you have the Colosseum right in front of you anyway!Breakfast every morning is wheeled to the door on a trolley and has everything you could want!If we ever return to rome we will be staying here without a doubt!Perfect place!
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked La Finestra Sul Colesseo after reading all the great reviews on here. On arrival we found the entrance a little worrying, the b&b is part of a rustic Italian apartment block. The entrance is quite dark and often smells quite unpleasant. On arriving at the b&b entrance however you would be shocked to think such a beautifully decorated space can be found in this block.Guido sat us down offered us drinks and thoroughly went through a map of Rome and the best places to eat and drink and of course sight see! This was fantastic and really helped us find our way around. The room was lovely, bright airy and a great (sideways) view of the Colesseum. The bed was so comfortable and lovely to come back to after a long day walking around Rome (you really can walk everywhere!) The location of the b&b is ideal and you are never far from anything.Sadly there were a couple of issues we found. The first being breakfast. From what we understood breakfast would be served to your room between 8-10am. What wasn’t made clear was that you had to go to the kitchen to ask for your breakfast 5 minutes before you wanted it delivered. This was rather annoying and on our first morning we waited 1.5 hours before eventually going to ask when we could expect breakfast (very annoying!) It’s also a shame that the kitchen area is not accessible during the day- it would be nice to have access to tea and coffee making facilities. Another small gripe we had was the lack of English TV channels. Granted you don’t go on holiday to watch television, however after a long day it’s always nice to go back to your room rest, shower and chill before heading out for dinner. During this time it would have been nice to watch some English news but the only channel which was in English was MTV. Overall we enjoyed our trip to rome and found this b&b comfortable and convenient. I believe a couple of modifications would make this b&b even more inviting in particular a re-vamp of the communal areas
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here with friends. I must say we were concerned by the appearance of the building & the strange smell when we first entered the premises but were happily relieved when Aldo escorted us up by elevator and showed us to our units. What makes this B&B exceptional are the beautifully appointed, clean, spacious, tastefully decorated rooms, and bathrooms, only a 15 minute walk from the train station, and of course a stone throw away from the coliseum, all this and a view, for a pretty fair price, considering this is Rome. The breakfasts are basic continental style, and vary little from one day to the next, served on a rolling tray to the bedroom as there's no dining area. Access to the kitchen amenities is not allowed, but there's a wine fridge in the bedroom (suite) and we were treated to a complimentary wine bottle to celebrate our arrival. Best place I slept in all of Italy, although I would have enjoyed a flat bed sheet in addition to the bed comforter. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights. The location is good, and although it faces a large street, it was surprisingly quiet at night. The room was comfortable and the bathroom modern. The only negative is that the plumbing in the building is a bit noisy.The room had a good Wifi connection and air conditioning.This B & B is just down the street from the Colosseum, and convenient to the subway system. Breakfast, served in our room, was good with fresh fruit, yoghurt, pastry, toast and freshly made cappuccinos.
hotelName:
22    La Finestra sul Colosseo B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Relais LeClarisse for four nights in June. We had just finished a week in Amalfi and one Tuscany. We wanted to relax and revisit some favorite spots and restaurants in Trastevere and Rome. The hotel is well located for walking trips to several attractions in Rome and those within Trastevere. Rooms are clean with housekeeping every day; and a very good breakfast selection. There is a courtyard area and an inside area for breakfast. There is a small stocked fridge in the room with items for purchase. One of the best amenities was a free smart phone for your use. Free local and international calls and Google maps. It was very handy for navigatiing the area. The lift to the second floor is small. Fits 2 or three people max. We had a room with a Lanai which was a nice place to relax between walking excursions. We would have used it more if it hadn’t been so hot. Everything is very clean and well maintained. Staff is very friendly and helpful. There is an ATM available on the opposite side of the block. The tram is a short walk if you need it. The hotel is a short cab ride from Termini station about 15 euros. We arrived early dropped our bags at the desk went to lunch and our room was ready with the luggage inside.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Former convent turned into botique hotel. Friendly polite staff and efficient check in. Not all rooms are accessed through reception. Ours was around the corner. Room was small but tidy and clean. Tea and coffee facilities available. Tram is just a few meters away andmany tourist attractions are close by including city center. Abundance of resturants within walking distance.Recommended for 1st timers in Rome
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only stayed for one night, but definitely recommend staying in Trastevere neighborhood and this hotel. Saved so much money by taking train from airport and tram that stops right outside the hotel. Tram also goes right into the heart of Rome. Very soft comfortable bed, and amazing water pressure in the shower. Convenient to all the cute cafes and restaurants in the area, enjoyed our stay and thought it was fun this was a converted convent!
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in mid April. We would return in a heartbeat and we have already recommended it to friends. The staff were extremely helpful and the facilities and room were spotless. The Breakfast was superb and there was a nice selection of food and drink. The cappuccinos from the machine were as good as any I had at coffee houses. Loved the guest room (Superior Double) with double doors opening into the courtyard. The room was smallish as all rooms tend to be in Italy but this one was very well appointed and equipped. An amazing advantage are the free smartphones available for your use. These have pre-loaded walking tours and audio guides for all major attractions in Rome. Location in Trastevere was amazing. This is a very charming area of Rome and the selection of cafe's and restaurants was spectacular. Wish I was still there.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cute, charming and different. The building used to house nones about 200 years ago, and is converted to a hotel. Doors, ceilings and windows are still the same, it takes you back in time. It is near all site seeing, 20 minute walk to colosseum and fountain. They offered a free cell phone with GPS in your room so you can go any where walking and come back to hotel without getting lost. Friendly service.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn’t be better for the price! Lovely room, comfortable bed, quiet despite being so close to the main road (quiet courtyard), kettle and hot drinks available (for the English tea drinker, especially good!), and a mobile with internet for use out and about in Rome & further afield. Breakfast had a bit of everything and very tasty. Staff more than helpful. I would stay here again on further visits, no hesitation.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have now stayed at this fabulous hotel four times this year. One of the times my daughter was traveling alone and I was confident that the front desk would always keep an eye on her. It is a charming hotel we love the Limone Room. The breakfast is wonderful and the chef is magnificant. We enjoyed sitting in the courtyard in the early evening before walking a quick stroll to Trastevere for dinner. Wonderful restaurants are very nearby. The warmth and charm of the Italian people are alive and well at Relais Le Clarisse!!
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Breakfast very taste and you can eat it in the garden, the staff was very kind, and help in every question we had, its located in very great place with transport and near the main area of the restaurant. the room is very beautiful and comfortable we enjoyed our stay very match.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second time in Rome and we decided this time to stay in a place south of the river. This place is a great location for a lot of good restaurants and is only a short walk or taxi ride to other attractions. The room was very comfortable, although very noisy since it faced the street. (Note to self: ask for a room away from the street next time.)All the employees were super friendly and nice. In particular, Romina prepared the breakfasts, including her home-made cakes. Breakfast is not to be missed because she does a great job.Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A charming hotel, which opens to a lovely courtyard, the staff are very helpful and professional. The location is in the middle of Trastevere which is full of interesting churches, shops, galleries, and great restaurants. There was a tram at our front door and a taxi rank. So easy to reach places and a really lovely place to stay. My mum and I really enjoyed our stay. We will be back.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just by a tram stop and within a shortish walk of the main sites this is a good choice. Our room was fine with a very large comfortable bed. We were on the ground floor overlooking a lovely courtyard where it would have been possible to have breakfast if it had been a little warmer. Very nice staff all speaking good English. Maybe the breakfast could be a little better. Fresh Coffee rather than a machine and a rather poor selection of warm dishes. Don't let that put you off as everything else is fine.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my husband stayed at your hotel for 5 nights at the end Feb - we were in Rome for the Irish V Italy Rugby match and happened to be there for my birthday also. We had a fabulous time in Rome and all thanks to the wonderful hotel. The location is great, Rooms and hotel really nice, all staff were lovely and really helpful but in particular Rominia in the breakfast room was fantastic we had lovely conversations and really enjoyed her food and excellent service. Every morning we enjoyed great coffee and what ever delights she had made and also the usual hams, cheeses, fruit etc. Lovely restaurants and bars in the surrounding are - all very walkable. Will definitely be back. Thanks for everything and in particular the little birthday cake which was part of my birthday surprise!
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed in Relais le Clarisse a Trastevere for 5 nights at the end of February 2019. We were in Rome to celebrate my 40th birthday and the hotel was perfect: the staff were friendly, attentive and kind - even leaving me a little birthday cake and bottle of prosecco on the day itself! The room was comfortable and charming, the hydro bathtub was a nice treat after a day walking around Rome and the mix of old and new throughout the hotel was thoughfully and tastefully done.Breakfast was the usual continental self-serve approach with cold meats and cheeses, bread rolls, yoghurts, fresh fruit, juices and excellent coffee (obviously!). All good quality and as much as you might like.The location was second to none: from a quiet side street it is a short stroll to all the night-life, restaurants and bars in Trastevere, and a pleasant meander along the Tiber will take you into the Jewish Quarter and Piazza del Venezia, the Colosseum and the Forum and the Pantheon.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights. We chose this hotel as it looked charming and we wanted to stay in Trastevere. Unfortunately, we ended up feeling disappointed and let down.Firstly, the positive points. The staff were, for the most part, friendly and helpful. The rooms were charmingly old fashioned and clean. The breakfast was fine, but not outstanding, and the hotel location was perfect.Now, the negative points. The WiFi signal wasn’t great. Sometimes it was fine, other times there was no connection. There were no channels on the tv.The pillows were quite hard, as was the mattress. The bathroom was fine, but a bit on the small side. There is only 1 lift in the hotel, and it’s tiny and extremely slow. There were two corridors on the upper floor of the hotel. You have to walk through the first corridor in order to get to the second corridor, which is where the rooms are situated. The lights in the first corridor were never turned on in the evening, which meant that we had to walk in complete darkness until we reached the second corridor, which had motion activated lights.Lastly, we were extremely unhappy with the way that the lady who was managing the breakfast treated us on the day that we were checking out. Breakfast begins at 7:30 am. We checked out at 7:15. We asked if it would be possible to have a quick breakfast. The lady at the front desk told us to go down to the breakfast area to see whether it was ready. She also said that we would at least be able to have a coffee, as it’s from a machine. My wife went down while I was busy checking out. She was told that we could not have breakfast or coffee, and that we would have to wait, even though the food had already been put out and was ready. Unfortunately, we couldn’t wait as we had to take a taxi to the airport. If we were checking out an hour before breakfast, of course we would understand. But 15 minutes before breakfast, and with the food already prepared, we didn’t see a reason to refuse us. They need to understand that sometimes people have to leave a bit early to catch a flight. This is not how paying guests should be treated and it left a bad taste in our mouths. After that experience, I can’t recommend this hotel to anybody.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location - right in the heart of Trastevere which is our favourite Roman neighbourhood but also close enough to walk to the City centre and train station. Really friendly and helpful staff gave us great advice on where to eat, how to get around on local transport etc. Clean and cosy hotel room. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very charming hotel with wonderful staff at the front desk to a very gracious hostess for breakfast. Located near shopping, restaurants in Trastevere. Walking distance to major sites. Located near tram stop. Rooms very clean and comfortable. Food and coffee was delicious. They also arranged airport transportation to /from. Before arriving they responded to emails quickly. They knew we where coming to go the the American University they had map ready for us at check in as a courtesy.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommend staying here. Room was great, had everything we needed, comfortable bed, tea/coffee, mini bar/fridge, lovely hot shower blah blah. If there was anything I would add it would be a mirror as the only mirror we had was in the bathroom. No big deal, but it would have helped as I forgot my makeup mirror (shock, horror)ALL staff were just brilliant and very very helpful. We absolutely loved the breakfast set up and had plenty to eat every morning. If I ever visit Rome again, I would not hesitate to stay here again. 10/10 for everything, including location
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cute property with a very friendly and accommodating staff. Stayed 4 nights before touring more of the country....very comfortable and the breakfast is well done. Short walk to the Tiber and not too bad to the forum but in bad weather, def would recommend a cab. All in all, awesome property, great people and wonderful location.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This small hotel on a side street in Trastevere was charming. The reception staff were all helpful, pleasant, and considerate. The courtyard is lovely (see photo). Our room was comfortable and reasonably spacious. The bathroom had a large shower. The breakfast, served in a room accessible by stairs from the courtyard, was consistently delicious. The location is convenient for anyone prepared to walk a km or so to tourist destinations on the other side of the Tiber — or take a bus or tram (no nearby metro stop). There is also a taxi stand only a block away. Highly recommended as a comfortable and surprisingly secluded place to stay in Trastevere.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our second stay at this establishment. A very private place in the middle of Rome’s most crazy neighborhood. We had a double that overlooked the courtyard. The staff was very helpful, and the breakfast very nice. We will be back our next time in Rome.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this lovely little hotel without realising what a great area it was for eating out - lots of different bars and restaurants in the square. There was a problem with a burst pipe in our room on the day of our arrival. We were contacted by email to let us know of the issue and offered an upgrade in their sister hotel for one night, which we accepted. The following day the hotel arranged a taxi to collect us and take us to our booked hotel, and couldn't have been more helpful. On returning to the hotel after a day out we found a bottle of fizz and some cakes with a thank you note, thanking us for our understanding. A very quaint rustic hotel with comfy beds and a lovely view over the garden. Very friendly lady who assisted in the breakfast room.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed with 2 children aged 9 and 10 in a Family suite room overlooking the courtyard.We were fortunate to get a free early checkin (around 10.30am) and were very happy with our room. The room was huge, very clean and featured a sofa bed (double) , a trundle bed, and a king size bed. There was a jetted spa within the shower area which the kids were very happy with and plenty of space to unwind. Our daughter enjoyed playing in the courtyard area which was like an extension of our room. There are a couple of steps up to the room but the kind gentleman who checked us in helped with carrying it up.we checked out early around 7am so missed breakfast which is served from 7.30am. The hotel kindly offered to make us takeout breakfast but we just popped around to the pastesserie one minute walk away to get a coffee.The hotel is well positioned to explore Trastevere and there are large numbers of restaurants/ Cafe in the area to enjoy. The Wifi is excellent and we experienced no lagging. There is a supermarket one minute walk away which does pre-prepared food like chicken, potatoes, salads etc. There is also anOVS store which is my daughters favourite clothing brand in ItalyI would recommend the area to stay, having visited Rome three times we found it a nice, chilled area.the staff at the hotel were very friendly and accommodating, they speak excellent English. The only issue we had was with the driver that transported us from the hotel to the airport. He was constantly texting / talking/ holding his phone. The hotel had organised the transfer for us and whilst not in their direct control it is something to be wary of. It maybe considered usual for Italians to do this but to our family it was a safety concern. I have not marked their overall score down because of this
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only had 1 night here. Had the Family suite which opened up onto communal courtyard. The room was massive , had bed for adults , double sofa bed and a single bed and lots of room. Bathroom was also massive with a great spa bathReception were very friendly. We didn’t try breakfast as we had early morning flight but they did offer a take away breakfast. After several weeks in Italy in hotels, apartments, the courtyard was nice to come back to after a few hours sightseeing Lots of restaurants around , supermarket nearby. Very lively streets in the evening but hotel is quiet.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very clean hotel and the staff were loverly ,it is in a good location near all the restaurants and near the tram stops if wanting to go into the center of Rome ,you can even walk into Rome central Breakfast was usual continental and some hot food it was ok The room was basic and unfortunately we ended up leaving clothes in our case as not enough storage spaces There is no bar but mini bar in room with very little in it but you can buy wine or beer at supermarket and the hotel has a loverly area outside where you can sit Other rooms may be different we were on the ground floor
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a beautiful quaint hotel set in the heart of Trastevere within walking distance to restaurants and bars and a short taxi ride or 30 minute walk to the centre of Rome. Garden suites surround a sunny canopied court yard with lime trees. Our room had a whirl pool bath that is accessed by a few steps from the main bedroom. There is a mini bar in the room with usual beers, crisps and prosecco at same cost of local shops. The service here is exceptional and breakfast is served until ten. Would definitely return here.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a 3 night break in Rome where we stayed at the Relais Le Clarisse and I would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel.As others have said, it's an oasis of calm and it was lovely to return here after a busy day in the city. We chose a superior room with a view of the courtyard. Our bed was very comfortable and we were delighted at how quiet our room was. If we hadn't seen other guests at breakfast we would have believed that we were the only people staying there. The bathroom was clean and the shower was excellent, plenty of hot water and good water pressure.The reception staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. We arrived an hour before check in so they stored our bags while we went for some lunch.The breakfast buffet was great with lots of choice - coffee, juice, yoghurt, fruit, bread, pastries, cakes, cheese and cold meats. There was some hot food, although not a great deal, but this didn't bother us. All we wanted was something quick and tasty, and this was exactly what we got. And eating breakfast sat outside our room in the courtyard was a bonus.The real selling point though was the location which was perfect for us. The only time we used public transport was to transfer between the airport and the hotel (FR1 train then number 8 tram which stops almost outside the hotel). We walked everywhere else including the Colleseum, Forum, Vatican, Spanish Steps, Pantheon and Trevi Fountain. What we particularly liked about the location was that in the evening we were right in the heart of Trastevere which is full of bars and restaurants. The atmosphere was amazing, there were locals and tourists of all ages so there was a real buzz and we spent all 3 evenings in Trastevere. Also, even though it was very busy in the small squares, it felt completely safe.The only point to be aware of is that access to the rooms above ground level is via a small (but modern) lift not via stairs so if you don't like lifts then I would recommend requesting one of the ground floor rooms.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were really surprised by this hotel. Compared to the bustle of Rome, it was an oasis of calm, with a lovely inner courtyard where you could eat your breakfast (in the summer) or just hang out at the end of the day.We were a family of three, and the room with extra bed just off the courtyard was perfect. I was worried it might be noisy but we didn't hear a thing, Everything was very clean, the bathroom was quite luxurious, and the beds comfortable. The reception staff was very welcoming and helped us with taxis and recommendations for places to eat nearby. Each day, after touring through Rome, it was so nice to come back to this quiet hotel. We will be back!
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stumbled across this property by accident when searching online for B&B accomodation for our short break to Rome.It is a little gem of a place situated on a quiet side street off one of the main routes into Rome centre.About 10 minutes walk gets you to the Ponte Garibaldi and a further 10 minutes sees you at the Pantheon. If your feeling lazy catch a tram 50 metres from the front door.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I have been to Rome many times and decided this May for our three nights we would try a different area and hotel in Rome. I was so looking forward to our stay based on the reviews I had read. We were very disappointed. The first room the desk clerk took us to was already occupied by someone else. The second room was tiny (hardly any room for our luggage) and smelled very musty. When I discovered water all over the bathroom floor, I insisted they move us. After charging us more, they moved us into a larger room. The linens looked very old, and we still had the same musty smell. I didn't feel that the room was very clean. The breakfast room is very odd as you enter from the courtyard (which was also a disappointment) down a steep set of stairs to a basement like room. Choices for breakfast were also disappointing. I have to say that I have never written a negative review before, however I couldn't not say how we felt. Needless to say, we would not recommend and will not be staying there again.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We extended our Oxford Trip to see Rome. Booked the hotel and three people (wife, daughter, and myself). Driver from the airport brought us right to the hotel. It was very deceptive as like "where was the hotel?" Anyhow, we arrived three hours before check-in. Front desk was very friendly and offered to keep our bags while we explored.We explored the area and had a nice late lunch. Plenty to do and see all around the hotel. We returned to the checkin and our bags were GONE! But not really, they were already delivered to our room and were awaiting us! Room was really nice and roomy and had no problems serving the three of us. Before was great size and we loved the shower!I had already pre-paid for breakfast for all of the days but the breakfast wasn't opened before two of our tour days. But they had these really nice Go-Bags for Breakfast which were perfect to start our day! Each time we returned from our day, the room was nicely made up and clean.On our last day we were actually able to stay for our breakfast. It was a really good breakfast with great choices. Could have either eaten in the breakfast room or the garden.Bottom line, service was excellent and very friendly. Rooms were very clean. And I found it extremely quite. I'm a light sleeper and only once did I hear a noise of someone in the hallway.If I ever go back to Rome, I would gladly stay here again!
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Never stay at this place. Staff are rude and arrogant. They have moved my room 4 times in 4 nights. On the last night they didn't even ask me while I was out in the town they moved my luggage and toiletries. Horrible horrible experience. Please never ever stay at this disgusting place. I would pick any other place than this one.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice rooms, great breakfast and pleasant staff. The A/C works perfectly! The room was spotlessly clean. The bathroom was a bit awkward: enormous shower, but no "leg room" for the toilet.If you have activities in the Trastevere area of Rome, the location is optimal.Sadly, there is so much graffiti in this area these days; making the neighborhood feel run-down. However, this hotel is an oasis, with a lovely garden courtyard in the middle.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in a triple room for one night (luckily). Liked it at first because the room was nice, appeared clean and was quiet. When I went to bed, found feces on the sheets of my bed from a previous guest and got it on my PJs. Called front desk and they never apologized. The staff person brought one sheet and asked ME to remove the soiled ones. I asked for a top sheet and they had to go get another one. Why would you only bring a bottom sheet! When we went to check out the next morning, the front desk staff made no mention of the issue so I brought it to their attention. No apologizes again and only gave us a 10% discount on the room! Then they had the nerve to act annoyed with my compliant! Hair dryer didn’t work and coffee at breakfast was mediocre. This is one of the worst hotel experiences we ever had!
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, comfortable (small rooms by US standards, just be advised) and adorable. Our inside (courtyard facing) room was quiet. (Except for one night when the couple next to us had a long, loud and quite ugly fight in English, but that's not the hotel's fault). Extremely nice and helpful staff who all speak English (and probably many other languages). Good shower. Location could not be better for getting around -- ta few steps from buses and trams. Trastevere is a lovely historic district with tons of restaurants and a great street scene, cute shops and amenities like laundry, shoe repair, markets. Not far from large flea market and your choice of bridges over to the "right bank" of Rome. walking distance to old ghetto area among others. Be aware that to get up to the second floor where guest rooms are, there are no stairs, only a tiny lift (elevator) that holds two non-obese people or one person and their luggage. You may occasionally have to wait for the lift but it wasn't generally a problem.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two nights in a standard room at Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere. We stayed in the Mimosa room which is situated towards the rear of the premises. Note that for this room and a few others you have to go down the street about 50 meters.The Mimosa Room has as comfortable double bed a safe, cupboard with fridge in it more than adequate hanging space, a small table, coffee tea etc.The bathroom was a reasonable size with larger shower, sink, toilet, bidet and stool. There are all the usual toiletries.Breakfast was served in a beautiful court behind the main reception area. You can just also eat inside if you wish. The breakfast fare was extensive and delicious.Well located in Trastevere this is a really nice hotel/ B&b place. It's close to the Vatican, the Forum and the city centre. I'd definitely recommend this hotel and will stay there again.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: when I was planning my trip to rome, I made a reservation for a b&b that had good reviews online and was in the location that I wanted. I'd never been to rome, and wasn't sure what the situation would be like, so after making the reservation, I emailed the hotel to say that I was getting in late, to which they replied that would be no problem and to call them when I arrived.I got to rome in the early evening. I hadn't slept for about 30 hours. after a long taxi ride in which the driver took a very circuitous route to my hotel, he dropped me off at around 9:30pm in front of a huge gray building on a back street, and I couldn't find the name of the hotel anywhere. it was dark, cold, and raining, I had all my luggage but not an umbrella, and my phone battery was in the single digits. some residents of the building came along and pointed to one of about 30 buttons on the wall to indicate that the b&b was located in the building. I buzzed the buzzer, but there was no answer. the residents let me in and I took the elevator to the floor where the hotel was supposed to be. there was no one around and no one answered the door. I called and emailed, but again, no answer, and nowhere to charge my phone.exhausted and not wanting to wander around in the dark rainy night in a city I didn't know at all, I considered laying down in the hallway to try to get some rest. but I decided to keep going, and walked back outside until I found a fitness center that was open. the person behind the desk tried to call another hotel for me, but they didn't answer, so she let me sit in the lobby and charge my phone. I got out my lonely planet guide and decided to try a few other hotels in the neighborhood. after no answer to a few others, someone answered at Relais Le Clarisse a Trastevere Roma. she spoke English (!) and told me that they had a room, and that she would be at the desk for a few more hours, gave me the number for a taxi company, and told me to call back if I had any problems with the taxi company.the taxi company did not answer, so I walked the mile to the hotel in the rain. when I arrived, the person with whom I had spoken was waiting and had prepared the room for me. the room turned out to perfect, with a huge comfortable bed, beautiful furnishings, and a private separate entrance. the hotel has a lovely garden patio, excellent location, and is not terribly expensive. I was so overjoyed that I decided to go out at midnight for pizza and wine, so she pointed me in the direction of a lively nearby piazza.heartfelt thanks to Relais Le Clarisse a Trastevere Roma for this amazing welcome to an incredible city.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cant give 5 stars, because the parking situation is terrible, and that’s important to us in a room selection. If you are not driving, and in need of a convenient parking space, this is a great hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is in the middle of Trastevere, so you can walk to a lot of good places to eat and shop. You can also walk from the hotel to the Coleseum, although its a pretty good walk. The room itself is large and comfortable, which is hard to find in Europe. Our room was a suite which had a den with a table, couch TV and refrigerator that is separate from the bedroom. Also had a kitchen if you want it for an extra fee. We declined the kitchen as a big part of visiting Europe for us is to experience the great food and fun restaurants, which there are many near the hotel.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed my 2 night stay here very much. Room and bed very comfortable, very quiet, everything worked, very good shower, kettle in room, good breakfast, staff extremely pleasant and helpful. My room was off the courtyard which was great (although ashtrays on the tables suggest it may not be so quiet and pleasant at warmer times of year). Once we worked out the buses and trams we found this hotel very well located for getting around, but close enough to most major sites to walk to, and found some good restaurants and bars nearby. Would happily return!
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed our stay! The staff went above and beyond to make our stay comfortable.The hotel is located right on a Main Street which makes it easy to walk to most of the popular locations in Rome or take a quick tram ride which stops very close by. Being so close to the street caused a lot of street noise if you need to keep the windows open.Walls are pretty thin so you can hear what’s going on in the hall. Luckily our room had no adjacent rooms. Breakfast was simple but a few delicious dishes were made in-house by the staff. What we appreciated most as Americans is that they did serve eggs! The staff even let us go in early one morning when we had to be up before breakfast started. The hotel offers a car service to the airport, but we found that Uber would actually be cheaper and more convenient. The driver we were given was also not the best, and was really upset that our flight was delayed 2 hours which was out of our control. This has nothing to do with the actual hotel as I’m sure this is a separate organization. Overall we found that the staff was there for whatever we needed. The location was safe and convenient. Would definitely stay here again on a return to Rome.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have mixed feelings about this hotel. Basically, our stay was fine and the staff could not be better, but I could not get a good night's sleep here and I will probably stay somewhere else the next time I am in Trastevere. I think that when I booked the hotel I did not pay enough attention to the star rating of the hotel (my fault) so my expectations were a little too high.The location is excellent and the front desk staff could not have been better. The housekeeper and the staff in the breakfast room were great, too.Our room was off the garden -- if you are a light sleeper, ask for a room in a different location. I was repeatedly awoken by other guests talking and laughing as they walked across the garden to the lobby, suitcases being dragged across the garden and in the hall and rooms above us, and I could hear it every time the elevator went up or down. I could hear the guests above us coughing and talking. We ended up running the HVAC fan just for the white noise. One night I was awoken by a couple sitting talking and smoking at the table right outside our door. I think this would be even worse in warmer weather.This is not a 4 or 5 star hotel, so make sure you know what to expect. Toiletries are minimal and there are no slippers, no Kleenex, no washcloths. The water temperature in the shower fluctuated between too hot and too cold. If you have mobility issues, ask if there are steps inside your room -- we had 3 big steps between the bedroom and the bathroom and a small step within the bathroom between the shower and the bathtub. The bed was OK -- the mattress was nice and firm but it sloped towards the middle. The pillows were of the shredded foam variety. Our room had an old-fashioned lock with a real key that was very big to carry around. The lighting in the room was awful. There was only one place in the room where it was bright enough to comfortably sit and read. On the other side of the room, I had to use the flashlight on my phone to operate the safe. There was no light and no outlet by the desk, so it wasn't of much use.The breakfast buffet was probably a little below average for Rome (decent cold selection but no hot choices). However, it's served in a very small room with the tables very close together. This wasn't a problem in January, but in summer when the hotel is probably full I think it would be quite uncomfortable because you wouldn't be able to walk between the tables without asking someone else to get up and move their chair. Also, if you have any mobility or balance issues or are of a certain age, getting to the breakfast room could be dangerous for you. You have to go down a step or two, open a door, and then continue down a set of narrow stone steps. All in all, I thought it was expensive for what you get. The location and the great staff would normally make me consider staying here again the next time I am in Trastevere, but I need a quieter place to sleep, so probably not.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in January and had a wonderful time! We were celebrating an anniversary and they left a little cake and small bottle of prosecco for us to celebrate. The location is wonderful and the rooms are clean and nice. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights in this lovely hotel and loved the friendliness of the staff, the room was quiet and the position is great for Trastevere and all the sites of Rome are walkable including the Vatican which took us 30 minutes. The breakfast choice was very good with homemade treats every morning. Free welcome beer was much appreciated.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights around Christmas 2017. The room was very spacious and clean.Location was fantastic and the hotel was very quiet. Great breakfast, but the staff made this hotel very special for us. Thank you, Gloria for a memorable stay.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
