review_body: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. We had a family suite which was very spacious with room to sleep 5. Very clean, good breakfast. Lovely courtyard inside the hotel. Location was very central to the major attractions with just a short taxi ride or 20-30 min walk. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Great neighborhood to easily walk to many different restaurants. Our only complaint was getting up early, the first person taking a shower usually had a cool shower until the water warmed up.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My two adult sons and I stayed here for 3 nights in November 2017. Whilst it’s not in the central part of Rome, it is a short 10 minute stroll to reach Centro Storico from the Trastevere neighbourhood. It’s also very close to the main tram line, so public transport access is not an issue. We had a triple room with a separate entrance from the reception. It was really only a standard room with an extra bed. Facilities were fine but not lavish. Very clean. The bonus was excellent staff who were very helpful (even rustling up 3 breakfast bags at the last minute before an early start at the Vatican for us). The dining facilities were terrific for breakfasts, which was the only meal we ate there, served in the old underground dining area where the then-resident nuns ate. Being very close to a main road into Rome central, I thought it would be very noisy. Not so, thanks to double glazed windows!Trastevere is a very cool place to stay in Rome. It has dozens of excellent restaurants all within a small 4 block radius of this hotel; plenty of historical interest around Basilica de Santa Maria; street art and laid back cafes; and wonderful boutique shops for that unique purchase you won’t get on the other side of the Tiber.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Relais Le Clarisse for 2 nights in one of their budget rooms in an adjacent building and loved it. The staff, without exception, was kind and helpful, breakfast terrific. It's especially convenient getting there from Fiumicino Airport on the local train to Trastevere Station, then the #8 tram which stops right across the street, avoiding Termini completely, a good thing. I very much hope to return.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small boutique hotel with modern amenities. Our room was closer to the street and street noise was a bit annoying when I was trying to sleep. Tiny breakfast area. My friend loved it and I was OK with it. Very convenient though to all the attractions with a tram stop just opposite to the hotel
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Like the hotel room in a good location .. tram line on your doorstep .. restaurants very close by .. only downside don’t take the rooms with a window on the main road as a lot of noise if you’re a light sleeper .. and the staff are very friendly and helpful which I found rare in Rome
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Relais Le Clarisse, a beautifully repurposed old monastery in the heart of the Trastevere in Roma. The room was spacious with high vaulted ceilings, right off the street, but very quiet at night. The bathroom was clean and modern - the whole place a perfect balance of new and old. It was in the heart of Trastevere, our favorite neighborhood in Rome, and a stones throw from hundreds of restaurants, piazzas, and bars. It also positioned us well for our one day blitz through Rome which started at the Coliseum, a 20 minute walk from the hotel, and ended at the Vatican. We would love to come back!
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel right on the other side of the river. Only a few minutes walk from so many cafe's / restaurants / bars I couldn't even count. If you're looking to hit up the ancient ruins, this hotel is a little far, but still walkable. Room had a very unique feel to it as it is a converted monastery / convent but all the modern fixtures make it a very comfortable place to stay. Service was fantastic and always with a smile. Would definitely stay here again. Only caveat: the breakfast is not included and not really worth it, go find a cafe and enjoy yourself.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: PROS: Location is great. The tram is nearby, and hotel is walking distance to most major attractions. Room was clean, bed was comfortable. Soap/shampoo provided were nice quality. Buffet breakfast was good. WiFi worked fine in the room. The receptionist during our stay was courteous and helpful when we needed something. CONS: It was loud (I'm only speaking for the block of rooms that are accessed via a separate entrance around the corner) - not good for light sleepers. Walls are thin; the room doors needed to be practically slammed to close properly. (IMHO, all of that might be somewhat improved by adding carpeting in the hallway to absorbe noise.) Also, there was loud clanking (maybe from old pipes?) in the middle of the night (which we mentioned to reception). Not very restful, unfortunately. We also felt the room was overpriced for what it was - basic and bland. (We booked through Tripadvisor - not sure if booking directly with hotel would have given a better deal.) Perhaps the rooms near reception would have felt like better value (they looked bigger / more nicely furnished, at least on the website). But I'm not sure I'd stay here again unless I got a better deal (and carried good earplugs).
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed our stay at LeClarisse. Hotel is peaceful with lots of character. Location is away from tourist area in a quiet part of the city. Staff was kind and very accommodating. Breakfast buffet was very good and breakfast bags are available if you are not in hotel during service hours.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose to stay in Trastevere due to the lovely old area with plenty of restaurants but far enough away from the main tourist areas. The hotel is in walking distance of all major attractions if you don't mind up to 8 miles per day. Room is good ( we were in separate part on main road) you just need to have the window closed and air-con on. Nice big shower room and lovely little courtyard where we ate breakfast. Would recommend as place with character and reasonable value for Rome. Booked with Expedia and got best price as already had flight booked with them.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights. Great location and very pleasant staff. Breakfast is good and the area is excellent with many super restaurants closeby. I would definitely recommend this Hotel for great value and good service.
hotelName:
23    Relais Le Clarisse in Trastevere
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights in this B&B - the room was very clean and nicely decorated. it was quiet and the mattress was very comfy.The location is really good, very close to the Metro, tram - but we most of the time walked. Gianni and his employee (sorry I cannot remember his name!) were of great advice: they take time to give you some good addresses, to answer your questions, etc.To put it in a nutshell, we felt at home, and if we come back to Rome we will go back to this lovely place!
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I booked into Romantic dreams after our first day in Rome, having been very disappointed with our first hotel. We were given a wonderfully warm welcome by Gianna who sat with us and furnished us with what turned out to be great information about where to eat and how to get around. He was a fantastic host, making himself available by text and phone when any help was needed. The room was spotless, private, modern with a big comfortable bed. The bathroom was en suite with a large shower and modern fittings, again spotless. We were a two minute walk from the metro station yet there was no traffic noise in the room. We have recommended RomAntic Dreams to all of our family and well will definitely be back there on our next trip to Rome.
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For our 4 nights stay in Rome we were staying at Romantic Dreams. Even before arrival the owner Gianni helped us a lot through WhatsApp, when he sent us informations about Rome and how to get to his B&B. The way is really easy, the place is reachable by all of kind of transportations - metro, bus, tram and stops are very close. Location is perfect, near you have everything - markets, restaurants, shops. Even we arrived late in the evening, late check in wasn’t problem, Gianni came for us to give us keys and explained everything to us. The room is spacious, very nice equipped, everything was very clean! Also very good is big TV with Netflix and balcony with street view. Bathroom is in front of the room but it’s only for you, nobody else can share! Also very clean with fresh towels. In the mornings there is so lovely kitchen, breakfast is good enough to get full! Fresh croissants, bread, cappuccino, tea, jams, honey, nutella, cheese, ham, juice, fruits, sweets...also we got an offer for egg omellette. My husband had birthday on the day of staying, we got so lovely surprise to our room-champagne! Everything was really very nice, Gianni is very kind and helpful, he cares about his customers, always reachable on WhatsApp, even at night. :) Last day our flight was late in the evening and letting luggages there wasn’t absolutely problem! We got keys from the appartement and in the evening just took our luggages. We felt like at home and we were sad to leave. Absolutely recommend this B&B.
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great stay. We were greeted by Giovanni and a nice cup of cappuccino. We were given lots of good tips and felt like Giovanni would have done anything to make sure our stay in Rome was perfect. Loved the place - the Vintage room is beautiful. The B&B is convenient, but quiet - didn't know this was possible in Rome. I would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice Location to visit Rom and search for a „Homepage“. The Owner is a very friendly person. Love him!nice StyleNice Ambiente Nice location Echt ein sehr schönes bed and breakfest und netter Gastgeber. Nur zu empfehlen!Super Lage Super Einrichtung
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Négy éjszakát töltöttünk el a RomAntic Dreamsben. Tiszta kényelmes szoba, kedves udvarias házigazda! Tipikus olasz reggeli frissen minden reggel. Nyugodt csendes környék jó tömegközlekedéssel.Többször szálltunk meg itt és még fogunk is. We were 4 nights in RomAntic Dream. This appartment is weey clean the room is the best. The owner Gianni is the best in Rome! Every day typical fresh italian breakfast with croissant yoghurt coffer.Quiet area with good public transport. The Colosseum is 15 minutes on foot! We were here 3rd time but the last! Thanks everything Gianni!
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Romantic dreams really is beautiful accommodation but Gianni and his staff are what make this place so wonderful. Gianni goes out of his way to ensure his guests have the most enjoyable time in Rome. We listened to all of his reccommentations and experianced the most amazing food, wine and gelato! Our room was spacious, comfortable and clean. Getting to the accomodation was easy from the airport with the help of Giannis instructions. The city is very accessible from the accomodation by public transport or on foot. We walked everywhere in the day and used the metro and busses in the evening. Thank you for making our stay so lovely and for the reccomendations for our next Italian trip! :)
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautifully decorated room, excellent service from check in to check out, and very convenient location close to public transportation that gets you all over. Gianni was very thoughtful and got soy milk for us, every morning we could enjoy delicious cappuccinos at breakfast. There is also a vegan cafe 4 minutes walk from the b&b, which was a bonus for us to grab some light food on the night we arrived. Thanks for a lovely stay.
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: В перше в житті в Римі. Він прекрасний і незабутній дякуючи людям що живуть в ньому. Джанні, ти просто супер іміджмейкер свого рідного міста. Така щира увага до своїх гостей. Відчуття, що гостюєш у старого друга! Умови просто на відмінно, затишок та романтика. Чудові сніданки! Ідеальне місце розташування, щоб прогулятися нічним Римом після смачних посиділок в Трастевере ;)Обов'язково повернемось!The first in life in Rome. It is beautiful and unforgettable thanks to the people who live here. Gianni, you're just a super image maker of your hometown. Such sincere attention to your guests. Feeling that you are staying with an old friend! The conditions are simply excellent, cosiness and romance. Great breakfasts! An ideal location for a walk around nigft Rome after delicious meetings in the Trastevere ;)We'll be back, for sure!
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best location I have been ever.Gianni gave me a lot of information and best restaurants in the Rome. and the rooms are different Styles and clean. And the Metro station is near the BnB then we can get the metro for going every most important place in the Rome. Thank you very much for all. I gave you a five-star review for romantic dreams bed and breakfast. see you soon
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hospitality. They were very helpful as far as the sightseeing in Rome,providing also a map of the city. Really close to metro station, only 5 minutes! The rooms were very clean and exactly as they look in the photos. As for the breakfast, excellent! I will definitely prefer it for my next visit! Nice job guys!
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were there for a week and it was such a great experience. You have San Giovanni’s Metro Station only 4 minutes far on foot. From there you can be in 10 minutes close to Fontana di Trevi or to the Vatican or to the Colisseum. You also have good restaurants and pizzerias near Romantic Dreams and even a supermarket.The breakfast is very complete, the room is very confortable, noiseless and with a big 4k tv even with Netflix where you can find a lot of films or tv series, and THE MOST IMPORTANT THING, Gianni, the hosting, is such a lovely person, it’s not possible to make guests feel more confortable.
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Top B&B in Rome! Easy to reach almost everything from there. Clean rooms. Amazing breakfast. And the service from the Staff was incredible! Thanks Gianni to help me to have a fantastic time in Rome! We’ll be back!
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was excellent, very close to the metro stations. Gianni, the hotel owner, was great, kind, carry, very helpful and friendly. He helped us a lot, every question we had, we turned to him and he answered quickly.The room was clean and cozy.The service was excellent and the breakfast was pampering. I highly recommend this hotel. The hotel worth the price!
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time visiting a B&B and it was awesome! The hosts were wonderful and provided excellent recommendations for local eateries and directions for visiting local tourist attractions. We felt very welcome from the moment we arrived and would definitely recommend them. The hosts also spoke English, which made communication a breeze.
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We rarely rate hotels on portals like Tripadvisor etc., but this palce definitely deserves some nice words as we were so delighted. We stayed for two days in this fantastic B&B and can only recommend it. It's more than a hotel, you immediately feel like home. The rooms look exactly like in the photos and are very clean. Gianni, the B&B owner, takes the extra mile and gives plenty of information and advice where to go, what to eat etc. We really couldn't wish for more during our stay, we were simply amazed by the politeness and friendliness of the staff! If you are looking for a special place with personality and exceptional service this is where you should go! GRAZIE MILLE! When we are going to Rome again we will definitely stay in this gorgeous B&B.
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend this place due to its cleanliness, family atmosphere and location. Although in hotels you are limited to their offerings, the owner of this b&b goes the extra mile for you to enjoy your stay. There is a great vibe to this place combined with the friendly atmosphere. Parking is a little restricted since there are more cars around than parking spaces. The rule of thumb: if you park at a blue line you need to pay, whereas white are free. Metro (Re Di Roma station) is within 5mins walking distance. The accommodation based in a decent neighbourhood. This place would be suitable for couples and families.
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: RomAntic Dreams is very, very good place to stay in Rome! Delicious breakfast (omelettes, croissants, sandwiches, coffee, fruits, yoghurts and much more!) served by owners Gianni and his wife. Gianni was very helpful - thanks to him we saw a lot of things in Rome which aren't so known by tourists. :) He was so helpful that on our last day he showed few things by his own car!Beautiful decorated rooms, greatly clean and silent. Also Hotel is located in a very good communication point near to metro station and buses. Thanks to the Owners I know if I return to Rome I will stay in RomAntic Dreams definitely. :) Thank you!!!
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is perfect. There is a subway station nereby and it is very close to the Coloseo. The rooms are great and very clean. The hosts are amazing persons. Hardly recommend this hotel, especially for couples!!!
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is simmply beautiful and stylish, the rooms are clean and the breakfasts are delicous. Hosts are very welocming and friendly. Gianni was very helpful as for the best places to eat and visit. I recommend this place for people who value friendly, domestic atmosphere and want to stay in a friendly, quiet and safe neighbourhood.
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this lovely place a lot. The owner was very very friendly and helpful. Our room was very clean and the breakfast was very good too.The location is absolutely great. We definitly would come again.
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I and my wife (Leila) spent an excellent few days in Rome in Romantic Dreams B&B. Besides of cleanness, comfort and great accommodation, we loved this B&B because of its owners and staff ( Gianni, Amparo and Giorgio). They are so lovely, caring and helpful that we felt we have a great friends of us from old days in Rome. B&B is placed in a nice place close to metro and there are pleasant restaurants around. I can talk about it for hours but recommend you to experience a Romantic Dream in Rome....
hotelName:
24    RomAntic Dreams b&b
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely apartment! Everything that was needed. Fantastic location round the corner from the colosseum and public transport!! Great welcome from Andrea who sat with us going through the map pointing out places to see and how to get there!! All staff excellent!! And very accommodating with regard to our luggage as we had a late flight out!! Would recommend!!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A clean nice Apartment centrally located in Rome The decor was lovely and the owner was very friendly and went out of his way to make sure we were comfortable. Andrea even offered to give us a ride to the train station. I can highly recommend Green apartments
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family and friends filled up all four of the apartments in this delightful area off the main road. This is our second time here and we stayed 5 nights this time (precruise). What a wonderful way to visit and see ALL of Rome. The tour guides picked us up right out front as well as our driver to the cruise port.This time we had time to cook and share a breakfast on the patio for the 9 of us. In the afternoons, after touring, we shared cocktails (or wine) and cheese in the courtyard. It is so comfortable and cozy and especially nice having our own kitchen, fridge etc. The local co-op store is not far away so we were able to stock up on fruit, breads, cheese and snacks. Andre and Maria are great. They gave us a map of the area and suggested various places to visit. Andre can suggest different tour guides too. We arranged our pick up from the airport with Andre and he met us as the apartments. It went so smoothly. We were only 5 minutes from the coleseum and our weather was perfect too for mid-October.We would stay here again!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in two apartments (#2 & #3 ) for 2 nights in September. The apartments are fully equipped and comfortable near the Coliseum. Andre was very nice waiting for our ride on the street at night, explaining to us about the apartment and also recommending a trip to Rome. We will be happy to return to the apartments in the future
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rome is a very busy & noisy city. These apartments are tucked in a courtyard off of a main road. We slept great each night. When we arrived we had a tough time locating the apartment because we used my husbands phone GPS! Mistake. It took us much farther down the road and we were on the wrong side of the street. Andrea was patiently waiting for us outsice. We were able to contact him once at the metro stationn which is important. He does not live on the premise. Andrea gave us maps and tips for our short two night stay. You must either pay cash or with PayPal. I didn't realize there was a PayPal fee that we must pay so beware if you use it. On the day we departed we left our suitcases near the locked entrance door and pick them up later in the afternoon .(we had a special key to get in the main door).  The aparment was spacious, clean and comfortable. The kitchen is well supplied with cooking supplies and a gas stove! There is coffee available for the morning which was very good. . Wifi works great. We did not use the TV so cannot review it. There is too much to see & do in Rome! It is a great location with metro close by (10 minutes walk) & Colosseum (5 minutes walk). On of my favorite things to do is to view the Colosseum at night. You feel very safe too. Not like in the early 80's when one wouldn't dare walk around late at night.  The only negative thing is the terrible smell from the pipes in the bathroom. I did read a review that mentioned it so expected it since it is an older building. They just need a special flapper valve on the pipes to fix the issue. We just keep the stopper in the drain and paper in the other hole. It really was not an issue for us. The apartment was very clean. It is cleaned daily too which is not all that common. I appreciated not having to pay extra fees for cleaning, etc.... We had a wonderful stay in Rome! Thank you Andrea!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights in the Green Apartments prior to our cruise. Location is a few blocks from the Coliseum and on the Metro line, as well as several of the street car and bus lines. Plenty of restaurants nearby and Andrea will give you LOTS of information on attractions, transit, etc when you check in. Payment is in cash (Euros) at time of check in, OR you can pay in advance via Pay Pal and pay an additional fee for the transaction cost. Do note that while the apartments are declared to be on the 1st floor, this is Europe, and the first floor is up a flight of stairs (no elevator). You will need to haul your luggage up a flight of stairs (we did have help from staff on arrival and when we checked out).We were in Apt 2 which has a window opening to the courtyard as well as one opening to the street in front of the building. Limited ability to block visibility with thin curtains.There is a supermarket a few blocks from the apartments where you can stock up on supplies, or there is a Carrefour Express a bit further away (towards the Coliseum) with a more limited selection.We enjoyed our stay at the Green Apartments
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not lavish, but basic and clean apartments, with full-sized fridges and kitchenware, near the Colosseum and San Clemente Church, which is very interesting and turned out to be one of our favorite sites. This was like living in a working persons area. We felt like locals!Our apartment was the Constantino. The water pressure was good and the hot water was plentiful. The patio was wonderful and we sat outside and drank wine after a long day of touring. The washer/dryer was used a lot!Andrea, the owner, is wonderful and full of great info and maps. In fact, we used his map on our return trip to Rome - it was great!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great week in Rome ....at Green Apartments for a second timeVery good location close to public transport but quietConvenient fir tourist attractions but also in an area that gives a taste of 'working' RomeAndrea a charming and helpful host...ably assisted by Maria for whom nothing is too much trouble
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You need to arrange before arriving when you will arrive as these are a few apartments around a common terrace area and there isn't a reception, however someone will be present every day during the morning.The location of the apartments is great, very close to the Colosseum and within walking distance to the city centre, train station plus underground five-ten minutes away.The apartment that I got was quiet, fairly spacious with a big kitchen with a table to eat, a separate living room with a sofa-bed, a bedroom with a double bed and a toilet. Plenty of Ikea furnitures, but the place was clean and nothing was broken.Upon arrival Andrea gave us a couple of maps of the town and a 15 minutes chat about what to visit, where to eat, a few recommendations, etc. To be honest it was a bit short for my taste and I like hotels with a reception always available, however the restaurants recommended were excellent. The woman that showed up in the mornings wasn't as friendly or helpful, however at 75€/night in November 2016 that was cheap compared with decent hotels, so I cannot really complain.To sum up, clean, well located and at a very reasonable price. I was happy with my choice.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were spending time, for a fwe days in Roma. We stayed at Green Apartments located at via Labicana 29. Although it is nearby the center of the most historical scens in Rome, the place is very calm and the apartments are very very nice. Hearty recommended mostly thanks to Andrea and his assistant Mria.J&H.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had a very good experience with this location. The apartment is very well fitted with all you need, there is plenty of space inside and you have also a terrace to enjoy the coffee or a glass with wine. Maria was very helpful for us and she gave us a lot of tips about everything: room facilities, map and very detailed explanation with places to visit, places to eat, local transportation and many other tips in order to enjoy our stay in Rome. Even this hotel offer airport transportation, Andrea told us that if we want to save some money, a taxi will be better, and we really appreciated this honesty.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough to praise this apartment. Firstly I would like to thank the owner Andrea for being so incredibly welcoming and helpful. We travelled as three 17 year olds on our first holiday abroad and he gave us amazing advice on the best restaurants, gelaterias and bars, the must see areas of the city and where to go for the bus/metro. He gave us a very comprehensive map and his advice was invaluable. The apartment itself is in the perfect location. The Colosseum can be seen from the front entrance and there are bus and metro stops within a 5 to 10 minute walk. Although it is extremely central the apartment is very quiet and secure, with a beautiful terrace outside of each door. There is plenty of cutlery, plates and equipment provided inside, good air conditioning and daily cleaning. We were also able to leave our luggage in the apartment block after to our check out at 10:00am whilst we went out and then returned for them later in the day.The price was very reasonable and there were lots of amenities close by including many good supermarkets, restaurants, bars and facilities such as bike hire.The owners also were very helpful in offering to book transport to and from the airport and advised us on the best value options.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location with a nice terraceApartment with 2 nice rooms and seperate showers! The guy who welcome us has been really nice, helpful with great tips to how enjoy Rome ! 5 minutes to the Coliseum with shops around !
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't speak highly enough of the Green Apartments. The location was perfect, the room charming, and the staff wonderfully friendly and knowledgeable. Upon arriving, Maria made us feel right at home, describing highlights of Rome, directions, and insights. Staying at the Green Apartments will be an essential part of any future trip we take to Rome. It's a tremendously accommodating place.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our trip started with a lovely welcome from Andrea who talked us through the best places to visit and the best places to eat. He gave us excellent advice about getting round the city and Green Apartments are situated in an ideal location. A short walk from the apartments and you reach the Coliseum, not just a magnificent building but also the ideal place to pick up a hop on hop off bus service. Praise must be given to Andrea and his staff as the apartments are clean and well equipped. It's an ideal location to explore Rome and we will definitely be paying a return visit to Green Apartments.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at The Green Apartments for 8 Nights in early June and loved the entire experience. Andrea the owner and Maria his assistant were extremely helpful from the time we first booked until we departed. Andrea emailed lots of information about the apartment, the vicinity and how to get there and even answered unusual questions such as where was the nearest swimming pool?When we arrived, later than expected, exhausted, grumpy, dishevelled and without our luggage (it was still in Hong Kong) he and Maria were welcoming, supportive and reassuring and Andrea assisted us greatly by following up on the lost luggage.He also provided a great map and spent time explaining what to see, where to shop and how to get around Additionally, the apartment was lovely, well equipped, quiet, clean and very comfortable. The communal courtyard was a delight and we sat out enjoying a cuppa a or a wine, frequently. Maria was a friendly face and visited each day to assist I would recommend this apartments to anyone visiting Rome for the first or 10th time . There were two metro stops within 400 metres and a bus line . We were close to the Colloseum but could walk to all the places we wanted to visit if we chose not to use the public transportThank you Andrea and Maria, we will be back
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Green apartments exceeded our expectations. Great location close to Coloseum yet quiet. Don't let the entrance fool you as the apartments are located through a private courtyard around the back near an Indian restaurant. Once you go inside the private entrance to Green apartments you are in another world. Their own internal courtyard is lovely and the actual apartment is clean, quiet and a reasonable size.Adrea is also a very professional and lovely host
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable flat, warm, good facilities comfortable bed. We were met and welcomed by Andrea in the evening of our arrival. throughout nothing has been too much trouble. Sightseeing has been enhanced by personal recommendations and his map.seven day bus and metro ticket got us everywhere easily. Brilliant location. Andrea and Maria are around to offer advice. Flat serviced each day. Would throughly recommend staying here. Penny and Ian F
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located a very short walk from the Colosseum, we started our four day pre-cruise visit in the wonderful "The Green Apartments Roma" the accommodations & touring advice were excellent. So close to Ancient Rome yet so quiet. My friends & I occupied all the apartments for four days & used them as a base for enjoying many sites. Can't wait to stay there again.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice apartments and very clean. Wonderful service and very nice people. Andrea the owner makes his best to help and explain how to optimize your vacation in Rome. A fantastic location close to the Coloiseum. Easy get to all Rome from there.EXELENT! Go for it!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had 2 nights at the Green Apartments this week and were very happy with our stay. Andrea was a most helpful host, even carrying my wife's suitcase up the stairs for us. He explained all we needed to know about the workings of the apartment and then sat down with us to explain the sights and his recommendations on the map of Rome. The apartment was very clean thanks to Maria who does the maid work each day. What we appreciated the most was the effectiveness of the internal shutters on the bedroom window allowing us to sleep in until almost 9 AM. No sunlight peeping in to wake us from a deep slumber on a comfortable bed. The communal courtyard was a peaceful area with only church bells ringing in the background to break the silence. Everything inside the apartment worked as it should and it was just great to feel at home after a hectic 2 week bus tour of Italy. My only gripe was that we only booked for 2 nights and not longer, but that's our fault.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here at the end of August and it was excellent. The apartment had nearly everything we needed. If they could have squeezed a small dishwasher into the kitchen it would have been absolutely perfect! Our thanks go to Maria who made sure she was there to greet us after mid-night when our flight was delayed six hours.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed for a few nights here and very much enjoyed it! The space is well kept and quiet. I loved being able to use the kitchen and very much appreciated the patio. Andrea was an amazing host. His map and personal meet/greet was fantastic. All his recommendations were wonderful. I wish we could have stayed longer. Bravo! It's a great place for most anyone!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Green Apartments for 6 nights. the location was perfect for a walk to the Colosseum and The Forum, the most spectacular part of the Rome. The apartment was comfortable, clean, well equipped, we found in there everything we needed.It was a real pleasure to drink our coffee in the morning on the terrace (or a good Italian wine in the evening).Andreea, the owner, was very helpful, he offered us a map with all the instruction we needed to get to the main attractions of the Eternal City. In the same time, he gave us some good advices how to avoid the queues or were to go to find some Italian patisseries or ice cream. Thank you again, Andreea! I sincerely recommend this location for a vacation at Rome and I ll certainly come back on my next visit because is so much more to see in Rome!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very comfortable appartments well equipped and just up the road from the collesseum Much better and more personal than a hotel .the ownerAndrea was most helpful with advice about getting around and where to eat. The map provided was invaluable as we were first time visitors  Maria the housekeeper was also very friendly and helped with some useful tips she also kept the place spotless  I would recommend this appartment to anyone who wants to visit Rome as there are Metro stations close by and plenty of buses The rooms are comfortable and you have the option to cook for yourself or visit one of the many nearby restaurants On the whole we were very pleased with our choice of accomodation and will definitely go again
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this apartment because it was close to the ancient sites, It was really a nice apartment, away from the crowds, but close to food, banking facilities and metro links. I would recommend this place to anyone looking for easy access to the historic sites. There is parking available , but is not associated with the apartment. There is a Indian Restaurant with in 20 meters and numerous restaurants withing a 4 minute walk. The Forum and Colosseum are a 8 minute walk with metro links for both lines within 10 minutes. Room included a frig, a stove and two separate bedrooms and bathrooms. Clean and comfortable rooms and quite area. Great price! Loved it!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartments are perfect if you have various family units wanting to spend a roman holiday together. My wife and I had one apartment, our teenage children had another and our respective parents the remaining two. We all had our own space and privacy, yet enjoyed each other's company by sharing the wonderful roof terrace that joins up the four apartments. The place is quiet, hidden away from the city traffic, but still minutes from the Imperial Rome we love so much. Andrea, our host, is most helpful and full of practical advice when advising where to eat and where to spend our money. He even gave us some great tips on how to hook up with a most charming guide, who took us on a tour of our favourite sites. Best of all, the possibility of preparing a quiet meal at "home". Our kitchen was fully functional and well equipped for a simple, delicious italian food.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment was clean and in a safe part of town. It was in walking distance to the Coliseum and Hop on Hop off Bus stop. However, the toilets ran all night, the shower is so small you cannot turn around in it and wash yourself. We could not get the TV programmed to English. Worst of all there was very loud music until well past 2:00 am. We have a 6:00 am wake up and two small children under 10 travelling with us that needed their sleep as well. Although I am submitting this review around 2:20 am, the music is still going strong and we are frustrated because we cannot sleep.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we've been there the third time.the apartment is very convenient. well equipped: an equipped kitchen, a living room with a sofa that can be opened to a double bed, a table and 4 chairs and so on. an air condition in the bed room. it's close to the coloseo, san clemente' san giovanni in laterano. 2 metro lines' tam and buses.the owner is very helpful and so is the young woman that cleans the place. there are 4 apartments. price is good. we hope to be there the next time.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently travelled to Rome for a two night stay and booked the Green Apartments. We had never visited Rome before. Andrea assisted us before we arrived and organised a transfer from the Airport to the apartment. Andrea met us at the apartment and provided an excellent map of the city and guidance regarding where to eat, banks, public transport and areas that he recommended that we visit. It made us feel very welcomed.The apartment was very clean, well equipped and had everything we needed. Public Transport was very close and the Colosseum was in walking distance as advertised. I would recommend a stay. We will be back next time we visit Rome.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a 1 bedroom and got a free upgrade for some reason. No complaints here. The owner was very nice and responsive from the time we inquired re the apt to the time we were there. He actually has his own map of the city and his own recommendations for places to eat and hang out!--more on that later.We had 4 travelers + baby, then had to add a 5th person, minus baby, at the last minute. The owner was okay with this, for a small additional fee--very fair. He did not charge the 5th person the first night she was there which was very nice of him. He even brought an extra cot!The apt is in a very nice location--about 5 minutes (brisk walking)-10 minutes (slow walking) from the colosseum. From there, you can walk along the main street--via dei Fori imperiali--to see the main attractions. There are 2 metro stations nearby--the Colosseum to the west or Manzoni to the east--if you don't want to walk too much. Across the street from the apt is two small grocery stores where we bought water and juice and fruits. There is also a small bakery where we bought our am croissants for breakfast.About the map the owner made himself and gave us--it's better than the map we got from the Roma Pass! There are def some hot spots on his map worth trying out. The apt itself was very nice and secure. As noted, we got a free upgrade to a 2bd/2ba with a kitchen area. The rooms were cleaned daily. The restroom was actually bigger than the standard hotel rr in europe. Wifi is free. The only thing is we do not get new towels daily like we would at a hotel, but it was previously noted new towels only if you stay over 3 days and we were fine. For some reason we lost power the first night and the wifi became slow. We emailed the owner and he was very prompt coming by to fix the problem. Overall we were very happy we booked this apt. Can't wait to come back!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as a family in a 2 bedroom apartment. Andrea the owner is friendly and has a welcoming nature. Nice courtyard provided to guests. Walking distance to most attractions, however not near anything in particular.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What to say, a great experience from booking to leaving.. Andrea couldnt have made booking the apartment any easier, nothing was a problem.. I was going with my husband and two young daughters for my brothers wedding. I asked Andrea to organise a transfer from the airport to the apartment, which he done. We arrived and were met by Andrea at the apartment, he gave us the tour, showed us the local places to eat, shop and the best way to travel.. information really useful while you stay and gave us a useful map which we took everywhere. The apartment we stayed in was number 3. it had a great wee kitchen, it had cultery, glasses, some pots and pans, washing machine, hob and oven . The rest of the apartment was a bathroom which had a shower, etc, main bedroom had double bed and plenty of cupboard space and then the sitting room was the second double bed when the sofa was made into a bed. There was also air con which is a must when staying in the summer time . There is a tv.. not really for kids viewing, Rome is too nice to be sitting watching it even at night. The apartment had a lovely shared terrace and was great to sit in the evenings in. Maria was in everyday and left the apartment spotless and was so helpful with any of the questions we needed answered. I did do a couple of loads of washing and Maria gave me the clothes horse to dry the clothes on.. The 4 apartments share one between them , there is also a small ironing board and iron , if its needed. We were approx 5min walk from colleseum and was great for walking to Metro station also. There is also free wifi, which is handy to have. I would def recommend The Green apartments for staying in Rome, great value for money and even though there is a flight of stairs to go up to them it was handy to leave the prams at the bottom of them.. If you are looking somewhere clean, close to the sights.. then this is the place.Great place, Great hosts.. Thank you both Andrea and Maria,
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in apt 4 for 5 nights, Andrea was great provided a map and lots of tips as well as organising our transport from airport, Maria left apartment spotless every day! 5 min walk from colleseum and metro. We had 7 month baby and found it safe and great location.air con in bedroom. Would recommend to anyone visiting Rome!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 6 days in Rome at Green Apartments, Andrea is very good and he met us at check-in, he took time to explain us everything around and had his own Map printed for us too. He is very supportive. But only down point thing I found as were with kids was that TVs in the room are not child protect. All the soft porn channels were visible, So I advice parents (who doesn't want their child to watch soft porn) to take out the cable and pretend TVs are not working :)Apart from that everything seems pretty nice, We from Sri Lanka and Andrea has been working in Sri Lanka sometime ago and he talk to us about Sri Lanka too.. pretty amazing to meet someone who has spent few years in your own country right :) Travel wise, take blue taxi as they are pretty cheap caparison to others. Plenty of dining places. There is a Sri Lankan food restaurant just 5 minutes walk from the apartment (if you are a Sri Lankan who reading this.) And they are pretty good, away from home and to taste something spicy and chilly. :) Overall the stay in this apartment was pretty nice. But I am sure there are many economical options around if you don't have kids to take care.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 4 days at the Green Apartments and were thrilled with everything. Andrea arranged a taxi from the airport for us. He met us at check-in and carefully went over what's around, where to eat, and ideas on what to do. We saw him several times during our stay and he was always making sure that we were happy and had what we needed. The apartments are a close walk to the Colosseum and Forum. There are plenty of good restaurants nearby. We also found great pastries, a couple delis, and of course Gelato - all within an easy walk! The apartments are an easy walk to two metro stations, which will get you to any attraction. We didn't use the bus, but the bus stop is close by also. Andrea, thank you for making our time in Rome memorable! We loved your beautiful city and hope to be back soon. Ciao!The Newby Family
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a wonderful place to stay. It is an great location (5 minute walk from the Colosseum) and the facilities are beautifully kept. The owner (Andrea) took time when we arrived to give us a tour of the apartment as well as go over the map and a possible itinerary with us. He also gave us a map that included his recommendations for site seeing, restaurants, photo opportunities and entertainment, which was extremely useful and the quality of his recommendations never let us down. The apartment location is also extremely quiet, as is the terrace, which is open for guest use. I would be happy to stay here again if I ever get the chance.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What impressed me the most about my first-time stay was the time Andrea (the owner) took to introduce my friend and I to his city. :-) When we arrived, he provided a customized map containing info about Rome's "Must-Sees," such as photo ops, restaurants, historical landmarks, transportation lines, etc. He proceeded to sit down with us and explain everything we needed to know, using the map to do it. We were thrilled to be able to catch a glimpse of the Colosseum from our apartment window. The surprisingly peaceful location was excellent--within walking distance of the Red line (Metro) and, in the opposite direction, the Colosseum, Forum, Circus Maximus, etc. The apartment was cleaned every day (thanks to Maria), and provided a comfortable place to relax/crash after full days of sightseeing. Also, the WiFi was dependable for those concerned about that sort of thing. Rome is a city that begs to be explored, so although we didn't spend much time in the apartment, it was a pleasure to have such a place to call "home." You will definitely not regret staying here. And since I tossed a coin in the Trevi Fountain, I expect another stay at the Green Apartments is somewhere in my future. ;-)
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at Green Apartments as well. The apartment was spacious for my family of 4. We also had friends stay in one of the other apartments as well. Loved meeting up in the courtyard. We were within walking distance to everything. The first few days we used the metro but once we got our bearings we walked to almost everything. We loved Andrea's recommendation of Luzzi's. We also had Indian that's right below, it was very good. Andrea was super helpful with everything from meeting us and checking us in, recommendations for food, itinerary, maps, tours, everything!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved everything about this apartment. We traveled with our 2 young adult sons so we needed more space than hotel rooms offer. The location is perfect. It is just down the street from the Colosseum and easy walking to most of the famous sites. Andrea was very kind and helpful. He arranged a driver to pick us up at the airport and deliver us right to the apartment. He also arranged a taxi to bring us to the train station when we left Rome for Venice. Our best pizza and wine meal in all of Italy was right down the street and was one of his recommendations. You should have no hesitation in booking your stay here. There is great wi-fi which was very important to all of us, especially our boys.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's all about location. When the taxi brought us to the address provided it wasn't clear where we were staying. Andrea was waiting out front and greeted us. The apartments are within eyesight of the Coliseum and is well situated. Close to the subway and bus lines as well as minimarts, bakeries restaurants and ATM's. Andrea provided us with an in depth orientation of the apartment as well as the best attractions and literary planning.The apartment was clean and well appointed. The common patio was a great spot for those wanting to meet others staying at the other suites. The apartments setback far enough from the main road that road noise is not an issue.Lot's of great restaurants near by as well as a supermarket. Andrea was a gracious host and was available on his cellphone to assist us as required.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rented apt. 4 from Green Apartments after reading previous reviews here. It is a nice, quiet rental despite the fact it's just off a busy street near the Colisseum. You are about 3 blocks away from the Colisseum and right across from the Colisseum is the subway to take you anywhere. The owner is very accommodating..we arrived early so he arranged for the cleaning person to come early. He also arranged transportation to and from airport and gave us a valuable map to follow. Right next to the apartment, there is an Indian restaurant, which we didn't go to as we don't like that type of food, but there is a pub next door that we went to on several nights to have a burger and drinks...very few people at the pub but the staff was welcoming and very informal. I suspect it picks up late at night and on weekends but we had early trains so didn't go there very late. Highly recommend this rental...you will be very happy.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 2 nights in the Green Apartments. Great location but it was a short walk from the Manzoni subway station, we tend to walk and take public transit instead of taxi. But Andrea (the owner) knew our approximate time of arrival and he was waiting out on the sidewalk in front of the apartment for us!! I am glad because the apartment is set off the street in a small area with other apartments and we may not have seen it. If you are going there, just go in the arch marked 29 and follow around through another small "tunnel" area and around to the left and you have arrived. It was clean and just what we needed. Close to all the things we wanted to walk to. Andrea was a great host and sat down when we arrived and showed us a map with all the great sights. We ended up using his map the whole time and not the nice laminated map we had bought and taken with us! We did not cook in the kitchen as we were only there for 2 nights but it would be nice if you needed to cook. Wine on the terrace was great. This would be a great place if you are coming with kids as there is lots of space and set away from the road. I highly recommend this apartment if you are coming to Rome.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We needed accommodation in Rome for a family of 4 adults for 5 days in June. When I booked the 2- roomed apartment it was only available for the last 2 days of our 5 day stay, so we booked the 1-bedroom apartment that can sleep 4 (with a fold out bed in the open lounge/kitchen area) for the first 3 days which was also slightly cheaper. We ended up not moving as we spent so little time in the apartment that it wasn't worth the move and extra expense.Our children (19 yr old and 22 yr old) found the fold out bed not as comfortable as they had hoped so although the apartment can sleep 4 it would probably be better for younger children. Andrea was a wonderful host and Mabel friendly and helpful. We found it unusual that when the apartment was cleaned the dishes were not washed. Perhaps this is how it is in Europe? There was a washing machine in the apartment which was fantastic as we used it before we left Rome. The only snag is that it needs washing machine soap powder so bring some along if you intend to use the machine. Racks for drying washing are provided in the courtyard. We highly recommended the accommodation and we would definitely stay there again. Also the map that Andrea gave us was fantastic! We visited most of the places he suggested/were marked on the map (coffee shop/ice-cream shop/pizza).
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent just over a week here. It was one of the best finds in Rome. Andrea is a true gent, very helpful and knowledgeable right from the outset. Mabel was equally as helpful. Both were fantastic hosts.We booked out two apartments as there were 4 of us visiting Rome. The setting was brilliant, close to everything we could have needed: metro, bus stop, shops, supermarket. And most importantly, the church that out friends were getting married in! It was only 2 minutes walk away. We had a view of the Colosseum from our apartment which in the evenings was just the place to take a leisurely walk. I'd definitely recommend to anyone, and I'd most definitely stay here again when I come back tot eh Eternal City.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we came again to green apartments. the place is very clean. the cleaning woman, mabel, is nice and very helpful. the apartment is well equipped, has an air condition for the sommer, close to many famouse sites in rome, a good public transportation.we were welcome by Andrea P, which is also very nice. we will definitly come there next time we're in rome.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We, a family of 4 (2 adults and 2 kids) from Edmonton, Canada, visited Rome in early July and stayed at the Green Apartments for 4 nights. Our stay was very pleasant, and we will surely stay there during any future visit to Rome.Booking was easy. All the details were available on line, pictures were accurate. The owner/host – Andrea was very prompt in responding to any questions that we had. He also provided us detailed directions and options of getting to the apartments from the airport. He was even waiting for us in front of the apartment when we arrived (we called him from the airport to fix the time).Location of the apartment was great. A short walk to the Coliseum, close to Metro stations, close to restaurants and shopping. We could even see part of the Coliseum from the bedroom (we were in Unit 3 for those who are curious). Andrea was a great host. He welcomed us and walked us through the apartment. Further he also advised us of what to do (and what not), where to go, provided us guidance on visiting the tourist spots, provided advice on how to be street smart when traveling in Rome, options of restaurants etc. He even has a customized map that he hands out to his guests. Further he is always available over the phone, if needed. The apartment was clean and very well furnished to suit our needs. One bedroom with a double bed and a double sofa bed in the living room. Also had a kitchen (fully stocked with pots and pans and utensils), and a separate dining area. Roof top patio was available for use. A cleaning lady came by every day to clean and stock up on the supplies. The Air Conditioning machine worked well and that was very important as it was very hot in Rome in July.The only drawback that we found was that a microwave was not available in the kitchen. We knew about that before we went, so was not surprised. However, I am saying that a microwave would have been very convenient for us.Overall, we were very satisfied with the apartment and our stay, and also with Andrea. As I said, we will surely stay there again in the future. Thank you Andrea for making our stay a pleasant one.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a party of 4 adults and 1 baby and stayed for 4 nights in a 2 bedroom apartment. It was perfect for us, cot and high chair provided and plenty of shops nearby for food at much better prices than in the city. We ate at restaurants nearby also and the food was great and inexpensive. The Colosseum was just down the road and it is an easy walk into the main city attractions. Alternatively the metro is a couple of blocks in the other direction which gives quick access to all points. Andrea was a great host BC and explained all the relevant details on arrival. He arranged transport for us to and from the airport which worked very well.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Green Apartments - Apartment #2 - during June 2013. It was both convenient and affordable, which is a rare combination in Rome! I have visited Rome about 20 times and found these apartments to be excellent. The metro stop is a bit of a walk during the heat of summer (both Colosseo and Manzoni - about 10 minutes), however, that is considered nearby in Rome. The apartment was clean and exactly as photographed, with no unpleasant surprises. Andrea is an absolute gem. He provides a map and gives you an excellent orientation of the neighborhood. He will schedule a taxi for you if you need it. The wifi is EXCELLENT. If you need a 'real' grocery / market (supermercati), there is a Despar nearby. Exiting the apartment complex, cross the street and take the steep stairway up! Veer to the right. You will see an elementary school on the corner. Following alongside of the school, turn the corner, and the Despar is on the left about 2 blocks up.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay in Rome was amazing. Thank you, Andrea, for all your help and the great apartment. Thank you also again for the stroller. We very much appreciate you sharing it with us. It was so much help! It was a great stroller for the city!Andrea was kind and such a help. He met us on the day we arrived in the apartment and went through where and when to visit certain sites. I was there for work and feeling a bit nervous about how to get to the conference site from the apartment, he quickly put me at ease by letting me know how to get there (so easy on metro B!). Our booking was somewhat last minute, but Andrea helped us by having us stay in Apt 1 and moved us to Apt 2 when it became unoccupied. Both apartments are great.The location of the apartment was perfect. Next to the Colloseo and between the two metro lines. Grocery shops, restaurants, gelato shops, park etc all around. Close to a major tourist site, but totally felt like a neighborhood and away from the beaten path. If you're traveling with kids (or not) I would highly recommend these apartments. There's a terrace where the kids can use up extra energy or where you can have your breakfast or evening rest. Wonderful place and great owner - very attentive! (I can only use one type of trip, so I'm choosing family, but I was also there for business) - the wifi worked great!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was superb, 10min walk to colosseum and in very safe and user friendly neighborhood. The apartments were clean and well appointed, nice to have daily maid service. The patio was wonderful for a pre-dinner drink and relaxation. We loved the quiet, especially after a week on the Amalfi coast and its constant roar of traffic. The apartment owner, Andrea, was extremely helpful, spending at least a 1/2 hour advising us where to go what to see and where to eat on his personally printed city map. We ate at several of his restaurant recommendations and were thrilled with all of them, not a bad one on the list. His tips on how to get tickets at the various museums and archaeological sites were invaulable and saved us long waits in lines. Andrea also was very helpful in retrieving one our party's eye glasses left in a rental car at Ciampino Airport.Our only negative was the poor lighting in the kitchen, needs under counter lights. Also a couple more kitchen hand towels would be nice.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in April and had a fantastic time at the green Apartments. We stayed in the largest apartment with three adults and two children and felt very comfortable here. It was clean, well equipped and in an excellent location. The kitchen, although small had everything we needed. We cooked here on many occasions. We were minutes from the Colosseum, so in regard to location it was perfect. We couldn't hear a sound from the busy street outside. The bus stop is literally minutes walk away and the metro is 10 minutes away.Andrea is a fantastic host. He spent an hour with us explaining where we should visit and where all the amenities were. His English was excellent too. He made us feel very welcome here. I would recommend these apartments to anyone requiring a central base in Rome for site seeing and especially for families as it is ideal. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we where 4 adults in rome from 26/3/13 to 31/3/13. we chosed to stay in apartment no. 1 in green apartment in rome. Andrea the owner is amazing person! speaks a very good english, stay with us one hour and gave us all the important tips about rome.the place is perfectly located close to city center, very quiet, clean and very enjoyable.we will come back for sure! Thanks Andrea.Shay Zion, ISRAEL
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we went to rome for the city marathon and were very pleased with the apartment. the location was very convenient (very close to the colosseum) and ther owner made us feel welcome. we loved his cafe and restaurant recommandations!
hotelName:
25    Green Apartments Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is clean, quiet, safe, and is located in a really interesting part of Rome. Paolo was extremely attentive, and steered us to a really nice restaurant walking distance along the Apian Way. Wish we could have stayed a bit longer, and we'll definitely be back again.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maurizio and Paola could not have been more accommodating. Our only regret is we only had two nights to stay here. I cannot recommend dinner with Mama Edy highly enough. Also, it's super easy and cheap to get downtown. There is a bus stop right across the street with a newsstand next to it. Buy a bus ticket there which is also accepted on the trains, take the bus a couple of miles to the train station, then hop on the train and you're next to the Vatican in minutes.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great host! We couldn’t have done this trip without the help of the owners of the home. We were a family of 9 and we fit perfectly into each room. We are greatful to have chosen this place. Not only was the house keeping excellent but the services and help that they provided was perfect!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed with family for three nights.Great stay.Everything perfect.Nice staff and great service.Thanks Maurizio for taking care of everything and making our stay enjoyable.Hope,will get a chance to stay there again in future.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The reviews brought me here and did not lie. This place is a gem, peaceful, serene, with lovely rooms and beautiful gardens.But the best is the heart and soul which Signor Maurizio and his team put into the place. True welcoming and joyful hospitality.I shall return !
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is difficult to summarize just how wonderful our 3 day stay was at the boutique Appia Antica Resort. Our adult family of 6 were warmly greeted by Maurizio and his staff upon our arrival. We were introduced to their luxurious apartments, Pricilla and Ipazia and the lovely grounds. These apartments are fully stocked with all one could need for a week, or a month if you could be so lucky. The hospitality of Maurizio, his wife Maria Luisa and their assistant Paola was unsurpassed. We arranged for an arrival tour with Maurizio of the Appian Way after settling in for an hour or two. What pride for his city and knowledge of its history. We shared a bottle, or two of wine with Maurizio and his wife prior to our wonderfully prepared "Dinner with the Italian Momma" which they arranged for us in our apartment. Fantastic! The resort is located outside the city center which was perfect for us. We could travel by bus, metro or taxi as needed and avoided the craziness of downtown. The neighborhood is quiet, is within short walking distance of two markets, a great coffee shop and plenty of quality restaurants. The value for money of this resort compared to other high-end hotels in the city center was a major consideration for us. We were more than satisfied. In conclusion, you will receive the highest level of customer service from our new friends at Appia Antica Resort. The communications throughout the booking process, leading up to our visit and during our stay was top-notch. We thank Maurizio and his team for the best of times during our Roman holiday. We will return for sure. Arrivederci amici.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased with the the staff and owners who wanted us to have an amazing experience. There is a personal attention and quality that will leave you feeling relaxed and came after leaving. The property has the small details going right for them! Will be back when I can :-)
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first visit to Rome and our trip lasted about three days in total. We had been in contact with Maurizio by email to make arrangements before arriving. A courier was waiting for us in Fiumicino airport and it took about 25 mins to arrive at Appia Antica. We were greeted by Maurizio who told us the history of this beautiful house and garden and really made us feel welcome straight away. The inside of our apartment was beautifully furnished and spotlessly clean. The fridge was very well stocked with everything you could wish for, so we didn't have to rush out and go shopping immediately. We were even presented with a complimentary bottle of excellent wine and more was available for purchase if required. Having said that, there are two local supermarkets close by, in either direction when you leave the property. The apartment is incredibly well furnished especially the kitchen and a very comfortable lounge, with a good range of DVDs. Maurizio then arranged for us to visit a local trattoria for lunch, which was very good. We asked Maurizio if it was possible to arrange a tour of the main Roman sights for the next day. This was done and the tour itself was really excellent, the main focus being on the Colosseum and the Roman forum. This was a small group tour (can't remember company name) and it was really good.From the property, it is about a 15 minute walk to the Appian Way itself and Maurizio gave us very detailed instruction on how to get there and what to see. He also gave us a bundle of maps and guides to keep. This was a beautiful walk and we both found it an amazing experience to be walking on one of the oldest roads in the world. It is also surprisingly rural and we heard and saw some interesting birds, including a Nightingale and a Hoopoe. The main highlight was visiting the famous tomb of Caecillia Metella, which is about a 45 minute walk.In the afternoon, Maurizio took us on his own personal tour of Rome which included many lesser-known sights and areas of the city. This included an amazing visit to the shrine of the water nymph Egeria, which I don't think either of us will ever forget. In Rome we visited many famous churches, the Jewish ghetto, an astonishing view through the keyhole of the Knights of Malta building and we learnt how to cross the road like an Italian !We can't praise the Appia Antica Resort too highly. It is a wonderful place to stay and Maurizio and his colleagues are the perfect hosts. We are already thinking about our next visit.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose Appia Antica Resort because I am writing a novel set in 1950s Rome and I knew that many of the era's actors and directors had villas there. I hoped to learn more about the people and places during my visit and asked if Maurizio could tailor one of his tours to my interest. Well, he accepted the challenge and gave us a fabulous tour, including a teatime conversation with a guy he knows who worked with Fellini! Along the way he pointed out the villa of Gina Lollobrigida and a restored medieval house rented by Liz Taylor and Richard Burton while they were filming Cleopatra (there's a risqué story about this . . .) Honestly, I could not have asked for a better guide and my novel will be all the better, thanks to the sites he showed us and the many, many anecdotes I collected. Maurizio's assistant Paola helped line up the details, including last-minute dinner reservations at a nearby trattoria (they squeezed us in as a favor, even gave us complimentary after-dinner drinks). We felt we were in good hands from the moment we made contact. The villa itself is beautifully decorated--Maurizio's wife Luisa is an interior designer and she has great flair! The kitchen is equipped with everything you need to cook a gourmet meal (great 24-hour supermarket nearby where you can buy the ingredients). We were joined on our last day by friends from Trento and I made a nice Sunday lunch for us all. We sat outside in the beautifully landscaped garden, talked and ate for hours, Italian style. Maurizio contributed a bottle of wine to our little reunion and afterwards he took us in his car to Villa dei Quintili so we could walk off the meal and take in the sites. A perfect end to a perfect visit.Grazie mille!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent stay with Marizio and his wife. The house and property were beautiful. Marizio was extremely helpful. The property is located directly across the street from the bus stop and reasonably close to the train station. We were within a short walk of the Via Apia and of several excellent restaurants. Even though this property is not in the center of Rome it is only a short ride on public transit. The setting is perfect and, I believe, much more relaxing then staying next to one of the major attractions right in the city.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I together with our husbands stayed in the four bedroom apartment for four nights at the end of March 2019. We loved the apartment's huge space, cleanliness, amenities and location. We would definitely stay there again! Thank you to Maurizio and Maria for the great tours and to Paola for restaurant suggestions.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I celebrated our honeymoon in several Italian cities, and we stayed at this absolutely amazing place for a couple of nights while we were in Rome, halfway through our 2-week trip. As soon as we arrived, we were personally greeted at the gate by Maurizio and Paola, and eventually Luisa. This place is unlike any place I have stayed at previously. It is like an AirBnb because you get access to an entire unit, and like a travel agency because after checking in you can learn a bit of history on Appia Antica and places to visit in Rome (highly recommend). Also, to our surprise the fridge was stocked with typical Roman/Italian drinks/snacks!There were so many exciting things about our stay here that I am likely forgetting to mention things; however, the garden is gorgeous. There is a body of water with Japanese Koi fish, bonsai trees, and unique-looking flowers and trees.For some, the distance from the center of the city (about a 20- to 25-minute drive) might be impractical; however, the peacefulness of this resort and the surrounding Appia Antica served as a much-needed retreat for my wife and I in our event-filled honeymoon. I highly recommend the Appia Antica Resort. The best part of our stay was how welcoming and friendly the owners were.We unfortunately missed our opportunity to sign the guest book, which means we'll have to go back!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This superb apartment is located in a peaceful, tranquil location. What a find! The apartments have been beautifully designed by the owner's wife Luisa. They are spotlessly clean and very comfortable, have everything you could possibly need for your stay, including a dishwasher and washing machine. A 'Home from Home'. No need to go shopping for the basics as the fridge is stocked with eggs, milk, butter, ham, juice, water etc., and there is a basket with cereals, toast, coffee, tea, sugar and wine, enough to keep you going until you need to go to the supermarket which is located a few minutes walk away. There is a delightful little coffee shop a few minutes walk away, sells the most delicious pastries, lovely for breakfast. The location of these beautiful villa/apartments is perfect, very tranquil, situated in front of the Appia Antica way and close to restaurants, shops and cafe. There is also the 118 bus stop in front of the villa/apartment, which takes approx half an hour to get to the heart of Rome, where you can then choose a tour bus to take you around Rome. Maurizio (owner) and Paula (Customer Relations Manager) are extremely helpful, friendly and very knowledgeable. They are 'first class' professionals, very approachable and really want to help in any way they can, to ensure your stay is awesome! Thank you all for an exceptional stay in your wonderful apartment. We will most definitely recommend your accommodation to family and friends and hope to return again soon.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved are stay. We could not ask for more. We will be back and i will recommend this that if you are looking for a location that the staff is there for you in every way. They made are trip so great.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
