Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed staying in this house, it feels like you are at home, supermarket is nearby, also a metro station to visit the Vatican. I visited Rome by car.The Appian way and ancient building is nearby and it is around the area you can visit by car easily.Also, castle Gandolfo is less 25 minutes by car and there are 2 big lakes there. There is two outlet Malls not far from the property.I also recommend the hotel to stay before your flight if it is in the morning.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of four and had the sheer pleasure of staying at the lovely and welcoming Appia Antica Resort. Our own home is very clean, organized, well maintained and beautifully decorated; therefore, when staying outside of our home, we look for the same. In our opinion, Appia Antica Resort far exceeded our expectations.The Appia Antica Resort is alluring; inviting you to enjoy, with anticipation, more of its' uniqueness at every turn. The attention to the smallest detail makes Appia Antica Resort a hidden gem of exquisite design and architecture. Maurizio's wife is an interior designer. When you visit the Appia Antica Resort, you will be witness to her enormous talented gift.From our first conversation, Maurizio was kind, considerate and professional. Upon check-in, Paola greeted us warmly and even helped to carry our luggage! After we finished checking-in, Paola spent about an hour with us, showing us around the inside of the apartment, as well as, the resorts lush and welcoming grounds. We have traveled extensively and never have we received such personal service! You can certainly tell Paola takes great pride in her position at Appia Antica Resort. The apartment we had the pleasure of staying in was beautifully decorated with fine, luxurious furnishing and a keen attention to detail. The kitchen is fully stocked with every appliance needed. The cupboards are stocked with a large number of the daily essentials; cutlery, cups, mugs, espresso cups, cappuccino cups, plates, cooking pots, pans etc. Our family loves to cook and this is a kitchen we would defiantly enjoy cooking in. It is open, bright and extremely inviting, coupled with all of the necessities to make a lovely meal or snack. There are a variety of complimentary teas, coffee and biscuits, as well; there are cold beverages in the fridge with fresh deli meats and cheese. There is a huge kitchen table to sit at and enjoy all of the goodies Appia Antica Resort has left for you. The living room and dining room are joined. The living room is beautifully decorated with inviting, comfortable couches, chairs and a large TV for your enjoyment. There is a lovely dining table with ample, comfortable seating. The bathrooms are large, clean and plentiful with luxurious linens. There are quality complimentary bathroom essentials for guests to use; just incase you forgot your own. The bedrooms are as beautifully decorated and welcoming as the rest of the apartment, and the furnishings and linens, are of fine quality. The beds are extremely comfortable, and with a TV in every room, it allows time to lay and relax after a day of sightseeing in Roma. The apartment itself is centrally located with access to excellent bus service. There is ample on-sight parking behind an enclosed gate which is private from the main road; however, still providing easy access in and out of the resort. If you would like to purchase additional food, there is a fully equipped grocery store just a five minute walk away. Across from the grocery store, there is an amazing, antithetic Italian restaurant. At this restaurant you will find the best Italian food cook by an Italian Mama! The atmosphere is very inviting and relaxed. We truly enjoyed our time there. There are many lovely, must-see sightseeing opportunities around Appia Antica Resort; each one oozing with an abundance of history. Maurizio is a great historian and will gladly share all of his knowledge with you. A true joy to experience.In closing, it is our wish we will be able to return to Appia Antica Resort, until then, it is our prayer, going forward, each and every lodging experience we encounter is a delightful, professional, fulfilling and as joyously memorable as our time at Appia Antica Resort. Dear Maurizio, Maria Luisa, Paola, Irina and Scarlet, It was lovely to meet you. Thank you for making our time in Roma such a wonderful experience which left us with many priceless lifetime memories. We hope to see you all again. Take care
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You feel like a part of the family when you stay here. Maurizio and the staff are amazing and informative. More than willing to spend the time to make sure you are comfortable in your home away from home. He spent an hour with us after check in, brought us wine that we bought, just to show us on the maps, where to go and see within walking distance. Absolutely amazing customer service!! He also set up our dinner reservations at Garden Risto! A must go as well. As Maurizio says, the resort is actually in the center of Rome, although you don't feel like it. Can't wait to visit again.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we had a trilling experience there , kind people and outstanding service , clean and exquisite rooms , the italian skill and kindness makes people breathe and happy al along their stay . No problems at all this resort is a must , believe me as ancient TUI board of directors !!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely fantastic customer service!! You are part of the family when you stay here. Maurizio and the staff are amazing and informative. More than willing to spend the time to make sure you are comfortable in your home away from home.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the AAR based on Trip Advisor reviews and it did not disappoint. We were travelling as a family (myself, my husband and two children, 8 and 5) and stayed in the one-bedroom apartment which was just right for us. It was modern, clean and very comfortable and had everything that we needed for our stay. It was so lovely to have a well stocked fridge with drinks and foods for breakfast. Maurizio and Paola were extremely helpful and although we did our own thing whilst in Rome each day, they had plenty of suggestions for trips / tours / resturants and things to do as well as advice on travel around the city etc.As previous reviews have said, the AAR is out of the main city but getting the buses in was very easy with the bus stop right outside and this suited us as it was quieter staying out of the busy city. There were plenty of restaurants / shops etc in the local area. As suggested by Maurizio / Paola we took a walk one of the days down the Appian Way into the city. This was a lovely and fascinating walk and it meant we got to see a part of Rome that I'm sure we wouldn't have seen had we not been staying there. Maurizio also took us for a quick tour down the other end of the Appian way on our way bck to the airport when we left, which was a nice way to end our trip.All in all a fantastic break in Rome at a comfortable, peaceful and cosy hotel.Thank you all!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The welcome provided by Maurizio and his family reflects the warmth of Italy. The amenities and guidance provided made us felt very much at home. Maurizio went to great length to ensure we fully immerse in the history of Rome and tbe Appian Attica. The apartment provided was beautiful and decorated in a very creative manner. This is much much better than a hotel stay....we miss you, your family and your dog. Thank you so much for everything. If ever we come again to Rome....your place will be our first choice. Terima kasih Encik Maurizio dan keluarga. (That was in Bahasa Melayu: thank you Mr Maurizio and family).
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed a week at the Antica Appia Resort (“AAR”) and had a fabulous and wondrous time. Prior to leaving for Rome’s Fiumicino Airport, AAR provided us with detailed transportation instructions and sightseeing suggestions. As soon as we arrived (at 8:00 a.m.), Maurizio (owner) was there to greet us. He had checked our flight and knew that it would be early, as did the high-end car service (Audi arriving and Mercedes departing) that AAR had arranged that brought us to and from the airport. Maurizio spent an hour with us to show us all of the amenities of our suite and how everything worked. It was well stocked with mineral water, sparkling water, eggs, prosciutto, bread, butter, Italian soda & Coca-Cola, cheese, crackers, cookies and wine. Maurizio provided us with a list of recommended restaurants which turned out to be spot on. As soon as Maurizio completed his introduction, we were introduced to Paola and she in turn went over all of the maps and lists that were in the suite and she also provided us with additional maps and information on where to go and how to get there and what tours to take. We have never received such fantastic hospitality and service before, and it continued on a daily basis while we were there. Irina cleaned our suite and made the bed everyday and restocked the refrigerator when we were low on drinks. Whenever we had a question, we received an immediate answer. The AAR is a gorgeous villa and it is set back from the road on extensive grounds. It is protected by an electric gate and has a large parking area for cars. There is a nice pond that is stocked with Koi fish. The AAR is a boutique hotel with trendy suites that have been artfully renovated and decorated. The floors and walls are very thick and it is amazingly peaceful and quiet. It has the high style, look and luxury of an ambassador’s residence. We have never received such exceptional value for cost, as well. In the future, we will again travel to Rome and also visit Florence. Of course, we will again stay at the Antica Appia Resort and highly recommend that anyone who has considered staying there, do so!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were always willing to help and gave us great suggestions for food and attractions. The room was nice and there were many services available. We hope to come back here for a longer stay so we can explore the area.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is probably one of the best hotels we’ve stayed at. It is more like an apartment over a hotel. You have a lot of space at a reasonable price. While you are outside the city walls, there is no lack of places to go to to eat or shop locally. Additionally there are many bus stops nearby so you can easily get into the city. What really separates this property from others is the people. They are here to help you and Maurizio (owner) is an amazing person. I’m already trying to plan a family trip back.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An old villa, renewed totally and seperated to hotel apartments. Each apartment has different entrrance. So nice. The place is safe. Well equiped. Daily cleanning. Private parking for your rented car. I loved the garden and fish lake.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I have always liked to explore new cities and for this year’s trip we settled on Rome.We have always preferred to make quick trips but using our time as best as we can. Usually guide books have done the job for us but, when looking on the internet for accommodation, we were intrigued by Appia Antica Resort, as many reviewers talked of how the hotel helped arrange many activities. We decided to spend three days there, after three days on another beautiful hotel in the center of the town.We made a reservation and were immediately surprised by being contacted by the hotel staff, who was wondering whether they could help with anything. We explained our situation and were so happy to receive some lovely suggestions on how to organise our time so that we could do all we wanted to do. Upon arrival, we were welcomed by the owner Maurizio, who, with a friendly smile, showed us the lovely garden (the mere sight of it made us relax) with its zen corner complete with koi pond and carps and the apartment: clean and proper and amazingly decorated.Thanks to the hotel staff’s suggestions, we were able to make the most of our time in Rome and the amazing thing was that, thanks to the clear explanations provided, we knew exactly where to go and how to get there and it made our trip so much fun and stress-free! We truly enjoyed our stay at Appia Antica Resort and will recommend it to all our friends! One day we had a masseuse who came home, to give us a relaxing massage, after one day walking all around the town. Another day, we had a wonderful tour on the Ancient Appian Way with Maurizio, a true expert of the area: he charmed us with the story of Herod Atticus and his wife Annia… (don’t remember!), a true drama of the II century A.C. !We wish there was one in every city, so we could use their help and feel at home as we did here anywhere but – alas! (or thankfully) there is only one: Appia Antica Resort!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful apartment with every amenity you could wish for. The hosts are very welcoming and knowledgeable about the local area. We loved the apartment which was spotless and cleaned everyday for us. Great buses just opposite the apartment that take you all over town. Would highly recommend for a family.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Paolo and Maurizio were amazing hosts - I felt like family. Maurizio gave a tour of the neighborhood and all of the history - he is quite the historian and storyteller! I highly recommend this property, especially if you are looking for a quiet property away from the hustle and bustle of Rome. I look forward to returning!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have never experienced a better service and a warmer welcome than at Mauricio's Appia Antica Resort. We were traveling with a big group of friends and celebrating one's birthday. Not only did they accommodate all of us, but also organised an amazing dinner party and a tour in Via Appia. Mauricio even rent us his own car for the tour, because my husband unexepectadly wasn't able to take bike-tour like the rest of the group. After the tour, his wife organised a picnic with a her home-made food. Yes people, we are talking about that level of hospitality. It felt like we left Rome having a bigger group of friends than when we arrived. Needless to say, that the apartments were in excellent condition and the location is perfect. The bus stop is near and it goes straight in to city centre. You can also rent a bike for the road trip to Via Appia. It's worth it, the nature and the views are breathtaking.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My visit there was absolutely amazing, the hosts made sure all of as felt welcomed and at ease. The food was delicious and the surroundings were stunning. The bike ride took my breath away. I definitely recommend anyone and everyone to visit there!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were traveling in Rome with a huge group of friends (about 20 people), so finding appropriate accommodation was not that easy. Choosing Appia Antica Resort was an excellent decision. We booked three apartments and all of them were in the best condition: tidy, stylish, yet cosy. Nevertheless, the most amazing thing about this place is its hosts. We were impressed by the hospitality and care for guests. We will never forget a bike-trip that Mr. Maurizio organised for us in the Via Appia Antica region and combined with his remarkable knowledge about Antique history it was a really exciting day. And the cherry on top - a picnic in the garden that Mrs. Maria Louise prepared for us. Almost all of my friends have been in Rome more than once and stayed in various places, but we all agree that Appia Antica Resort will really remain as our top 1. Can't wait to come back there again!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Resort and the hosts are wonderful. We were staying with a large group of people and our stay was made perfect by the hosts. Maurizio, his wife and the resort team are wonferful people, attentive, helpful, you feel like at home with them. The rooms are immaculate, artfully decorated, very clean. All amenities in the rooms, with fully stocked kitchen, TVs, bathrooms. We were given all the information we needed, all trips/bookings were organised without us needing to do anything (bike tours, scooters, tips for visiting museums/Rome, etc). The resort is in a perfect location - next to the Appian way and all the surrounding sights as well as a stone's throw from central Rome.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent five wonderful days in Appia Antica resort with big group of friends. Aii these days we were surrounded by care,kindness,sincerity. Maurizio and Maria Luisa are perfect hosts! Maurizio knows abouit Rome and Roman history a lot and about Appian way knows everything! Maria Luisa's lunch is the best ever! Everything in resort is confortable,clean,clear.Best villa to spent time with family or friends and visit Rome!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay at the Appian Antica Resort (AAR) and the wonderful customer service provided to us made our 30th wedding anniversary visit to Rome the most memorable experience. Upon arrival we greeted in the courtyard/gardens of the very beautiful large, house with elements of "Fascismo" architecture. Our apartment rooms, kitchen were stylish and clean. The service was at a level that went way beyond our expectations. When our VISA card had problem at ATM cash machines Maurizo personally drove us to an ATM at a larger bank to resolve the problem. Let me tell you, that is when extra personalized service counts the most. Our trip involved finding a special heritage bakery "Forno a Legna da Sergio" featured in Dan Leader's book "Local Breads" located in the small town of Genzano di Roma in the Castillo Romani on the way to scenic Lago Nemi 20 km south of Rome (see article in FreshLoaf artisan bread baking blog). AAR made the car rental arrangements, provided special guidance on driving, parking, and even mapped scenic view points for the best pictures. We went on Maruizio's half day, in depth Appian Way tour. Walking along the Appian Way is a very romantic experience. He took us to most wonderful bakery after the tour. We had the best white pizza and a special white cherry/custard/pine nut tart ever. We then spent several days touring Rome with a very good semi-private tour AAR arranged for us for the Vatican, Colloseum, Roman Forum and Palatine Hill. Amazing sights but after experiencing the crowds there it was nice to relax at AAR enjoying a glass of wine that Maruzio had provided us as a gift (he knows wine, food and history well). Also, noteworthy was the Italian Mama meal experience. AAR arranged for Italian mama "Edi" to cook a personal meal for us at AAR. Edi is a cooking goddess. Her "amatriciana" was better than that of any of the guide book rated restaurants in downtown Rome. It was amazing. Maruizio also took us to local farm market, provided us with gift bottles of delicious wine, treated us to the best coffee, on and on... This was an unbelievable amount of passionately provided service "con Amore" Thank you AAR.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked the Appia Antica Resort for the first leg of our 25th Wedding Anniversary trip to Italy. We had never been, and were a bit apprehensive about everything. SO many choices. Well, staying at AAR was the perfect choice. Loved the introductory emails from Mauricio. They arranged a lovely ride from the airport to the hotel. Luisa gave us a warm welcome and Paola, armed with a complimentary bottle of champagne gave us the best, most detailed overview of the area we immediately wished we were staying much longer. The apartment was fully stocked with snacks, breakfast items, and more. It was very comfortable. I was amazed by the level of detail with everything you could possibly need for an extended stay... even a small clothes washer! I also have to mention how impressed I was that they had the proper stemware for red and white wine, grappa, Prosecco and more The gardens are magical and the perfect way to relax with wine before dinner. Luisa lights candles every night! Maurizio took time out of his busy day to drive us to dinner the first night and even came inside with us to make introductions. Who does that?!? The courtesy and genuine kindness here completely blew us away. LOVED the location. Not touristy at all and so completely quiet for a good nights sleep. There are many exceptional restaurants within walking distance and the bus stop is across the street. Super easy to buy tickets there if you didn’t want to take a taxi into town. We also enjoyed checking out the local supermarket near by. Was SO cool to experience the Appian Way nearby. Walking in the steps of Caesar! Plus there are other, non touristy sites to see along the way. My only two regrets are that we didn’t stay longer (only 4 nights) and that we didn’t plan time to take one of Maurizio’s tours. However I feel this is a great excuse to come back again! I also want to say that as a TripAdvisor reviewer and follower for years, I was completely saddened to hear recently that some establishments have been accused of paying for or making false reviews in Italy (among other places.) Saying this because I was worried after hearing that that the reviews for AAR might be skewed since they were so glowing. I can personally assure you that no one deserves to have an exceptional rating than this place. Hands down one of the best travel experiences I’ve ever had.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cannot recommend this place highly enough. Very clean spacious and we had the most wonderful stay ever here great location and staff!!!!!  Would definitely visit here again as the surroundings are so beautiful
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The customer service was exceptional, the staff went above and beyond in all aspects. Maurizio, Paola and Barbara all made us feel so welcome, we felt like a friend or family member visiting! They booked local restaurants for us, arranged tours and airport transfers- nothing seemed too much trouble! The apartment is beautifully and thoughtfully decorated and fitted out. The gardens are lovely... tranquil and peaceful- away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although our stay was brief, Maurizio couldn't have been more accommodating and informative. This place is soooo comfortable, clean and has all the creature to make your stay special. Wish we didn't need to head home, we'll be back!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms and restroom were spotlessly clean — special kudos to the cleaning lady! The staff gladly accommodated all our special requests. Restaurant recommendations (and bookings) were particularly helpful. Appia Antica way nearby is a beauty, not to be missed!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First. All the reviews you have read here are true; second. you might find Appia Antica is even better. Everything about the resort is designed to make your stay in Rome the best it can be.In no small part, this is down to the care, thought and kindness of host Mauritzio and his team. For example, we had intended to hire one of the two cars the resort provides for guests. However, after our extensive orientation from Paola on the first morning, we abandoned that plan and spent a day walking towards Rome on the Appia Antica itself. A wonderful experience that most visitors to the Eternal City will miss but one that should be a must.Our apartment was spacious, well-designed and comfortable. The housekeeping was outstanding. Guests also have use of the gardens where there are many places to sit to eat or enjoy the sunshine.The resort is 25 minutes or so from Piazza Venezia. The bus service is regular and cheap. A cab is €20 to €25. Uber operates here but regular taxis might be cheaper (all but one of our Uber drivers faithfully followed the Uber map - the other knew a shorter, cheaper route).Thank you to everyone at Appia Antica for making our visit, 25 years on from our Rome honeymoon, so equally memorable.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel in beautiful, tranquil setting. Charming hosts full of information who truly wanted to share their love of Rome. Location was surprisingly good with easy access to bus just across the street on a route not as heavily traveled as bus routes in center of city. If you like to walk, as we do, you can walk the beautiful and interesting Appian Way very close to the hotel all the way to the Colosseum and beyond.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A beautiful place to stay just out of the hustle and bustle of Roma city. Beautiful rooms and property. Highly recommended. Well stocked fridge too and endless suggestions from Maurizio and Co. Would stay again
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I loved our stay at the Appia Antica Resort. The apartment was clean, smelled fresh and was tastefully furnished. As wonderful as the apartment was it was outdone by the warm and friendly staff.Maurizio and his wife Luisa have created a gem and a wonderful little slice of Italy for guests to enjoy. We all loved Barbara as we spent the most time with her, but Paola was just as warm and funny when she spent a good amount of time giving us very helpful tips of activities for us to do.I REALLY REALLY loved Appia Antica Resort. If you are going to stay in Rome, look no further than this place. Trust me, you'll love it.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly serviceminded staff, Nice and spacious rooms, Nice garden, Free parking on the premises. Good location if you have a rental car, but too remote if you must rely on Public transport. Taxi from town cost approximately EUR 22 one way.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The owners take a personal interest in making sure every detail of your stay is fabulous and rewarding. Even going as far to ensure you didn't over pay for any pre-planned excursions, going over how the buses work, and recommending resurants, that will be near your place of sightseeing. It was like having a dedicated tour guide. They genually want you to enjoy the best of Italy. The rooms (apartments) where clean and spacious. You can't go wrong if you stay here.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had two wonderful stays at Appia Antica Resort, at the beginning of our trip and at the end of our trip after a week in Tuscany. Maurizio, Paola and Barbara were very welcoming and helpful, providing us with maps of the area and Rome and recommendations for restaurants. Maurizio even drove us to a wonderful local restaurant called "Garden Risto" and showed us some neat spots along the way on the Via Appia Antica. Our two bedroom apartment with pull out sofa was the perfect size for our family of five. The apartment was beautifully appointed and was very clean. It was also a nice treat to have drinks (juices/water) restocked for free each day. We were also gifted a bottle of wine upon our arrival to the hotel. The gardens and koi pond at the resort were beautiful and a nice place to relax after a day touring in Rome. It was nice to stay just outside of the city center of Rome and in a non touristy neighborhood. We found the bus to be super convenient as the bus stop is located directly across the street from the hotel and it is only a 10-15 minute bus ride into the heart of Rome. We spent a total of six nights at the Appia Antica Resort and enjoyed every minute!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great resort. I get nervous travelling places where I don't know the area much. There resort, without me even asking, gave me all the information I needed to get around Rome and enjoy it too the fullest extent without difficulty. Room and accommodations where the best I had in Rome and Florence
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was our fourth time in Rome, and I reserved Appia Antica to try something different. And as everyone else has said, what makes this property shine is its hosts, particularly Maurizio. I have traveled many places with top-notch service, but I still cannot believe how much he went out of his way to make our stay special. Plus he is a bright and well-traveled guy with great insight into Italy's culture, which makes him loads of fun to talk to. His tale of a day in my home state of Hawaii was hilarious. My daughter absolutely loved the time with him, and my mother demanded to know how on earth I could have taken such charming village photos in Rome! It was a perfect few days of down time. My only regret is not buying more buffalo mozzarella at the market.Grazie mille!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow, what a wonderful find!!We came to Appia Antica Resort at the end of a long family holiday in Italy and it was simply perfect.Thanks in large part to the warmth and hospitality of Maurizio, Maria Luisa, Paola, Irina and Scarlett the dog.The apartment had everything we needed and AAR kindly stocked it with supplies to greet us.AAR is in a brilliant location, right in the heart of large number of ancient Roman ruins.The team were amazing in terms of restaurant suggestions in Rome as well as the immediate vicinity and we had some incredible meals, most notably at the Garden Risto approx. 1.5k away.Maurizio is a brilliant host who is very knowledgable about ancient Rome and we had some great chats.I have already recommended friends to stay at AAR on their next visit to Rome - we will certainly be back!!Thank you for a lovely four days in Rome, AAR.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maurizio and Paola were amazing hosts! They took care of our car service arrangement from the airport which was plagued with multiple flight delays and rebooking. This was so helpful given how stressed we were from the day of traveling. We stayed for three days and Paolo took all the time to make sure we had our days planned with lots of great recommendations for logistics and places to see and eat. The one-bedroom apartment we stayed in was wonderful - very modern and tastefully decorated. Having our own full kitchen was nice on the days we wanted to make breakfast and enjoy outside on the lawn or by the koi pond. Overall, we were so impressed with the hospitality and loved the tranquility of the resort especially coming back from a long day in the hustle and tussle of Rome. We would definitely stay again and would certainly recommend for those with families or those wanting to enjoy the peaceful side of Rome. Thank you Maurizio and Paolo for making the experience so memorable!!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second time at Appia Antica Resort because everyone there is accommodating, knowledgeable and helpful. The organization of all my activities in Rome are taken care of by them, plus I know their recommendations are always a positive experience. The location, setting and décor of the apartment is superb. I hope to go back again.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Maurizio and Julia were so knowledgeable, helpful and accommodating. The apartment was clean and impeccably decorated. We wish we could have stayed longer. You do not find this attention to detail at most other hotels.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for several days this month and cannot say enough good things. The bedding, the gardens, the furnishings and most of all the people were perfect!Julia was so kind and recommended wonderful restaurants and activities during our stay. She drove us the to local ATM herself and took us to the phone store and assisted with our purchases there. It is like having a helpful family available to you during your stay. We have since moved on in our travels in Italy and all agree Appia Antica was our favorite!
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful property at a great price. The owner and staff were so helpful recommending places to visit and eat. Location is as good as it gets. Just outside the main city of Rome and amazing places to visit close by that may be missed by people who are looking at guidebooks and just visiting the city itself. The Appia Antica and the Aquadotte a must to visit.
hotelName:
26    Appia Antica Resort
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Althea Inn has a lovely spacious room (especially for Rome) with a modern bathroom and an amazing roof terrace. Alessandro is such a gracious and helpful host and personally served us wonderful breakfasts with coffee, fresh orange juice, fresh fruit and Italian paninis on the terrace. Good local restaurants- don’t be put off by the exterior look! Very convenient for local buses and trains. A wonderful stay!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a Fabulous apartment with superb relaxing terrace. The breakfast brought to the room every morning is superb and the staff friendly and so welcoming. Comfortable beds and space. We had a lovely girly weekend - thank you!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights at the end of May. We found it on Tripadvisor and we have to agree with all the positive comments: Althea Inn is a lovely place to stay! We had the Da Vinci suite, which has a bathroom with large marble shower. The terrace is really nice, equiped with a comfy loungeset. Breakfast is served in your room at the desired time. Coffee, fresh orange juice, croissants, bread, fruit,... whatever you like.Alessandro is a terrific host, helping out with transportation, restaurant reservations or any other question you may have. Really top guy!!Piramide subway station is just around the corner and takes you to the city center in no time (although we never used it, you can easily get there walking). Ostiense train station is also really close, it has a direct train connection with Fiumicino airport.Overall, we had a great time at the Althea Inn and would reccomend it to everyone without hesitation!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My mom and I had the opportunity to stay at Althea on our Italian holiday and we are so glad we did. Prior to our cruise we stayed for a few nights in the Michelangelo suite which has a beautiful balcony with a swing and after we stayed in the DaVinci suite. Both rooms are impeccable and well dressed. Our favorite though was the DaVinci- we just enjoyed the lay out and the balcony on this one a little better, but that’s just our personal preference. The rooms were very clean and had everything you could possibly hope for and more. Alessandro, the owner, is what made our stay the most memorable. He was very kind and went out of his way to help us with everything we needed. When I was feeling under the weather he even offered to go to the pharmacy for me. Anna was also terrific, very accommodating and friendly. I know Italian coffee is amazing but somehow Alessandro’s coffee was better than anywhere else I went. I don’t know how but he must have a secret recipe! His in-room breakfasts were delicious and fresh. This hotel is a real treat. I look forward to getting back there someday.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 8 nights at Althea Inn and will highly recommend it to friends and relatives. Alessandro is a gracious host, recommending and reserving restaurants for us, offering to help with reservations. We enjoyed having a tray delivered every morning for breakfast. One day we left on an early morning day trip before breakfast and he provided granola and a sandwich to bring along for the train. The location was ideal, near a subway stop with convenient buses also. There is a train to Ostia Antica to visit ruins and then go on to a sea side restaurant for lunch. This is a gem in the city and Alessandro was a pleasure to meet, as well as the housekeeper Anna. I would love to visit again.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I strongly recommend this place to couples who wants to have a very peaceful moment. The rooms are very beautiful and comfortable, and the terraces are simply the best of the place. The service is very good and the people that works there is very kind and attentive.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This apartment is really fantastic. The location is close 2 (km) to the city center. We had the Dolce Vita room. Host Alessandro is very kind, received us with a nice prosecco. He arranged taxi shutlle from the airport to apartment. We used his free bike rental service. The breakfast was great, served at our room. The minibar was complementary. The last day he arranged the taxi shuttle for us back to the airport. Rome is great, this apartment made it fantastic.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, which we stayed at before leaving on a cruise from Rome. The hotel's name and description led me to believe that there was a common roof terrace accessible by all guests. We were on this trip for the first night of our wedding anniversary vacation. When we booked, no room was available that had a private terrace, but as I mentioned, I was surprised that there was no common terrace for use. We may not have stayed here if we had realized that in advance, but the host was very kind and gracious to us. He brought up complimentary wine and some lovely pastries for our evening, not only because of our anniversary but I think because we didn't get the terrace room we were seeking.We enjoyed the breakfast, and the decor of the room was nice as well. We enjoyed being in a non-touritsy neighborhood, and enjoyed checking out the nearby pyramid, coffee shops and restaurants. We could easily get everywhere we needed by the nearby metro station.I recommend the hotel. Try to book a room with a terrace.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our 8 day stay at Althea Inn, Alessandro was very helpful and gave us information on good restaurants in the area, things to see outside the main tourist destinations and where to shop for specific items. The room and bed were great, breakfast was wonderful - always fresh ingredients and delivered to the room at our specified time each morning. Anna had our room clean and tidy each day and was also very pleasant! The location was great for us, outside the main tourist area and Bus 23 gets you to central Rome and the Vatican in a matter of 15 - 20 minutes although can be crowded certain times of the day. The Inn is roughly a 7 minute walk from the Roma Ostiense train station. The entrance to the building is non-descriptive, don't let that concern you, the Inn is on the 5th floor. Will definitely stay at the Althea Inn again when we visit Rome in the future.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Althea Inn roof terrace in February this year. Everything about the place is absolutely fantastic. Alessandro was the perfect host gave us good recommendations for restaurants and served a lovely buffet breakfast each morning. The rooms with terraces are superb with a good bed. The hotel is in the testaccio area not far from the circus maximus and colosseum. Foodie market a few minutes away with numerous food stalls and fresh produce. I would recommend this place to all my friends.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I just completed our stay at Althea Inn. What an amazing find! We were even given a welcoming gift upon our arrival.Beautiful, updated rooms with all the amenities of a 5 star hotel. Alessandro was so friendly, attentive and welcoming from the moment we got there. Breakfast was amazing and Alessandro checked each evening prior on the time we would like breakfast delivered. Bed was extremely comfortable and linens changed daily. There are so many wonderful places to visit nearby and the metro is less than 5 minute walk. We are looking forward to our next stay in Rome and will definitely be staying at Althea Inn again.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great apartments in a great location for easy transport links to and from Rome’s amazing sites. Alessandro is a perfect host, nothing is too much trouble, giving good advice on travel, places to eat and places to see. We would highly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Alessandro is the perfect host, always there, always responsive, and great tips for restaurants, transportation, and in general navigating the sometimes overwhelming and confusing city of Rome. Althea Inn combines 5 star service with authentic charm. I've never been in a place where the host is so present and authentic, and yet not at all intrusive. We loved staying in Testaccio, which is out of the madness of so much of Rome...a real neighborhood--and a five minute walk from all the public transportation you need, so that anything you want to see in Rome is easy to get to, and easy to get away from.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B is amazing and I cannot wait to stay here again on my next trip to Roma. My daughter and I stayed 2 nights here. Alessandro the owner and manager, is amazing. He can teach a class in customer service. We felt like royalty in our lovely top floor apartment with a huge terrace. We love Testaccio, and the location is perfect--super easy to walk to all our fsvorite restzurants. Our room was large, super clean, and very well appointed. Elegant decor. Super comfortable beds and bedding, Alessandro went out and purchased brand new foam pillows since I am allergic to down feathers. The place is super safe and quiet. Very safe entry. Elevator that works. Breakfast is served in the room, excellent options and coffee was terrific. Alessandro helped us with dinner reservstions, ride to airport, and he helped us when we arrived 4 hours too early. He made sure the room was cleaned as soon as possible and even served us breakfast. Grazie mille! I highly recommend this B&B.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this B&B on Trip Advisor and the reasonable price and 5 star reviews sold us. It was the best place we stayed during our Europe trip. Alexander, the owner, gave us attention from the moment we booked. He was in communication welcoming us and offering his assistance. He is the real deal! Our flight was canceled at the last minute and he refunded that night, which we greatly appreciated. He greeted us at the door upon our arrival, helped with our luggage and showed us our quaint room. It was very clean and inviting. Due to the long travel to get there, I immediately took a shower, and it was luxurious! You will see what I mean, when you go! The bed was comfy and the room was so quiet. There were no "English" tv stations, so my husband didn't keep me awake with the tv on! There was even chocolate on our pillow! Alexander brought us a delicious breakfast each morning, to our room, where we sat at a nice table and enjoyed a cappuccino, croissants,fresh fruit, cured meat and bread. It was more than enough to get us going for whirlwind tours. Alexander gave us a computer print out with a map of what bus, trolley or train to take to each place we visited. All public transit is about a 5 minute walk. It was so easy to get everywhere, and cost 1.5 euros. Although, if you go during "rush hour" it is definitely an experience with the crowds. My husband uses a C-pap machine (for sleep apnea) and needed distilled water. We asked Alexander where we can find that, and within 15 minutes, he was at our door, with a bottle he bought for us! Now that is service! There are lots of restaurants around the Althea with delicious Italian food. Alexander gave us a list of places we could try Right around the corner is Conrads - a well stocked grocery store. We were delighted with the price of beer and wine there, as well as pizza and pastries! I sat our on our balcony reading a few times, which was pleasant, although not a great view! The neighborhood is not the best, but once you are inside the building, you feel like you are in a palace! There are so many places to choose in Rome, but this place felt like home. Take my advice, book the Althea Inn Roof Terrace, and rest assure you will feel safe and rested, and Alexander will take care of any concerns you may have. Enjoy Rome. It's an incredible city. We can't wait to go back and explore more! And of course, stay at the Althea Inn Roof Terrace!!! Thank you again, Alexander, you are definitely the BEST :-)
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a truly excellent little find. The rooms are spotlessly clean and comfortable. We had an extra bed put in our suite and it was absolutely fine. The roof terrace was a delight even though it was February and a bit chilly. Alessandro is the perfect host - he is kind, thoughtful without being intrusive. He provided us with a list of local restaurants - the recommendations were excellent. Ths a fantastic area with outstanding local food including a superb gelateria run by an elderly woman tucked away down a back street. Don't be put off by the distance on the map - it takes only 15 minutes to walk to Circus Maximus. It really is worth it.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A place that made Rome a even better experience! Like sleeping at home but with a dedicated and special service! Alessandro made is best to ensure that we had the best time at Althea and in Rome.We loved the room, the bed and the personalised breakfast that was served every morning at our room. We were even surprised, by a little breakfast that was left in the room, the last night before we leave for the airport at 4.30 AM.Amazing!Grazie Mille Alessandro, Ciao
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in the first week of November 2018. It is situated in a quiet very safe street on the fifth floor of an apartment building. There is a good lift to the hotel itself. The area has many good restaurants, the owner providing a list of his recommendations. We tried three on the nights we were there, Osteria Fratelli Mori, Trattoria Pennestri and Pizza Remo (this pizza restaurant is a must, such a wonderful surprise) all were just fantastic Italian cooking. Alessandro's hospitality and attention to detail are superb, nothing is too much trouble. The room was modern with a most comfortable bed, and feather pillows. The bathroom was of a reasonable size with a good shower. We had a room with an outside space but unfortunately the day we arrived there had been a heavy shower and the cushions were soaked, so it was not possible to sit on the terrace. The breakfasts, delivered to your room were wonderful, with fresh fruit, ham, cheese, fresh orange juice, croissants and coffee. It took about 30 minutes from the hotel to walk into the centre of Rome, mainly along the river Tiber. It is easily accessible from the main Rome airport using the local train service and then a short 10 minute walk. We would certainly recommend the hotel for a stay in Rome and if we return we shall certainly stay again.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the Althea Inn Roof Terrace!!! I can't believe I'm just getting around to writing a review from our September stay; (sorry Alessandro!). Alessandro is the absolute best host. I feel like he takes his guests under his wing, making sure you have everything you need for a good stay, including making restaurant reservations, calling for taxis, offering welcome beers, waters and prosecco in the honor bar and offering great recommendations in the non-touristy Testaccio neighborhood of Rome. We were in Rome such a short time and didn't get to see ALL of the sites, but we did get to experience a real Roman neighborhood with great restaurants, a fun vibe and an amazing artisan market (my favorite!) The room was bright and clean and beautifully decorated, and of course, the terrace was amazing; the highlight. So nice to have breakfast, delivered to the room each morning, on the beautiful terrace, which is why I booked this stay. In fact, Alessandro's small B&B is booked most of the time so I actually began our two week itinerary in Italy around availability for this lovely penthouse accomodation. Absolutely happy we did! And the value???!!! Shhhh…! We would have paid much more. If it's available, book it!!!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice block ideal location only two stops from the collosium,easy airport run train or fixed price taxi. Clean comfortable rooms and nice helpful hosts good restaurants and a couple of bars. A handy little supermarket shop nearby and a very good local market.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Having read abouth the Althea Inn Roof Terrace in a number of publications, we decided to stay. What a pleasant surprise. Classical bedroom suites (with superb shower room and terrace), sumptiously comfortable bed and spotlessly clean (thank you Anna). The rooms were quiet and well placed, so it is a santuary in the hussle and bustle that is Rome.The host, Alessandro, was very welcoming, helpful and informative. He was never intrusive, but always available and did his utmost to ensure that we had a great holiday. The breakfast (served to your room) is wonderful. The location is downtown Rome, which means that everything is reasonably priced and good quality and it is easy to get to all the sights eithet by Metro or walk - the Tiber is 700m away.Thoroughly recommended.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just finished a fantastic stay in the Althea Inn. We’ve been to Rome before and this time wanted a location just outside the hustle and bustle...this was perfect. It’s a 5 min walk from Roma Osteria (train from airport) and 5 mins from nearest metro station. It’s a 20 min walk to the Colosseum or Trastevere, which we really enjoyed. Was great to see Testaccio and enjoyed some lovely meals there.The Althea Inn has everything you need for a comfortable stay, the room was well appointed, but what was fantastic was the terrace outside...A lovely spot of tranquility to enjoy breakfast or a drink on an evening.The thing that really made the most difference was the hospitality of the owner Alessandro. He delivered a lovely breakfast to the room at your chosen time, and even brought us a second coffee 10mins later. He was happy to provide local insight which was much appreciated. All in all, a great break and was very much enhanced by the Althea Inn and Alessandro. Will visit again
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in a residential part of Rome, Althea Inn offers clean, quiet, well furnished rooms. Although on the 5th floor access is easy via a lift and you are buffered from street noise.There is the added bonus of a private, well furnished terrace.Close to bus lines and train stations you are well placed to take advantage of the good public transport system. There are also many excellent restaurants close by and a large branch of Eataly not far away. The host, Alessandro, was very welcoming, helpful and informative. He was never intrusive but always available. He made getting to the airport an enjoyable experience!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All recent reviews have said it all. If you are looking at the Althea Inn Roof terrace website, trying to decide where to stay in Rome, then look no further. Book here. It’s a real oasis. Delightful Alessandro will look after you really well, answer all your queries and bring you a delicious breakfast to eat on your own private roof terrace. Freshly squeezed orange juice, espresso or cappuccino, fresh fruit salad, lovely bread and prosciutto, jam and croissants. Lovely room and comfortable bed and really quiet. It’s very close to the metro- Pyramide- and buses and trams ( use the Citymapper app on your phone to find out how to get anywhere). And close to the Stazione Ostiense for a direct train from Fiumincino airport. ( details on the Althea Inn website)There are no other tourists in Testaccio and the area might appear a bit scruffy- but there are so many wonderful restaurants within a 5-10 minute walk ( all listed on Althea website- we tried most of them and particularly loved Flavio Velavevodetto).What more to say?! Oh- so reasonably priced too. Stay here.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great place to stay. Not to far from city centre and attractions, rooms were very well presented, spotless, immaculately clean - the cleaning lady also did a great job in keeping the room clean and tidy. Our host was so helpful and friendly - very nice guy. I can't fault this place for the money. Great breakfast every morning, and also had the use of 2 well maintained bikes for 5 days. Host even offered us a free ride to the train station....thank you was such a lovely break.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We couldn’t have made a better choice to stay in Rome for the weekend. The location is perfect, away from the tourist areas, but very close to bus stop and subway minutes away from the center of Rome. Great Restaurantes in the area to try genuine Italian food The decoration and the details of the room are just what you need to spend some nights comfortable in Rome. The details of the breakfast that Alexander brings everyone morning to your room is just what you need to start a day full of energy. Fresh coffee, fresh fruit, fresh squeezed orange juice and fresh bread (our request) all great. Cleary a place to choose in Rome.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our four nights at Althea Inn Roof Terrace in Rome! We arrived around 9:30am straight off a red-eye from the US and were completely exhausted. Although it was too early for our room to be ready, Alessandro and his team were able to get our room ready for us several hours before check-in so we could take a much-needed nap. Our room (Da Vinci Suite) was absolutely perfetto! Comfortable bed, and the private outdoor terrace was gorgeous and a wonderful spot to relax between touristing around Rome. Bathroom was also gorgeous, and had its own set of doors onto the terrace. The inn and room were spotlessly clean. The breakfast, served personally by Alessandro on our private terrace each morning, was incredible! Croissants (your choice of plain or filled... the chocolate-filled were to die for), hard-boiled eggs, prosciutto, freshly-squeezed orange juice (and I am from Florida, this juice was the real deal), cappuccinos, toast; breakfast was just perfect! Don’t be turned off by the inauspicious neighborhood... at first glance, the area seems a little gritty, but it’s a safe, quiet but bustling neighborhood filled with Romans... tourists, not so much. It’s a very authentic Roman experience! While a bit away from the main Rome tourist hotspots (Trevi Fountain, Vatican City, etc), Colosseum was walkable within 20 minutes, and we also walked from Trevi Fountain in about 30 minutes. It’s also right by a Metro stop (Pyramide) and several bus lines. From Althea, nothing in the city was more than a half hour away either by transport or on foot. Trastavere is just across the river, and the wonderfully authentic Testaccio Market is just a few blocks awayA few notes (not detractions at all, just helpful planning items for other travelers): there’s not really a lobby area or area to relax outside your room... but if you have a private terrace in your room, it’s nothing you will miss. The room didn’t have an iron and ironing board but that was seems in line with most places in Europe, and it didn’t turn out to be an issue at all. We were too busy exploring to worry about wrinkles! The Inn is on the 5th floor (US 6th floor, but it will be marked 5) of an apartment building, and can be a little tricky to find at first. The Inn is unobtrusively marked on the building callbox, and once you get in the building and on the elevator, go to 5, then turn to your right and the main desk is through the door marked Althea Inn. The door may be shut... just knock! We definitely walked around in a sleep-deprived daze when we first arrived trying to find it inside the building. Thank you Alessandro for a lovely stay! If we’re ever in Rome again, we will be back!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks again to Alessandro for such great hospitality during our 2 night stay. He went out of his way to make our stay more pleasant - helped us with restaurant reservations, storing our luggage for an extra day, booking airport travel and even preparing some breakfast before an early departure. We loved staying in a real Rome neighborhood outside the city center and living like locals for a weekend. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not give any negatives about this little jewel. When you arrive Alessandro meets you, carries your cases upto your room. He had arranged the transfers from the Airport. If you know Rome the Train and Metro are a short walk from the hotel, so you could use this if you are comfortable doing so. He then spent time explaining the facilities and talking about the local area, then he gives you as much info about Rome you want or need. He was always helpful and tried to steer you in the best way to make your stay as great as possible. He even had bicycles to use, but unless you are used to riding around roads that are irrational to say the least, don’t try it. But the public transport is only 500 meters away, very cheap 7 euros a day to travel on the Metro, trams and buses who needs a bike.Alessandro brought breakfast every morning which was filling even though it seemed there wasn’t a lot to eat. Very tasty and a great start to the day.If you needed anything during your say he was on hand to help.Rome was tiring but a tick of the list. We stayed for 3 days but to see everything I would say at least 5 days is needed. Although we did see the top 10 places and more. But enough said about Rome.This oasis is a lovely place to stay.Recommend to all.Alessandro thanks again for all your helpMr and Mrs BullockWiganEngland
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stumbled upon Althea Inn while doing a Google Maps search for something else, but I'm very glad that I found it. It's one of the best rooms I've seen based on pictures, way better than most 4-star hotels in Rome. It didn't disappoint - the room is as expected: homey yet modern. Althea Inn is the whole of Level 5 of an apartment building. It has an old-school elevator, which is ok, but I have to mention that it's a bit of a squeeze. It can fit 4 Asian-sized tourists without bulky luggages/shopping bags. Don't be put off by its location. It is just outside Rome's walls, and bus stops and the train station to Rome's must-sees are just 5 minutes away (max) by walking (e.g. Colosseo is just 2 train stations away). The area is also close to good local restaurants. Gelateria La Romana, the best gelato shop in Rome, is just a few minutes away, but I digress! Alessandro, the owner, was very helpful and proactive even before we checked in. He made sure that everything we require has been organised for us. Breakfast was included in our booking, and he serves this every morning. Italy isn't exactly known for breakfast food, but the best ones we had are from Althea Inn. I can't recommend this place enough! I will definitely book with them if I ever go back to Rome.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There is nothing impressive about the Althea from the outside, but don't let that fool you. Everything about this B&B is first class. Alessandro, the owner, not only met us and explained how to operate everything, he went beyond by recommending restaurants and even making the reservations for us. Our room had new furnishings and a very comfortable bed. And an air conditioner that actually put out cold air, something you can't always count on in Rome. Althea is an easy walk from public transportation which was remarkably easy to use. Oh, and the breakfast was excellent.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We originally stayed during our visit to Rome 6 years ago and have decided to re book this time around as we had a wonderful experience last time.It was great to see that the service received was just as amazing. Breakfast in the morning was wonderful and Alessandro has catered to all our needs, admittedly we had fair few requests. We have chosen a smaller room in this visit, and regretted having the larger room with two large suitcases and two big personalities! If you are looking for an authentic Roman experience staying in the residential area, but very close to all of the sights, go no further!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at the Althea while spending a long weekend in Rome and it proved to be an excellent choice. The inn is convenient to a lot of great sites, being only a couple stops from the Colosseum for starters and provides easy access to a lot of the great neighborhoods of central and south Rome. The staff was extremely helpful and readily assisted with every request we made, including arranging car service to the airport. There’s a lot of choices for local food and culture if you’re tired from checking out all the sites. We splurged and picked one of the terrace rooms and it was so worth it! Booking through the hotel website also allowed us to add an included continental breakfast and complementary drinks, both soft drink/water and beer/wine. In regards to transportation it’s tough to beat. It’s within an easy walk of all forms of mass transit, with Piramide metro, Porta S Paolo rail station and the north-south 83 bus line very close by. There was provided a great list of local restaurants in the area as well and you can even borrow a bike to tour around! My wife and I would definitely look at staying here again if/when we come to Rome next!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am in Love with Althea Inn Roof Terrace. Every morning, we received the most amazing breakfast with the wonderful Inn keeper. Our room, had a very comfortable bed, and everything you need; refrigerator; coffee maker; hair dryer; little table to eat; and even a safe to keep our precious items safe while touring the sights. Neighborhood is residential, and a 5 minute drive to the Colosseum. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very happy with this hotel. The rooms are stylish and comfortable, with excellent beds and bedding. Delicious breakfast brought each morning to our small private terrace. Alessandro was an excellent and informative host, guiding us to the area's nice local restaurants (and fabulous local gelateria)! Great to be out of tourist Rome in the evenings, but able to access everything we want to see with a short ride on the metro. Highly recommend.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights in July. We are so happy we chose this place for our stay. Our room was impeccably clean and very nicely designed. The roof terrace, which is private, is lovely as well.Great location for exploring Rome and have some great food in the neighbourhood. Alessandro is very helpful and we really enjoyed the free bicycles. Will definitely stay at the same place again and will recommend it to friends and family. Hope I come back soon again.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The appartments are delightful with their own private terrace where Allessandro brings breakfast each morning. Within easy walking distance of Ancient Rome and, if you don't fancy walking, the Pyramid station. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Althea Inn Roof Terrace is an exceptional property. The rooms are clean, elegant, well furnished and provide all the necessary amenities. We had a room (10 nights) with a terrace which was a perfect place to enjoy a beautiful breakfast delivered personally each morning or to simply relax and enjoy wine in the evening.What really stands out about the property is the excellent customer service provided by the innkeeper and staff and the feeling of comfort they are able to provide.Alessandro, the innkeeper went above and beyond to make our time at the Althea Inn (and my birthday) a memorable one. He was always available to help with restaurant reservations, sightseeing suggestions and transportation...and always with a warm smile!The Inn is located in the Testaccio neighbourhood which is a comfortable walk to many of the sites in central Rome. It is also located within a 5 minute walk to 2 subway stations and a bus stop. If you are a bit of a foodie you will most certainly appreciate the many wonderful restaurants serving authentic Italian fare and the Testaccio Market within minutes of the Inn.If you are reading these reviews and are still on the fence about reserving...don't be! You will not be disappointed. I cannot recommend the inn or the hospitality extended to us highly enough.Thank you Alessandro!!Elizabeth
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friends and I have just returned from a weekend in Rome. We had a beautiful room in the Althea Inn. On arrival I discovered I had the wrong case. The manager - Alessandro - could not have been more helpful. He drove us back to the airport, helped us sort out the situation, waited until we had filled out all the appropriate forms and drove us back to the inn where a chilled bottle of Prosecco was waiting! The room was clean, beautifully designed and had the most amazing roof terrace where we enjoyed a delicious breakfast each morning. The inn is slightly out of town, but still only a 20-30 minute walk to the Colosseum. I cannot recommend the inn - and Alessandro's hospitality - highly enough. A great weekend!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Althea Inn Roof Terrace is only two stops on the metro from the Colliseum. We were so blessed by this place and Alessandro who runs it. My friend accidentally picked up the wrong case at the airport and Alessandro took us back to the airport and helped us over the 3 hours it took to navigate lost and found .We were bought a delicious breakfast of fresh orange, croissant and fresh fruit, along with delicious cappacino. Nothing was too much trouble for Alessandro who works so very hard at looking after his guests. The bedroom was spacious, clean and the bedding and products, attention to detail were fantastic. The most beautiful part was being able to sit on the terrace and have breakfast or wine, and being two stops away from this amazing city. Thank you so much Alessandro we hope to be back. Penny.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B & B is on the top floor of a building, requiring a ride in a very small elevator. Allesandro, the owner, and the staff are pleasant and helpful and the rooms are very comfortable (however I could not get the Italian version of a Keurig to work!) The terrace is attached to only one room, so ask for that room if you want it! Breakfast, as ordered, if brought to your room every morning, and is very good. The location is a good 45 minute walk from the "tourist" area of Rome. There is also a very close Metro stop (Pyramid.) Just spend a bit of time scouting out the station area as it is easy to get turned around with the multiple Metro exits at that stop. The Metro is fun and you can easily get wherever you need to. There are also good restaurants close to the B & B. Initially, I was concerned that we were so far away from the main areas we wanted to visit, but once we got our bearings, the traveling became part of the fun. Thanks for a lovely stay, Alessandro.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved Althea Inn Roof Terrace. Roof terrace offer a great escape from the crowded streets of Rome. Neighborhood has many good reasonable restaurants in walking distance. Hotel is very close to metro and train stations plus has easy access to buses to The Vatican and Rome proper. Easy walk to river and south side of town.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you’re coming to this magical city you must stay here. The superb host Allessandro could not have been more helpful, the rooms with the courtyards were terrific and the breakfasts were so good. His restaurant tip Fratellli Mori in the same street too is a winner. We’ll be telling everyone about this place and plan to stay there next year!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first visit to this wonderful city was more than enhanced by our four night stay at the Althea Inn. Alessandro’s careful attention to detail ensures that his guests feel very special. On arrival, he greeted us with welcome drinks and we were delighted to find the apartment was as lovely as the website shows, immaculately clean, spacious and stylish. Also, despite the dire weather warnings of rain and thunderstorms promised for the duration of our stay, we found the beautiful terrace to our room was bathed in sunshine and remained so for our whole stay! We enjoyed perfect weather, sunny but not too hot -so much for weather forecasts! The pretty terrace full of flowers and foliage, was so lovely to return to after a long day sight-seeing, a tranquil haven to escape the noise and bustle of Rome; a happy hour spent swaying on the swinging bench with a Prosecco from the minibar to recharge the batteries and reflect on all the awesome experiences of the day. Also in the mornings...a great area to enjoy breakfast, which is brought to you at a time to suit your day’s itinerary, from 7am onwards. The breakfast is, as so many reviews emphasise, delightful: fresh produce, ample and beautifully presented. Testaccio is a good location. You are surrounded by restaurants and bars, supermarkets and banks, so it couldn’t be more convenient. You have an overland train station at Ostiense, a few minutes walk, that goes straight to Fiumicino Airport, and you are also within 5 minutes walk of the Pyramide metro station- then just a couple of stops direct to the Colosseum! And still, you feel more like a local than a tourist- a proper roman experience. An unforeseen bonus was visiting the very lovely cemetery where Keats and Shelley have their last resting place. It’s just around the corner from the Althea Inn, and I doubt if many tourists are lucky enough to visit.With regard to the more well known sights of Rome, I suggested to Alessandro, prior to arrival, that we would appreciate any advice or recommendations he could offer during our stay. He immediately replied, providing links to attractions and museums which require advanced booking. When we checked there was only two time slots left for us to get tickets for the Vatican Museums and Sistine Chapel, (four days before our arrival-so check it out on the official site if this is as important to you as it was for us). Alessandro saved the day! There is so much more I could write, but I find I rarely read long wordy reviews so better not write one! Althea Inn-fabulous.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Althea Rooftop Terrace B&B is within the walls of Rome. Located in the historic area of Testaccio. There are wonderful restaurants, bakeries and coffee shops everywhere. You are also steps away from many historical sites, checkout the pyramid. Alessandro is there to help you with everythihg. He will deliver your breakfast of fresh fruits, juice, meats, bread, croissants and pasteries at a time you select. I recommend having it on the terrace. The terrace is a delightful outdoor room with flowers and vines five stories above the street, and all yours. The property is lovely clean and well maintained, and you will be staying amoung the romans.If you are a walker everything is close enough to walk. If not, you are moments from bus and rail service. And the cab from your doorstep is truly inexpensive.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this lovely, small inn for two nights and could not have made a better choice. I did a lot of research before choosing the Althea Inn and was not disappointed. The inn is in a non-touristy area, yet is well-served by shops and restaurants and a metro stop. My room was very clean, quiet and comfortable. The highlight was the inviting terrace, with comfortable seating, as well as beautiful flowers and foliage adding to the privacy of the terrace. The bright spot of each morning was the delicious, plentiful and artfully-presented breakfast in my room. The inn's proprietor, Alessandro, was always pleasant, helpful, knowledgeable and responsive. I had a wonderful experience at the Althea Inn and would not hesitate to stay there again as well as recommend it to others.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my husband stayed in Althea Inn for six nights in April 2018 and we couldn't have chosen a better place to stay in Rome. Our room was very clean, spacious and beautifully decorated. The private terrace crowned the room and served as a wonderful place to relax (and enjoy a very reasonably priced drink from the minibar!) after spending a day walking in Rome.We loved the location of Althea Inn. The historic centre of Rome was only a few subway stops or a short walk by the river Tiber away, but the masses of tourists or the hustle didn't seem to reach the Testaccio area. Instead, it felt like an area where one gets to sense the true Roman everyday life.Above all, what made Althea Inn so special was the wonderful and friendly staff and our host Alessandro. Alessandro was very helpful, sincere and seemed very much devoted to making every guest enjoy their stay. He even helped our friends from back home to organize a birthday surprise for my husband. The breakfast (served to our room every day) was indeed delicious and clearly made from fresh ingredients; a great way to start the day! Alessandro also gave us very good recommendations of the restaurants in the area; delicious dinners right next door and a lot more reasonably priced than in downtown Rome.We would like to thank Alessandro and his staff for a truly nice and memorable stay in Rome, we will definitely be back!Rosanna & Tommi
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four nights at Althea Inn and I would definitely stay again if we return to Rome. Alessandro was so helpful with travel tips and restaurant recommendations, and he was so gracious about our inability to speak Italian. we loved the Testaccio area of Rome and especially the local farmers market, a five minute walk away. It's also close to a subway and train station to get to all the other sites but it's also within walking distance to most everything.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we arrived at Althea we felt so welcome and absolutely loved our time here. The rooms and breakfast are both beautiful and it is in the perfect area to get a proper Italian feel without bumping into any other tourists. Just a short tram or metro away from all the exciting tourist locations. We can't wait to come back again and stay here.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed four nights here and received a warm welcome by firstly by Ana and later Alessandro when we checked in. We took a chance and booked one of the rooms with a terrace despite the late season and we managed to enjoy a couple of afternoons/evenings out there and we could easily imagine the feeling sitting outside during warmer evenings!The room was cosy and charming and with an adjoining mosaic tiled bathroom. The scented soap and shower products was fantastic and refreshing. The bed was firm and comfortable with fantastic pillows according to my taste.The fully loaded breakfast tray spoiled us every day and was great way to start each morning!We took real advantage of the list of restaurants supplied in the room and enjoyed a lot of good food during our stay.The proximity to the Metro station Piramide ensured swift transportation wherever you wanted to go and yet we were in a very calm area of Rome.
