That said there were nice restaurants within walking distance among the list of suggested restaurants in the room.We hope to come back soon to Rome and we know where we would like to rest our legs then as well!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Althea Inn at the end of our 3 week italian honeymoon. Alessandro made our stay very special - the room and terrace is exactly as pictured on the site. He asks you what you’d like for breakfast the night before and brings it direct to your room the next morning - high quality food and delicious freshly squeezed orange juice. As we were on honeymoon Alessandro also gave us a bottle of wine and patisserie which was a lovely surprise. He took the time to suggest fun non touristy things to do in the area and arranged to be at The properly for our luggage being collected the day after we left. Thank you for a lovely stay - we will definitely be booking again next time we are in Rome!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Allessandro is an excellent host. He always went above and beyond our expectations! He set us up for breakfast even on days when we had tours at 6:30am! He would bring us fresh fruits and delicious croissants the night before so we could have them for breakfast the next morning. He allowed us to use a local cell phone for the day after we missed a tour meeting time, so we could find the tour guide on site. The bikes made for a great relaxed site seeing experience 2 days during our 7 day visit. You can book the hotel directly on their website too. I would come back here anytime.
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived, we didn't know what to think. No big sign, just a doorway on the street. When we emerged from the tiny, charming elevator, we were offered cappuccinos and cookies. The room was immaculate and stylish. Bed was super comfortable with many pillows. Even the shower was amazing. We can't say enough about how well we were treated. The owner personally gave us a ride to the airport at 4:00am!
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights to enjoy the wonders of Rome and wouldn't hesitate to go back. Everything was quality. The room, the cleanliness, the service, the breakfast, the wifi, the location and the host. What's more it is located in a very cool area of Rome with terrific restaurants
hotelName:
27    Althea Inn Roof Terrace
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room has good size. The location is very central, with the taxi stand across the street. Very close to Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain. We walked everywhere, except the Vatican, which we took the taxi there, and took the metro back. Recommended!
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is big and well equipped (but the tv that wasn't always working, but we didn't really care). It's well located (close to the metro line going to the Vatican).The service is great: they even booked us a restaurant for the night of our arrival as there was no online reservation and my italian is well too limited.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Classic Roma is in a great location within walking distance of the Spanish Steps and The Trevi Fountain. A taxi to the Vatican was 8 euro. We even walked to the Borghese Gardens. Alessio was extremely welcoming and very helpful. (Saturnia is stinky - you were right x). Breakfast was generous and the rooms spotless. Great place to stay.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here just one night on the way out and it was fabulous. The gentleman at check in was so helpful and friendly. The rooms are excellent, clean, modern and just perfect.The location is excellent too close to everything. I would come back here. Plus the price is right.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four nights at classic Rome Hotel! We really enjoy time there! it’s Very Good hotel. Excellent location, couldn’n been better! Very Nice, modern and clean rooms. Nice view to the street. Breakfast was good, There was everything You need! I even got gluten free breakfast! We can recommend this hotel! Good hotel for the price!
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband, nine yr. old granddaughter and I stayed here for 3 nights. It's in the center of Rome and walking distance to most of the monuments and shopping districts. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished. Even though it's located in a very busy area we weren't bothered by any street noise at all, it was very quiet. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We plan to return to Rome for a much longer stay (three days in simply not enough!) and we plan to return to The Classic Roma.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel because of the good reviews from Tripadvisor. We stayed in The Classic Roma for 1 night as our post cruise before heading back home.The location of this hotel is in an old building. Their rooms are located in the 1st and 2nd floors. About 4-5 big rooms per floor. The hotel is situated very near Spanish Steps (2 blocks away and you will be either at the foot of the spanish steps or at the top area). Also, it is very near the Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona. There is a mini supermarket (expensive) where you can purchase drinks and some snacks. Mc Donalds is just few steps away as well. There is a Bar and a restaurant beside it as well. Sephora is just around the corner.The room is big with aircondition and tv (english included). Bathroom is also nice with amenities included including slippers.Breakfast was provided which includes 3 kinds of meat and egg, pastries and bread, coffee, juices, yogurts, fruits and milk. Everything is wonderful EXCEPT the lift starts at 0 level. It is not in the ground level meaning, you need to use stairs to bring your luggages up(checking in) and down (checking out). After the stairs everything is okay. I love the hotel but i can’t recommend it for older people or PWD as there are no provisions for them. Other than that, this hotel is perfect. Love the interior, love the personnel, the location, the breakfast and even the small lift (very old fashion).Tip: coming out of the building, turn right and walk 2 blocks. After 2 blocks, turn left and you’re at the top of the Spanish Steps. Nice view from the top.Tip 2: Near Mc Donald’s, there’s a Coop supermarket (turn right), you can purchase your snacks and drinks there. Way way cheaper than buying across the mini mart.Tip 3: go to the main road and cross the street, you will be in Trevi Fountain.Tip 4: don’t buy your souvenirs in Trevi Fountain, streets leading to Spanish Steps are cheaper (magnets and keychains only €1 @).
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small, but very nice hotel. Clean, comfortable beds and spacious rooms with great bathroom. Straff very hospitable and smiling. Only minutes away from the Spanish steps, the Trevi Fountain, Barberini and Villa Medici with the most beautiful park area, and shopping districts. Taxi station and subway just around the corner. Lots of restaurants in the area. I stayed with my teenage son, he enjoyed it just as much. Next time in Rome, this is the place I will be booking!
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my wife recently stayed at the classic Rome for the rugby six nations and I have to say we could not fault this hotel and plan to return there on our next visit. The staff are so helpful the rooms are kept spotless and are set out so nice. The hotel itself is very central with the Trevi fountain 5 mins one way and the Spanish steps less than 10 mins the other. With a taxi rank literally right outside for your return to the airport or they will order you a private car if that's what you prefer. Thanks guys you made our weekend even better Andy n Gillian x
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Classic Roma was excellent. We were a family with 2 teenage children and accomodation was perfect. Room was large and had 2 large single beds for the children. Room was spotlessly clean and had excellent wifi.The staff were amazing and would do everything to assist.Breakfast was reasonable for the price EUR6 if not included in room rate.Location was great and a short walk to all historic sites and transport.Highly recommended and would definitely return.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location, spotlessly clean rooms, friendly staff. It has all the basics that you will need while visiting Rome. A little hard to find at first but if you follow google maps it will take you straight to the front door. First impressions aren't great but it just shows you shouldn't judge a book by its cover, it's like a little hidden gem in the centre of Rome. Situated right in the middle of two metro spots it's easily accessed. Breakfast is only €5 per person and just a typical continental brekkie, fruit, cereal, pastries, coffees & juices. Would recommend to family and friends
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is our first (but not last) time in The Classic Roma. It’s location is just perfect, walking distance to everything! The room and bathroom are clean and nice. The staff are very friendly and kind. They all speak english which is a big plus. The breakfast was lovely with lots of different things to eat. Everything from sweet to bread, ham, müsli and yoghurt. We will be back soon!
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my 3rd visit to Rome in 2 years so I knew I wanted a convenient location in the heart of the city for the 4 night-5 day visit with my adult daughter. The Classic Roma was a perfect choice - it's just off a main intersection of Via Francesco Crispi and Via Tritone - makes it easy to find your way back.. Places like this are usually mid-block - I always look at google earth when doing my planning to see where the front door is. In this case, the Sephora store is on the corner, then a restaurant, then the front steps of Classic Roma. From the sidewalk there are 2-3 steps to the front door and once inside another 4-5 steps and then down the hallway to the elevator. It's a one person w/luggage kind of elevator, so we did the stairs. Across the street there is a Deutsche Bank with ATM access and a taxi stand. It's only 2 blocks from Fountain of Trevi which we visited at different times during our stay. We were just a 15 minute walk to Villa Borghese which was also on our list of places to visit. It's so convenient walking to all the major sights - from Piazza Popolo to the Coliseum, Piazza Navona and the Pantheon. If you're sightseeing, it's a good choice.We stayed in Room 6 which was on the street..a little noisy but we bring ear plugs, so wasn't a problem. I'd rather have a view with a little noise than look at a building wall. I believe there were just 6 rooms total. Our room was pretty basic, clean and comfortable but that's fine with us as we are only there to sleep. Breakfast was served in a dining room across from our room. A nice selection of pastries, fruit, coffees, juices, eggs were hard boiled and scrambled. The twin beds we requested were fine - a little firm as most Italian beds are - extra blankets and pillows were nice to have. No problems with the bathroom. I liked that that were several local restaurants, not just touristy places to dine in the evening.. We were very pleased with our stay at Classic Roma.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, walking distance to main attractions (5 minutes walk from the Trevi Fountain!) and local restaurants. Very helpful reception. Room was a good size, simple, but clean. Bed was a sofa bed so not really suitable for a long stay, but was ok for the 3 nights we were there. Brilliant to have a full Sky package but a shame that only 2 channels were English! We were on the 2nd floor and the road was very noisy, but for the price of the hotel and the central location it was to be expected.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is hard to find but once you find it you will be surprised of the rooms and decoration . The rooms are large , clean and well decorated ,Except for the super hard bed. Another guest house that has never felt a real hotel bed and bedding. You get a rock hard bed and a top sheet. No cozy comfort after a long day of walking. I wish they invested in a mattress topper or a more comfy inevitable cozy bed. Otherwise everything else was fabulous . Location is fantastic . No onsite parking but we got lucky and found street parking for 7 euro for 24 hrs . Staff are really nice.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was in the heart of Rome. It was near the Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps, Pantheon, shopping center and all the great restaurants. It was also walking distance from the subway station. The hotel itself is nice. Very old fashion. The only downfall during our stay was their old school elevator was out of service so we had to carry our heavy luggage up three flights of stairs. And the hotel isn’t the most modern because they still use regular keys to lock up the doors. They did serve breakfast everyday. Breakfast consisted of eggs, meats, and cheeses. They also served coffee and juice. Overall the hotel staff was very helpful in helping us get around. They provided us with maps and restaurant recommendations as well.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed there for 3 nights. The room was clean, it's very good located, the staff is very friendly and I really loved the breakfeast !! The price is a bit expensive but it's normal if you compare with other hotels. I can stay there during my next visit.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay! Staff was nice, breakfast was great! Airport service was there upon arrival and very nice. Taxi station is across the street and very convienant. Could be a bit noisy at night but that is because you are in the heart of town. The location couldn't have been better, and felt very safe. More like a bed and breakfast feel.Cons: Could not get the AC to work and the beds were not the best not we made out fine! We were able to open the windows and had nice weather but would be concerned if it were summer time.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited last month with my boyfriend and my family and we all had a lovely time. The hotel is very clean, the rooms are large and the staff were lovely, giving us a map of the city and showing us where all of the attractions were. The location was brilliant for us and allowed us to walk almost everywhere! The breakfast was also very nice and each room contained a very well priced mini bar! Overall we really enjoyed our stay here and would stay here again our next time in Rome.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've been to Rome several times before and stayed in hotels in other areas, such as Trastevere and Termini, which were all great too. But The Classic Roma had everything we wanted. We had a big spacious, very clean, and comfortable room. Breakfast (not included in our package) was purchased for only 5 Euro and you get a simple but filling buffet of coffee, meats, cheese, cereals, some salad and juices. It's location was very convenient. You were practically at the center of Rome. Fontana di Trevi was less than 5 minutes away. All the others were walking distance. Barberini Metro was also 5 minutes away. A big plus was the helpfulness of the receptionists. Giorgio, though he knew we've been to Rome before, still gave us lots of tips and suggested new sites to visit. He made checking in and out smooth and convenient. Elena, the other receptionist, too was helpful . When we asked her to make a restaurant reservation at La Taverna dei Fori Imperiali, she promptly called and we were able to got the last table for the night. Another receptionist was also helpful in booking us a taxi. They were all friendly. And to top it all, their rates are so reasonable. Hope to be back here next January to enjoy Rome and bring our friends.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfectly situated approx. 10-15min walk from Trevi Fountain, The Pantheon and Navarone Piazza. All the main attractions are asily walkable from this hotel, The coliseum is a lovely 20 min walk through the bustling city sights as is The Vatican. Easy walk to Beranini Metro station if you do not feel like walking. The room was nice and comfortable, the breakfast was good value for money and the staff were friendly and helpful. Upon arrival they even took time to show us details of all the main tourist attractions.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel, in the center of Rome, close to all the famous places, very clean and very quiet rooms, nice breakfast very polite staff!!! Nice experience if you want just to have a good sleep in the center!!... I will come again..
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all, this hotel does not look like a hotel as it's on two levels in a block of flats . However there is a lift and the location is excellent, just a stone's throw from the Trevi Fountain and the Spanish Steps. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and for €5, breakfast was a very good deal in an expensive city. I would certainly be happy to go there again.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a perfect location for exploring Rome. It is right down the street from Barberini Metro Station and so close to walk to Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. The location is the best part about the hotel.The people were very nice and pleasant too.The not so nice things about the hotel follow. The room was extremely small, even by Rome standards. The bed was so tiny that my husband's feet hung off the end of the bed. There was about one foot between the bottom of the bed and the wall. One There was not alot of room for luggage. There was a closet and one luggage stand. We used the small desk for our other luggage and there was no room for our carry ons.The shower was so small that you could not bend over to pick up something if it fell. It had a rain head shower, but there was no way to get out from the water because of space. Shaving your legs was impossible in it. It also leaked all over the floor outside the shower.The room needs paint desperately.The building itself has peeling paint on the ceiling and broken floor tiles. The hotel occupies only part of the building and the reception is on the 2nd floor. There is an elevator, but if someone happened to leave the manual doors open on another floor, it ceased to operate.Lastly, it is a shame that a hotel that includes breakfast charges for using coffee in the room.We enjoyed our stay, but they should spruce up the entrance and the rooms need paint.
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. Brilliant location. Ideally placed for many tourist attractions. Room was large and well provisioned. Excellent staff that were more than helpful to point out some city do's and don'ts. The breakfast was a little brief and underwhelming but the quality of the room, location and staff knowledgeably more than made up for it.If you're a light sleeper you may struggle - as you are near a rather busy junction....
hotelName:
28    The Classic Roma
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing Guesthouse close to everything. Ladies looking after us were exceptional. So lovely and welcoming. Beautiful croissants and juice/coffee for breakfast. Transport locally situated and short walk to Rome terminus. Helped with my lost luggage and printed off tickets for us. Nothing a problem.Room had aircon which was a blessing. Didn’t hear a peep from any other guests.Would highly recommend and would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cant Express enough how much we enjoyed our stay at Roma Central Guesthouse. From the time we arrived and where greeted with open arms from Dorinda to the almost tearful goodbye at the airport drop off with Camillia. It was an amazing stay, everyone we encountered here was warm and welcoming. Our room was very cozy and kept clean and refreshed daily. The morning breakfast of croissants, coffee or a tasty cappuccino made by Eduardo was delicious.On my next visit to Rome I will definitely be staying here again. It was truly a pleasure.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 4 have spent 4 nights at the Roma Central Guest House... Where do I start? Right from our arrival at the guesthouse, Dorina welcomed us and showed us around giving great advice on sites to visit, restaurants, map and transport options. We have loved our stay here with all the staff being so friendly and helpful going out of their way to make our stay an enjoyable one. Our family room was just like the website pictures which were serviced each morning with a lovely croissant breakfast, tea, coffee and juice offered daily. Even with our early departure Jacinta continued to look after us providing croissants in our room the afternoon prior in readiness for our early morning departure. The kitchen was sufficient for our needs allowing us to buy groceries and fix an easy meal after a big day out. The location is superb being able to walk to Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Colloseum, Coop supermarket and many shops and restaurants within the area. We hope you enjoy your stay as much as our family did!
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you for a lovely stay in Rome and your hospitality. All staff couldn't do enough to help and make our stay as enjoyable as possible. Breakfast was served daily. We particularly appreciated the fresh pastries - even when we had an early flight back they were wrapped and bagged ready for us to takeaway- little touches like this make all the difference! It's a very clean, well kept guest house. Beds are comfy and lovely hot showers. You have the use of a kitchenette if needed. The guest house is located just off the main streets and close to main attractions of the Spanish Steps, Colleseum and Trevi fountain. The Vatican is about an hours walk away too. Not a problem for our family but beware its on the 6th floor with lots of steps!! There is a lift which we used but a little cosy with only two people at a time!!
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location within walking distance of some of the main attractions in Rome. Lovely family room, well presented, comfy beds, clean and a good breakfast to start the day off. Lovely wekcome and well looked after.Beware if you don't lkke lifts though. 6th floor and 2 oerson lift. Wasnt a problem for our trip
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Have walked either to or from (or both) every attraction we visited. 6th floor family apartment. 1 Queen, 3 singles. Own kitchen. Big apartment, kids happy to finally not be on a shared sofa!Not the newest but clean, large & worked well for us. Close also to supermarket and restaurants. Lift up to 6th floor takes 2 people at a time. Gated entry so quite secure. Breakfast consisted of croissants & coffee and was served by a very friendly lady. Would absolutely recommend.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are finishing our holiday in rome and booked here for 5 nights. It's great. A kitchen available for guests to use and a lovely lady who brings breakfast every morning. After 6 weeks away we really appreciated being able to cook some meals. Free wi fi, real coffee, comfortable pillows and beds, all within walking distance to termini, Colosseum and the trevi fountain. Quiet location.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There may be English-speakers on staff, but the 2 people we dealt with only spoke Italian. But the worst thing was that the room has an awful "sewer" smell, especially the bathroom...and the drains were almost totally plugged up. (the source of the smell, no doubt) I would not recommend this place, unless you A. speak some Italian, and B, they give you a guarantee that they got the drains fixed!!
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet location. Perfectly clean and nice. Daily cleaning. Fresh bathroom. Quiet, well functioning air conditioner. (We had 36 degrees celcius in Rome the week we visited but our room was just perfect.) Wi fi not perfect but OK. Breakfast bread in pre packed in plastic, but nice with fridge with juice, butter and jam. Waterboiler. Totally OK. Coffe shops, restaurants, ice cream and pizza places just outside the door. Close to supermarket Coop. Small lift which took two persons at the time. Only one key, which was a bit problematic since we were a family of 4 persons. Maybe we could have fixed that with staff. Didn't think to ask. Very nice staff. Perfect location with walking distance to many attractions. Really worth the price. Would certainly stay here again if I come back to Rome.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A comfy bed is so important when you have a tightly packed schedule. This was comfy with specially good pillows, air con and so quiet. 4 nights - Perfect! We had a supply of pre packed breakfast bits. A fridge with milk, butter, juice though the carton was part used so we didnt as not sure how long it had been open. Tea and proper coffee too. Wi fi was rubbish but there was use of a laptop and printer in the private reception. Not luxury but great for the price and Dorina was so lovely, couldnt be more helpful. Nice restaurants just outside the main door and a mini supermarket and little wine bar. All main attractions close by, we walked to the lit up Colloseum on the first evening. A walk up the main street for buses and metro to anywhere you wish. We had a great time and would recommend staying here.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice comfortable room with everything you need. Although they offer breakfast included it should specify what is offered as they are restricted by local food service regulations and therefore all food offered was pre packed and not fresh daily baked. Plenty of options near by however if you want to go out. All major sights are accessible by walking if you wish. Our host and all staff are fabulous and really nice and will help with whatever information you need.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a lovely guest house! Dorina was wonderful and couldn't be more helpful. A lovely family room with a small balcony and breakfast provided in the room with the option of using the communal kitchen area if we needed to. Very clean and very comfortable beds. A short walk from the train station in one direction and to the Colosseum in the other direction. A lovely ice cream shop opposite the guest house too! Would definitely stay here again if I ever go back to Rome.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Roma Central Guesthouse. It was relatively close to everything. Staying in a guesthouse was new for us. We enjoyed the experience. Doreena and the staff were very friendly and accommodating. The room was clean and comfortable. I liked the cool elevator, if it's not for you you can always use the stairs.Thank you,Kathy C
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved the place, very centric (everything is near by), very clean and neat, but the best of all, Dorina is such a great guest host, extraordinary person, she makes your staying much more simple, highly recommended!
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good welcome and location : 10 minutes by walk of Coliseo, Termini Station and Historic CenterRoom clean and bigVery disappointed by the breakfast : industrial food in a basket in the room.....not very typicalWifi doesn't work in the room but OK at the reception.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this hotel was the location - very close to everything including metro stop, Termini, and Trevi fountain. Good restaurants and gelato nearby, plus a supermarket. It’s hard to find a room for a family of 5 in central Rome for a reasonable price, and we were quite comfortable and had plenty of room (2 adults, 1 teen, and 2 kids). The elevator is small - two people at a time - but it’s the largest that could be retrofitted into the building and I was glad not to walk up 6 flights of stairs! The room was very clean and quiet - we did not see or hear any other guests during our 8 nights. We stayed over Easter and they left a lovely basket of candies and pastries in our room for Easter Sunday (see photo).The bathroom - often had a sewer smell that must be from old plumbing and unavoidable. It was also narrow - only one person at a time for sure. But again - old building and unavoidable.I was a little disappointed in the breakfast - having stayed in many other European hotels with a breakfast, I was accustomed to a small breakfast room with staff making food, fresh cheese/meats, cereals, yogurts, and such. In this case, there were beverages in the fridge and assorted packaged pastries on the counter. We did not starve of course, but it was different than other European hotels so I want to mention it.Overall we would most certainly stay here again - it was safe, clean, and well-located.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was within walking distanc to Trevi Fountain and Rome Termini for the eurail. The neighborhood was clean, safe and felt upscale with a lot of great shopping. We loved it here and would totally stay again.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great welcome by Dorina. The room was big en clean. Italian breakfast. Don't expect to much of it. Its mostly toast, butter, jam and cakes. But it was wel taken care of and it was nice to have tea and coffee in the room. There was also an fridge in the room with milk, juice and a bottle of wine as a welcome from our host.Every Day the room was cleaned properly. Just put the doorhanger outside.Thank you Dorina and friendly cleaninglady! We had a great time.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked to stay here for May 2019 by mistake instead of 2018 this year. Unfortunately they were fully booked this year and we couldnt stay but what attentive and lovely staff. They contacted us by phone to check the dates and went out of their way to give us a refund (despite this normally not being possible) and were helpful on the phone Once it was all sorted they sent a lovely email. If this is any reflection of the service you get then it seems to be a top choice. Thanks again for kindly rectifying our error and we will keep you in mind for future Rome trips.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As above we were very pleased with the guest house and enjoyed our stay.our visit was complemented by the use of a clean and friendly guest house. I would recommend this guest house to anyone going to Rome
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed here for one night in Rome as we had book our hotel but our flights got change so we had an extra night and booked to stay here. It is in a bit of a funny location and is quite difficult to find at first however our host email you before hand to find out what time they can expect you to take you up to the guest house. To get up to the guest house you have to go up the tiniest lifts so only one at a time with your luggage. When we arrived we were shown to our room and given a tour of the kitchen area which we were free to use with orange juice provide for breakfast in the morning. So our room was great very big it had two double beds in a table plus chairs wardrobes, Tele and our continental breakfast. My husband and I decided to take a bed each to sleep in as it was a long day and whoa they were comfy. The tv was brilliant had a lot of English channels which were on sky so in the evening was great to wind down and relax. The bathroom was quite small and the shower didn’t look great but it was very powerful to use as I just washed my hair before I went to bed. It was in a good location for the trevi fountain and all the shops but would be quite far for the colosseum as I think it was about 45-50 min walk. It was lovely and quiet we barely heard anyone whilst we were there. Good stay
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rome by night is magical and the Imperial Forum not too crowded. After a long walk it was lovely to return to our Guest House. A very good family room with plenty space: usually we feel a bit crowded but not this time. We could prepare our breakfast at 5am as we had to catch a train at 6:30am: milk, coffee, fruit juice, cakes.... Close to Termini Rail Station, Trevi Fountain and Coliseum.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a fab time, the hotel was very friendly and couldn't do enough for us, it was centrally located and was ideal as a base to go visiting the sites, I would definitely stay there again and I will be telling all my friends and family to stay there, thoroughly enjoyed it
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room and hospitality. It had everything that one would need for a couple nights if not more in the heart of Rome. The place was walking distance to everything and uniquely tucked into an older building. Would recommend!
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The film doesn’t seemed like in the website I wasn’t satisfied with the location ... the place of the hotel looks like an old junkies squat. They tried to give me another room that I paid. I reserved for 2night but I didn’t stay there 2nights only one night because the quality was bad
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a clean simple hotel. Room was on main floor so a bit noisy at times but no major complaints level of noise was tolerable. The room was clean and accommodated us 2 adults and a baby well. The proximity to termni station was awesome as we were able to get anywhere and everywhere from here as it is the main transportation hub. The walk was 7 minutes to the hotel and felt safe to walk at night. Good value for the money if ur looking for a clean no frills type of hotel.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice and clean, near the central of Rome. Easy to go anywhere and safe!Staff is friendly and nice. Room is very big and very clean!Hope I can come back again next time. Everything is wonderful and nice!
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent value for money. Close to all the locations that one wants to see when one goes to Rome. Very clean. Facilities were good. Small kitchen equipped with all basic needs that one would need for a small breakfast or snacks.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location when visiting Rome! I would recommend this hotel to friends & family for business or pleasure. I was able to walk to everything and just minutes from the Spanish steps and the Colosseum!
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exceeded expectations - great value - centrally located -10 minutes to Colleseo; short walk to Metro (Vatican); walking distance to most other attractions (Trevi, Patheon, Train from/to airport). Buy a bus/metro pass as you will be walking quite a bit and hopping on the bus is handy and the Metro will help get you around. Breakfast was pastries, coffee and juice.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are well maintained. I was welcomed perfectly well and people are extremely friendly. Clean - except of one or two hairs in the bed -. The lift takes you to the 6th floor. I stayed in a beautiful room. The issue was, that the the room faces a very smelly internal courtyard. It was impossible to leave the window open.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very central so you are able to walk to all the sites worth seeing, cafes and restaurants right outside the guest house, shops and everything else two minute walk away. Nice size room with kitchen and bathroom all very clean. A lady called Dorriena met us there and was very helpful with everything, only ten minute walk from the terrmini (bus and train station). Good value for money and if we go back to Rome would stay here again. thanks for your kind hospitality.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The host was very warm and welcoming. Location is perfect walking distance to the Trevi fountain and the train station. Call host in advance so she can meet you because finding this hotel is a challenge.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its located in the central of Rome, so visiting Colosseum, Pantheon, Trevi Fountain, Roman Forum, Palatine Hill, etc by walk! My daughter & I stayed for 4 nights without any problems and enjoyed very much. The room & restroom are big and quiet. The bed is comfortable.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great value. Friendly staff. Close to the train station and restaurant. There is a fridge in the room and also cable TV, a small balcony with a table and chair and a view of the inside building. A good choice for family trip.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was really clean and nicely decorated. Dorina is such a lovely landlady and very accommodating. She has been really helpful and even had our luggage left with her for a day. She has even booked our taxi to the airport.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Also very close walking distance to most of the historical sightsStaff are very welcoming although spoken English is minimalLuggage storage is available for a few hours at no extra cost.Room is very clean but very basic
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had 2 days in Rome. This hotel fit all of our needs. The location is great with good restaurants nearby. You can walk to the Colosseum easily, but recommend a taxi to the Pantheon area which is under 10euros. Hotel is also really close to metro and Roma Termini
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positive: The room was spacious and clean. Host was very helpful. Location was within walking distance from bus stops and metro stations. Negative: It was difficult to find the actual guest house building. The mattress of the bed kept getting displaced. There wasn't always someone at the reception, but the host came in when called over phone.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and helpful staff in a good central location! The cleaning lady even dropped her duties to move her car so that we could park outside the hotel which was extremely helpful given the problem with parking in Rome!
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff was amazing and kind. Location and room were terrific. Only issue was recommended restaurant was a tourist trap that overcharged and upsold us. Pretty standard for any hotel in a tourist hotspot
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice clean, safe, and comfortable. Very helpful staff. Close to the train terminal. Centrally located between the colosseum and the Spanish steps all within walking distance and the metro is only a few blocks away.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dorina met us and showed us around when we arrived and helped us store luggage and get transportation when we left -- she was great. The hotel had arranged a pick up for us at the airport and, through the magic of e-mail and texting, they modified our pick up since we landed 8 hours later than expected. The room was clean and comfortable. The free wifi worked well and we got pretty good using the elevator. The a/c worked to keep us cool since it was very hot when we were there. We enjoyed the trattorias on our street -- very convenient after a long day of walked.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay in this guest house with lovely staff who are always available - thanks Dorina for making us feel so welcome! We were very impressed with the size and cleanliness of the room and the free wifi was working well.It's in a fantastic location - very central in a great district with lots of restaurants and bars in the area (definitely recommend Monti as an area!), walking distance to Termini station and many of the major tourist attractions (Colosseum, Roman Forum..) I would definitely recommend this charming guest house. We will be staying there again next time we're in Rome!
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If I did not give this hotel five stars is because the elevator is very small and can fit only 2 people at a time, other than that, the hotel is clean, the room and the beds were comfortable with it's private bathroom. The host Romina is relly nice and helpful. It"s Centrally located sorround by stores and restaurants The entrance offers an old world vibe which I like.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came on a trip for our 25 year wedding anniversiry.First we could not find the room or reception, but aften going back into the Hall we found the door on the 6th floor, called the reception on the phone and two minutes after Dorina welcomed us to a wonderfull romantic Italian clean room.Dorina made this a Fantastic stay, at our 25 year wedding Night - Champagne, glasses, a long rose and gratulation lettter awaited us.Dorina even arranged tables at wonderfull De Trani restaurant, which is a wonderfull place with excellent food and drink. Even got discount as frequent quest :-)Best recommendations for real Rome atmosphere and experience.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Roma Central Guest House after relocating from a very sub-par hotel nearby. Dorina welcomed us and was so helpful and friendly, we felt at home instantly. As many other reviewers mentioned, if you have realistic expectations, this guest house will be more than adequate for a few nights stay. The communal kitchen is a plus for people like us who, after eating pizza and pasta at every meal for over a week, like to pick up ingredients from the grocery store to prepare a salad for dinner to change things up a bit. Beds are comfortable, shower/bathroom is spacious and clean, air conditioning worked well and the location was perfect for all our sightseeing needs. We found Roma Central Guest House to be great value and we would stay here again if/when we visit Rome in the future.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dorina met us at the entrance to the building because otherwise it might have been tricky to find (we telephoned ahead to advise approx time of arrival). She was pleasant and efficient in settling us in. Room was perfectly adequate for our needs; it was a quiet haven. The location was good for us and what we wanted to do and especially closely located to the train station.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great room, location and service! The room looks exactly as picture shown. The hotel manager Dorina was very helpful. Check in and check out service was simple and straight forward, she will let you store your luggage for later same day collection for free. If I return to Rome I will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are about to finish our stay within this apparently old building less than 10 minutes walking from Termini station. We say apparently because outside aspect differ from the inside. Rooms that respect privacy, extreme quietness and a resourceful person whose name is Dorina that plays perfectly his role of host.A shared kitchen and a good enough breakfast in the morning will accompany your stay. We were even given a local hand made cake as a present considering is late easter and in Rome is typical to give it away to your surroundings, amazing this last detail coming from Dorina.Last but not least, the location is remarkable to spend a couple of days in Roma, you will need to absorb every drop of time while here.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The guest room was walking distance to the main tourist atrractions of rome, like the fontana di trevi, the spanish steps and the colosseum. The cleaness of the room was very poor. Breakfast was just bread, jam and coffee.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location with very few city noise.Friendly welcome but only Italian speaking staff :-(Wifi OK but no working printer available during our stay (f.e. boarding passes).Accommodation a little outdated (missing lamps, broken hangers, ...) and not so clean on arrival (room + shower room).Common kitchen on the other hand clean and cared.Very limited breakfast but typical Rome ;-)
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was greeted and shown everything. Friendly helpful staff. Safe and secure, a great location with comfortable beds. Shop across the road, close to all the main attractions. I would highly recommend roma central.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dirty, strong smell of mould and air freshener, gross bathroom not a B&B its pre packaged never expire croissant and make it yourself instant coffee. Don't stay here, find another place. I wish it looked like the photos, it did not.
hotelName:
29    Roma Central Guest House
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a fantastic hotel with great spacious rooms, super comfortable beds, and plenty of space for storage. The service is uniformly excellent and I have nothing but praise for the excellent front desk staff , house cleaning and the staff at breakfast.As a Marriott Titanium Elite member, I was upgraded to a bigger room and received the complimentary breakfast buffets which were excellent.As someone who travels nationally and internationally, Le Meridien greatly exceeded my expectations of what I would normally expect at a 4 star hotel.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service at Le Meridien was fantastic. We had been corresponding with Olga at the front desk prior to arrival concerning 2 adjoining rooms. She made sure our needs were met and she stayed beyond her shift in order to welcome us to the hotel. Since we drove into Rome, it was a bonus that the hotel had valet service. Everyone from the front desk, bell service, housekeepers and the breakfast attendants were very accommodating. The location of the hotel was perfect. It was walking distance to attractions on the other side of the river. (Piazza Navona, Pantheon, etc.)We will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here specially due to its proximity to the Vatican plus it turned out to be nicely situated near the river and it was a reasonable walk to the Spanish steps and Trevi Fountain. The staff is especially friendly and helpful. Bright sunny room. Nice big toiletries. The only bummer was the shower. Very small and impossible to not be drenched in the rain shower so I had to keep turning off the water to apply conditioner and such. Rooftop bar and pleasant lobby bar as well.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everyone from the valet parking dude to the front desk to the servers to the breakfast attendants were just great. The breakfast (which granted, we paid for) was excellent. The room was fine and it had what was probably the most comfortable mattress I have ever slept on.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Walking distance to all. We came during a heat wave, so a convenient gelato location was down the block ..rooms are super neat and clean. Staff were kind and very knowledgeable. We would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little Marriott hotel within a mile of the Vatican. Also walked to Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, St. Teresa & The Pantheon. Everything with the exception of the Coliseum is walkable!!! Great service, very clean rooms and wonderful helpful English speaking staff. Extensive Breakfast to die for...Go there NOW!!!
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very clean and everything looks new and fresh! The staff has been wonderful from check in and we are still there. I wish I could remember the name of all of the attendees who have helped us, but I can only remember Stefano because we have had more interactions with him. He has been extremely helpful and has a wonderful sense of humor!The hotel is very comfortable not far from the attractions, and you can use their bikes and bike around the city.If I came back to Rome again, I would probably stay in his hotel just because of The convenience, friendliness and helpful staff, and clean and updated rooms.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at Le Meridien Visconti for 2 weeks in May. Great location, easy walk to all areas (Colosseum is the longest at ~30 minutes). Rooms are nice, clean and quiet. 7th floor rooftop excellent place to hang out in the evening. Front desk service is outstanding.Best of all was the bar area...…..superb service, good food...……..both Alesandro's are top in class in making a cocktail + conversation. Giulia (bartender/waitress) is simply one of the nicest young ladies we met the entire trip.Thanks to all and Cheers!
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For whatever reason, the hotel management thought it was a great idea to rent the hotel for a huge party in their interior patio where all the noise and music (Karaoke of course) could be heard by everyone in the first and second floors of the hotel. When we called the front desk to complain about the noise level, their response was that the party was already booked and they could not do anything to stop or tame the noise level.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful performance by Rosario Fugà in the evening at the rooftop bar! Very pleased with my stay. Rooms are very nice and well kept and hotel staff is quick and eager to help. Made being in a foreign country much easier.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What I believed would be an ordinary hotel was anything but. The service provided by all employees was that of a true 5 star hotel. I have Marriott Titanium level membership and we were upgraded to a very large two bathroom suite free of charge. I would stay at this hotel again without hesitation!
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve been Titanium since the scheme launched and in the last two hotels, here and Marriott Central Park, Rome the scheme is pointless In both hotels there was no upgrade. In Marriott had to pay for breakfast for my Wife whilst every other property include breakfast The room at Meridien was OK but bathroom was not for two and why only one bath towel. Economising ?The roof TOP terrace sounded like a great place to enjoy the evening and views of Rome. Except it was booked for a function so I can’t tell you if it’s any good!Breakfast was OK but don’t leave it until 10.30 like we did or it’s all cold Unlikely to return
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Super location close to vatican ,Trevi fountain but not too close. You find your self surrounded by locals and their restaurants and stores. The breakfast bar is absolutely a bargain. The pastry are top drawer as is the service.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived from the US and with my husband's status(Titanium Elite) was provided with a temporary room for us to rest and shower, while waiting for our room. Party of 3 -we had a king size bed and a single bed along with a sitting area! Room was very spacious and clean. Entire staff was extremely helpful! Breakfast was great and had long hours(6am-11am) which was really nice. Room was quite and the rooftop bar was a must! It's within walking distance to most of the popular tourist sites. Great restaurants in the area.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you Le Meridien Visconti Rome!The location of the hotel could not be better, walking distance to Vatican, Borghese Gardens/Museums, Spanish Steps! Olga, Concierge Extraordinaire and Alessandro, Amazing Bartender/ Mixologist, MANY THANKS!!
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, great location in Prati region close to St. Peter's/Vatican and walking distance to many of the main sites including Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps, Piazza Navona, Villa Borghese. Hotel rooms are clean, spacious and well serviced. Breakfast buffet offers a lot of selection and is open 630-1030, which offers flexibility. Nice patio with selected privacy. Would stay here again.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well appointed hotel about a mile from the Vatican, and 2 miles from the Colosseum. We walked from here to the Forums, Colosseum, Pantheon, Trevii Fountain, Spanish Steps, and St. Peters, and Vatican Museum multiple times. Fun walks. Plaza de Populo, Ara Pacis, are across the bridge. Light switches are a bit odd to figure out but doable. Skip the breakfast (they have a buffet but it is a bit odd to an American) and go local, since there are many good cafes in a block or two. Bar was good for afternoon beer and snacks. Shower was modern. Many local restaurants within a few minute walk. Castile San Angelo a stone's throw away. Staff was very friendly and helpful, fluent in English. The doorman called taxis in a flash. We navigated using the Courthouse and River. A bank with ATM is a half block away. Took 20 minutes to St. Peters, 30 mins to Pantheon or Trevii, about an hour walk to Forum, Palatine Hill. Nice dessert, candy shops, and gelato cafes really close to hotel. Multiple pharmacies all over if need be (we needed sinus stuff). Look for the church with the Purgatory Art about two block away.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We ended our 16 day Italian adventure at this property, located not far from the Vatican. I am a Titanium Rewards Member and received an upgrade to a larger room( Grazie Noemi) As we were celebrating a special occasion, in our room we found a chilled bottle of Prosecco and a fruit plate. This hotel is a Category 5 so I was able to use my e- vouchers for the 3 nights. That being said, we were especially grateful that Noemi upgraded us. Loyalty has its rewards! The bed was comfortable but I must say that this was the smallest room we stayed in in Italy. No real view. Fortunately we were out a lot. The breakfast buffet was probably the largest and most extensive of the 4 Bonvoy Hotels we stayed at. The servers were very attentive. The rooftop was not yet open but we did have a night cap off the Lobby where one night there was a flautist. We enjoyed the neighborhood- walked around-quiet and residential but with Restaurants you could walk to. Never a problem getting a taxi when needed. Close to Vacation City. Grazie Le Meridien Visconti for 3 nice nights and for getting us the Private Drivef to the Airport. Bravo!!
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in a good location and within 20 mins walk to the Vatican. Just a 10 minute walk takes you over the Tiber where you can walk to all the main tourist sights.There is a bus (number 87) just around the corner from:the hotel that takes you to the Colosseum and the underground is 10 mins walk.Upon arrival the reception staff were great, giving us maps and tips to get around the city. The rooms are modern and very clean and hardly any noise. Breakfast is in the ground floor restaurant and is buffet style with lots of breads, rolls, waffles, yoghurts etc. Great base for our long weekend in Rome and yes we would stay here again.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had just debarked from our cruise and got to the hotel early. The room was ready! The people at the desk were very accommodating, and the wait staff excellent. The room was quiet and had quality amenities. The only problem occurred when we wanted to use the telephone to call the desk. The was NO response ever! Every time we wanted room service or needed ice or information, we had to walk down to the desk—6 floors!
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cute hotel in the city Centre, walking distance.Check-in was quick and professional. Room was cozy with modern furnishings. Rate included breakfast which was abundant. Within walking distance to center - if you have difficult walking might not be a good for you. Staff was professional, welcoming and polite. Shout out to Francesca who was super helpful!! Only negative: housekeeping took the card for electricity in the room so once we returned had to go back downstairs to get a new one.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived slightly early 8am and was told to come back at 2pm. Room was available at noon. The front desk graciously accommodated!! Hotel is conveniently located near most city attractions (Vatican, piazza navona, Trevi Fountain, Spanish steps) Booked an executive room and noticed it’s almost no different to the standard room. Unfortunately we had some issues with the USB ports next to the bed. Maintenance quickly resolved the situation and sincerely apologized. Housekeeping provided double turn down service which was unexpected and greatly appreciated. Had two meals at the hotel. Breakfast on -1 level was cold (they ran out of eggs) and Pasteries didn’t taste very fresh. Also had dinner at the lobby lounge and asked for a medium steak. The steak arrived very rare and didn’t taste very good.Definitely skip dining here and venture out.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel somewhat within walking distance of most major attractions. Rooms are nice and the service is great. The bar/lounge area just off the lobby was a disappointment. Drinks were overpriced and the bar staff didn't seem capable of making anything that wasn't on the bar list. I would stay at this hotel again but would venture out to find somewhere else for a drink.Roberto at the concierge desk was fantastic.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We started our Europe trip at this hotel. They were very kind and let us check in early- greatly appreciated after a long red eye flight. Room was nicely decorated. It is located between the Vatican and the Pantheon/Roman Steps/Trevi sights. We walked almost everywhere occasionally catching a cab when we were tired. Recommended.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Terrific and modern and friendly staff. Wonderful Bonvoy property where we have been staying the last week. An added bonus is live music proved by flutest Rosario Fuga, each night in the Bistro Bar. It is a great added touch to have live music and great wine and snacks.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in an absolutely charming area of Rome! Quiet and beautiful yet not too far from all the amazing sights of Rome! My room was very nice and especially enjoyed rooftop terrace and gym! The front desk was extremely helpful with any questions concerning local sights. when in Rome I would definitely say this is a wonderful hotel
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for one night prior to going on a cruise. The front staff were exceptionally helpful and friendly when I arrived at 9am after flying over 20hrs from Australia. They found me a room within half an hour even though check in was not until 2pm. My room was clean and comfortable. The hotel is located near the river Tiber and a short walk from the Spanish Steps. I also had a delicious dinner at the on site restaurant.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: About 22 minutes for good walkers Campo de Fiori for walking tours. Walking time from there you can take in Pantheon, Piazza Navona, Fontana de Trevi, and the Spanish Steps within a half-hour and another 20 minutes or so back. About 5 McDonalds on that route to the sites. Time spent at sites or eating extends it. Time recovering from getting lost also extends it. Ask the Desk about good restaurants or to help you train or tours, as they are terrific at helping (Even help you with a little Italian). Level 0 is the main floor. -1 is the morning cafe fro breakfast but be sure to charge it to your room number else it is more expensive.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good, albeit brief stay here in early April. Location is fantastic - 5 minute walk to Castel Sant’Angelo and then obviously just a bit longer to the Vatican. When I arrived for check in, Francesca was extremely helpful with both getting me sorted with an upgraded room as well as with a recommendation for lunch. The lay-out of the guest floors can be a bit confusing but the good news is that the hotel isn’t huge so you won’t be roaming for long in search of your room. My room was very nice: decent size, comfy bed and very bright. This hotel doesn’t have a concierge lounge but it does have a rooftop area - unfortunately, it rained quite a bit the afternoon / evening of my stay so this area was closed. I’m sure it would be a heck of an asset when the weather is nice...can only imagine the views from up there.The lobby & bar area always seems to be busy. On the day I was there, they were hosting a large conference. In fact, it seems like there was a small event in the bar / restaurant area over lunch. Around 3.30/4p, my colleague and I were looking for a space to get some work done and the employees in the bar area prevented us from sitting, saying that they needed to clean the area. Thirty minutes later, when there was no effort to clean the tables, I asked Alessandro who appeared to be the manage of the bar area. I was taken back by his remarkable lack of empathy and guest alignment in his responses to our requests. Once the table was ready, it became obvious that we they just wanted to prepare the area for dinner and that we were basically a bother. Considering that there is no lounge or workspace in the guest rooms, I would have thought that the hotel staff would be more accommodating to guests trying to get some work done in the common areas. This whole thing was a big turnoff for me.All in all, for 261 Euro/night for a hotel in central Rome, this was still good value. Would consider returning for a holiday but likely not for business.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was very pleased with the Le Meriden property during our stay in Rome. The location was convenient for visiting the sites we had chosen and the rooms were very nice. The bar/lounge was an inviting space and even had live music one evening. I cannot say enough about the professional staff at this hotel. They were very accommodating from check-in to assisting my family with packing souvenirs for our trip home.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in March. Our rooms were very clean and had all the amenities of a top hotel. The beds were very comfortable and our hallway was quiet.  We enjoyed both outdoor spaces: the rooftop bar, and the seating area off of the lobby. It was nice to sit and have a drink and relax after a full day of sightseeing. The location was great too. We walked to Vatican City and many restaurants. One night we went to Travastere for dinner but chose to take a taxi. What really made our experience 5 star was the staff. They were all incredibly nice and helpful. They called taxis for us and made dinner reservations. They did it all with a smile as if we were the most important guests. Laura was particularly sweet and helpful; her dinner suggestions were spot on. I would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed two nights at Le Meridian at the end of our month long trip. The hotel is located in the really nice Prati area away from the tourists but not the sites. There are a lot of great restaurants nearby and good shopping. The bus lines and metro were close by also.The real test of a fine hotel is how well they handle a problem. We came back to the hotel after a late dinner and there was an air conditioning problem. They moved us quickly to another room and then moved us to a better room in the morning. The staff was friendly and professional throughout the incident. They adjusted our bill more than expected and had refreshments delivered to our room for the inconvenience.The rooms were all large, clean and comfortable. They were also well appointed. The lounge areas were very nice. The hotel staff arranged ground transportation twice for us as well as dinner reservation one night at an exquisite restaurant they recommended: Trattoria Della Brachetta dal 1924.We plan to stay at the Le Meridian on our next trip to Rome.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a family vacation trip to Rome, when we selected this hotel to stay for 4 days. The location was very good. Vatican is within the walking distance. There are bus stands close to the hotel; hence communication wise this hotel is really good.The room is also good; though there was no view from the window. Breakfast is quite good too. It was a good stay in this hotel.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved the room and it's amenities. Only stayed one night. It was a little too far from the Roma Termini for a comfortable walk with backpacks.We did it but I'd advise against it. It's location otherwise was fine and there was a fantastic gelato spot just around the corner.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there with my boyfriend in March. The rooms are newly renovated, very modern, and clean. No air conditioning thought but that's okay coz it was winter time. Location wise, it's very accessible to the tourist spots like Piazza de Popollo, Spanish Steps, Fountain of Trevi etc. Breakfast selection is great too! But the best part is, I left some money in the safe when we checked out. Called the hotel after 4 days and they safe kept the money for me! Their staff is probably the most honest I've seen in all my travels. Special shoutout to Stefano and Laura for their above and beyond excellent customer service. I would highly recommend this hotel if you're visiting Rome.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am currently staying here as on date.The location is fantastic and rooms are what you get for what you pay in Europe.Breakfast: loads of bread but really nothing to offer in the spread. The service is poor and will not provide plates at night.We reached for breakfast at 10.40 on 31.03 Sunday morning, and they were already in pack up mode with 80% of the spread empty.I have stayed in Le Meridien at other locations and such is not the case.The aircon only runs in one mode and in March time if you are lower floor , you decide between opening window and letting colder air to come in along with noise or sleep in a stuffy room.Marriot please do the needful before comments like mine fill up the reviews.Still trying to catchup on lost sleep afterEating in Caffe next door.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The smiling, welcoming front desk staff left a GREAT first impression and set the positive tone of our visit. They went above and beyond the call of duty and enhanced our time in Rome. The breakfast area provided a variety of choices for any dietary needs. The hotel is in a terrific location. It is within walking distance of many historical sites. Bravo!
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is great, but as a titanium (former platinum elite) marriott member, I thought it was overpriced. Felt more aligned with the courtyard brand. The breakfast was particularly disappointing relative to expectations.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am an SPG/Marriott member since 2007. Platinum status for 9 years, currently Elite Ambassador - last year I stayed 140 nights with SPG/Marriott and spent tens of thousands of dollars doing so (some of my own dollars and some of my company’s). I reserved two rooms at the Le Meridien in Rome for the weekend and was upgraded to an executive room from a superior. Sounded good so I did not question it, however, I soon found out an executive room is not much bigger than superior and is not really much of an upgrade. I asked if I could be upgraded to a suite for at least one room, but they told me they were sold out and there was nothing available - maybe Saturday a suite would be available. I found that strange considering suites had been available when I booked. I looked on-line and it was no surprise they had suites still available (it was 4:00pm, so it wasn’t early in the day). I called my ambassador concierge and asked her to intercede, which resulted in the hotel providing one suite. Overall, my experience with the Le Meridien in Rome is as follows. (1) They did not want to provide a commensurate upgrade for my status, (2) they lied about having suites available and I had to spend an hour of my time in Rome fighting with the hotel to get an upgrade, (3) there was no platinum check-in line. Overall, just a very lackluster reception for a long term member.We are loyal Marriott members and when we travel we make an effort to stay at Marriott properties. I travel a lot for business, but also travel for pleasure. After 140 nights of business travel, I want to de-stress and get away from the daily grind and get a decent upgrade for a family trip. Having to spend an hour of our limited time, fighting to get an upgrade is stressful. It also starts the trip on a negative tone plus we look like jerks because we have to forcefully ask for upgrades or else we will not be taken seriously. I recommend you do your homework prior to arriving as I do not think it’s their policy to look after Marriott reward members.Upon check out, the desk attendant told us that they get so many platinum members that they just can’t upgrade everyone. Ok. I guess Ambassador Elite members are just a dime a dozen - that makes me feel a ton better. There were some good points. Aldo in the breakfast area - makes the best cappuccino in Rome. Breakfast was pretty good as food goes, but it is unfortunate the breakfast is in the basement. The rooms were very clean - the cleaning staff is doing an excellent job. I know the manager Alessio often responds to Trip Advisor reviews. When I asked if he was present in the hotel, I was told yes. I really thought since I asked for him by name, he would at least check in with us at some point. He did not. I hate making a bad review. I thought a lot about whether to write this. Fundamentally, however, all we wanted was one out of the two rooms upgraded. We didn’t ask for anything else. We didn’t ask for special favors, special services, no crazy requests. Just one upgrade to suite, in a hotel that had availability on a non-peak weekend.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is one of the amazing hotels in Rome. Very clean very quiet and very luxurious. We booked a notmal room and got upgraded to an executive suite. The suite was very ample and clean. The bed was very comfortable and the living room furniture was very decent. The breakfast buffet was excellent. Highly recommend for couples and families!
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Previous visits to Rome were more of the standard tourism variety. This was for a very specific leisure purpose - and Ireland versus Italy Rugby international. Context set.I will start by saying I will use this hotel again whether for business or pleasure. Bedroom was clean comfortable and perfectly adequate for a four day stay. The lobby area is busy and other than for a short linger is utilitarian as opposed to comfortable. The bar is overpriced. The availability of a computer and printer just off the lobby is useful. The wifi in the room is good.Breakfast was good if a little chaotic. The ability to cope will a large crowd seemed to challenge the staff so the result was that there was plenty of choice but lots of waiting in between. Will be interested to experience the location on a "normal" weekend or day.Location is perfect and anywhere of interest is walkable. As I said I will be back.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Five of us stayed in two rooms last summer. This hotel exceeded my expectations. Stefano at the front desk welcomed us warmly and gave us a great suggestion for lunch. Rooms were super-clean and modern. Location is within walking distance of the Vatican/Saint Peters, Piazza Del Popolo, Castel Sant’Angelo, and many more places. I would stay here again without hesitation.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for a long 4 night break. As previous reviews have mentioned they do not go over the top for loyalty members. Our first night we had a very loud neighbour, reception did try and help but some guests are just so selfish. In fairness the reception staff in the morning were very helpful and moved us while we were out during the day.The rooms are comfortable, maybe a little small. But a good place to rest after a day catching the sites. Walls of rooms are a little thin and neighbours can be heard.The only extraction we didn’t walk to was the Colessum this is purely because we had an early morning tour. We took the number 87 bus, stop 5 mins walk and runs every 15 mins.There are a number of good restaurants close to hotel
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a week here and found it to be a pleasant affordable hotel slightly off the beaten path. That's not to say it's in a remote location, it's just the street isn't as busy as most in Rome. Our whole group were silver-haired but we had no trouble walking to most of the major sights in the city. We were also no more than 15 minutes away from the subway station at Piazza del Popolo so public transportation was available when needed. All the people working the front desk were very friendly and helpful during our stay. The breakfast buffet was reasonably priced and had a wide range of choices so no complaints there. Our room wasn't large but we had enough space for storing our belongings and the king sized bed was very comfortable. Having a wine shop, a gelato shop, and a grocery store in the immediate area only added to the positives of this hotel. When we return to Rome at some point in the future, this will be our first choice for a hotel.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For Rome this hotel isn't in the ideal location for walking to the main sights but it is a nicer version of hotel. I guess one could say it is a bit of an Americanized version of an Italian hotel. We didn't eat in the hotel. Room was clean and bright with a nice washroom. The staff at the front desk and the bellman were really pleasant. We did walk to the Spanish Steps from here but if you'd like to be walking distance from the Forum and Colosseum this is a bit far. However it is a nice hotel.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
