review_body: This was our third visit to Rome and first staying at a "name brand" hotel. It was clean, the location was good. But as far as value, you can do much better booking with one of the smaller boutique hotels in the area. For the price the breakfast buffet was rather average and staffing the mornings not very attentive. It took several repeated requests to get the instant coffee packets and water in our room. Food in restaurant was ok at dinner. Stayed 5 nights, but next time we will go back to the smaller private hotels.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great, it is within 20 minute walking distance to the Vatican museum, and many of the key attractions in Rome. the hotel is in a good residential neighborhood, and short walk to shopping and food. there is also small supermarkets located within 5 minute walking distance. The hotel location is excellent. As far as the room is concern, i have to deduct a star, the TV so small, I think my desktop monitor are about the same size. We got true king size bed which is a plus, but, the hotel offers no coffee machine in the room, only hot water kettle with 2 packs of instant coffee. The breakfast buffet is in the basement, and the choice is fairly good. We had breakfast there in the morning, and truly enjoyed the fresh orange juice. Bigger TV, and coffee maker is a necessity to make this hotel worth to be labeled a 4 star hotel.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 1st time visit Rome and We stayed for 5 nights . My husband is SPG & Marriott member , the room we stayed is at the corner and it’s nice .The hotel location is not so close to Metro station , but it’s workable to many places .Nearby there’s a cinema, Gelato shop , and many eating place .You can take a bus (100 min $1.50) to central, and many places .For the hotel breakfast serve until 11am, the pancakes is delicious. However it’s boring for the food menu for 5 days stay . If hotel can change the breakfast menu that will be perfect.Hotel housekeeping is efficient.Overall , it’s worth to stay .
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the Le Meridien for a whole week in January. The rooms are clean, modern and just a few blocks to the Lepanto Metro station. There are many restaurants, shopping stores and gelateria in the area. Relatively safe to walk in this Prati neighborhood. We walked to and from Lepanto station very early in the morning and late at night. We would stay again in this hotel.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Area us good for business.Within 10 minutes walk from Vatican and via del Corso (shops). Nice restaurants in the area.Staff very Professional.Spacious room. Quiet at night.Hot water takes a long time.Loved the waffles at breakfast.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pro: It’s a good, newly renovated hotel with modern, fresh decors. More residential located (a good thing avoiding touristy stuff in downtown). The services are okay in general. Breakfast service are fantastic , esp. with fresh orange, great cappuccino! Restaurant is actually very reasonably priced, food choices are healthy! Cons: the pillows are TOO SOFT! I strained my neck overnight after two nights in. It’s most painful experience ever! Thankfully there’s farmcia nearby.They don’t really care if you’re Platinum Elite member with Marriott. I used my suite night upgrade, I don’t understand why I was downgraded from a Terra suite room to a Junior Suite on 2nd floor. Avoid this room, it’s loud and very cold due to lack of double layer window.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Greeting - 5/5 - very warm they had the rooms ready - made sure that we had breakfast vouchersRooms - 4/5 had two connecting rooms - clean stylish - small though. One room the TV did not work. Bathrooms very niceBreakfast - 5/5 - lots of selection - very bright and spacious.Bar - 4.5/5 - great service - need longer wine list by glassFor the kids wish they had a pool.Location is amazing can walk to everything4.5/5 is overall for me
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. The hotel location is great. 15 min walk to either Vatican City or Rome city center2. Hotel is very clean and elegant. I wish my room has the exact same furniture. Design is so clean and comfortable3. Toiletries are Malin and Goets. Plus plus plus4. Bistro food was great, but also expect to pay more as it’s a hotel restaurant 5. The staff, especially Laura at the front desk was so friendly and helpful. I feel very welcomed.Will def stay here again when I visit Rome.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel for a family vacation to Rome over the Christmas holidays. It caught my attention as being value-priced, and part of the new Marriott-Starwood family, so stayed here to top up my nights to qualify for Platinum. Clean rooms, and the heating worked well (as it was a fairly cold December week when we were there). The bathrooms are a bit small, especially the showers. I'm a bigger guy, and could barely turn around in the shower, but the water was hot and the water pressure awesome. Probably the highlight of our stay was the breakfast that was included as part of my Platinum benefits. My daughters loved the selection of foods and the quality of what was available on the buffet. Compared to other hotels we've stayed in, this included breakfast is one of the best we've had. We found it easy to hail Uber vans to get everywhere we needed to go, and on one nice day we walked to the Vatican in about 30 minutes along a cool shopping street that seemed to cater more to locals than the tourists. We'd definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
30    Le Meridien Visconti Rome
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here for 6 days whilst exploring Rome and we enjoyed our stay so much more due to the welcome and service received here.The manager (Morris) greeted us warmly and immediately made us feel welcome. After a brief passport check (to confirm identities, not to keep) Morris handed us a map and spent a great few minutes telling us where we could visit besides the main points of interest.He circled various food places, hidden gems and the best churches (there are loads). He carried on with a few bits of key details and then handed us a couple of discount vouchers for nearby restaurants. We later visited La Famaglia (one of those recommendations) which turned out to be both well priced and delicious, lovely pizza and steak (yes, steak, my partner had maxed out on pasta).The room had everything we needed, including a hairdryer, a mini bar, a safe, and thankfully air con. We ended up receiving some complimentary wine too, which was a lovely treat.Other reviews have mentioned noise issues, but largely it was quiet, there are signs asking for silence in the corridors and respectful noise levels in the rooms. It works, apart from the odd conversation from the hallway it was extremely peaceful. It's located within a 30min walk of nearly everything but the Vatican, luckily the hotel is very close to the metro which takes you there for €1.50 single. So not a problem at all.As a side note nice little extra we recieved when we left was an offer to keep our bag at the hotel post checkout. We had a late flight but Morris was happy to keep the bag with him till we needed to leave. Very much appreciated.We would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although we got in Rome pretty late at night we have been welcoming in the best way could ever be possible. The Manager took all his precious time to give us all the tips and to fully answer to our questions regarding the city. The room modern and absolutely well equipped was very clean and fresh.The area is very safe and closest to the main spots.Morrisson is definitely a must in Rome.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had hard time to find the guest house since they are restyling the facade and the door was a bit hided in the dark. Beside this all the rest is awesome.They’re on the 4th floor of an old historic building, very central and close to the shopping district. Staff is very helpful and well prepared. We are lucky we’ll go after all the tips they gave us. Room was modern, fresh and very clean. Kettle with free croissants, coffee and tea in the room. Just perfect!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Let’s say this first, Rome is beautiful and so desirable as well but a bit dirty and with many vagabonds/nomads wandering in the central street that special at night don’t make you feel confident (thanks to the Hotel for the good advise). Morrisson is the best place we could ever book for our holiday. Safe, clean, close to the main attractions and well furnished.Manager always ready to help us and for the New Year’s Eve make us celebrate offering us a special Italian cake. Shopping district is only 10 minutes walking.Breakfast (Italian) is served two blocks away.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s a very new and well decorated boutique hotel, perfectly clean and in a very quiet but strategic area of the city. The furniture are modern, minimalist and functional and surprising the room is full of amenities. Kettle with free coffee and tea and magazine. Management very professional and generous with good and helpful advice.Breakfast in a nearby local Bar.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rome is very dirty but... beautiful. Morrisson is a an elegant and cosy guest house with very luxurious rooms. We appreciate a lot the information and the useful tips the manager gave us st the check-in. Very polite and well prepared staff. Clean and quiet.Work in progress outside the building.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I believe the right choice of the hotel is the key to have a perfect holiday and even this time i was right. This’s a small hotel boutique with all the comforts a traveller need when on vacation. Well managed, perfectly clean (every day) and located in a very nice and safe area of the city center. Breakfast is outside in a characteristic local bar.The facade of the hotel is under maintenance.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a charming place to be. It’s a quite small luxury boutique hotel with modern and clean room. Boiler and free croissant every day in room. Manager is very captivating...No lounge and Breakfast outside in a local Bar. But that’s not bad, when in Roma live and eat like Romans.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently stayed here for 4 nights and was not disappointed. The place itself it’s a 20-30 minute walk from the main town centre and is situated in a fairly quiet part of the city. Upon arrival we were a bit confused as the hotel itself is on the fourth floor! I must point out this is not a hotel and is an apartment, we stated in the title. It’s very small and you genuinely feel like you’re the only people there. The place was spotlessly clean which is an important thing for me so I was very impressed!The room itself was modern, comfy bed, nice bathroom with so much storage. There’s a window you can open and very nice air conditioning. There was a safe in the room to keep your valuables too which was free to use. The only fault with the room was the thin walls but luckily we didn’t have any noisy neighbours.The staff here are very friendly and helpful, there’s someone on reception every day until around 3pm. The gentleman who I assume is the owner was very knowledgable about the city and gave us some useful tips before we set off out. I’d definitely stop here again as it was everything we wanted from the trip and would recommend for any couples / single people travelling to visit Rome. (There is also a nice gelato shop near by!) :)
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, clean and comfy. Wifi worked well. The manager, Morris was very helpful. The hotel supplies guests with various discount cards for nearby cafes and restuarants which we tried and all were excellent. However I must admit that the "continental breakfast" turned out to be a bit of a fizzer as it became an "Italian breakfast" which consisted of a cup of coffee, a glass of orange juice and a crossant at a cafe several blocks away.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We will never forget the last new year's eve in Rome! Fantastic atmosphere and great time in this lovely and ancient city (maybe a bit dirty...)! Morrisson is the place to be. Very clean and cosy hotel in a very nice area... Thanks to the stuff for the good directions.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are very thankful to the stuff of Morrisson for all the tips they gave us regarding Rome, sightseeing and Restaurants. But also regarding Milan.This is a lovely and charming small guest house (5 rooms i guess).The place to be in the center of rome.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in Rome (beautful but a little bit dirty i would say) and we decide to avoid big hotel but a small luxury one (as been told to us). We have been rewarded of our trust.Perfect location but what's more important free strong wifi with 4 different sources. Clean and elegant. Impressive check-in (after all the information we had we didn't need to ask for anything else). Breakfast is outside. That's even not bad since the bar is very popular in the area with friendly staff.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I suggest this place to everybody but especially for Japonese people. Professionalism,courtesy and good attitude make your stay safe and comfortable.Our culture is very well respected. Mr Morris himself made us the check-in and it has been a great honour. We wll be back in Rome next February and definitely at Morrisson.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have never experienced a guest house so fancy and clean so far... Really a great surprise. We felt safe and comfortable in a lovely and elegant room with everything we need around. Absolutely excellent check in. Good and smart tips did help us a lot during our stay. Thank you very much. When a MORRISSON in Danmark?
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This establishment is not really a hotel but a group of rooms. It is opposite the British Embassy. On entering the building the 3rd door on the left is the lift. 4th floor. Exit the lift and Morrissons Rooms are on the left. Check-in went well. Victoria gave us huge amounts of info and secret places to visit in Rome as well as good value restaurants.Our room was very quiet and serviced every day. Comfortable bed, good shower, very clean, mini bar, kettle for tea/coffee.Breakfast is taken in a café 2 minutes walk away. It consisted of the typical Italian sweet pastries which is the norm. The staff at the café were very obliging and happy. Don't be put off by having to walk to a different location for your breakfast. It really is not a problem and in fact it is interesting watching the locals go by and come in.If you are looking for a very quiet place to stay in Rome, this is it. Only 10 minutes walk from the Termini rail Station.If you are in Rome to party, go back to your room late, be noisy, then seriously this accommodation is NOT for you. There are plenty of notices advising that if you do make unacceptable noise then your booking will be terminated. End of. I had no problem with this. Subsequently, wonderful, undisturbed sleep.If returning to Rome for a 6 Nations Rugby match then I will definitely look to stay here again.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We couldn't have made a better choice. In a lovely city with so many problems (dirty and pickpockets everywhere) we felt so happy to have discovered the Morrisson. Small Guest house-boutique right in a safe rea of the city center with all you need in your room. Boiler with free coffe/tea and croissant included.Free speed wifi but most than everything the professional stuff that took all their time at check-in to give us all the useful information of Rome and the hotel.Pickpockets warning and good Restaurant (no touristic) tips. Thank you guys.You made a very good job.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Morrison Hotel is situated in a very nice area next door to U.K. Embassy 10 mins walk from Termini station. Rooms were lovely and clean and staff were wonderful with help for sightseeing tips and with suggestions of local places to eat! Would definitely recommend!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came here for a few days away with my boyfriend. Absolutely loved it. Hotel was clean, lovely rooms and staff made it even more amazing. Staff were very friendly and helped us with anything we needed, helped us with our way around Rome went our their way to search for places we wanted to go. Cannot wait to come back next year definitely worth a visit!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time there. Super nice, one to one customer service. We like to explore the city and walk a lot and we are on a budget so for us the location was great : couple of blocks from train station. Lots of supermarkets close by, several laundry stores. The area is safe at night also it houses several embassis close by. The breakfast is good and the people there as super nice too. There's several bus lines that goes to all the main sites so its very convenient. The room is real stylish, nice and super clean. Tks Morrisson for a eat stay!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This establishment was quite good. Really more of a B&B (no real lobby/24 hour front desk, etc) but fantastic given the price. It's in a great location, about a 15-20 min walk to the main Termini station, 1.5-2 miles to most of the big historical sites in Rome (except the Vatican), in a safe neighborhood, and just around the corner from one of the best gelato places in town (La Romana).Pros: good location, room was very clean and the Morrison staff was very helpful and friendly. They really care about their guests experience while visiting and it shows. The outside of the building looks a bit rough but Morrison's itself (inside) is clean and modern.Cons: breakfast was not served onsite. You have to walk 2 blocks or so to a little place where the staff didn't really seem to like dealing with non-Italian speaking guests. We fared well, but watched as employees got visibly upset with some guests who had problems communicating. The WIFI is a bit spotty, and you are "strictly forbidden," as a note on the wall of your bathroom warns, from washing any clothes.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a short 10 minute stroll from Termini we arrived at the Morrisson, which is located on the 4th floor of a charming building of the quiet Via Palestro, and the staff immediately greeted us as VIPs.They went through the usual hotel stuff (including a practice run of the impressive front door) and then showed us on a map all the local food and drink spots as well as all transport links. Old Rome is a short walk away and for the slightly further away sights, 2 Metro stops are an even shorter walk away.The room itself was spotless and neatly laid out, the bed was very comfortable and (most importantly for me) the shower has excellent pressure. Roman plumbing seems to have been upgraded!Breakfast was served in a charming local cafe, located just around the corner, where authentic Italian coffees kicked off every day of exploration.Throughout our 4 day stay, the staff were consistently friendly and helpful and the room was cleaned thoroughly every day. Would highly recommend!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most of the building in the city center of Rome we realize are very old and historical, that's the reason because when we reach The Morrisson we were not sure of our choice. But the exactly moment we walk in it has been totally another history.Modern, minimalist, functional with all a visitor could ever desire in his room.Managed very well by a pretty much qualified person, the room are very well cleaned daily. Useful stuff are always ready to help you. Breakfast is outside in a pretty interesting local Bar. Excellent.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rome is a kind of mess and dirty but beautiful. We realize immediately we made the right choice with Morrisson. Professional and useful stuff right from the check-in. Room well decorated and clean. Kettle with coffe and tea plus croissant every day.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've stayed with my wife for 2 nights at Morrisson Executive rooms, at Rome.It's a lovely place to stay at Rome and have everything just a few minutes away.The stuff was very informative and helpful, gave us all the information needed about what to visit.The area that is located is very peaceful and safe. Right accross the street is the British Embassy so you can be sure that nobody is going to harm you.Definately a place to visit again ☺
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This Hotel impress us a lot. It' s small but at the same time gave us the best service we could ever have. Maniacal clean with a professional and well knowledgeable stuff always ready to help and suggest us the best tip. Breakfast is outside in a local bar but isn't bad at all. We had every day croissant and boiler with coffee and tea in our room. Wonderful experience!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice, very very clean, not exactly in the center , quite and convinian place.The breakfast not in hotel, but near, in coffee shop, so with such a nice people. I will recommend it to all of my friends.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Small boutique hotel in a very strategic area of the city centre. Walking distance from Via Nazionale and pretty close to Spanish Steps and the shopping district. Watch the pickpockets while in Rome! Thanks to the stuff who gave us good advise. Manager very charming.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: That has been my second time in Rome and i am just happy to have choice this small Hotel (5 rooms) right in the city. My room was like a 4 star Hotel with all you may need on travelling. Kettle in my room with coffee, tea, milk and sugar. Free croissant every day. Very professional stuff. Breakfast is outside but fine.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel near metro 5' walk. Beautiful and clean rooms and the best capucino in Rome with hot croissant in a cafe nearby for breakfast.Our host mr Morrion was very communicative and friendly.Surely recomended for medium budget accommodation and for couples vacations.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for a few days during our honeymoon and it was absolutely perfect! Its a small hotel (4-5 rooms I believe) but the owner and his staff are amazing. Very clean and modern as well. We were welcomed warmly, given a brief guide + map on Rome and everything was better than expected. The proximity to public transport as well as landmarks is great as well. We really enjoyed our stay and recommend Morrisson Hotel. Breakfast is included and its at a cafe around the corner. You get a pastry, coffee and orange juice - he calls it the "Italian Breakfast". It is also located in a safe part of the city.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Morrisson is a suite of 5 rooms in a typical building in Rome, shared with apartments and another similar setup called Deseo. Don't be put off by the exterior-- everything in Rome is "gently worn," and there's really no disadvantage to your stay itself. Imagine it as a 5 bedroom apartment, each room with en-suite baths, and a small entryway where the reception is. It's no frills, but everything is immaculately clean and recently renovated; the bathrooms were nicely appointed and have A/C and window that you can open to let in fresh air (assuming it's not oppressively humid!)-- it gives you a little taste of normal "living" in Rome. We took the train from Fiumicino to Termini and walked 10 minutes to the hotel-- the street it's on, Via Palestro, actually does have quite a few bars and restaurants, as well as other hotels on it; try Mamma Angelo's if you're looking for something nearby; we found it on yelp, and were very satisfied with the food.Check-in was quick and painless. The manager was incredibly exuberant and enthusiastic, with lots of good tips. We were initially a little nervous how close everything was to each other, since it is literally 5 rooms off of a single hallway, but we actually never crossed paths with any of the other guests, and didn't hear any of them, with the exception of the water running when they were showering. The room itself was exactly like in the pictures- no frills, but met all of our needs. The only thing I didn't love about it was that there was a bedspread but no blanket/comforter, and it wasn't obvious whether it had been freshly washed; but it could have just been a little worn.It's definitely not in the city center, but it's stilil accessible. We basically walked to all the sightseeing spots which are mostly 20-30 min walk away, with the exception of the vatican, which you can walk 5 minutes to the subway station, take an 8 min train ride, and walk another 5 minutes to get there. Also, the 62 bus around the corner takes you straight into the centro storico and passes by a lot of major stuff such as Trevi Fountain, the Fountain of Neptune, the Pantheon, etc. It's really not difficult, and you can buy the bus tickets at the Tabacchi that are all over the place. We left one morning at 4am to catch a 6:30 flight-- to get to the airport, you can take the Terravision bus from Termini for four euros, which was really convenient (and costs half as much as the train). Oh, definitely go to La Romana, the gelateria around the corner. It's totally worth it-- we don't even like ice cream and gelato, but ended up going four times! There's often a line, but it moves relatively quickly :)
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful stay last september in this small but fancy hotel. Management is very professional and help us a lot. Rooms are very very clean. Not even a 5 stars hotel where i often stay is so deeply obsessively cleaned. Every evening we use to find a Morrisson courtesy which was an italian homemade fresh oie or croissant. I love this place.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Impressive. Very nice and elegant rooms with modern furniture which contrast with the old and historical bulding where the hotel is located. Across the street from the UK Embassy in the city center of Rome. GM Morrisson is awesome!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a place.. fancy and elegant, clean and central. Rooms are very silent and provide of any comfort. Management is very professional. GM is awesome... and good-looking! Fashionable and perfect for girls like me who always want the best. Perfect.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front desk is unbeliavable. We had a very late check-in and nevertheless they have been spending long time to give us all usefull information and the answer at all our questions in order to have a pleasant stay. It's a small boutique hotel very elegant,located right in the city centre in a very nice and safe area where many embassies have site. Rooms are like a 5 stars hotel. Management is very professional and efficient. Clean and quiet. What to say bad? They may need a big lounge. That would be perfection!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wonder why they had a reward from expedia as one of the most well clean hotel. Location is simply perfect. The employees and the manager are very kind, professional and multilingual. They gave us good advise regarding pickpockets and avoid us bad surprises. Forget about the building which is old and historical.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I use to travel a lot around the world for business and pleasure and this place come like a big surprise to me. Rome (also the 5 stars hotel where i usually stay) is not famous for the professionalism and comptetence of the management but this place absolutely it is. The manager (but i guess is the owner as well) gave me very good suggestion and tip with competence and deep knowledge. Rooms are like a five stars hotel. Obsessive cleanliness and elegance. They just need a big lounge and could be the number 1 in town.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and helpful staff with recommendations on places to see and restaurants to try. Great location and also quiet. Includes a breakfast voucher for coffee, juice and pastry at a local bar. We will be back!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely welcoming, extremely clean and tidy. Easily accessible by subway, bus, however, a few minutes from Termini station.The whole is enhanced by the kindness and sympathy of the charismatic Morrisson: a person extremely helpful and worthy of the place it manages.Breakfast is included and is expendable in a bar a few feet away.The rooms are spacious and bright.Hard to find a facility so beautiful and so comfortable at a price like this ... Definitely will be back and definitely recommend to our friends and acquaintances!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We start from the position: perfect! It is located a few meters from Porta Pia and Via XX Settembre, Castro Praetorian metro station and 2 minutes walk to the terms.With a lovely walk you can visit many attractions of Rome. Let us now turn to the structure: excellent!The hotel is located inside a building, on the fourth floor (ascensorato of course), and everything, absolutely everything is brand new! The rooms are beautifully decorated, spotlessly clean, new and modern furniture,minimal style, soft lighting, perfect bathroom, great shower. Free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel. Finally, the staff: impeccable! Rarely do I choose a hotel or confirm the quality of the staff, but this deserves a special praise. The owner immediately puts at your disposal,excellent advice and high availability. In short, the final judgment: comparable hotel in a good 5 stars! Stra-advised
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was lovely and very helpful. The rooms were very very (!!) clean and luxurious. The location was great with lots of good bus routes and within walking distance from the train station. Really good local restaurants and all within walking distance. In short, a perfect experience.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A short stay in Rome over the marathon weekend where everywhere was busy. We arrived late, but emailed the hotel prior to arrival what time they should expect us. There was a member of staff waiting for us. An enthusiastic, bubbly person who explained everything to us - the room, the nearby area, what to see, where to go. The hotel is probably a 10 minute walk from the main station (Termini) and conveniently located in the area of embassies which makes it a safe and quiet spot. The rooms are comfortable, big and very clean. Mini bar is reasonably priced. In the morning you get a voucher for breakfast in a cafe near the hotel: in a bar (45 Via Cernaia). It is possible to walk everywhere from the hotel - the main attractions. I have to say that our stay was particularly nice due to the choice of accommodation. They offer luggage storage too - which is great if you need to check out but have time to do more sightseeing.The staff who work there are amazing - friendly, positive and extremely helpful!!!! It deserves another star!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a 4 bed room which had a comfortable double bed and 2 full size singles as bunks. It was spotless, cleaned daily, had a safe and ensuite. Staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel is a short easy walk from the station and about 40 minutes on foot from most of the main ancient sights of Rome. There are restaurants/bars/supermarket a few minutes away. Breakfast was in a nearby cafe. It was perfect for our family city break and I would recommend anyone to stay here.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in Sep 13. The hotel is situated 8 mins from Termini station but is in a much nicer location than the station. The hotel is on the 4th floor and it only has 5 rooms and the standard of the rooms is very high. It is a little bit out of the centre but as long as you don't mind walking then this actually works out well as I think value for money it is much better than staying right in the centre. The room looked small when entering but is actually much bigger than my initial thoughts and we had more than enough room for the 4 nights we stayed. Rooms were cleaned to a very high standard daily and the hotel reception were very helpful. They left croissants and cake in our rooms a couple of days. Breakfast was traditional Italian at a local bar with croissant, coffee/tea and orange juice. We thoroughly enjoyed out stay at this hotel and would recommend it to anyone!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived in Rome for the first time last Sunday and were beginning our first time to Italy by staying here for three nights. I have to admit that I am more used to the larger chain hotels when we go on a city break (e.g Hilton, Marriott ) but having studied trip advisor in conjunction with comparing the prices and location of other hotels I opted to book this establishment. I hesitate to call it a hotel because it certainly doesn't come close to that in terms of my "concept" of a hotel. It is on the 4th floor of a residential block of flats and is designed on the name badge as -Executive Rooms. We walked from Termini station following the directions given by the hotel in an earlier email and they were fantastically accurate in their terms. There is an elevator albeit very small and were allowed entry to the property. We were met by a pleasant receptionist who took our details and showed us to our room. We arrived at 11.30am and I had half an expectation that we would be allowed to leave our luggage but be sent away until cleaning of the room from the last guest had taken place. Thankfully we were allowed to move straight which was welcomed as we'd had a very early flight from London and the temperature was already reaching close to 30•. We had air con which was individually controlled by us and the room was quickly cooled to a comfortable level. There were only a handful of rooms at the most and the lighting of the reception area and the room corridor was aimed at creating a certain mood it did verge upon slightly seedy. Don't get me wrong there was nothing seedy whatsoever about this place, quite the opposite but it was just a bit dark and maybe trying a bit too hard at trying to create an ambience which was a tad affected. There were plenty of towels and free toiletries and we in fact both nodded off for a bit before freshening up and starting our adventure . When we arrived we were required to pay our city tax in cash and separately from our bill which wasn't a problem but my husband didn't have any denomination of cash under €50. We were only charged €12 but the receptionist didn't have any change. I expected her to say that we could pay upon our return back to the hotel later that evening but instead she took the whole of the €50 and told us that we had to wait till the owner/manager started his shift later that evening before we received our change. I suppose I may be criticised for being a stingy Brit (!) but we weren't talking about a couple of pence, we were talking in excess of £30 and the manager was not due in till late evening ! Again with hindsight perhaps I should have said no that's not acceptable, but we were hot, tired and I suppose not wanting to create any atmosphere when we had just walked through the front door of a strange city. Again I had never come across that way of thinking on my travels and was slightly taken aback. To be fair when we did meet the man himself later that evening he had the money waiting and in fact he offered it almost immediately to us which restored by faith. We had a good nights sleep and awoke fresh and raring to go. My husband went for a shower followed by me and I was in the process of applying conditioner to my hair when he came to the bathroom to tell me the owner had just called the room to complain that we were using too much water ! He was laughing when he said it and initially I thought he was trying hopelessly to be funny but soon realised through his insistence that he was serious. This was a hotel for which we were paying almost £100 per night and for which we were being told when to turn off the shower tap!!! We are not environment unaware people and I fully appreciate the concept of world sustainability but I have never been monitored in a hotel by the water police. I did as asked but did wonder whether we had perhaps made the wrong choice of hotel. We then had a pleasant albeit small breakfast at a nearby cafe and enjoyed the rest of our day. We enjoyed our next day too and found that on both days our room was fresh and clean upon our return. We did notice that our door was not secure though and I made a comment to the lady at reception regarding it and she said that she had just finished cleaning it on both occasions. There didn't appear to be other guests around and we did have a safety deposit box so wasn't overly concerned. The bed was comfortable and there was adequate space for our luggage and clothing. The location is good for its proximity to Termini station and it felt safe. A side of The British embassy is in fact on the same street as this place and there is obviously a security presence as a result of this which isn't necessarily a bad thing. There are a few decent enough places to eat in the area but try to keep away from those directly at the station as they seemed overpriced and pretty underwhelming. Would I come back again to the Morrison hotel? - well funnily enough that is a question I asked my husband on our last night. For cleanliness, comfort, convenience of location and value for money yes I think we would but if the Hilton or some other established hotel had a similar price I think we opt for them given the few little "quirks" of this place.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights on a long weekend trip to Rome. The location is very good, a little out of the centre but within easy walking distance from the Metro and main bus/train terminal (Termini). The staff were very friendly and helpful, and explained everything perfectly. The room was very modern and comfortable, it was so nice to come back from a busy day sightseeing to relax for a few hours before heading back out in the evening. The free wireless access was a bonus - there are two wireless signals (morrison and morrison 2), if you dont get a a good signal with one try the other, it worked fine for both of us on our iphones. Overall I would recommend this hotel if you want a comfortable tranquil place to stay within easy reach of Rome city centre and the main sights (Colosseum, Pantheon, Roman Forum, Vatican, Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps etc)
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just a short walk from the heart of the action in Rome, in a nice quiet neighborhood. Its actually good that your not right at the foot of the Spanish steps as its nice and relaxing. Morrisson the guy who operates the hotel couldn't be nicer and really went out of his way to help us with all of our needs. The rooms are clean and modern we actually stayed here twice as we had to come in and out of Rome and we were happy to be here not just once but twice.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our group of four stayed at the Morrisson hotel for two nights. The room, while small (to be expected in Rome), was super clean, modern and comfortable. The ac was great, the beds were comfy, and the shower was roomy enough to turn around in. The hotel staff are absolutely excellent and super helpful. The owner even got us croissants on the morning we left because we were missing the free breakfast. We would definitely stay there again and plan on recommending to our friends.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my partner for 3 evenings in room 402 at the end of April. This hotel was a great find. I put in a lot of effort before my trip to determine what hotel I should go for. Rome is not a cheap place to stay, but this hotel ticked all the boxes, for a very reasonable price. The clean, comfortable rooms were a joy to come back to after a day's sightseeing, in the knowledge that the room would have been tidied, with fresh towels like clockwork!There are five rooms on the fourth floor of an older style apartment block. Do not in any way let this put you off as the rooms are all brand new, and the fact there are only five rooms means that the service provided by the staff (especially the owner!) is far above what you would expect from a central European hotel.As for the location - the weather in Rome when I was there was superb, and despite the hotel being close to stations on both lines of the Rome metro, and bus links on the road a block up from the hotel, we decided to walk pretty much everywhere. The Colosseum, trevi fountain, vatican, parks and spanish steps are all well within walking distance, as are the nightlife spots within the city. The hotel is a 10 minute walk from Termini station, and the location of the Ryanair bus drops for Ciampino and Flumancio airports. The location is very safe - within the area of the city mostly taken up by foreign embassies. We never at any point had any issues with going for a quick wander round the local area, where there were a number of lovely bars & restaurants. WIFI - I note that this had been a sticking point for some reviewers, but there are now two access points, and the wifi works perfectly.Breakfast - The breakfast in the small cafe round the corner is an absolute delight, and a perfect way to energise yourself for the start of a long day's walking!I'll leave my last words for the staff. All the staff were exceedingly helpful, and were more than happy to answer any questions we had regarding the local area, or a wee bit further out. They were always up for a chat and conversation about our day, and seemed genuinely pleased of how much we enjoyed ourselves.I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Rome. I genuinely believe you would not be able to beat the level of service/location/quality of the hotel at the price anywhere else in the city.Will definitely be back.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a great find,with a price that worked out to 65euros a night,with a design of a 5star hotel.The hotel is on a fourth floor of a shared building,Please DO NOT let this put you off,everything about this hotel is 5 star.The service/staff/breakfast/location/price 5starWe were so glad to find this hotel, the money we saved with booking this hotel we put towards city seeing food etc,this helped because we found rome really expensive
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything descriped earlier applies except for the negative review. The outside of the building is not looking very fancy and a bit anymonous and therefore it is not recognized as a hotel. Having said this the rooms are very new and very nice including the nice bathroom. So if you are looking for a nice room to stay at a good location and don't mind to take the steps or an old small elevator ( planned to be renewed in the future) then this is a good choice. We hesitated hearing about the breakfast at a local bar but we really enjoyed since many locals and tourists of other hotels are here for some breakfast, juice and coffee. Also the friendy owner is a big help in finding the nice places to go. The free WiFi works perfect since there are 2 access points now.
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Morrisson Exclusive Rooms for only 3 nights. We had a business meeting and Morrisson Hotel was closest to our point of interest. Reading the comments we were a little skeptical about the hotel, but everything proved to be contrary to the defamatory review. So trust us and give credit to the positive ones! As soon as we arrived we were greeted with respect and professionalism by the staff members. At the reception we were given all the details we needed; starting with the breakfast (the location of the bar, what will be served for breakfast and scheduling) and a detailed guided tour on the map of all the sights we could visit in the short time we had free after working. We liked that very much! Moreover we received complex answers to all our questions and they helped us with everything we needed (and we had a lot to ask..). Comments complaining of lack of professionalism, lack of cleanliness and lack of respect of the staff, from our point of view are pure evil. The rooms were more than impeccable; every day I felt like we only just arrived, because the rooms were as clean and neatly arranged as on the day we checked in. Breakfast, though in a bar a few minutes away from the hotel, delighted us. We presented the coupons we received every morning, in the hotel, to the cashier and we were friendly served with delicious croissants of different tastes and quality coffee. Our room 403 was gorgeous! We were worried though, about the Wi Fi signal after reading here that it would be weak, but we were assured that it will perfectly work, because the signal was strengthened in all rooms, and so it was. It worked great!We will come back for sure, because we were excited about how we were treated! We did not find anything at this hotel that we do not like.I'm glad we did not let the negative review scare us away and tested on our own the hospitality of this hotel! The hotel should be rated as a five stars hotel!!
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel! Service was second to none! Rooms were spotless. In the heart of rome. Would stay here again in a heartbeat!Quiet!!!!!! (this seems to be hard to find in rome!!!!!)
hotelName:
31    Morrisson Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
